Reviews: I love this. I make it for myself and my kids as hot chocolate or “chocolate milk” and the taste is so good they have no idea it’s good for them. Other brands taste like medicine, this is just delicious. Always feel refreshed and energized afterwards which you cannot say for most hydration and electrolyte drinks! Will definitely keep buying it!!!
Takes away lightheadedness and makes my husband feel much better..He's 71 and takes this willingly everyday because he knows it helps him.
The chocolate tastes delicious! I drink it every morning and it energizes me for my day. I will definitely be buying again. 10/10 would recommend.
I absolutely love this! My buddy gave me a few of his and immediately I was sold! Taste is pretty good also!!!

I like to work out regularly. This includes weight-lifting on some days and running on the treadmill for other days. Given how depleting it can be to run for prolonged periods of time, I like to have an electrolyte drink after my cardio days on the treadmill to try to restore my electrolytes. After having tried this electrolyte drink mix, I must say that I am rather impressed.This chocolate flavored hydration mix actually tastes better than I thought it would. I was a little bit hesitant as I have normally only had fruity-flavored electrolyte drink mixes before, and nothing I have had was similar to the rich flavor of chocolate. However, after having a mix with 8 ounces of water, I was surprised to note that it tasted like hot chocolate - although cold, because I did not use hot water. At 8 ounces of water, it did taste a bit watered down still. I believe that this drink will be most enjoyable if used with hot water or milk for a richer taste, and potentially with less water than they recommend (they recommend 8 to 16 ounces of water per stick).There are a couple of flaws that I have with this product. Firstly, the drink mix did not fully dissolve well. Some other electrolyte drink mixes that I have used have dissolved better than this one. Also, for this drink mix to be most enjoyable, I believe one should use milk or hot water (or hot milk, for that matter). This is an extra step versus with fruity flavors that can be very enjoyable in cold water (from the sink for me). As I enjoy convenience and wouldn't want to heat water each time before use, this is a flaw for me.I like how these sticks have a good vitamin profile. Each stick has significant amount of Vitamin C, B6, and B12, as well as some zinc. You're getting more than just electrolytes with these sticks. There are 2.5 grams of added sugar per stick, which is higher than I typically like as I try to avoid added sugar. But, there are only 10 calories per stick, so if you're a calorie counter, these might be for you.Given the rather affordable price of these electrolyte sticks ($36 for 30 sticks at the time of writing), I think that these could certainly be worth it for those who enjoy the hot chocolate flavor. Given the flaws that I personally have found with these, I will give them 4 stars.

This was a fun one and one of the more unique water additives I've tried. This is like having portable yoohoo everywhere you go! My only negative is that the flavor isn't as robust as the "real thing", but it's very, very good. The packets are strong and would be fine to travel with -- I had no concerns with the package being flimsy or difficult to open. The additive did dissolve fully for me, which is something that's a big point of interest for me. Flavor is good! Like watery chocolate, again, a neat and unique flavor additive. The packaging notes you can also try this hot, but I put this in cold water and enjoyed.

The powder is easily mixed into cool or hot water. I like that there are very few lumps. It tastes okay. I'm not sure of the sugar, calories, or electrolyte intake but, I did feel more energized after drinking it. I tried it cold and I liked it. My favorite way of drinking it is hot. The packets are easy to travel with and open. I like that they are conveniently made. Overall, I think it is a good product.

RECOMMENDATIONS:Recommended.The packets tastes great! Almost as good as regular hot chocolate, although you do taste that extra saltiness associated with hydration mixes.Honestly do not know if it works or not; how do you measure your body is getting hydration from a packet? I do notice that it makes me less thirsty throughout the morning after ingesting this, so there’s that.POSITIVES:- Tastes great for a hydration packet mix. If the packaging holds true, it also does not contain extra carbs either.- Portable; you can take these with you anywhere.- Highly dissolvable (is that a word?), you can use these with cold, hot drinks and anywhere in between.- Individual packets can easily be opened; no need for a knife or scrips or.NEGATIVES:- Nothing comes to mind, just hoping they work as advertised.IMPROVEMENTS:- None

The overall essence of chocolate is very light, but still noticeable. I preferred adding a stick to hot water as the chocolate flavor was very unappealing when combined with cold water on its own. The sticks themselves are durable, and wouldn't tear easily if left to bounce around freely at the bottom of a gym bag.

So I was hesitant to try this because most of the time when you think of drink mixes for hydration, you think of fruity flavors like lemonade or something - not chocolate. Especially when mixing with water… it just doesn’t sound good. BUT I was really surprised by how much I liked this product! I’ve only tried it with hot water (like a hot cocoa) and I was surprised by how much chocolate flavor there was. It would probably be better with warm milk but I wanted to try it with water first and I was not disappointed. Overall, I liked this and I will definitely use them for before/after workouts. I’m excited to try it with milk to see if it’s even better than with the water. Will update if I remember!

I was pleasantly surprised that this tasted as well as it does. Ingredients are pretty simple, and it contains a high DV of vitamins. I've been having these as a hot drink with hot water, and its like drinking hot cocoa. Its not as sweet or rich as regular hot cocoa, but its pretty close in my opinion. It does have that diet/alternative sugar taste, but it subtle to me so I don't notice it as much.This has been a nice to drink in the cold winter days especially in the morning. I tried putting it in my coffee but it doesn't seem to taste great with the blend I have. Maybe when the weather gets warmer I can try to to use these in smoothies. Overall, I've enjoyed these chocolate drinks and would recommend it for those looking for a healthier option!!

Actually tastes pretty good. There is a strong salty flavor, but the chocolate pairs well with it. Still, 250mg of sodium isn't terribly much for an "electrolyte" drink. I don't care for the smell of powder, but once mixed it is fine. It dissolves fairly easily and individual sachets make it easy to take a few with you when traveling. At a dollar per packet I don't think these are a great value, for example a chocolate protein powder would be a much better value.

These little packets, about a dollar each, claim to contain only 2.5g of sugar, packed with rehydrating electrolytes, essentially aimed at the fatigue relief and morning-after-the-party market segment. Suggesting it might replace an IV treatment to recharge the body with accelerated hydration might well be true, but we have no imperial evidence of such.The potassium, sodium, Vitamin C and magnesium and low sugar are certainly a good recipe for a morning lift -- an energizing boost to start the day -- and the chocolate flavor makes it all go down with ease.We keep them in our travel case for general jet lag symptoms and energy boost on long trips. It's good to have a few along in case of a touch of the hangover syndrome.

Sports fanatics in my household are on keto/fat burning/low carb exercise regimen, therefore we sampled this HydroMate Electrolyte-Enhanced Drink Mix.What works:Low carbs: 3g per serving.Low calories: 10 per serving, for those trying to burn fat.Each bag contains 16 (5.7g) sticks/servings for convenience.Chocolate/cocoa flavor tastes alright.Dissolves readily in Cold or Hot water.  Option to mix/shake with milk for thicker and creamier taste.Contains a good assortment of Vitamins, minerals, and salts (Sodium and Potassium) for hydration.No added caffeine for those of us sensitive to it.We all felt hydrated without muscle cramps during our training sessions.What may not work:This hydration mix only works well for our low intensity/aerobic exercise sessions of 45 minutes or less because it doesn't contain any significant calories (10) from carbs, fats, or proteins to fuel longer, higher intensity training/workouts.  YMMV

I’m unsure exactly how I feel about this electrolyte drink mix. They come in 30 individual packets which is nice and convenient. The package says to mix with 8-16 ounces of water, so I chose 8 because that’s a big gap. It does taste like chocolate, a little weak, but chocolate nonetheless. It’s kind of odd because when I taste chocolate I expect a level of “creaminess” and since this is to be mixed with water it’s not there lol. Overall it’s not bad, but I’m still unsure about how I feel.
This chocolate flavored electrolyte drink reminds me of those type drinks in the yellow container. Everyone in my family likes it. Easy to  carry for travel too
These NatureWorks HydroMATE Electrolytes Powder Drink Mix Packets work well and taste good. They are low in carbs and calories which I really like. They are a good pick me up.

I love the idea of using chocolate (instead of citrus or berry) as flavor for salt-based recovery products like electrolytes and BHB ketones. Chocolate complements the salt and masks the bitterness well.This powder is one of the tastier electrolyte drinks. No question about that. The ingredients are also well-considered. The one thing I wish were different is the sucralose. Sucralose, ace-k, sugar alcohols, and aspartame all can cause issues for people with allergies or diabetes or other sensitivities. There are better choices.

I don't normally think of "chocolate" when I'm thirsty or after a work out when I'm wanting something to hydrate.  But surprisingly, this works for me.I'm also not used to chocolate products that can be mixed with cold water.  But I mixed this with ice water and the product completely mixed with a little agitation.The packets are easy to open, but not so easy that there is a risk of opening by accident.The flavor is a little sweet, a little chocolatey... but not like chocolate milk.The description talks about a boost of energy.  But there isn't much sugar.  I don't see anything to indicate that it has caffeine (an artificial boost), or any other ingredient that would explain the energy boost.  But I can confirm that after my workout, I felt a little sluggish until I drank my HydroMATE drink.  That is to say... I did feel that I got a boost of energy.This is certainly travel friendly.  Weather you're traveling on a plane where you're only allowed to carry powders... or if you're just traveling to the gym.  Since this is an individual serving packet, you also don't have to measure and be concerned about making a mess.  The packets easily empty into a "normal" water bottle, so you don't even need a wide mouth.

The flavor is definitely chocolate and does taste good.  But for me I had a after taste, not bad after taste but there was one.  But after taking this to the gym and work I really didn't have the after taste anymore or I just got use to it.  Value for the money is ok at about $1.50 a drink it isn't that bad. (I've had better priced ones but not that great on flavor.)  I do wish it gave some protein with the drink, I'm not sure if it has any protein content but it would be nice to have some after working out.  I believe I would get this again because my kids like it and it is a good change from heavy sugar drinks out there.

I ordered these hydration packs despite my aversion to any hydration that isn't lemon/lime. I once ordered an apple cinnamon one and regretted it my whole hike. It was great at home but not much as thirst-quenching hydration. I was expecting this to taste like watered-down Yoohoo.You get the potassium chloride and all the other elements and vitamins you get with your sports drink, but this is an excellent way to start your morning. I tried it hot in coconut and almond milk, and in my coffee as a mocha with some cinnamon. I have dehydration from gut issues, so I get dehydrated after my third cup of coffee in the morning. This is an excellent addition to kick off your morning. The flavor is chocolatey and delicious without being overly sweet. And thanks to it being keto-friendly, I don't spike my sugar as I do with high-glucose sports drinks.You aren't going to fill your hydration pack with it for hiking, but a thermos of this hot chocolate for a hiking break is outstanding. A delicious treat that replaces essential elements lost while being active. My boyfriend has already mowed through 10 packets in 4 days!

I hate drinking plain water, so I am always on the hunt for things to add to my water bottle that will help me stay hydrated. I was a little skeptical about the chocolate flavor, but its not that bad. It is a bit weird with water; it kind of tastes like if you had a Yoohoo with ice, drank all the Yoohoo, let the ice melt a bit, and drank that. Just really watered down Yoohoo. Apparently you can make it hot or even add it to milk, so that might be tasty. I guess if you're really craving chocolate and this is the only way to get it, its clutch. Otherwise, it's just okay.

Overall this product is fine. The taste is ok - saw others say it tastes like chocolate milk… I don’t think I’d go that far. It’s chocolatey but in a bland watery way. It’s also super super sweet which I don’t love in hydration products. I’ll use up the product but don’t think I’ll order again as there are better tasting hydration products out there.

When I first came across this product I though 'what? That's weird'. But I do love chocolate and, as a competitive triathlete, I use hydration mixes frequently. I figured I needed to at least try it. Turns out this hydration mix is really good! I was surprised. It has a subtle, sweet chocolate flavor. It's a lot different in terms of flavor than any other hydration mix I've tried. The other cool thing about this hydration mix is that you can make hot chocolate with it! It's great for staying hydrated when it's cold, or after a long run in cold weather (also, it's very good when you make it with warm milk/milk substitute). I like that it contains electrolytes as well as zinc and some B vitamins. If you are bored of all the fruity hydration mix flavors, and you like chocolate, I would recommend this product.

These have made a big impact with my water intake. Normally I drink about 100 Oz of water a day, but when I drink that much water, I have to go to the restroom about every 30 min to an hour. This can be very frustrating, especially when at work. I notice that if I add this to my daily protein drinks, I definitely don’t go to the restroom as much. I really like how few calories it has. As far as taste goes, I add this to my protein drink that already tastes like chocolate so I can’t really speak to that. I would definitely reorder these 👍🏻

Review for: NatureWorks HydroMATE Electrolytes Powder Drink MixGood tasting powder drink mix that is good for you.  Only 10 calories and 2.5 grams of sugar per serving.  I was a little apprehensive of a 'chocolate flavored' energy drink, but I was surprised by the taste, and they are good for you.  I did mix up a batch with milk, and it tasted even better - going to share with the kids

My toddler loves to drink whatever I'm drinking so he can feel all grown up; but this takes it to another level.  Overall it tastes like we are having chocolate milk, but without all the guilt that sometimes comes with that.  Definitely would be getting again!

I took the packaging's advice and mixed this with milk, and found it was a surprisingly tasty and effective pick-me-up during a cardio workout. Tasted like salty chocolate milk, which (like chocolate bars with sea salt) is actually quite delicious. Did not expect an electrolyte drink with just sodium and chloride to elevate me this much, but it did. Drinking it after pouring sweat for a bit gave me a noticeable boost I wasn't getting from a regular beverage. There are more sophisticated electrolyte mixes on the market, but this one worked very well for me.EDIT: Dunno why I thought this was just sodium and chloride. Significantly, there is also potassium, magnesium, and a number of B Vitamins. This IS a fairly sophisticated electrolyte drink.

I cannot imagine drinking this cold, but as a hydration and electrolyte supplement to my coffee pre-workout this actually tastes very good! The salt is a kick like the salted caramel coffee drinks one can get at a coffee shop, and if you are sensitive to the aftertaste of sugar-substitutes you'll still taste it. But it isn't overpowering as it can be in other electrolyte packets.Very happy I came across this product and looking forward to using it often in training!

These taste delicious! They don't smell so good, but it mixes well and quickly. They are perfect to just poor into a water bottle, shake, and drink. They taste so good, you wouldn't know they were good for you in any way. It resembles yoo-hoo or chocolate milk. I've only drank it cold, but I'm sure it would taste good heated up. I absolutely love this drink mix and so does my daughter. This is the best hydrating drink I've ever had and so glad I learned it exists so we can get more.

Simple to mix and tastes like chocolate a chocolate flavored sports dink. If you have had any sort of sport drink it has a very similar taste and after taste to those. I'm not sure how I feel about it hot but it does taste good cold. Taste more like watered down chocolate milk which isn't a bad thing in this case.

Use with hot water or milk, and it tastes very much like hot chocolate. I add the packets to hot water with my collagen, and it is the perfect combo. Very easy and convenient to throw them in your bag since they are individual servings. Low sugar, and doesn't taste like you are drinking salt water. Would recommend!

My son is a wrestler and these are perfect for him. He takes them to practice and adds it to water. He thinks they taste like cold hot chocolate. He has mixed them with milk and made them hot as well and he says its so good. He has even asked me to get them again.

I've tried HydroMate mixes before and they are great for feeling hydrated and replenished after an intense workout. I was really excited to try this mix because it says you can mix it with hot water and make hot chocolate with it. I used my keurig to brew 10 oz of hot water and I stirred in one packet of this afterwards. It mixes well and I love drinking it after a nighttime workout to warm up, relax and feel refreshed.
This chocolate powder tastes great. I use it in my morning coffee. Also tastes great in water or milk

As I was drinking this I kept adding water and I enjoyed the taste even as it became more diluted. It says you can mix a packet with 8 or 16 ounces of water, and both do work for me. This dissolved in a glass of water to my satisfaction just stirring with a spoon, but a shaker jar will work as well. I feel satiated after one glass and I’m hydrated. I like the B vitamins, and vitamin C as well as the electrolytes. Only 10 calories, 2.5 g sugar and I love the flavor. Very satisfying!

The hydration plus chocolate are powder packets you add to water or milk. Liquid can be warm or cold. I added a pack of the powder to water. Takes a bit to fully dissolve by stirring. Drink tastes like thin chocolate milk. It's good.

This is kind of an odd flavor for a hydration drink, but it tastes great and chocolate lovers will really enjoy it!It's got a great chocolate taste. My only complaint is that you mix it with 8 oz of water, which is a fairly small serving if you're trying to rehydrate, but of course you can just drink water after this,
This it great when you are dieting. Low calories and not bad protein. The taste isn't to bad either

Wanting to add this to my morning routine but failed miserably. First off, I’m not a big fan of super sweet food/drinks so this is definitely not for me. You can suggest add more water then, but I did and it ends up tasting like a washed up chocolate drink. I also taste the strong salt on it so it’s like drinking a very sweet and salty drink for me. Strange flavor. The sodium content is 250mg though it’s medically considered low dose, for those who have sensitive taste buds you will definitely notice it.Also this uses sucralose as a sweetener so if you’re not a fan of it just fyi.Did it gives me the extra boost for my day? Unfortunately it gives me a headache that I have to drink tons of water to washed it down my body, half my day I have to deal with the headache and I’m not the kind who can take pain killer coz it gives me tummy ache so I just have to deal with it.

I wasn't sure if these were going to be something I liked at first because I've tried other chocolate supplements in the past and they just weren't very good. This is way different and SO delicious and also makes me feel hydrated and energized. Really fresh, chocolate milk tasting beverage that is easy to drink and keep myself hydrate and get those electrolytes back! Surprisingly great. Would purchase again

The media could not be loaded.
                



 Watch my speed up unboxing video. I like this product in my coffee and milk. Recommended brand.
My husband says it tastes like chocolate milk. I guess it does...kind of. Buy I don't like the taste much on its own  and it didn't mix that well.

There are no redeeming qualities to this product.It doesn’t mix well in a glass, you have to put it in a bottle and shake it to get it to mix, otherwise there is a ton of floating gunk in your cup or mug. Even in a bottle it leaves these white gritty pieces (and all the chocolate gunk too).It tastes like Tootsie Roll tried to make hot chocolate powder. It kind of tastes like hot chocolate mix with that strange not-quite chocolate taste. At first, I thought it “wasn’t that bad” but then the aftertaste of salt happened. After drinking it, it leaves a gross salty chocolaty flavor in your mouth that you have to brush your teeth to be rid of.I drank a full 8 oz glass to see if it seemed to help with hydration. It made me nauseous and queasy the rest of the day.It is NOT satisfying or thirst quenching. When I finish a workout or feel thirsty, it is NOT something I want to reach for. I tried a couple times but just can’t think of any benefit of this mix.

Hydro MATE chocolate hydration drink mix is AMAZING! I was surprised that the chocolate flavor was a good as it was!  Great taste and good way to start the day. I drink mine cold but I can see drinking it hot as hot chocolate. I need to mix with coffee to see how it'll taste.Pros:- Flavor- Mix well- Keto Friendly
great size. However, you need to be extra careful putting the bottom lid on. lets just say that protein powder all over the front seat of the car is messy...
I travel often and I’m able to put my protein or my pre-workout in these and fly with them no problem. Highly recommend these!
Its a little guy but it'll get the job done

They’re really cute and the clips are nice. The only downside is they don’t fit a whole scoop of the protein I use, so it’s a little sad I either carry two or just use it for the funnel. Gave the rest to my friends as xmas gifts. Great overall.

I would argue that this is an essential purchase for just about anyone taking supplements. The convenience factor cannot be understated. I’ve used them for pre and post-workout supps for months now and they have never broken or untwisted. Cleaning is very easy as well. If I had one critique, it would be that they may be just a hair small for some protein scoops. The scoop will fit but you’ll probably miss some of the pour. This is very minor though and should NOT detour your purchase. Get a box of 5 and even if you don’t need them all, they make a great little gift for another lifter.

I really needed them to hold two scoops, but it hardly holds 1/2-3/4 of a scoop. Some dimensions or content measurement would be a great addition to the advertisement and info. They’re honestly too small to be worth using, they could work for pre work out but I don’t use that crap. Be warned.
I got this as a solution for going to the gym. They are the perfect size for me. Easy to fill easy to get into a bottle. I think they are great

I got tired of hauling around protein or using zip lock bags to carry a single scoop of protein everyday. I wondered if they had something like this, so after a bit of searching, I found these little things. They are amazing. They hold a single scoop of protein each and I can even fit the scoop right into the base of the pack and pour the whole thing in without making a mess.
Easy to take any powder with you.. i workout at work so is perfect to take with me and it becomes a funnel for ease of use to put into your water bottle

Got these for my wife as stocking stuffers. She loved them. Kept 2 for herself and gave the other 3 to her gym friends.They work great. 4 stars because I wish they had more choices on the design. All 5 have the same boring design on them.Other than that- great product and Amazon had a better price than the manufacturer and with prime, I got free shipping and didn't have to wait 2 weeks for shipping.

Been using these for preworkout. They seem high quality and effective. The top and bottom screw on tight. The small spout is small enough to pour into a water bottle. Enough room for the roughly 28 grams I put in, with a little room to spare.Not enough room for my protein, but I expected that. I generally take a double dose, plus a few other things like creatine and cacao.
Container is not big enough for a full protein scoop, but it would hold a serving of Creatine.
This is a good set of containers. They are a little small depending on how much protein you need.

These were purchased as Christmas gifts for gym employees.  They thought they were cute! I like that the bottom comes off to scoop the protein and the top works as a funnel for small mouthed containers.  Only real complaint is that the carabiners all broke quickly.
I love these. The open on the top or the bottom and fit all of my shakers so there is no mess.

Quick easy and convenient... love to be able to take my protein powder anywhere anytime... whether on vacation or out for a day... always have with me when I need.  Would recommend this product to anyone.  Nice size too.

I never knew how much I needed this item until I got it. I'd been using little containers or plastic bags for my protein. Horrible! These are sturdy, super quick and easy to use, and as much as I like them I've even given a couple away to people that I know would appreciate them as much as I do.
I put my protein power in these for my shakes to take to work so it’s ready to go. Very handy.
It wont even hold a full scoop of whey protein…
Nice product but a little small for a scoop of protein.
These are way too small, couldn't tell from the pics and video, they barely hold one standard scoop of protein, which also makes it hard to fill them without spilling.
Amazing idea, great size. Great gift idea for gym go-ers
Can't even hold one serving of protein! Don't waste your money.
NA

Only able to put 3/4 of a scoop(4.75 tbsp) into container.  Was able to put pre-workout and BCAAs into containers, however the volume of those is a lot less.  Does not work for me at all.  Disappointed no returning item
Didn’t come with the carabiners
Don’t depend on them being whereever you clip them. Garbage rings. And too small only one scoop can hold. Not a fan.
Para un regalo
The angle adjustment,  1st buffer. Product worked until adjustment, then quit.  The replaced unit, came quickly.The unit works fine, have not used angled adjust much.
i started polishing my car, and the polisher lived for about 15 minutes at most, then smoked and stopped working

I was surprised how loud this machine is. Buffing out a whole car is not doable without ear protection. The machine is a lot heavier than other buffers I have used but it does work and the pads work well on my car. The noise though makes me wonder if it's gonna give out on me soon or not. Until then I am using it when my cars need it.
Great value for the money it works exactly as expected and the led screen is a nice touch to know automatically how fast it is spinning

After using this for a bit, I was really starting to notice how heavy, hot and loud it was. Heavy is just fine when I'm polishing the top of my car, but gets a little tiring on the sides. The loud part, well, it's not exactly uniform. It sometimes whines quite badly. It made me wonder if it was about to explode several times, but it never did.I polished two crossovers and a minivan with it. I would say it was getting a bit louder by the time I finished the third vehicle. That is a concern. It's already starting to sound worn after three vehicles, so how long will it last? I guess we'll have to see. It did come with a set of extra brushes, so there's that.I used it with a variety of pads. It didn't cause me any headaches with any of them. Functionality wise, everything went just fine. It just sounds a bit weird and is rather hot.

While this isn't a commercial-grade polisher/buffer, nonetheless it delivers good value for the money.  The package includes the buffer/polisher, bale and straight handles, a good selection of polishing, buffing and sanding pads to use with a hook & loop backing plate.  It's variable-speed -- sometimes a bit too variable, rising and falling even under no load -- but with plenty of torque.The drive transmission is rather loud with more gear backlash than I'd like, and the occasional bearing squeal is a bit unsettling too.  Gears are metal, the case is grease packed, but it employs a metal-to-metal cover that's going to leak -- not ideal for buffing/polishing.  It comes with an extra set of motor brushes -- puzzling to me but it's always nice to have spare parts.It has ETC and CE safety certification; there's no ground lug on the electrical cord implying double insulation.  Most of the unit is sheathed in plastic, offering some protection from dinging the work surface, but the tool quickly gets pretty heavy so care is required.  Motor ventilation area seems low for a tool drawing up to 12A -- the unit gets pretty warm in use.  The strain relief on the power cord is a loose fit, but the power cord is of good length and not too stiff.For the weekend DIY auto detailer on a budget, this is a good, basic setup.  But if you're a newbie, well, regardless of the buffer you buy, consider practicing awhile on something other than your wife's Lexus.  And wear hearing and eye protection.

Back in the day, my favorite of all time polisher was an orange Black and Decker. They stopped making that one. Currently, my favorite is a Makita with variable speeds which is more than twice the price of this one. This polisher is substantially made in that it is a bit on the heavy side which is an advantage when polishing horizontal surfaces. The weight of the machine enables you to squeeze the trigger and do nothing more than just let it dance over the surface under its own weight, when doing vertical surfaces like on the side of a car the extra weight is cumbersome, and requires a little extra effort.So, how do they make a polisher/buffer with all of these features including a digital LED lit number pad on top showing you your speed setting, as well as so many different foam pads, both a side arm, and a top hoop arm option and at such an attractive price? I'm not sure, but if I had to get critical, I would say you definitely need hearing protection when using it. The gears, and motor are unusually loud; there is even a bit of clackity-clack in the way the gears mesh. Maybe, I just got a less than perfect one, maybe not; I have no way of knowing. Since I already have the Makita that I bought several years ago, and I have an old inexpensive plug-in polisher I use for my dirtball jobs, this one will be relegated to a lender. It can be used as a sander also since it has a 7" Velcro pad, and has several sanding discs included, but for serious grinding, your best bet is a 6,000 RPM dedicated grinding. Ideal polishing occurs at 2400 RPMs in automotive applications, and this one cover that base very well. I'm not sure the LED digit is an accurate setting representing 2400 when set to 24, for example, but that doesn't matter. When you are using compounds and polishing, the work surface will tell you exactly which speed works the best, and I am sure the digital readout would give you the same speed level again and again.Wearing ear protection is suggested when using any buffer, but I must admit this one is clearly louder than the rest I have used. It's a bargain polisher, so if you are weekend warrior, and don't want to invest in a pro-level buffer to be used on a daily basis, this could be a good choice.

MY GOD, IS THIS THING LOUD!  NOT THAT ANY ARE QUIET, BUT THIS IS ESPECIALLY LOUD, YOU WILL WANT TO WEAR EAR PROTECTION OR KEEP LOOKING FOR THE RINGING PHONE FOR HOURS AFTER USE.  ALSO NOT GREAT IF YOU HAVE INQUISITIVE NEIGHBORS THAT WANT TO CHAT WHEN THEY SEE YOU (OR HEAR YOU IN THIS CASE) DOING SOMETHING.  IT IS REMARKABLY UNNESCESARILY LOUD.That said (what?), it is heavy, so you don't have to apply pressure, but after a couple of hours of use if your ears and neighbors can stand the racket, your arms will hurt.The touch button LCD speed control is OK, but I think I prefer the older rotary style as it seems that I have more control with that style.It does heat up quickly and you can feel the heat coming off while using.  I don't like that you have to give it a break to cool down like every 20 minutes.  I tried restarting too soon once and it would not work, which makes me wonder how long it will last.The grips are an either/ or, you can't have both, I often went for a phantom handle after it was changed to see what worked best at various heights and angles.It's OK after first use, but don't know that I would buy it again.

So I got this to buff out some scratches on a display case. I’m hoping it helps and it doesn’t make things worse. My new nickname for this YIMOOCH buffer and polisher is Buffy the Oxidation Slayer. The YIMOOCH and a little but of Meguiars One Step compound were exactly what I needed to tackle some oxidation on my old red boat - and oxidation on red is the worst.The range of speeds with the YIMOOCH really helped me dial in the right speed for the compound and later polishing. The YIMOOCH fits a wide range of 7" polishing and buffing pads including coming with a nice starter assortment of pads. The velcro on the disc is well made and holds the pads well. I also like that it has 2 handle options for holding it.If I could change anything I would make it a little lighter weight, I don't know if that's possible for a polisher this powerful though.It's easy to use, take your time to get to know it and your car, boat, truck, RV whatever will thank you.

I got these polisher buffer for my husband and he loves it it is very powerful and works amazing, this kit has everything you need for work. It is made high-quality and meant to last we highly recommend it

Someone in a parking lot scraped the side of my car.  Didn't want to claim it so I thought I would try it myself 1st.  Took a bit to get used to, but in the end with some patience I was able to buff it out enough so that you had to look to see it.  Worked much better than a pad and my battery powered drill.  This was heavy duty and solid enough to control the spin.  You just have to apply a light touch so that you don't burn the paint.

First off, this buffer has some weight to it.  If you want something light, this isn't for you.  Additionally, the "loop" handle and the single hand handle are either-or... or you can only use one or the other and swap them out.The buffer comes with a starter set of pads as well as sandpaper.  If you plan on using this to wax a vehicle or some other project requiring distance from the plug, make sure you have a good extension cord.  The weight can actually come in handy when buffing a vehicle and I do not find it to be too much.  Very happy with this buffer!

So this isn't going to be much of a review because I have never actually used the buffer for safety reasons.  When I got the buffer and unpacked it, I was testing the functionality of the 90 degree adjustable handle.  Id never seen that on a buffer before and was thinking "hey I can see that being pretty handy."  The handle was locked into the 90 degree vertical position from the manufacture.  Once I unlocked it from this position it would not lock back into that position.  In fact, the handle will only lock into the horizontal 90 where the trigger guard faces the left of the motor.  It will not lock into the horizontal 90 with the trigger guard facing the right of the motor and it will not lock back into the most needed vertical 90 position.  Since it just wouldn't be safe for me to use this buffer with the handle being able to just freely rotate, I have not used it and just dont feel comfortable writing a detailed review on something I have not fully used.The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because the thing does work.  Other than that I cant review anything else about it because I am not able to use it.  So I would tell potential buyers to just spend a few extra bucks and find a better-quality buffer polisher.

The YIMOOCH 1500W Buffer polisher with LCD turns me into a professional. It has 12 level speed setting that allows me to accurately control all kind of applications. It also has detachable and flexible handles that provides enough pressure when using it. I can use to Sable, polish my table, buff my car etc. This is a great item for my tool room. I have no second thoughts. I highly recommend this one

As a fitness enthusiast and a Science guy, I am always curious to find the real value of a supplement. What works and what does not work. More importantly, I believe the analysis of a product should be based on strong scientific knowledge base, combined with good old fashion practical use of the product, and only then one should come down to the final conclusion.This product review and analysis was conducted based on 3 parametersA. Constituents: What comes in the box, the real value of the productB. Assimilation: How does this product goes down in your system, how much of it will your body assimilateC. Usability : Long term usability and and effects.I believe this is one of the best supplements available in the market today. The Question is Why?1. The Quality of protein. Since its manufactured by Glanbia (who owns Optimum nutrition), this product is coming straight from the manufacturer. This is a BIG factor, 90% of the protein supplement companies source their raw materials from third parties, often importing them from third world countries.100 grams of Whey protein isolate from one source is NOT equal to the 100 gram Whey protein isolate from another. Inferior resources usually have high level of Heavy metals and cattle Hormones. This has been elucidated from recent tests and published widely in the consumer reports. ON aced this report with minimum levels of such harmful residues. Reason is simple, they make their own whey in a plant which has to abide all regulations under US law.Just for the point of reference. I am from India, and therefore know first hand how many poorly regulated cheese plants export their whey to Europe and US. So make sure your Whey protein is coming from Whey extracted in the US!!The Additives2. Ideally, I will prefer the protein powder with no artificial sweetener. But lets face it, such a product will be hard to sell. However, Golds whey keep artificial sweeter to minimum. If you check Bodybuilding.com forums, lots of consumer complain that its not sweet enough. I request all such folks to realise that is actually good for them, if you feel this product is not sufficiently sweet for you. Its better you use lesser amount of hydrant (Milk, water, juice etc), or add a tiny bit of Honey.The Profile- The Myth about Isolate vs a Blend3. This might be hard for some people to digest. However, the truth is 96% people who use Whey supplements, will have no additional benefits of taking an Isolate vs a Blend. Please note, when I use the word blend, I mean a product lile Golds whey which is well balanced with Whey isolate and Whey Concentrate. (not any junk product form the market). If you take the blend, you might get 1 gram of extra fat or 2 grams of extra carbs which is absolutely nothing. You can burn this by adding 1.5 minute to your jog routine or walking for 2-3 minutes. You will get the same result and effect as the Isolate, so its not worth spending extra refined Isolate. The Isolate rumor is just a Hype created by the supplement industry. I will repeat this again, if your blend is as good as Golds whey i.e you are getting 24 grams per 30 gram scoop, you don't need an Isolate.Who all comprise the 4% population who can benefit from an Isolate. First people who are extremely lactose Intolerant. I have used the word extremely since all good products add enzymes to digest the little amount of lactose residue in the supplement. Lactose is not a a bad thing, its simply the milk sugar. So if you are highly allergic to Lactose, Isolate will help (they have negligible levels of lactose)Second tier of people who can benefit from Isolates are professional athletes who are pepping up for an upcoming competition. This competitive set is consuming 5-8+ scoops of Whey protein daily and therefore will benefit from reduction in additional fat or carbs.4. Why go for Whey protein blend when you have specialized protein powders with Whey,egg and Casein.Its simple science, Whey is just better with the best Biological value*. This means that your body will better absorb and use the protein source from Whey more than any other source, therefore no wastage. Egg is also a great resource, which is just behind Whey. However in real world it lags behind Whey substantially, even the delayed absorption rate cannot compensate much. Scientifically it has been proven that Whey is just better, since it doesn't tax your digestive processes as much as an egg protein.Question of Casein:Its true that Casein has an edge when it comes to delayed absorption. Its anti-catabolic properties and slow absorption makes it an ideal night time protein. This said, its best when you take Casein in concentrated from, i.e. if you need Casein, take only Caesin, do not mix it with Whey... Why do I say this, Its a big topic based on metabolism response(will add a different thread later). One last thing 24 grams of Whey protein is NOT equal to 24 grams of Casein as the Biological value of Casein is lower than Whey.However Caesin does have its own benifit of delayed response, provided you actually need it.*Biological Value: Biological value (BV) is a measure of the proportion of absorbed protein from a food which becomes incorporated into the proteins of the organism's body.Whey protein concentrate: 104Whole egg: 100Cow milk: 91Beef: 80Casein: 77Soy: 74Last Thoughts:Always keep a note of how much protein you are consuming from Supplements Vs straight from the food. Ideally one should keep protein sources from supplements under 25%, but if your life style is demanding and you are unable to get hold of good meals rich in protein, you should always keep your protein dependency under 50%. In layman terms, for most of us who are looking for fitness, keep it not more than 2 scoops/day. For those who really pump some heavy Iron keep it upto than 3 scoops/day. (let me know if you wish to know the science behind this)In the end Supplements are only Supplements. The word Supplement has a lot of Drama attached to it, as if, if you don't take a protein shake within 30 minutes of your work out.. you will never make good gain. Total Crap. This is not a make or break factor(its just beneficial). Baring few exceptions. Supplements adds up only 20 percent of your fitness equation.

First off, I've purchased a bunch of different flavors of ON Gold Standard Whey. All of them have close to the same nutritional value, but they vary greatly in taste. Both my wife and I drink these protein shakes as part of our daily diet, and as a product, Optimum Nutrition is great. I've mixed with both milk and water, and all of the shakes mix well and don't seem to clump. I've tried other manufactures whey, and I keep finding myself going back to ON for the price, nutritional value, and above all the taste.So the flavor question. As I mentioned, each flavor has a different characteristic from the others. Some are bland, some taste sweet, some taste overly fake. We loved some, and we hated some. Below is a list based on what we like so far and why. Bear in mind that I hate diet drinks for their bad aftertaste. The drinks don't have to be sweet for me to like them, but I can't stand the garbage aftertaste of fake sweeteners.The best flavors:Rocky Road - By far the single best tasting flavor. The downside is that it does taste a little sweet. The nutritional value is right on with the other flavors, but it is a bit sweet. I could drink this all day. If you only buy one flavor, this is it. There is no real aftertaste, and the flavor is great.Extreme Milk Chocolate - Another good flavor with almost no aftertaste. This one tastes like chocolate, and doesn't have a fake taste to it. If you are looking at the chocolate flavors, this one is perfect.Natural Vanilla - This is a slightly different product, and it comes in a tub with yellow labeling instead of the red. It's on Amazon for the same price, and it has the same nutritional values. They claim it has less artificial sweeteners in it, hence the natural label. In any case, this is the best vanilla out there. There is no aftertaste, and it tastes like vanilla milk. It is not as sweet as the others, but it the single best vanilla flavor I've found.The middle of the road flavors:Cookies and Cream - This one is both good and bad. If you like the creamy vanilla taste, you will like the flavor. It doesn't have a bad aftertaste, but it is sort bland. It is sweet, but bland. Also, the cookie chunks in it don't dissolve. This is the only flavor so far that has bits of stuff that you are swallowing when you drink it. It's odd. That said, I have reordered it in the past.Chocolate Malt - It's just OK. The flavor is a little odd because of the malt. Given the choice, just order the Extreme Milk Chocolate.Caramel Toffee Fudge - Again, just OK. They tried too hit to many flavors with this one, and it just turned out odd. Not a bad flavor, but don't start out here. I got bored so I tried it. I doubt I'll order it again.And the bad:Double Rich Chocolate - This flavor sucks. It tastes like fake chocolate. Not good fake chocolate, but generic fake chocolate. It has that bad aftertaste of fake sweetener, and is all around not good.Vanilla Ice Cream - Another swing and a miss. This flavor tastes like bad fake powdered milk. It has that bad aftertaste, and is probably the single worst flavor they have. If you are looking for vanilla, avoid this at all costs and get the Natural Vanilla.Tropical Punch - Another fake tasting flavor. When I got this, I could barely get through the first few shakes. Eventually it grew on me a little bit, and I was able to drink it without hating it. It tastes like strawberry milk with a bunch of fake sweetener. It's just wrong, and is not something you want to drink after a workout.I know that taste varies from person to person, so take this with a grain of salt. I hate the taste of fake sweetener, so this list draws from that. I've taken to buying the 2lb tubs to try out a flavor, and then going with the 5lb tubs if I like it. It costs a bit more that way, but it means there is only 2lbs to choke down if you get a flavor that you hate.Enjoy!

Whey vs. casein proteinby Jeff S. Volek, Ph.D., R.D.Proteins provide the body critical amino acids that serve as building blocks for the formation of new muscle. But not all dietary proteins are equal. The major proteins in milk are casein and whey. These two milk proteins are both excellent sources of all the essential amino acids, but they differ in one important aspect--whey is a fast-digesting protein and casein is a slow-digesting protein.Whey stimulates protein synthesisFast-digesting whey means it is emptied from the stomach quickly, resulting in a rapid and large increase in plasma amino acids. This translates into a quick but transient increase in protein synthesis, while protein breakdown is not affected. Whey also has higher levels of leucine, a potent amino acid that stimulates protein synthesis. Whey protein is superior at augmenting protein synthesis rapidly, but this positive effect is short-lived. Consuming repeated doses of whey allows for sustained high levels of blood amino acids and repeated bursts of protein synthesis that provide superior effects on muscle protein balance.[1]Casein offers a positive protein balanceCasein is the most abundant protein in milk. It is relatively insoluble and tends to form structures called micelles that increase solubility in water. During the processing of milk, which usually involves heat or acid, the casein peptides and micelle structure become disturbed or denatured to form simpler structures. As a result, a gelatinous material is formed. This is the basis for why casein has a slower rate of digestion, and results in a slow but steady release of amino acids into circulation.In one study, researchers gave healthy subjects 30 grams of either whey protein or casein protein and made several measures of the anabolic and catabolic effect for 7 hours after the meal.[2] Whey protein resulted in a rapid increase in blood amino acids and protein synthesis, but it was short-lived. Casein, on the other hand, resulted in a prolonged increase in blood amino acids that resulted in a 34% reduction in protein breakdown. The net protein balance remained more positive after intake of casein protein over a 7-hour period. The superior long-lasting effect of casein was attributed to a delayed gastric emptying and slower absorption rate from the gastrointestinal tract to the blood.Whey and casein are better togetherSince whey rapidly increases protein synthesis and casein blocks protein breakdown, a combination of both would be ideal.A recent study compared the effects of supplementing with either a combination whey and casein protein versus carbohydrate on several markers of muscle anabolism during strength training.3 Untrained men participated in a 10-week resistance training program and either supplemented with 40 grams of carbohydrate or 40 grams of protein containing a mixture of whey and casein. Half of the supplements were consumed one hour before and then immediately after exercise on workout days. The results were overwhelmingly positive for the combination protein group. Despite similar background diets and identical training programs, supplementation with protein resulted in greater increases in several measures of muscle anabolism, including greater increases in lean muscle mass, thigh muscle mass, muscle strength, anabolic hormones and muscle specific proteins.In a similar study that lasted 14 weeks, untrained men performed resistance training and received either 25 grams of carbohydrate or 25 grams of a combination whey and casein protein one hour before and immediately after exercise.[4] The combination protein group had significantly greater increases in muscle fiber size compared to the carbohydrate group. These studies provide strong evidence that a combination protein consumed before and after workouts increases muscle size.Practical uses of whey and caseinThe science unequivocally shows that the digesting rate of protein is an important regulator of protein balance. Whey provides a quick burst of protein synthesis while casein makes an ideal protein supplement to sustain long periods of an anabolic environment for muscle growth. Based on these different characteristics, whey and casein can be used alone and in combination to exploit their unique biologic effects.For example, whey protein can be very effective before and after a workout and first thing in the morning. But since the benefits of whey after exercise are short-lived, you should consume a meal containing protein 20-60 minutes after drinking a post-workout whey protein shake. In one study, 30 grams of whey protein were provided in a sequence of 13 small meals given each 20 minutes.[1] This was found to be far superior for muscle anabolism compared to a single meal of whey or casein.Alternatively, a combination of whey and casein (20 grams) could be consumed one hour before and immediately after exercise for a sustained benefit on protein balance. Casein is a perfect protein for a shake before bed because it promotes a sustained anti-catabolic environment while you sleep.SummaryBecause whey and casein have different but complementary effects, many people keep both types on hand and use them differently throughout the day--whey in the morning and after workouts and casein before bed. Or you can mix whey protein into a large glass of milk (about 80% casein) to combine the benefits of both. Research shows these proteins support greater increases in lean body mass and decreases in body fat as part of a resistance training program.

When I first ordered this, it was for a fitness and nutrition plan that I needed 2-3 daily protein shakes to supplement (recommended by a team athletic trainer). I was very hesitant about this because I needed to drink so much of this daily for up to six weeks straight. Fortunately, this stuff is great!Flavor is an opinion, I got the double rich chocolate and was very happy with it (happy enough to order a second jug). It dissolves completely in a shaker bottle. During the nutrition plan from our trainer, I mixed this with cold water. It was satisfying as a single serving without sitting hard on your stomach, and it kept me from getting cravings for sweets or snacks.Fast forward a couple months, and now I'm pregnant and have developed gestational diabetes. I had about 1/5 of the jug leftover, and as I've learned to control my blood sugar through diet I've discovered that this product is excellent for controlling those glucose readings, killing the random pregnancy-cravings for sweets, and most importantly, I can have a shake (made with milk, yum!) at night when I take insulin.That said, learning all this new information about diabetes, I made a mistake in timing my insulin last week. Within one hour, my blood sugar dropped over 100 points and was in the 40s, which is very dangerous. I have never experienced something like this before, so it took several minutes to figure out there was a problem with my blood sugar. I did a meter reading and an alarm preprogrammed into my meter went off. I was alone, dizzy, sweating, confused, and a little groggy but I remembered a couple things my doctor told me: drink a big glass of fruit juice, then hit the protein. I swigged back some of my kid's juice in the fridge, then turned around and sitting right there was a clean shaker bottle with a waiting scoop of double rich chocolate whey I had set up for the next morning.I was shaking so much at this point and barely conscious, I couldn't get the shaker cap on completely, but I held it on as best as I could, shook it for maybe 10 seconds, then drank it as fast as I could. No joke, I was starting to lose consciousness so I dropped everything, grabbed the phone, and went to wake up my husband. All I could get out was I needed help before hitting the floor. He immediately called the high risk OB practice I see and the on-call doctor was able to walk him through how to read my meter's logbook, how to check my levels, and told him to get me to drink juice and some form of protein.This took about ten minutes, so as I was stretched out on the floor my sugar levels started to come up enough that the fog was lifting. I told them what I'd just had to drink, so my husband read the label of the whey protein to the doctor. Her comment- "that's perfect, I couldn't recommend anything better at this moment". When they did the next meter reading about 15 minutes after drinking juice and protein it was already up into the 90s, and over the next hour it stabilized around 110 thanks to the protein.It's not that this stuff saved my life, it's not that it even played the biggest role in the weight loss I experienced earlier this year. That was all effort and hard work... but the outcomes in both situations were notably more positive because of this. I shared the label with my doctor during a follow-up (this product is not available in stores locally). The doctors, nurses, nutritionists, and counselors were all very impressed with the nutritional content and values. They have actually recommended two shakes for the duration of pregnancy, and if I'm diligent 24/7 with my diet and taking the insulin properly, my blood sugar has been excellent since then.I would highly recommend this to athletes, those that are looking for a way to curb cravings, add protein if it's lacking, and of course as an effective tool to cope with gestational or type 2 diabetes. The carb load per serving is well under the recommended limits on diabetic diets, and best of all this stuff isn't gross. Choose your preferred flavor (the rocky road is also good). And be kind to yourself. Learn what is healthy for you. Do not use this product without also cleaning up the rest of your nutritional needs.And keep a scoop handy!

Weighed the container, and I got roughly 2lbs as mentioned, despite it looking half empty.Now, onto the review itself!As other reviews were mentioning, make sure the expiration date is on the bottom and NOT the side, otherwise it's not an authentic product and will probably taste like crap. Check the "scoops" that come with the product too (You really have to dig around with a spoon to find it).As for mine, I received an authentic product with 0 problems.So I don't have a blender or shaker.. YET. I mixed this with a spoon, and let me tell you it worked out pretty well! It still has chunks, so if you don't have a shaker or a blender yet, definitely accept this fate lol. I'd recommend purchasing a shaker! Amazon has some that are roughly $10.I know stuff like this isn't supposed to taste too great, but WOW this surprised me. I didn't want vanilla or chocolate because I'm getting very tired of those flavors and wanted to try something new. Pick something you'll be comfortable with for about a month or two. I read another review saying it tastes exactly like a banana laffy taffy and wanted to test this, and is absolutely does. If you just chucked a bunch of banana laffy taffies and blended them in milk, that's exactly what it tastes like.So that being said, it's a VERY strong artificial banana flavor, mildly sweet- but not overwhelmingly sweet. Genuinely, you can't even tell this is a protein supplement, and that's all I care about.I will be buying more of these in the future and trying out the other flavors, but overall I'd give this a solid 7/10. I'm not a banana guy myself, so I wasn't expecting to love this at the start.Blew my expectations though. I'd love to try the cookies and cream one some day.

I am usually happy with a protein powder if it tastes good and mixes well, and this is great on both counts.  I use protein powders because I am eating at a calorie deficit to lose weight, plus I am a vegetarian and don't really care for most protein-heavy foods (too many eggs just don't agree with my stomach, nuts and butters are super high in calories although I do eat some of those, etc.).  That puts me at huge risk to lose muscle mass, which I don't want to do.  One way to overcome this problem, or at least basically keep up (maybe not gaining, but certainly not losing muscle), is to consume additional protein.I have found one good way to get protein is to make a smoothie in the morning.  I take 8 oz of unsweetened almond milk, plus ground flax seed (or sometimes hemp seeds or chia seeds, depending on what is in the pantry), some type of greens powder or moringa, matcha, PB2, cacao, and protein powder and blend it all together.  Then I add a half cup of frozen mixed berries.  That way I am getting a lot of protein and antioxidants all at once, without too much sugar, but the chocolate/peanut butter/berry taste seems quite decadent.  This is the protein powder I have been using lately and it is one of the best I've tried.  It has a great chocolate taste (this is a review for the double rich chocolate flavor, by the way), and it is such a fine powder, it is easy to measure out and it mixes perfectly without clumps.  (I do use an immersion blender to mix.  I find mechanical means better for such things and it is easier to clean than a standard blender.)I love that this is supplemented with BCAAs.  I have recently become a big fan of BCAAs.  They work so well for me in reducing delayed onset muscle soreness, and I have been lifting heavy (for me) weights lately in an attempt to preserve muscle.  So I have experienced a lot of delayed onset muscle soreness, but I feel that the BCAAs are doing a good job of helping repair my muscles and ease the soreness.  That is a nice plus from this product. Plus, vegetarian diets may be low in BCAAs (although some are found in dairy and eggs).I also like the macronutrient balance here.  This is pretty low in fat and carbohydrates.  Although I am not strictly tracking macros, it is nice to find a protein source that is pretty much just protein and not much else -- I get plenty of fiber in my diet already from fruits, vegetables, beans, and grains, plus that way I can get my fat somewhere else (since fat does taste quite good!), like in using actual butter or olive oil to roast vegetables (instead of cooking spray) or maybe having a little real peanut butter instead of just PB2, having an avocado on taco night, etc.I do like that this is made in the US.  I feel there are better quality controls in the manufacturing process.  Plus, you know, I only feed my pets food and treats made in the US, and I should have standards at least as good for myself!In the end, I highly recommend the double rich chocolate flavor, in particular, as a palatable, easily mixable, nutrient-balanced vegetarian protein formulation.  Once I make it through all the protein powder samples I have accumulated, this is a top contender for a repurchase.

This is a great protein powder all around, but so far chocolate is by far the superior flavor and texture wise.. it does have a couple extra grams of carbs and sugars per serving compared to some more expensive brands, but it also is at the top of the list with amount of protein, vitamins, aminoacids per serving for almost half their cost. Really 2.5 for me, I gave it the extra half star since I am rating it on the following which is subjective at best.  I have been using this protein drink (Chocolate) for years, and I was happy with it.  I gave it a 4.5 out of 5.  It tasted good, mixed well, and had a good consistency.  This is based on using it with a blender only, with a "thick shake" setting.  Recently, something changed.  The price increased by about 10% to 20% and the amount decreased by about 10%, from 2lbs to 1.78lbs.  This annoyed me, but was not enough to give it up.  I understand that things go up sometimes, not enough to change my rating, so I re-ordered.  When I tasted it I realized something had really changed.  The taste was… different, and not in a good way.  It's hard to describe, but it tasted "artificial," definitely not what I was used to.  The taste was strange; previously it tasted like a milk shake, I could not tell that there was anything artificial in it.  But now… it was not good.  It was tolerable, I have tasted worse protein drinks, but it definitely was not what I was used to from this brand.  I then compared labels from the old to the new.  The only difference was at the end of the ingredients it listed an "immune support blend" of C, D and Zinc.  I don't see how this alone could change the taste so much, but something did.  I used to alternate between this and the "Naked Whey" brand, since the "Naked Whey" was a lot more expensive and it did not taste as good, .but was all natural.  Unfortunately, the taste in the new version is bad enough for me to give it up completely.

This chocolate peanut butter protein is some of the best tasting protein I’ve had. I’ve used this many times; large and small jug.That being said, there’s only one issue I have with it. The smaller jug has a super flimsy lid. It will appear like it closes correctly, however if you squeeze the sides of the lid it will pop off. So, if you pick it up by the top, the jug will let loose and tumble to the ground sending powder everywhere. Happened to me twice with two different jugs. Only got to enjoy half of the bottle as the other half was blanketing the kitchen floor like a fresh, brown snowstorm. The large jug does not have this lid problem from what I’ve experienced.In conclusion, the protein is excellent but beware of the lid of the smaller container.
After lifting weights.

I find adding a half scoop to my high protein yogurt adds 15 grams protein. Strongly advise users to chew a papaya enzyme with use of this and all Whey based protein powders. I've tried a wide variety of protein powders and this one is one of the better ones that I've had. Great amount of protein and amino acid content especially for the price. If you're looking for a good taste this one has it.The only problem I had with it was the solubility of it in water. If you try to stir this in a cup you're not gonna have good results. Even when I used my blender bottle it still had a graininess to its texture and I had to use my high power blender to completely mix it.Once I used my blender though all the problems went away and it went down nice and smooth with a superb flavor and was a great drink to have after my workout.
This stuff actually taste good and provides a lot of protein in one scoop. Great price and value. I won’t buy anything else. Def recommend!

I've seen reviews claiming these have deceitful nutritional fact. Mostly in terms of the actual amount of protein per scoop. I'm here to tell you, I can't confirm that because I don't know how to, and more importantly, I don't really care. As long as it's not unhealthy for me, it's fine.Now, to the review(s). I've tried Strawberry, Bananas & Cream, and Cookies &Cream. They all blend the same in my shaker bottle. No protein clusters of chunks floating around. They get very frothy, though. And if you're a fan of whole milk, these are REALLY good with that. Almond Milk is just as good, it just makes them thicker in consistency, so you get more of a milkshake texture. I haven't tried water because I will never mix protein powder with water. Ever. Yuck. I hate it. Plus with milk/almond milk you get that extra 3-5g protein.Cookies & Cream is my absolute favorite. It takes just like a milkshake. Seriously. It's delicious. I can go on for days about this one. My goodness!Bananas & Cream is just the same. Very potent with the banana flavor. It seems slightly thicker than Strawberry and Cookies & Cream, but that could just be me. The flavor is the bomb, though. I love it.Strawberry is strawberry. And honestly, that's all I can ask for. It tastes like strawberry. And if you've had any other brand's version, you'd appreciate this review. Strawberry tastes like strawberry. Not Nyquil. That's all I'll say on that.Strawberry Banana. I mix these two occasionally. One scoop of each, because I love strawberry banana flavored things. As and I love the taste of these two combined.This also mixes very well with oatmeal. I use about half a scoop in plain oatmeal, cook with almond milk and a few walnuts. It's amazing. I never have to add anything else, except maybe butter.Overall, I love this stuff!

I have been using the for about two months I don't really need artificial protien to hit my protien intake for each day. However it does help with bulking because sometimes I need an extra 300 calories. If you do buy this just know you need to drink a lot of water. I personally drink about a gallon a day, and it seems to be fine with me. So no uncomfortable trips to the restroom if do drink the correct amount of water for you. Just remember any type of protein powder is rough on your kidneys so don't use this in an excessive amount. 1 scoop 30 grams of protein max it out at 2 and it's 60 grams

I knew I had to change something in my nutrition habits, not saying anything it's really wrong with me. Also, since my sister drinks protein shakes, I asked her for a reference. Afterward, I usually do a form of exercise for 15 minutes or so. As I mentioned, once the powder gets comfortable with me, I can always adjust or tweak a few simple changes to how I consume it.
Overall, I love this product because it actually has a really good taste,I am on a weight gain journey, and I have seen great results.

Background: I’ve been lifting weights for pleasure for 20 years. I’ve used creatine and vegan powders, but it’s my first whey protein. After using this for a week, I’m pleased with the results. I’m a small woman who loves lifting weights, so I only drink one scoop on water or milk after my workout.Digestion: I have a sensitive stomach , usually avoid sweeteners, coffee, lots of flours, etc. I still get to drink this whey protein without issues. I also listen to my body: if my stomach is not up for it, I only drink half of the massive spoon and leave the rest for later.Flavor: Banana flavor is Not bad at all, actually kind of enjoyable with milk, even with the sweetener.Results: It makes me feel full and I’m noticing that lifting more, eating more protein, and adding this has made the whole process easier and I’m getting bulkier ( more muscle ).I deduct a star because I wish it didn’t have artificial sweeteners in it , but I knew it when I bought it.I have no idea if it’s spiked , if it has all the protein it claims to have or not. I’m just happy that I can keep it down and it seems to be helping my weight training goals. I would try to find something healthier in the future, but this is a good kickstart for me to get past the plateau where I was.I the Creatine of the same brand before my workout , less than a spoon. I don’t mind if the whey only has 1.5 g per spoon. I’m already taking creatine and  I don’t need that much more for my size, so a gram is perfect for me. Then I drink the whey post workout or a little earlier in the day to supplement a meal.For $17 for 2 lbs, it’s a good value, and will buy again next month.

good value

I don't like the fact that it has to be consumed within 10 minutes of mixing it because drinking it so fast always makes me feel more than a little sick. The fact that they use artificial sweeteners means that you're not digesting it and it just rapidly creates bacteria that makes you sick if you drink a lot of it at a time. (More of the sweetener in your body all at once=more bacteria.) I've tried sipping but I'm just not that patient and artificial sweeteners aren't good for you, anyway. I'll be looking for products that either use Stevia or nothing from now on.That being said, the flavor is one of the better ones though still chalky. I think the quality is good. I work out 2.5x a day 6 days a week including weightlifting (total of about an hour and thirty minutes a day incl. dynamic warm-ups and static stretching cooldown times which do a lot of the anti-soreness work), drink a serving of BCAA's at my first workout and I don't have a lot of muscle soreness if any, though I still feel fairly exhausted by Saturday.The scoops are huge so it doesn't last long. I didn't factor in the servings per container when looking at this. If you were to take 2 scoops every time it would only last 9 days. As I stated, I work out twice a day every day except Saturday so that means I've run through this container really fast and will probably need to order another one in less than a week from now. I'm thankful it's cheap or I'd have given up on buying protein powders all together.It's rather a lot of calories totaling up to nearly an entire meals worth at 2 scoops but I don't eat much, anyway, so this helps me not be too far under my calorie goal in the event that I don't consume enough for any reason.The one thing I will say is that the Cinnamon Swirl one is horrible. The taste is bland and it doesn't seem to have anti caking agents so not only can you not scoop it properly and there's always a massive empty hole at the bottom that you can't fill but it doesn't even mix. You end up just chewing on clumps of the powder it's disgusting. I've even tried doing it with boiling water/milk, hoping the heat would help dissolve it. It helped a little bit, but stopped working after a bit. I'll only eat it in my hot cereals, now, since you won't really be able to tell that way and I can add extra flavorings to it to make it taste better. But I won't be buying another one.

I fell in love with Beachbody's Recover drink (chocolate) but realized I could get the same benefit out of a regular protein shake instead of spending $80 a tub for 20-something servings. I have tried quite a few different brands and flavors to get something that tastes even remotely as good as the Recover does. The extreme milk chocolate flavor is good even mixed with water.
