I love the flavor, I love how this protein mixes and I love how swole I am getting just by ingesting this protein!! Don’t read those negative reviews because clearly they don’t have love for the gainz.

This review will be on three different flavors. Tropical Punch, Extreme Milk Chocolate, and Vanilla Ice Cream.First, I am not a gym rat or anything like that. Like many people after the new year, I decided I wanted to lose weight, but this time I actually started working out. lol. I know that protein is a great thing to have especially after a workout. I have tried Whey Protein in the past and it always tasted absolutely gross. I was shocked beyond belief when I received my first Whey Protein order of Extreme Milk Chocolate and how good it tasted. That's when I bought the Vanilla Ice Cream and then the Tropical Punch and I have placed an order for the Mocha Cappuccino. The previous protein powders that I did not like were not Optimum Nutrition if I remember correctly.I titled this Tropical Punch because I had a heck of a time finding reviews on that particular flavor.I make my mixes 8oz plus one scoop of powder. You'll understand this later. I also use one of those hand shaker blenders (I think that is right).TROPICAL PUNCH - After reading some of the reviews, I opted to try this with Gatorade (or maybe it was Powerade) first because many people said that this tasted nasty with milk. I have not tried it with milk and I don't plan to after trying it with the Gatorade and Powerade (both were fruit punch and I also tried it with the White Cherry Powerade). It tastes pretty good to me, but it doesn't taste like tropical punch or at least not any tropical punch I have ever had. I use 4 - 6 oz of either sports drink and the rest water to make 8 oz. Thus far, I have one of these after a cardio workout. I know that these sports drink have a lot of sugar (21g per serving) but that is for a serving size of 12 fl. oz. Basically, 7 - 14g of sugar is a heck of a lot better than downing a 12oz can of soda (I had a "discussion" with a friend and needed to vent that line. lol)VANILLA ICE CREAM - This also taste pretty good to me. It taste like it says. I mix this with 4 - 8oz of 2% milk (sorry fitness extremist, but skim milk is just not that great tasting to me and yes I have tried it with skim and 1%). Of course, if you use 4 oz of milk then use 4 oz more of water to make the drink.EXTREME CHOCOLATE MILK - I saved the best for last, for the ones I have tried. I love, let me repeat this, love this powder and I never thought that chocolate would be my favorite flavor (I'm one of the odd people that prefer vanilla over chocolate). If you want to try one Whey Protein to see what it is like, then you have to get this one in a 2lb jug to see if you like it. Since I'm not the only one using this powder, my first one (purchased about 3 weeks ago) is almost gone and I just ordered a 5lb jug of this because it is that awesome. I mix either soymilk (If you told me ten years ago that I would enjoy a chocolate flavored soymilk, I would have cried laughing over the improbability) or my 2% milk 4 - 8oz. When I mix this with the 2% milk, it tastes almost identical to Barber's Tru Moo Chocolate Milk. When I mix it with the soymilk, it tastes a bit off from the "Tru Moo" like chocolate milk, but not comparing it to that, it taste really good.I will add more when I get more flavors. I hope this helps people decide on this product.
I have no idea about quality but it tastes great shaken with milk

I have tried many types of protein, including vegan (super yuck). I'm sure there are comparable products to this one, but I have had good results using Gold Standard Whey. I have only had the chocolate flavors and they are very tasty. Adding a banana, strawberries etc only enhances the flavor. It's, at the very least, a good place to start. You may not have to go to another product after trying it, though.
My only complaint would be that it’s dairy and therefor for can cause slight stomach issues. Anyways it seems high quality and tastes great.

I noticed that this didn’t taste the same as usual (in a bad way).  Then took a look at the two labels.  Definitely some changes.  I’ve ordered this for years, but not sure if I’ll keep buying.  Definitely not as good - taste wise.

Tastes great! A lot of people have issues with the taste of other protein powder (me included) but this was VERY surprising with how smooth and yummy it is! I don't even have an issue with using water with it when push comes to shove, and considering I'm lactose intolerant, it didn't leave me with any digestive issues or tummy aches afterwards, and it's been a few weeks since I've been taking it.

The Extreme Milk Chocolate tastes terrific.  The Unflavored doesn’t have much effect on the taste of milk, so I use it on cereal.I’m one of the older rats in the barn.  I turned 70 a few months ago.  I have been working out off and on forever.  When I was younger, I was trying to be slender, not scrawny.  As I got older, I became more concerned with slowing the aging process.  Recently I ran across articles in several reputable sources observing that older people need more protein than younger, so I thought I’d give the whey a try.  The results have been extraordinary.  I’ve plateaued at 21 pushups for years.  I just did 26.  Since I started going to this particular gym about 10 years ago, I have occasionally managed seven pullups.  I just did nine.  Keep in mind that there are no secret minerals in the whey.  What I am is a guy with a not atypical omnivorous diet who was probably getting at the low end of the protein recommendation for younger men of his weight.  This was fine for getting me through the day.  But apparently, I wasn’t getting enough protein to take full advantage of my workouts.

Guess what everybody...this product is great. I go through phases where I have one protein shake every day, and this is the best one I've tried. It's great by itself, but I often add in some instant coffee. I think this powder would work well with a regular diet, but I personally like it when I'm trying to do keto or just reduce my carb intake.Remember: liquid first, then add powder. I recommend blending in half of the scoop first, then once that has blended, mix in the other half. It blends more smoothly that way for me.Looking at the negative reviews - I didn't have any issues with a "gnarly chemical smell," and I've never had to contact the company, so I can't speak to those criticisms. I started buying this during the pandemic, so I'm not sure if the formulation I've had tastes different than some of the older reviews. I never had any gastrointestinal issues with this product, either.I just use hot water, personally. The taste is still good without adding milk. If I want a bit extra taste, I'll add 2 oz heavy cream at the end. Well, that or heavy whipping cream, which I learned is a different thing from just regular "heavy cream." Who knew? I didn't. Don't judge me. We all start somewhere. My knowledge base for creams (and many dairy products, generally) is just lacking for whatever reason. Maybe it's a failure of the education system. Maybe I'm genetically predisposed to not retain information regarding different types of creams. It's not like I'm over here confusing dairy products for facial creams or something like that (I'm not a total "Lost Cause"), but still. I'm going to have to go down to the city library and see if there are any good sources of literature on this issue, but to be honest I'm not 100% certain that it is a good/efficient use of my time.Anyways, my partner likes to make hers in a regular blender with just milk and a handful of frozen fruit.

I tried both the extreme milk chocolate and the vanilla ice cream flavors. I tried to convince myself that I didn't hate the vanilla for so long, but I am at the point where I can no longer tolerate it. The vanilla completely overpowers literally everything you put it in with this strange, cloying flavor. I tried smoothies, oats, pancakes, desserts...everything I could think of. The only thing I can do with the vanilla is make oats, and that's if I use some other flavors that actually drown out the strange "vanilla" flavor. Other than that I am at the point where I am just trying to gag it down to finish it off. The extreme milk chocolate is simply okay, but it's much better than the vanilla. It tastes more like a packet of cheap hot cocoa mix, which is fine; it's not really "chocolatey" to me. However, neither of these powders mix well with hot liquids (like coffee). That is a mistake that I made several times while trying to finish them off. They dissolve okay in cold liquids. Overall, I would never order the vanilla again (do not make the mistake that I did!), and I am on the hunt for a better chocolate protein powder from elsewhere.

Review based on Extreme Milk Chocolate flavor.There's a reason they call this "Gold Standard." Each scoop packs in 24 g of high quality whey isolates, aka the pure protein good stuff, with only 130 calories and 1.5g Fat per scoop. Whey is a short acting protein, so it's best taken shortly after a lift session. This review is based on the Extreme Milk Chocolate flavor. While it doesn't taste as good as something like Muscle Milk, I didn't expect it to, since it cuts out a ton of the sweeteners and calories found in Muscle Milk. With 8 oz of water, one scoop of this stuff creates a mild, odd chocolate flavor. I wouldn't say it's bad, but I wouldn't say it's good either. With 8 oz of skim milk, the flavor improves a great deal, and is borderline "tasty." With milk, it also creates a much thicker drink of a milkshake like consistency. I will definitely stick to drinking this with milk from now on. If the taste was a little better, I would have given this 5 stars.As a medical student, I know that a lot of these protein supplements are not only unnecessary, but can be dangerous. Excess protein won't help you build muscle any faster. It has the potential to clog up your kidneys and lead to kidney damage at a young age. I spoke with several doctors I've worked with in the hospitals during my rotations and here's the consensus: 1) Keep well hydrated. The more dehydrated you are, the more likely the excess protein will damage your kidneys. 2) Don't over do it. The average person only needs about 1 g of protein per kg body weight. If you're exercising a lot (especially lifting), your protein needs certainly increase, but only to about 1.2 - 1.8 g protein per kg body weight. The average person gets plenty of protein in their everyday diet, so adding a supplement isn't necessary for the vast majority of people. Studies have shown that most people DON'T benefit (ie. gain any more muscle) from adding them to their workout. Here's the thing: If you're dieting, you may be losing some of the normal protein sources in your diet, and therefore, could benefit from some form of protein supplement. That is where I fall in. I am currently trying to shed some pounds with dieting and exercise, while trying to not only maintain, but build some lean muscle. So for me, I think the supplements will be beneficial.Summary and advice: This is a great choice for protein supplementation, especially for those on a diet, due to the high percentage of protein per scoop, with low calorie/low fat profile.

3.5/5I bought this shake to increase my protein intake while reducing carbs and fats in order to grow lean muscle mass.  My first experience was awful.  I had the first serving after getting home from work, had it in water.  It mixed relatively well, no big clumps but you could see the powder in the liquid, it would have probably settled after a while.  I started drinking it; first, I didn't like the smell, second, the texture is awful, you kind of feel the powder in the water.  The aftertaste was good, but drinking it was a bad experience.  Later that night at the gym I had to run to the bathroom, it totally messed up my stomach.  Also, my tongue and palate felt like If I had burned drinking a very hot beverage.  I thought this was something else until I noticed it felt like that after drinking the shake, every time.  Second time I had it in water it didn't mess up my stomach, but had the same trouble drinking it. The only problem I have is that milk has fat and carbs, which is what I'm trying to avoid.Now, later that week I decided to give it a try in milk.  What a difference! It's blissfully good! Creamy, chocolaty, dissolves well, no strong smell, didn't mess up my stomach!  As good as any chocolate milk!  I did feel the burnt sensation on my tongue and palate.So, in summary: good in milk, bad in water.  Weird sensation in tongue and palate after drinking, which goes away soon.  Drink plenty of water afterwards.I'll update soon with details about performance.Update: Using a shaker bottle helps a lot when mixed in water. Texture is improved and is easier to drink.  After this I believe it is deserving of the full 4 stars.  Hopefully performance will make me change it to 5.

Great product for money gets tight but you still need your protein. Great for a meal replacement, and for meeting your protein goals. Taste really good especially with milk or almond milk but water isn't bad either. For 24g of protein and 120 calories per scoop, it is really hard to beat.

I'm going to review this product base on: flavor, solubility, and effectiveness.Flavor:I've never heard of milk chocolate (as a drink) before, and maybe it doesn't really exist outside of this product, but this product does not taste like chocolate milk. Before purchasing ON's Whey Gold Standard, I discuss the option of flavors with my friend. My first choice was the Double Rich Chocolate, who can go wrong with chocolate? But he mentioned that it might be too chocolatey for me. So then I saw the Extreme Milk Chocolate (EMC) and thought that it was a perfect solution; it is chocolate, but not super chocolate.Perhaps this is my own fault for not reading the flavor correctly, but I thought milk chocolate was the same as chocolate milk. I mix the powder with milk (I don't think any whey powder taste good mixed with water), and it makes a nasty sewage color solution. It taste as good as it looks.I think the flavor is milk (like powder milk), or vanilla powder, and chocolate. So when it is mixed with milk you obtain milk, milk, milk, milk, chocolate. I think the ratio of milk powder is a lot more than the chocolate. I have tried using less milk and more powder to see if it changes the flavor, but it does not.As far as taste goes, I would not buy the Extreme Milk Chocolate, maybe try the Double Rich Chocolate. I purchased the 
Optimum Nutrition 100% Casein Protein, Chocolate Supreme  2 Pound
 and it taste a lot better than the EMC, so that is my reasoning for possibly buying the DRC.Solubility:To mix the whey I use the 
Sundesa BB28-MC01 BlenderBottle 28-Ounce with BlenderBall, Blue
, and it works pretty well. The blender bottle works wonderfully (I've written a review for that too), but this powder does not dissolve well, maybe 90% of it dissolves completely. No, its not user error. When I use the blender bottle to mix the Casein protein, all the powder dissolves. It could be that particular flavor, I cannot say for sure until I try another one.The one issue with this powder is that it generates a lot of gas when it is mixed using blender bottle. After shaking, the liquid produces a lot of bubbles, it can be rectified by swirling the bottle, but the gases still form. So a few hours after drinking it, I get really gassy. Maybe it's my body's reaction to this type of powder, I have never experienced this with any Muscle Milk powders. ON's casein powder also produces gas, but not to the same degree, and it doesn't cause me to become gassy.Again, maybe it's just happens with this flavor, I won't known until I try the Double Rich Chocolate. The only reason this brand is still redeemable in my eyes is their casein powder. I'm pretty much blaming everything on the EMC flavor.Effectiveness:This one is going to be short, I promise. I'm sure you already know the benefits of whey protein, otherwise you would not have search for this product in the first place. There are plenty of sites that can give you information about whey protein for workouts, and most of them say that the majority of whey proteins are the same, the main difference is flavor, hence the reason my review is mostly based on flavor.I gave it three stars because of the flavor (-1 stars) and gassy side effects (-1 stars).

Preface: I bought this specific powder because according to the "Big Reddit Protein Powder Measurement Results" (Google it!) spreadsheet, it has the one of the closest claimed protein percentages vs actual tested protein percentages. In other words, I figured I can trust it.I am unsure about the results as I am only a few months into my new diet and I have yet to begin my proper workout routine. As such, this will be subjective on the taste and consistency.Taste: a bit too sweet, and definitely gross with water. However, it tastes okay with whole milk and actually a little like someone took Swiss Miss and added a bunch of sugar to it, along with a spoonful of some mostly-tasteless substance that thickens everything a bit.Mixing: it does dissolve pretty well, but not as well as might be implied by packaging. Mixing it is actually very similar to trying to mix Swiss Miss cold: it clumps a bunch and sticks to the spoon. You'll have better results using a mixer or shaker. HOWEVER, it is totally drinkable mixed with just a spoon or fork in a glass.My tip for people who are new to protein shakes and find the regular mixture hard to swallow/gross: use a full serving (1 rounded scoop) with about 6 ounces of whole milk. If you don't have a mixer/shaker, stir it well with a spoon, but then let it sit for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, and smashing any large clumps on the side of the glass. Then close your eyes and chug it. Think of it like a medicine, not a meal.

I really love ON Gold standard protein. It's become my "go to" brand for supplements for a few reason. First, it's not loaded with extra sugars on carbohydrates. It's also really nice having a large amount of nutritional information on the label.The taste is unlike any other protein I've had. So far I've tried chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla ice cream flavor, all of which have been fantastic. My personal favorite so far has to be the vanilla ice cream. All of them taste better than any other brand I've tried. The powder mixes really well, much better than most other protein powders. After maybe 10 seconds of shaking in a blender bottle, there's no clumps left, just a smooth shake.If you want an awesome tasting protein that is low on carbs but gets the job done with proteins, look no further!

I initially bought a smaller container from my local grocery store and once I knew it was fine with my stomach and taste buds I ended up buying this huge container here and just refilling my smaller container. The price on Amazon is a huge value for this size too!It mixes easily into liquid (I use almond milk) and I also use a high speed blender with ice and a frozen banana. The (gourmet) vanilla flavor is the only flavor I’ve bought because I can use it to make EITHER a fruity shake or chocolatey shake just by adding cocoa powder. I’ll add 1/2-3/4 scoop right into my instant oatmeal.Getting more protein daily into my diet has been much easier with the help of this powder. I’d highly recommend trying if you haven’tfound one you like yet.Also- there is stevia along with other “natural” artificial flavors. But their whey protein isolate has been working for me so far with no tummy troubles!

I've tried 6 or 7 different low and no carb protein powders in the last 2 years. This stuff is the best if the bunch. In taste, mix ability, muscle care, etc. Sometimes I'll eat nothing but protein pancakes for 3 days straight and be fine with it. Feels like I'm cheating. Tastes like vanilla birthday cake. Mix 3 eggs, 3 scoops of this, and a few splashes of almond milk (check the label, almond milk can be 17g of carbs, or 1g. I buy the cheapest stuff from Walmart or Aldi's that has 1g or even <1g carb). Mix it all up, if it's too runny, add some more powder. Put the batter on a griddle after rubbing it down with butter. Flip after 3 mins. And in about 5 mins you'll have the best tasting pancakes. I like lots of butter and that's my diet - high fat, zero sugar which some day increases testosterone. Out of all the proteins on Amazon, all in the $35-$55 range for 4 or 5 pounds, nothing works as well as this stuff. Adding baking soda only makes it bloated and brings out the egg taste way too much so I skip it. If you want to lose a few inches in 3 weeks, each these for 2 meals a day. Or, do yourself a favor and get a good shaker cup. You can make a 75g protein milkshake in one cup and you're good. Bottom line is, I've bought them all, tried them all, and Dymatize Elite is by far the best in all categories. Tastes great, truly. I feel like I should be getting fat eating this and drinking this because it's so tasty. It's worth the extra few dimes a day! Save yourself the trial and error and several hundred bucks - I did that for you. One caveat- I can only vouch for vanilla. It's my favorite but I can't imagine it's much different in other flavors. I like this brand because you don't need multiple scoops for a 24-30g serving of protein, but the prices on this have gone just absolutely off the rails. I've tried many different types of proteins, but I've always been a huge fan of the good old fashioned Gold Standard.Price: (4.5/5)5-Pounds for ~$55 is a great deal.  You can probably find it a bit cheaper other places, but nobody else delivers in 2 days or for free.  If you go into GNC or any other large supplement store, they are going to charge you around $70 for the same product. Also, if you are someone who buys pre-made protein shakes at $2-$3 a pop, STOP RIGHT NOW!  One scoop of Gold Standard has 24g and at the current going rate of $58, that’s about $0.75 a shake.  Plus, the 5-pound bucket should last you at least 1-2 months, as long as you aren’t taking 3 scoops a day.Flavor: (4.5/5)This is category that will trip up most people when buying protein.  I don’t care what anybody says, taste matters.  If you are going to be drinking a shake every day, or nearly so, you don’t want a nasty, chalky, chunky drink.  This is something that Gold Standard does really well.  I like the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor a lot, but their Delicious Strawberry, Banana Cream, Strawberry Banana, and Double Rich Chocolate Flavors are all awesome as well.  The recommended 8 oz. of water per scoop is a little high for me, as I like a creamier shake, so I usually put 6 oz. in and it’s perfect.  I’ve also had a lot of success putting scoops of protein in various smoothies, on PB and J sandwiches, in my yogurt etc.  The only better tasting brand of protein I’ve ever had is Syntha-6, but for the extremely low fat and carbohydrate ratio in ON-Gold Standard, this one tastes amazing.Mixibility: (5/5)This is one of the easiest mixing proteins I’ve ever had.  My shaker bottle makes short work of any powder, but even if I forget that, a spoon in a cup or even just shaking up a scoop in a bottle (sans blender ball) does the trick.  As I said earlier, I put protein in my yogurt some days (by the way, Vanilla protein in plain yogurt = vanilla yogurt… mind blown) and even that takes minimal mixing with a spoon to get it completely mixed in.Ingredients: (5/5) I touched on it earlier, but Gold Standard does it right with their ratio.  24g of protein in only one scoop, with less than 1 gram of fat, 1 gram of sugar, and 2 grams of carbs.  Also, it has been a long standing tradition with ON to only use high-quality protein isolates, which, if you care about your body at all, is a very good quality for a company to display.

I've tried a lot of protein drink mixes over the years and the ON Gold is by far the best tasting and the one I've had the best result with. I'm not a big guy, I'm a guy with a small frame that was just shy of 180 lbs when I started using this product and after 5 months I'm now under 150 lbs and I'm now far more muscular and quite lean. while that weight is below what I'd like the mirror tells me that it suits me pretty well and in the end it's what i look like that's more important than what I 'think" I should weigh.Now I'm not going to sit here and tell you that all this was done by drinking this magic Whey protein as that wouldn't be true. I also cut my daily carbs way down and increased protein intake. I don't eat bread anymore, i cut way down on deserts except on special occasions and just plain eat healthier. I drink this stuff twice a day one before my workouts and one right after. I lift heavy weights for about 40 minutes each work day and then do HIT on a rower for about 20 minutes making my workouts around an hour each day before work (getting up at 3:40AM is rough, but it's paying off). I have to eat like a horse now just to keep from losing more weight because the muscle I've built up is burning calories all day long!I snack on other protein sources throughout the day which include peanuts, natural peanut butter (right out of the jar), high protein Greek yogurt, a hard boiled egg and sometimes a protein bar. I also drink about 10 80z cups of water through the day. And by the way I'm just on the cusp of turning 50 and my build is better now then when i was lifting in my early 20's! I credit that in part to ON Gold as I'm sure the ingredients are far superior to what i took those many years ago. I'm also lifting weights that are a little bit heavier than when I was in my prime as well. i don't have the endurance i had back then, but my strength is actually slightly better now then it's ever been.I've tried Vanilla Ice Cream, Double Rich Chocolate, Rocky Road and a mint one (forget the name). My favorite is the Rocky road, but I usually buy the Vanilla Ice Cream because I get more for my money and I blend it with just a a couple strawberries and a few blueberries to give it some extra flavor and it's very good.

Meant to order Double Chocolate, but fat fingered this flavor and have to say I'm happy with that "mistake."  Years since I used a protein supplement and there are obvious improvements.  Ordered not because of how hard I work out, but because I dont eat the amount of protein I used to, dont have the same appetite, and thought a serving or two a day would be good a good idea.  It does fill you up making it easier to resist grabbing some pretzels or chips.Amazing how much easier it blends in just cold water.  From my recollection there would always be chunks, some stuck to the bottom or sides of the glass, but with this drop a scope in, stir for 10-15 seconds and it's good to go.  The taste is also vastly improved.  I distinctly remember chugging each serving to minimize the time I had to taste it.  Not that I would sip this, but it's got a decent flavor and what do you expect from something that is over 80% protein by calorie?  With low cholesterol per serving and highly concentrated protein source by calories it's perfect for multiple things.Can't really say if it helps with muscle gain or recovery since my days of working out frequently and intensely are over, but it does keep an aging for former gym rat from reaching for an empty calorie snack.  If somehow it turns back the clock and my workouts start improving I will be sure to update it, but right now couldnt be happier with the product.

The vanilla ice cream flavor is much, much better than I expected.  It may even be my overall favorite.  Glad I ordered a whole 5-pound drum of it.It tastes almost exactly like vanilla ice cream, minus the calories and without the chokingly rich milk-sugar throat feel.Literally I like it better than actual ice cream.It is difficult to resist drinking 2-4 of these per day.What's more: it blends better than any of the other flavors I have tried to date, and I have tried a lot of them.  Malted milk probably blends worst, while vanilla ice cream and coffee blend best.Coffee is also incredibly good, but seems to have actual caffeine or related compounds left over in it; I am sensitive to it, to the point that even decaf gives me skin problems, but small amounts are ok.Anyway, I like to mix this with creatinine, d-ribose, tyrosine, beta-alanine, taurine, and a few more uncommon personal favorite ingredients for the perfect early afternoon boost.  Everything blends in perfectly, no chunks to break up with a butter knife, so whatever additives make it blend seem to help dissolve any other custom items I like to add as well.  In other words, it is very compatible with extra supplements.I like this one better than french vanilla, too.  Overall just very impressive work by the R&D team at this company, will keep buying as long as it exists.

This is a repeat purchase. Good value for the money, great flavor. The double chocolate is our favorite. Goes great with milk or coffee. Vanilla is more versatile for mixing in though, which we sometimes buy as well.

Just bought this and I had to stick my hand and forearm into the jug to find the scooper. A good amount of the powder spilled into the kitchen sink just trying to find the stupid scooper buried at the very bottom. Are we NOT supposed to find it until we're done with the jug?  I also spent an hour trying to research how much I'm supposed to take (that is, I researched what their scoop is equivalent to... a teaspoon, tablespoon, etc.. with no luck). I read other reviews here that said to use a spoon or kitchen tongs to look for the scooper, and I had given up. Then I wanted to contact Amazon's customer service, but first I'm supposed to contact the manufacturer who will not even reply to me unless I bought it straight from them --- so I gave it one last chance, and stuck my arm (forearm deep) into the bucket and swirled around until I felt something when I was literally scraping the bottom of the barrel with my fingernails. I pulled out a gold colored scooper. There it was. And there also was a mess in my kitchen sink of powder wasted. At least tell the customer how much the scooper is equivalent to, so no one has to go through this. . . .  I will update this review in the future as far as the whey protein and its effects. -- For now, only 1 star for making me waste what I purchased.---UPDATE JUNE 15, 2013--------So after using the Whey Protein, I'll raise the stars from 1 to 4.  (I'm still pissed about the scooper, so no 5 stars.)  As for the product, I'm not using to grow muscle at this point, so I can't comment on that. I've been using the Whey Protein to preserve the muscles I already have as I lose weight (burn fat) by taking in enough protein while dieting. I guess my muscles are being preserved, so good product I'd say. The taste at first was not the Vanilla Ice Cream as expected. It tasted more like Vanilla Ice Cream with metal and pennies in it. If you go into this expecting the actual taste, you'll be disappointed. But if you go in expecting a metallic taste, then you'll be surprised that there's some vanilla flavor in there too. I got used to the taste after a few months of use.
I’ve always used this powder but this last shipment wasn’t good, damaged product I have to ship it back if I want another one but I just don’t have the time and I’m at school so

In summary: High protein per serving, a lot of added aminos (no need to add extra glutamine), about $8 cheaper here than at supplement stores that rhyme with PNC, mixes well, tastes good, and does not spoil quickly.I am a casual lifter and a fan of optimum nutrition ("ON").  Between that and muscle milk, I have been using these products for approximately 10 years.  Last year I decided to branch out and try another whey supplements given that I have never really tried others; I just went right to ON.  So I tried 3-4 types.Aaaaaand now I am back with ON.  I had marked less gains and recovered noticeably slower with other protein wheys than I did with ON.  I imagine part of that is all the amino acids and other things in ON, whereas many other wheys are just the whey or minimum amounts of the extras.By no means am I a fitness junkie like I was in high school or college, and certainly just a causal lifter now, but I still do full-body workouts and I find my body needing more then just whey.  ON has just become my staple and it mixes well while taking good.  I frequently mix it with oatmeal in the morning for breakfast, or on the weekend with ice cream.  I like the plain vanilla flavor just by itself, but it mixes well with pretty much everything (fruit or peanut butter).The amount of protein per serving is fairly high and there are a lot of amino acids added which make buying extra aminos or glutamine a thing of the past for me.  I rather just have to mix on thing than create a concoction of everything--especially when running late in the morning.I recommend this to causal lifters or high school/college athletes, which is what I had used it for.  I can't say I would recommend it for body builders, merely because--well--I am not a body builder.  But I imagine they may be satisfied too.

I've been lifting weights off and on for most of my life now and this is the best protein I've used.  Mixes well in any shaker cup, great taste and a good amount of protein at 25 grams a serving.Yeah, it's a bit pricy but everything is nowadays.

Optimum Nutrition makes a good quality whey protein that tastes pretty good and has some of the better ingredients (provided you stick with basic flavors like Vanilla Ice Cream, Double Rich Chocolate, and Strawberry) than many other whey protein supplements. It also mixes quickly and easily with a simple shaker cup in 4-8 ounces of water. Yes, it will taste better with milk, almond milk, oat milk, or cashew milk (and be a little thicker).

I've ordered 5lb vanilla twice recently. Amazon shipped a product manufactured almost a year ago (manufactured 12/20 ordered on 10/21). ON shipped a product from a newer batch (manufactured 5/21 ordered on 6/21). There is a difference in after taste and consistency, but it is still the same powder. Just not as good as the fresher, more recently manufactured product.Despite this, the flavor and consistency are much better than any other powder I've tried. ON is a great brand. I've never experienced any negative side effects from this powder and I drink 2 scoops a day mixed with milk & fruit, sometimes an extra scoop with cereal or oatmeal at breakfast or yogurt at dinner.It is usually cheaper to order on Amazon, my take is just order from wherever suits your needs better.
So yummy! I was using it as a meal replacement and thoroughly enjoyed it, amd felt full.
Bigger than expected.It tastes good and kind of shashaMy friends and I love it.Recommend!

This is a great starter protein for anyone looking to get into fitness. Mixability is fair, works great in a shaker. Many flavors offered but honestly vanilla and chocolate are about all I could remain consistent too. It’s a little pricey for the quality, but available everywhere. Great place to start and evolve from.

This would be a great protein powder if it didn't have such an awful taste. But it's easy to scoop, dissolves well in water, and has a really good amount of protein per scoop. You just gotta swallow it down.

Notice increased rate of recovery and increase in gains within the first few weeks of using it.Been taking it 3 times a day. (One in the morning w/ breakfast & before workout, one after my workout, and one before I go to bed.)My biggest gripe is that I got the Rocky Road flavor, while good tasting, it contains sucralose (splenda) in it.While I'm not terribly concerned because the amount of the sweeter is very low in the powder. (i.e. You would need several large scoops (1/4-1/6 of the container) before you even came close to the amount that is in one can of soda)Next time I purchase I will be buying the vanilla flavor as it does not contain sucralose in it.I cannot say whether sucralose has any long term health effects, but if it does, I would prefer not to find out on myself.Happy with the results, not very happy to discover sucralose in it. Since it's my own fault for not researching properly, I see no reason not to give this product five stars because it works beautifully.ON is one of the only companies that has been found not to lie or alter the truth on their labels. Other companies that offer protein powders can differ by up to 20% on their labels, so do your research!I used to buy BCAA's and Glutameine seperately, but since this is a blend, it fulfills my daily intake of what I usually would take, saves me money.I also take ON's creatine powder w/ the protein powder three times daily. I found using the creatine w/ the protein powder helps it mix with the water better so I don't have powder at the bottom.
Good flavor, blends well and tastes like vanilla ice cream.  As expected and will buy again.

I wanted to write a review about this since I realized I’ve been using it for years. I checked my order history and the first time I ordered it was 2011 and it’s now 2020 so it’s been quite awhile. My favorite flavor is vanilla ice cream and I can use it with vanilla flavored things and also chocolate flavored things and it’s not a distinct vanilla flavor which is really nice. I like the chocolate flavor as well and I’ve tried a few of the other flavors but I’ve found they have some odd after tastes so I don’t use those anymore. My husband likes this protein for his shakes and I just had a baby so I’m using it to make protein oatmeal to keep my milk supply up. I mix it with chocolate pb2 and a spoonful of pb and it’s great. I’m not working out yet but I’ll have it in a shake once I get there. It’s easy, the ingredients aren’t terrible and the taste is great. Plus the price is on point.

This is the best tasting whey protein I've ever had. It still has a slight "protein smell" that hits your palate, but people aren't joking when they say it literally tastes just like vanilla ice cream. I put 2 spoonfuls of peanut butter and it tastes amazing. And when I say that, I don't mean amazing for protein. It tastes amazing, period.Other than that, it's mixability is pretty much as good as it gets as well.

Definitely glad I got this protein. Optimum Nutrition is always the best way to go when it comes to supplements, as they always deliver on quality, and effectiveness. I love how smoothly this stuff mixes in just about ANYTHING, seriously. And it tastes amazing, I don't feel like I've gotta just slap it down. Tastes good mixed with your favorite drink, or with just plain water. I use this to lose weight, so most of the time I mix it with just water. But sometimes I like to mix it with milk or orange juice or even into my oatmeal or yogurt. I also love that it only has 1g of sugar in it, and it is very low on calories. It is easy on my stomach, I am lactose intolerant and this protein is lactose-free which is perfect. No gassy feeling after drinking it. I would suggest getting the 5lb tub or even the 10lb. It lasts you a lot longer, and the price on here is the best, considering you also don't need to worry about shipping, not only that, in stores, 5lbs of this stuff will easily run you at twice as much as here.. You WILL be spoiled after using this stuff, you won't want to use anything else, certainly nothing below standard. Only protein even better than this stuff is the Platinum Standard Hydro Whey, also by Optimum Nutrition. The only reason I don't use that is because it is not lactose-free and I did experience a bit of gas for a while. But you can't go wrong with anything by ON.Update February 2021: this stuff is still the best and a go-to. Recently purchased the Banana Cream flavor and it is DELICIOUS. Still swear by and highly recommend Optimum Nutrition's products.

I've been using this for years now.The research suggests that about .8 grams of protein per pound of body weight per day is optimal for maximizing muscle protein synthesis (in combination with resistance training of course). That's a lot of protein, and it can be hard to eat that much without also going overboard on the fat and carbs. This is an easy and delicious way to get extra protein in your diet. It dissolves easily and tastes great. I mix it with water or milk depending on how many carbs I want at the moment. I also mix it with oatmeal in the mornings. Pro tip: mix the whey powder thoroughly with 1/4 or 1/2 cup of *cold* water before you mix it in with the hot oatmal to avoid lumps.

I bought this (as I do almost all Amazon things) because it was cheap and it would arrive fast. This one came with significantly less powder (once I got a new one from a nutrition store directly I was able to compare) and the color of the powder is a little browner, the one I bought from Amazon had the quality/safety seal removed, and it tasted significantly sweeter. This leads me to believe that this was a fake product. BEWARE
We are happy with this powder so gar  has a great taste, mixes well with all smoothies/shakes we have made so far and does fill you up. We are happpy

Tried the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor - it was better than expected. Really easy to blend into smoothies or my morning yogurt. The tub I got was pretty full - definitely seemed like 5lbs worth of protein.I also like the protein per calorie level of this brand. It is expensive, but not unreasonable. As someone that has tried a LOT of brands of protein, I'd generally recommend a normal vanilla flavor as they tend to be more versatile and easy to gulp down.
Flavor
This vanilla ice cream flavor is the best one I’ve tried out of many different brands and flavors.

I writing this review on 5lb - french vanilla.Pro1) It tastes so smooth and nice. I couldn't taste any chemical taste to it as I did with my previous whey. Sometimes, I work out so that I can justify myself to drink this (not even joking)2) It mixes real well with water and 2% low fat milk. I haven't t tried other drink but I had no problem with water and milk.3) It works. After heavy weight lifting, my sore muscles used to take 3~4 days to completely recover and ready for the next round. With this whey it takes me about 2~3 days and I can feel my muscles growing faster than before. I actually started to gain weight a little faster.4) Reliability. This product has been out in the market and used by many customer for years. You can rely on this whey and not worry about banned chemicals, etc.5) Fair price. I won't say this is the cheapest one out there. But it is definitely  a good price for its performance and safety.ConI couldn't find it yet. I will update it if I see one.Overall, I definitely recommend this product. I did find some cheaper products on Amazon but I did not risk my health over like 5~10 bucks. For the quality of the product, the price is definitely fair and I will buy it again when it runs out.
Totally recommend, good taste, high quality

I've never used whey protein powder in my life, so I wasn't sure what to expect. I imagined a strong, sweet, artificial flavor and maybe some clumps. Wrong on both counts. I bought the vanilla ice cream flavor, planning to mix it into some almond milk. Before adding extra calories, I figured I would at least TRY it with water first. So glad I did! The flavor is NOT strong or super sweet AT ALL. It's super, super subtle. Clumps? None. It's perfect. This stuff is perfect. Highly recommended.

This was recommended to my Husband by a professional. So when I came across it, I thought okay cool I'll surprise him with it! He loves everything Vanilla, go figure the taste is his favorite thing about it. I do mix it with ice and put in blender. Sometimes he'll go behind me and add a little more powder. I wouldn't suggest it but he has been fine doing so. He started this for about 2 weeks before he started a regular exercise routine. Let me tell you this dude has begun to fill out in places I thought he would always be scrawny in. He also has hyperthyroidism and has quit being a baby about it once he began drinking this regularly. Would absolutely recommend and repurchase. Also, it is HUGE! I ordered it over a month ago and it literally is like half full! Affordable Gem! #founditonamazon

I have used this product for several years and it has remained outstanding in taste, while blending with fruit, yogurt and lo-fat milk. I blend all those ingredients together and make a shake about 16 oz. for a mid day meal. It is a little heavy to pick up when full, as I keep it out of sight.I remind anyone that the scoop will be near the bottom of the powder, when opening the first time, and a long knife or utensil will be needed to find it. Once you know that, then it is easy to find it. I keep a scoop in a drawer so I can use it with the next order and not have to dig for the new one. EEZY PEEZY. I have found no other product with these ingredients for this great price. Enjoy.
The Vanilla Ice Cream flavor is ama-za-zing! Whether in a smoothie or just with milk, the flavor makes the drink chuggable. Blends well with all different types of blending cups.

Purchased for my boyfriend and stole a few sips to fall in love lolI store a bit in a travel container to mix at work when my work day has me stuck at the desk. I use my portable blender and add milk with ice. Frothy delicious ice cream flavored treat that fills me up. No chalky after taste at all.

I've ordered this 13 times from Amazon - I always get the 5# Vanilla Ice Cream. This is a great whey protein product that tastes great and mixes easily with any milk - I use almond milk. Try it, you will like it.

I have been using Optimum's 100% Whey Vanilla Ice Cream powder for several years. It is great-tasting, easy to mix up, and easy to digest. It is super convenient to add protein any time of day or night. My favorite mixing bottle to use is the Blender Bottle. In my opinion this flavor is one of Optimum's best, if not the best one. 5 stars.UPDATE: 2017Something changed in the formulation recently. The protein seems to thicken way up, too much. I like making a couple shakes the night before work so I have them chilled for breakfast and lunch. They used to thicken slightly overnight (I make them with milk). Now, they are VERY thick in the morning, it is almost unappetizing. I am thinking some cellulose or 'gums' were added.It was such a great mix, taste, texture before, why screw it up? When customers find a product they like, don't change it!I have noticed that if I use maybe 1/2 water and 1/2 milk it is less thick, but the thickening agents don't make it better. If you use a blender and ice, it will already get thicker.Note to Optimum: change the formula back to the 2016-ish and before recipe, that was much better. The flavor is still good now, but whatever makes it 'thicker' has made me knock off a star (or maybe 2).Of note, I have been a long-time purchaser of Optimum Nutrition products, starting with Pro Complex protein back in the 1980's.

I've purchased this whey about 5 times...and many other brands over the years.  I am very happy with the solubility of this powder--it does blend in a shaker cup with water or milk.  I like to mix the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor with milk, so one scoop + 8 oz. milk yields about 32 grams of protein.  I have no idea if it's true, but I've read that the body can't absorb more than about 40 grams of protein with any one meal, so I don't bother with more than one scoop at a time.Many of the other brands I've purchased over the years do not taste as good or blend as well, although this is mostly subjective.  A few brands have a metallic taste--not the Gold Standard.  Also, the GS has 30 mg of Cholesterol (10% daily value/2000 calorie diet), which is 10 mg or so lower than other brands (and even other GS flavors, which is why I stick with Vanilla IC).  The 5 lb container includes 77 scoops.If you are wondering, I have tried other flavors, but I keep coming back to the Vanilla Ice Cream.  First of all, you can always add fruit to this flavor, or Hershey's Syrup if you're in the mood.  I like a frozen fruit berry blend from Target with milk and powder in the blender; the frozen fruit gives it a fruit-smoothie texture!
Is it normal to find big chunks of hard pieces with gooey stuff inside?

Man this powder is delicious! The vanilla ice cream is so good, it seriously tastes like a vanilla milkshake to me. I just plop a scoop in a tall glass, pour milk and mix it up with a fork, absolutely wonderful. I will be buying this many more times.

We have tried few flavors of this whey protein and liked the vanilla ice-cream flavor as best. If someone does not like whay then they may start linking it using this one. This also seems to have least sugar among all the available options. Blending with water takes some time.
The flavour blends well in my shake. It don’t have that awful after taste I’ve experienced with others.
Goes well with PB2 and almond milk, but had to measure by weight since it did not include a scoop.
Large container which makes it a good buy for what you get.Highly recommend.

Overall I’ve loved this protein powder for a while. It does everything I need it to do and it’s easy to mix. I simply won’t be ordering this anymore though as yeah I know inflation is a thing, but it doesn’t give you an excuse to make a 5 pound tub of protein powder to nearly $75. This is clearly ON just saying screw you to the customers you’ll buy it anyway.

Product was delivered super fast. I bought 5lb of the vanilla ice cream protien powder and i swear this is the best tasting protien powder ive ever had A+ and the container was absolutely full. Also within its sell by date.

Using my kitchen scale, it takes a scoop and a half, almost 2 full scoops, to get a 31 gram serving. Seems kinda scammy in that aspect. Also, it does not have they nice smooth taste of other protein powders. It does mix well, and considering I have a food scale and can measure portions, it will work, but unless I weigh out the whole bucket I'm not sure it will have as many servings as advertised. I really just wanted to let everyone know that if you are looking to get the nutrition value of "one serving" you are going to need about a scoop and a half.
Smell Good; Taste Good. I got everything I need. Perfect Ice creams in my cup

Excellent product and excellent price for my favorite protein. Excellent protein with fast absorption rate. I used to purchase through Bodybuilding.com exclusively but now they're always limited in their flavors and they charge shipping. So, here I am back at Amazon. Product arrived quickly and is the same high quality I'm accustomed to.

By far the best protein powder I've ever used.I've tried Double Rich Chocolate and Vanilla Ice Cream and both taste great, blend super easily in a shaker bottle, and mix well in smoothies and shakes. None of the clumps, slimy texture, or artificial aftertaste I've gotten from some other brands.Optimum also always scores really well in the third party analysis of protein powders that I've seen. The label is accurate so you know exactly what you're putting into your body.High quality at a reasonable price. Highly recommended.
I have been using this for years as a supplement or a light snack “pick me up. “It blends easily with frozen fruit or juice for a refreshing smoothie.

I normally don’t like to venture outside of chocolate protein powder, because in my experience I don’t like any other flavor in it. But I had heard good things about the vanilla ice cream flavor, so I took the risk. It turned out to be super good! Similar to Nesquik Vanilla Milk if you’ve ever had that.The only bad thing is that the container came j completely crushed in on the side and won’t pop back out, but the flavor is so good that I’m still keeping my review at 5 stars. Lol

This is a really great whey protein powder. The quality is very good and the ingredients and ratios are great. It even has "Lactase" as a final ingredient, which is the enzyme that helps you digest lactose if you are lactose intolerant like me. And, I even didn't have any issues on my first protein shake I made (which was this stuff, blended with almond milk, frozen chopped spinach, and a banana. But, then, I had another shake later in the day that was just the protein and almond milk and that did affect my stomach a little bit and gave me gas. I think that the lastase in this probably isn't enough for my body. And, it doesn't acutally tell you how much GALU is in it (for reference a serving of Lactaid has 9000 GALU which equals three tablets of Lactaid, and I don't think that much is a in a single scoop of whey protein here; so I offset it now by taking a single tablet of Lactaid or an equal off brand and that solves my digestive issues).I recommend this powder for any serious exerciser, whether or not you are doing aerobic or anaerobic. Please vote yes below. Thanks!

The product itself is fine. This review is for the subscription. I signed up to save the extra 5%. I have received two shipments thus far and both  times the inner seal was broken. The cover took no resistance to remove and the powder spilled all-over my counter. Normally with a product like this you peal the inner seal back, this insures freshness and let's you know the product was not tampered with. The seal simply came off inside the cover with no resistance and explosion of powder on my counter.  I have no way of knowing the powder is fresh and untampered. Secondly the 2nd shipment was the wrong flavor. I ordered Vanilla and got double chocolate. I hate chocolate when it's a protein powder, and it wasn't even the milk chocolate, it was double, so double hate it. Not that I'm going drink it anyway. I like gold standard, but can't trust buy it here.
I dont reccoment vanilla flavour, just get the chocolate

I have not tried every protein powder available, but compared to the ones I have liked this one the best.  It also isn't loaded up with sugar like many other brands, which is cool.  I actually prefer the vanilla ice cream flavor.It says instantized so that it mixes readily with a spoon, but you need to really whip it to get the chunks out if you're just using a spoon to mix it into water or milk.  But yeah, totally mixable with a spoon, which is also cool.I read the one star reviews, and they're all complaining about the taste.  Again, check the nutritional label:  there's only 1 gram of sugar.  It is not sweet, at all.I didn't like the sugary, more calorie dense "better tasting" powders like Body Fortress and stuff.  I'm not using a protein powder for the delicious flavor of whey products, I'm using it to supplement my protein intake, period.I'd really recommend drinking the vanilla mixed into milk.  It's definitely not awesome in water.When mixed with water, I'd add some other vanilla flavoring to pump it up.  If I'm in a hurry for breakfast I'll throw in a no sugar added Carnation Instant Breakfast Vanilla flavor, and the two vanilla powders in water are 100% potable and inoffensive.

ON whey protein powder is usually a pretty solid product and at a relatively decent price.  It also dissolves quite easily in water and depending on what flavor you get, or on your taste buds, it can taste pretty good.  Based on my experience, and if I'm only drinking it with water, I would go with Strawberry and Cream, Double Rich Chocolate and Rocky Road (in that order).  The flavor I recently received was Vanilla Ice Cream and I think it's horrible, so I would stay away from it, but I also realize that taste is subjective.  I've gotten Vanilla Ice Cream in the past and don't remember it tasting this bad, so perhaps they changed the formula, but it's not a flavor I plan on ever getting again -- it tastes extremely artificial with a horrible aftertaste; I will just stick the ones I previously mentioned.
Arrived timely and is the perfect protein supplement. Great flavor and nutritional content. Good value especially with subscribe and save

I was really hesitant to buy this particular product due to the negative reviews. Honestly, I have not experienced a single thing that would make me not recommend this product.The flavor is great !! I have purchased Vanilla Ice Cream and it tastes exactly like that.Blending the product is no issue either. I pour the powder in first, use a fork to move it around a lil, add some milk and mix it up once again.I'm no nutrition expert so I'll probably update my review on whether I felt any of the benefits the product claims. I will of course keep my training consistent and exclusively use this product.
I’ve been using ON for more than a decade. Great protein. Easily mixed and the flavor is delicious when mixed with 2% milk. Highly recommend. Amazing value
Taste good

I got the vanilla ice cream flavor.  This isn't quite as tasty as the Isopure creamy vanilla protein powder, but the price is better so I think I'm willing to sacrifice a little flavor.  Isopure is more of just a creamy almost powdered milk-like flavor with a hint of vanilla flavoring whereas this one is heavy on the imitation vanilla/birthday cake-y flavor and I'm not a huge fan of it.  I know some people are really into the synthetic vanilla/fake cookies sort of flavors you often find in protein powders and bars, so you might really like this.  I might repurchase this it's a pretty big tub and I could see myself getting sick of the flavor eventually.  Other than that, though, it performs well as a protein supplement.

ON Gold standard is one of the best there is, of the many I have tried, it is the best. This Vanilla Ice Cream flavor is sweeter and more vanillay than the regular vanilla, which makes it all the more better to drink.  It mixes decently in a shaker cup, granted i always mix with cold milk, but there's always a few lingering chunks.  no problems in a blender or with room temp water. Will continue to buy this brand, thos will experiment more with flavors.

If you're an avid lifter, you already know.  Best protein powder on the market.  No gimmicks, just everything you need to make the gains you need.  Have been using it since high school with no plans of switching.  I like Vanilla, but the chocolate and double chocolate are good too if that’s your flavor.

Like most protein shakes, if you just add water it is not going to taste like you went to Dairy Queen. but with a few recipes you can make some excellent tasting drinks.-= Vanilla Shake =-To start, find your round spoon buried inside your container. Its in there, just use a kitchen spoon to dig around and find it.- 1 scoop of protein. (vanilla ice cream flavor)- 1 cup of milk. (add more milk as desired)- 2 ice cubes.- 1 scoop vanilla ice cream. (optional)- Blend 10 seconds.Even without ice cream it taste great.. for me, I don't worry about fat so I enjoy the bonus time to time. Don't have a blender?  no problem, put 2 cubes in ziplock and smash em in a towel lol.I even throw a scoop of protein in my waffle mix on weekends to mix it up.. So don't worry about flavor.. you can put protein in anything..  drink it raw, or give it love, it is up to you..Hope this helps all those who worry about flavor. Just remember, protein doesn't come as a jar of cookies..  you gotta make the cookies.
Has a good amount of protein and blends in great without any particle or powdery taste.  Easy to use in a hand held shaker or your Vitamix.
Been using this for years. I mix it with Fairlife chocolate milk daily. Great whey for my heavy lifting, meathead. Swole is the goal, size is the prize. Peace love and protein.

Satisfied with the flavor, the contents, and the results I’m seeing from using this product. Although there is one minor issue. The specific flavor I bought claimed to not have sucralose, the “vanilla ice cream” flavor. But as the product arrived, I saw the ingredient was actually in the product and I was disappointed to see that. I would rather a product not have an artificial sweetener, but it’s hard to find a good quality protein with glutamine and amino acids at a reasonable price. So this is the best of a bad situation, being completely honest. Would much rather have a product with natural sugar, but I can’t complain too much. I’m seeing results and have had no other problems as far as consumption with this product. It’s easily mixed and tastes phenomenal while giving me results in the weight room I need within a month of using. Would reccomend. 8.5/10 (would be 10/10 without sucralose)

I freeze a banana in little slices and when I mix them with water and the powder, it comes out like the consistency of a milkshake.  It's like going to Dairy Queen after each workout.  This product helps with recovery and lessens the soreness of a workout.  Being over 50 and on a diet, this product has worked very well to help me drop fat and increase muscle, while helping me reduce cholesterol (hard to keep cholesterol down when increasing protein intake).  Even if you are not using this product to work out, I'd suggest it as a way to keep protein intake up while reducing cholesterol and fat intake.
It tastes like ice cream. I add chocolate and a frozen banana to make a nutritious drink.

Tastes great!  Dialysis patient waiting to get a transplant and transplant team suggested I get this for weight gain being new to dialysis and lostv10 pounds in three months as my body adjusts. I've gained. 2 pounds in a short time and going to the gym to put muscle back on. I was afraid I would spend that price and not like it but not the case!!  I love it

The two major problems I've had with other shakes are 1) They taste terrible and 2) They don't mix well (or when mixed, they foam up so much that you're basically eating instead of drinking them). This shake has neither problem - I totally disagree with other commenters about a foul taste - this is actually delicious. I got the vanilla ice cream flavor and mixed with water it tastes really good. It's not at all too sweet or gross to me, on the contrary it has a pleasant, mild taste.

Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard whey protein powder mixes easily with water or milk.  I like the reputation ON has for purity and quality, and the calorie/protein ratio is excellent (just 120 calories/24 gram protein).  I have tried 4 flavors of this, all very good, but I like the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor the best, and Chocolate Mint second best.  The other two I tried I'd say it was a tie - French Vanilla Crème and Extreme Milk Chocolate, and as I mentioned those are very good too.  I often like to mix this up in a large glass with half skim milk, half water, and add several ice cubes or crushed ice.  Let it chill for a bit from the ice and it's delicious.  I find the 5lb container to be convenient and cost-effective.

I like the versatility of the of the product it goes well with my organic juice cleanse powder. I've been using this product since the spring of 2005. they've actually improved the flavor a few years ago. My only dislike is their scoop, the handle is in the middle causing it to collect powder and the scoop is also opaque so one cannot see if there are any pockets. Fortunately I've saved some of the earlier scoops which are clear enabling one to see any pockets and the handle is at the top preventing any product from collecting on the outside. I have informed them of this several times,but to no avail.
Love the taste great to get your protein in!
Gold Standard is some of the best Whey Protein you can buy. It blends well, there's no filler, and the flavors taste great. Highly recommend if you want a great protein shake.

To each there own. I have use ON protein for years. I stick with extreme milk chocolate and double rich chocolate. I decided to try chocolate peanut butter. It’s gross. I’ll slog through it and never buy this flavor again. It tastes like chocolate and peanut shell dust. Maybe you’ll like it. I don’t.

I'm not a laboratory so I can't verify the ingredients quality... but the taste and how well this stuff mixes is tops. I don't know how they do it, but t has the consistency of a milk shake! When you mix this throw a couple of ice cubes in it so that it's nice and cold! It mixes just fine when cold. I didn't expect it to suck, but I'm really impressed with how well this tastes.

Vanilla ice cream flavor came today and gave it a try with my wife.  We both agreed with one scoop and 8 oz of 2% milk it was very good and no grit.  I was expecting a chemical taste.  Nice vanilla flavor.  Yes, the scoop is there you just have to dig for it when you first open it up.  The instructions say to add 6 to 8 oz of your favorite beverage and blend it.  I could not imagine the vanilla ice cream with anything but milk or a smoothie.  Must be a generic label.  My wife had a good idea to use a refillable water bottle and shake it instead of dragging the blender out.  15 seconds of shaking and done.  Great product!

The flavor is as good as expected, great in smoothies. Add your favorite fruits to it with a couple of oats, greek yogurt and peanut butter and you have a high calorie high protein gainer that will last longer.

I really like the vanilla ice cream flavor. It can be made with a lot of ingredients to give you different flavors. My favorite is 1.75 cups of unsweetened almond milk, a handful of frozen pineapple chunks, 1/4 teaspoon of coconut extract and 1 scoop of protein powder. It's almost like a virgin Pina colada!
Mixes easily and is the best tasting protein powder I've ever had hands down!
Barely any vanilla taste. If it weren't for the protein, I wouldn't even gulp it down. I threw it away after 2 shakes. Seems to give me peeing problems too.

I had been using cheaper whey powders for so long that I forgot just how good ON is. I generally don't like vanilla powders but this is great. It also dissolves very easy. The old stuff I was using doesn't dissolve well and I was always lets with hundreds of tiny clumps floating on the top. That isn't an issue with this ON.Pros: Taste, dissolvability, ingredients.Cons: It costs a little more but not enough more that it's anything prohibitive.

Let me get this out right up front: If you have been drinking this flavor and liked it, DO NOT BUY THE "NEW AND IMPROVED" VERSION. Vanilla Ice Cream used to be my favorite flavor of the ON whey line. Used to be, but not anymore. I just received a new bottle, whipped up a cup as usual, and the first thing I noticed was how syrupy and gloppy it was. And when I tasted it, I almost spit it out. Clearly, something had changed -- for the worse! Let's start with the new consistency. The new label shows a variety of viscosity enhancers, eg, cellulose gum, xanthine gum, lecithin -- compounds which I have no problem with in various products -- which were absent in the previous recipe; but in this new formulation, I can best describe the consistency of the blended beverage as sludge-like, sticking thickly to the blender and cup. It is so viscous, I actually found it a bit difficult to swallow. Well, ok,  how about the taste? It is sickeningly sweeter, and the vanilla flavor seems very different (and not in a good way) from the original recipe. Looking at the labels, I see that ON has added sucralose in addition to the orginal acesulfame. This additional sweetener has the effect of changing both the degree and the quality of the original pleasant (IMHO) modestly-sweet taste to a new overbearing artificially-candied taste.  I frankly can't stand it. I don't understand why ON, which makes 24 different flavors, did not simply make a new flavor for people who might enjoy a syrupy, hyper-sweetened, artificial vanilla-like flavor, and just left the original flavor alone for those of us who had developed a liking for it. Don't buy this product if you are expecting the original flavor; the new version is dramatically different. Furthermore, if you have opened it, used it, and found it too disgusting, by all means return the opened bottle like I did. There was absolutely no indication on the website that the recipe had been changed; hence the product is "not as described on website." Maybe enough returns will send a message to ON. Maybe they will even revert to the original recipe.By the way (no pun intended), my one star review applies only to the flavor change, not to the general quality of the ON products

Really great protein powder, truly one of the best I've tried. I will be a repeat buyer on this one.  I always buy vanilla, because it's more versatile for everything I do with it: shakes, protein pancakes, overnight oats, and other recipes.  Vanilla ice cream flavor is just a step above what I was expecting.  The smell of this when I opened it...AMAZING!  Easy mixing and great macros: 120 calories, 1 fat, 3 carbs, and 24 protein for 1 serving (31 grams).  Also, there are 73 servings in this, so the price break down is phenomenal for quality protein.Thought I'd share an amazing protein pancake recipe I make almost every day:1/2 c. cottage cheese1/2 c. oats1/2 scoop (16 grams) vanilla protein powdersplash of vanilla extract2-3 egg whitesMix in blender, cook on skillet, DONE!  Fast and easy and tastes amazing.

SIMPLY LOVE IT!  GREAT PROTEIN.  GREAT TASTE.  GREAT PRICE.  I WOULD GIVE IT 7 STARS IF I COULD.I had about 3 migraines a week for 10 years.  Praise the Lord I finally discovered that dairy products were the chief triggers, but I never made the connection because the symptoms always occurred a day later.  I've tried every milk substitute under the sun and every one of them triggered migraines as well, and I had given up ever eating cereal again, let alone weight training protein supplements (yes, eggs were a problem too).  However, I can drink the 100% Whey with no side-effects whatsoever.  I use it as both a milk substitute and a weight training supplement (3-4 servings a day).  The 5 pound canister at a great price makes it affordable too.  I don't have enough stars to rate it.

The protein chocolate flavor is tasty. Some reviews have mentioned that a previous formula was much tastier, but there's nothing wrong with how it is now. Tastes great and mixes well with skim milk, beet powder, creatine powder, tart cherry powder, powdered peanut butter, and any other kind of goodie you want to add to make it super healthy.  You can even toss a couple of eggs in and blend it for even more protein.At its current price of $40.00, it only costs half of what many competitors charge, and mixing it with skim milk gives 38 grams of 16-amino acid protein per shake, so it's cost-effective, good quality, and gets the job done.

No gripes here. Per ounce this is among the top healthiest and best price. The flavor is good not great, but none of them blow it away. I use this with a few other ingredients for a brunch shake to replace my breakfast and lunch.
Arrived a couple of days late due to Icey roads. Packaged very well, seals intact, no damage or problems. Prices for protein powder keep going up, good to see some are trying to keep the cost down!
Very very tasty post workout shake for me....better than ice cream!
I've been waiting for this to be back in stock!! Great price, great results in the gym for over a year now using this protein powder and it tastes AMAZING
Gastric surgery recommended…. for protein after surgery…

I originally wrote a review about there being no scoop when I first opened the jar, the scoop being essential to measure the amount of powder to use.I just took a long skewer and probed throughout the bottom of the 5 pounds of powder.  I hit an obstruction at the bottom of the large jar.  After much effort, I finally was able to fish out the "missing" scoop.Why the scoop was at the bottom is hard to figure.  I find it hard to imagine it simply "settling" there.  It should have been near or at the top of the powder.  Hopefully, the producer will place the scoop last in the jar at the top of the powder.  Sealing it in pouch would keep it empty and less likely to "sink".  Perhaps the pouch could also have an adhesive strip to adhere to the top of the inside surface of the jar.
good product and affordable price
Flavor is good.Protein shakes
Great price

I was recommended this product by a friend. I've tried a fairly small number of protein powders. I was looking for something that was even more budget friendly than Optimum Nutrition and to be honest, it's clear where Body Fortress either "cuts corners" or is simply delivering a slightly different product.First of all, it's worth noting that Body Fortress uses whey concentrate, not whey isolate like Optimum Nutrition. The primary difference here is that, as the name suggests, an isolate is an even more "pure" protein nutrient. What that means in practical terms is that you have to have more of it to get a similar amount of protein. So yeah, two hefty scoops is going to give you 60g of protein in one hefty shake... but it will also mean more calories, more fat and, perhaps most disturbingly, a TON of cholesterol.*That's fine if you want more of those calories, but the thing that I'm not a big fan of was just how much of the product I'm going through so quickly. Even though Body Fortress costs quite a bit less than O.N. you are using a much bigger scoop, so you're going through a larger amount of powder in less time. At the end of the day, you get a few more grams of protein but at an almost negligable price difference. I wish I had taken that more into consideration when buying it. If I ever have the desire to really bulk up, this might be a better option for me, but I already do a pretty good job -for me- managing macros without needing the extra fat contained here.To Body Fortress' credit, the powder mixes easily in milk or water, doesn't smell or taste bad. So for what it is, it's fine. there are some clear compromises/decisions made in this product that don't work for me, though.*odds are that if you are working out and doing lots of exercise you'll be okay, but for those using it as a more relaxed meal/calorie supplement, you will want to take that into consideration.

This protein powder tastes great and works fine. My issue with it is only that they advertise 60 grams of protein per serving, which seems better than competing products until you look at the serving size required to achieve that which is a ridiculous amount. A true metric should be grams of protein per specific volume of powder. But since none of the products out there make this easy to calculate, it would take a lot of time and effort to figure that out.So anyway, without wading into those shark-infested waters, the average consumer like myself is left with other deciding factors: cost and flavor. And that's what brought me to this product, and I will continue to use it until I find a better cost/flavor product. I'm guessing most whey protein these days is about on par when it comes to volume of product versus grams of protein. This one tastes good, and doesn't break the bank.
Great value for those wanting a cheap protein

The main thing I want to write about is the flavor. I saw so many reviews saying the flavor was bad and it almost turned me off to buying this. The day I got it in the mail and made myself a drink, I used one scoop and about 8 oz of milk. Side note, the scoop was absolutely /buried/ in the powder, I had to dig around for five minutes to find it, thinking that they just forgot to include one. After mixing everything, I felt the result was way too thick (and a little chunky as well, which I couldn't get rid of just by mixing with a spoon.) In part due to the thickness, the result was a little sweeter than I wanted to stomach--keeping in mind that I tolerate less sweet than the average person. The other two times I've made it I added about an ounce or two more liquid (for one scoop), and today I used a smoothie cup to shake it instead of stirring, and both of those changes have made it great in my opinion.In the past, I've drank Muscle Milk, Koia, and others, and I find this to taste close to if not the best. I did a lot of math when looking at this versus other options, and for the amount of protein per serving and the volume of the product, it's really not a bad price. I think it was just slightly more than some other options and I was willing to pay a smidge extra for some of the qualities.

I use this product consistently for over a year now to meet daily protein goals. Its great! The chocolate flavor tastes fine and mixes great. The price however on amazon is ridiculous. It has doubled in a year lol. Literally buy it on Walmart or CVS for half price and pay an extra couple bucks for shipping. Just trying to help out!
Lost 2 stars on value for money.  Price increase of just under 40%, excessive.

Holy cholesterol!  This stuff is rich.  It tastes delicious, and has the calories and cholesterol to match.  It's also super cheap, and mixes well with water, both of which are great. For putting on muscle though, this works well.

I was able to buy 3 of 5lbs each at a good price, strawberry, vanilla, chocolate, but the next Amazon raised the price exaggeratedly, I will look for it elsewhere, Amazon deceives me with prices and they are not always They are affordable.but I gained a bit of muscle mass and feel good drinking my shakes Body fortress.

I've been using pretty much every brand of isolate, and I'm just sick of it. They taste bland and after buying over 10+ 5lb tubs over the years, you get sick of the watery flavor. People criticize this brand for having a "misleadingly" huge scoop, but the nutrition label clearly states how many scoops you're getting out of the container. Even purely on a protein/$ calculation, this brand is one of the cheapest per gram of protein. And let me tell you, it tastes way better than an isolate. it's like trying to eat a steak or burger that's 99% lean, yes it's healthier, but it tastes much worse. This powder will work much better for recipes etc. The better taste and sanity it provides is worth the extra grams of fat. The macros are still good at 200 cal and 30g protein per scoop, most protein powders need to be mixed with milk anyways to taste decent, but this one doesn't. It tastes like hot cocoa. Just heat it up and throw some marshmallows. You got yourself a healthier and sustainable treat instead of depraving yourself of taste in pursuit of the best macros. The only thing that tastes better is syntha 6 cold stone, but after finishing 3 different tubs, I'll be the first to tell you it's not worth it. those things give you gas unlike anything else, pretty sure it's the digestive enzymes they put in the powder, because nothing has ever come close to syntha 6 levels of gas. So just get this

There is a lot of protein in here.  There's creatine and bcaas.But the cholesterol level is too high.  I had to stop taking it.You get a ton of protein and it's not as loaded with sucralose as other powders, so it's not too bad on your stomach.But I switched to JYM because of the cholesterol level. I'd rather take a combo of powder and creatine pills than drink 200mg of cholesterol

Usually I drink protein with milk, at first it was hard to mix with milk but I figured out that by adding a little bit of water into shaker cup and adding the protein giving it a mix and then adding the milk worked great.
