I’ve been using this Body fortress whey protein for 6 months now, And honestly works great and also the price is just right as many other protein companies sell overpriced protein with awful taste. Did I forget to mention Whey protein has best flavors and honestly I love it

There’s nothing special about the taste but if you stick to a schedule when making protein shakes it won’t take long to get used to the flavor. I usually make one after breakfast for my drive to work in the morning. Two scoops is 60g protein and the 5 pound container is $32. Pretty good price wise.

I do not understand why Body Fortress didn't fill their powder container to the top? And no product can settle to 1/2 it's original content. Shame on Body Fortress for giving 1/2 container of their product. Protein Powder doesn't really have much of a flavor, I added peanut butter for taste. Comes out with a few lumps if blended with a fork so use your blender. Flavour is great. Its my goto shake mix. Great with frozen berries.

Ive tried every protein shake on earth at this point lol (not really but u get my point) this one is one of the best calorie/protein ratio WHEN taste is added into the mix, dont accidentally buy the 140 calorie per scoop one cuz that one tastes bad but this 200 calorie one is by far the best tasting shake ever. Powder that is, if u want something that tastes comepletely fire u jeed to try our the pre made bottles of a dofferent company

This is by far the best value for money, and the flavor is unrivaled by other brands. I'm on my third container of it, and I haven't even considered switching brands due of the flavor and pricing. Others seemed to be complaining about their cholesterol levels. A single scoop contains 125 milligrams of cholesterol and 30 milligrams of protein. A single egg has 185 milligrams of cholesterol and 6 milligrams of protein. In that regard, it isn't awful at all. You can definitely find a better ratio, but it will almost certainly cost you twice as much. Others have complained about sucralose, an artificial sweetener used in Splenda. That's what gives it its distinctive flavor.
The product does deliver lean protein providing energy and food for your muscle tone and strength/
The protein does it’s job, but the flavor isn’t as rich as chocolate whey protein I’ve tasted before. The powder blends well without clumping.

We enjoy the flavor. The only problem is the scoop is somehow buried deep in the product so you have to dig halfway through to get the scoop. The container went empty is useful around the kitchen or shop.

I assume with anything. You get what you pay for. I have used this protein for over a year and plateaued pretty quickly. When switching to a different brand I had more noticeable progress and it even tasted better. This specific protein taste nothing like chocolate but more like blended cardboard dust.

This is by far the cheapest protein powder out there which is great except it makes me question the protein accuracy. If they truly are honest, its a great deal, but I'm not for sure.  I see a lot of people complaining about the formula and flavors, honestly for me the flavor of the vanilla is great still. It would be nice to see the magnesium and phosphorus back in the formula though.  As far as gut effects, as long as your not eating it dry there's not rly any issues. There are lots of useful reviews for this product. It is what it is - a protein drink. Their numbers are inflated compared to other products because they use multiple scoops, and when you take this into account, the product is similar to others on the market. So, if you like those other products, I think you will like this one.The only thing I can find that I do not like is the aftertaste. There is a sugary aftertaste after drinking the product, and it lasts for a long time. A very long time. Like, hours worth of time. I will drink the product (8oz of milk and one scoop of the product) at 9am, and that aftertaste is still with me at 11am and 12pm. Water does not make it go away - it results in the water tasting a bit sweet.

It still tastes like a protein shake guys, but the flavor is good. I personally throw mine in a cup post workout and stir it pretty quick with a fork and just drink it down in a gulp. Even with this minimalist method that rightly should have me choking on powder there are next to no clumps. I would bet if I put it through a blender like a person ought to, it would be silky smooth. The price to protein ration can't be beat either, and for how much protein is in there it is pretty low carb. Creatine being in there too just makes this an incredible deal. I actually rolled by a rack of this stuff in my local Walmart the other day for around the same price, so I like that I can pick it up immediately if I run out. Definitely my new go-to protein powder.

It tastes tolerable (Chocolate) for a protein powder and keeps my levels up for blood donations and general fitness.  I do a scoop every morning, and sometimes a second if I have not eaten much during the day in the evening. Not sure how other powders are so much better based on the cost. I will also sometimes through a little bit in baked goods like banana bread and it doesn't affect the flavor much, or at all.

I will buy this again! First, the five pound size is a great value. Next, the packaging is thoughtful. This is a large container, so the fact that it is square, unlike the majority of containers which are round, allows the container to be neatly stored without wasting space. Finally, the flavor is good. I have chocolate and strawberry (in a two pound container) and enjoy them both. If the chocolate peanut butter is available in the five pound container, I will absolutely grab it!You can be creative with how you use the powder. I use a half serving always, because I am a female (I need fewer calories) and I am not using this to bulk up - just to get some nutrition and protein while watching calories. This is a fast, convent way to up the protein. I often have my half serving with one half cup or so of whole milk yogurt. If you enjoy frozen yogurt, then you will enjoy this as a healthy treat. I have mine fresh, but if you are patient you could freeze it before eating. Enjoy!

I’ve had a lot of protein powder in my 27 years around the sun. This does the job well, great for recovery after workouts and I take atleast 1 scoop a day minimum even in rest days. You can’t beat this product for value for money and quality. If you want a better quality protein powder pay the extra for it, but if you’re on a budget and just getting into training or have been lifting for a few years this is a decent quality “bang for your buck” product. I have to use protein supplement because I’ve had gastric sleeve surgery. I stumbled upon Body Fortress when it was the least expensive brand that provided the proper amount of protein per serving. I doubt that there is any brand that actually tastes like chocolate milk, let alone a milkshake, but Body Fortress tastes ok and works for me. When mixing with milk, I actually prefer the vanilla, as it tastes more shake-like and has less aftertaste than the chocolate. I’ve tried the strawberry, but didn’t care for it at all and ended up blending it with chocolate and vanilla to get rid of it. But tastes vary, so you may like flavors that I don’t. I mostly use the chocolate, and I usually mix it in decaf coffee. I make one pot (8 cups) coffee, one scoop of chocolate Body Fortress and one serving of Benefiber (I also have to take daily fiber supplements) and blend them together. I often add a touch of cinnamon and/or half of an overripe banana to add a little pizazz. A large dollop of honey really tops it off nicely. In summertime I make the coffee the night before I want to drink it and keep it in the fridge overnight for an iced coffee drink the next day. Hot or cold, it’s a great way to get the protein I need.

After 3 weeks, I can see improvement in loss of some belly fat, a bit of definition in my torso and arms, and I feel pretty good. I honestly don’t care too much about the taste. I use this product for its nutrition, because I need protein, so the taste is kind of irrelevant.  It’s either this or prepare and eat a bunch of chicken. I’ll drink this no problem for convenience. It’s protein powder.

This stuff has always been my #1 pick and I 100% recommend it to anyone but just be warned that it will often clump up into little balls of unmixed powder if you plan on using more than 1 scoop in a blender bottle. If you aren't picky about this or plan on using a real blender, it's not something I would worry about.
I always buy my protein shakes through Amazon. Easy, good price and quick delivery.

I'm not into paying 50% more for a name.  I can't put a name in my cup or blender and have a shake with it.  Here I pay for quality ingredients and nothing more, and that's what I get every time.  I like the nutrition levels of Body Fortress's formula as well.  Keep doing this please.

For the price, this stuff is pretty good. Hits the standard 30 protein a scoop like most other brands for a cheaper price. The taste of the Chocolate is among the best I've tried, I used 1/2 cup water and a tablespoon of PB Powder per scoop and some ice to make a killer PB Chocolate protein drink, thickens up just like a milkshake and isn't super watery like some other mixes, super delicious and filling after a workout.The issue with this product is the ingredients and the serving size, you get what you pay for. Like the other reviews said, there's quite a lot of Cholesterol and it has Malodextrin. If you're going low carb/Keto or looking for something pure protein, this has 17g Carb and 10g fat for 2 scoops which is pretty bad compared to other similar brands. The scooper/serving size is also gigantic so even a 5lb tub was lucky to last me about 2-3 weeks. Overall, a good product but I've moved on to other 'cleaner' protein powders.
The flavor is very pleasant, mixes really easy, no after tast, no gas no bloating. Works really well I take it right after workout.Would definitely recommend it.

Blends very easily. And honestly tastes great even with just cold water. I did the math on this vs several other brands and this is cheapest per gram of protein while also being a recognized quality brand. No complaints. I've only had the chocolate

Been using Body Fortress Whey Chocolate for 8 years. This was a great deal on 2 5lb. Bottles for less than regular price for one.  Mixes well with some sticking streaks on my blender cup but, not a serious problem.  Like their chocolate flavored powder, and with 30-60 gms. (1-2 scoops) of protein, am satisfied as a supplement,  especially after  the gym.
Great Product.
This is by far the best protein powder I have used to date. It tastes like cold hot chocolate. I just mix with water and it is delicious. HIGHLY recommend.
Protein shake is very good & mix with Almond milk since I am not a milk drinker & for the calcium and vitamin D…

With so many protein powders, I found this great protein powder.  I felt the affects instantly after consuming.  It has helped with my workouts and running.  I will definitely purchase this product again!

I began to plateau my body weight after a year at 185lbs and 6 ft tall steady working out. I began taking this protein powder and noticed an immediate increase in energy and began breaking through in the strength department to the tune of 40 lbs more per rep bench press(now 245lbs) and 100 lbs for deadlifts(325lbs) within 2 months of taking this powder. I also gained 7 lbs mass while maintaining my waist size. I highly recommend it for people who are consistent with their strength training.

I like it that it's dairy-free & low sodium. Below the ingredients it says it contains dairy. The only thing I could see being dairy is the cocoa. Any other non-dairy or even vegan protein powders tend be very high in sodium and/or sugar. This one isnt. I'm lactose tolerant. I have 0 issues with this, unlike Muscle Milk's non-dairy mix.Other protein powders I can drink mixed with milk or almond milk. This one actually tastes good with water. I can easily mix it with a spoon or mixer ball with water. It goes down smoothly, not thick. 5 pounds is very much worth the money. This was recommended by my trainer. Walmart sells the 2 pound size for the same price as this 5 pound on Amazon.
This tastes great.  After I use my blender bottle I pour some into a coffee mug and it makes a great hot cocoa.
I have so much emergency food. This was bought just in case Biden’s handlers cause a food shortage
I've tried a lot of protein powders and this one is the best value-for-money I've found.  Unfortunately, it's a little too sweet and I only realized that it had creatine in it after buying it.

not bad but not amazing. I got the chocolate flavor and 90% of it mixed with the milk and the taste wasn’t bad. It was surprisingly good compared to how the other reviews said it was going to taste like. It has creatine in it which can go from 1.5g-6g depending if you only use 1-2 scoops and if you only drink it once or twice a day. If you’re just starting to go the gym and have a tight budget this might be you’re go to protein since it’s cheaper and also has creatine in it. If you don’t have a tight budget you might want to look into other protein. It also doesn’t come with a scooper so you will need a food scale to weigh it out.

Great amount of protien to calories ratio.  If you are Lactose sensitive I would recommend staying away from this bad boy.  It has me on the toilet REALLY fast.  This is almost a laxative for me  LOL.

Great Protein for the amount that's in it. Best bang for the buck. BCAA's,Amino Acids, Creatine especially, etc. The only thing is the flavors that aren't the best but overall it has so many things in it that makes it a beast. I've tried Cookies & Cream and Vanilla, chocolate is so far the only good tasting one.
Decent for value

I loved the taste of this product. However after using it for a month or so I had very bad  stomach trouble. Laid off it for a week and tried it again but the same thing happened so I won’t be using it again. I’ve read that it can cause stomach problems and with me it sure did. I suspect that it isn’t  the product it’s just that I’m one of them unlucky ones that have problems with it

I'm a college student and athlete. When it comes to college, you definitely wanna save. I'm used to dropping $50-60 on 5 lb tubs of protein powder, so I decided to try this product out, due to the price. I've seen it around for years and I've also had many fellow athletes swear by it. I've gotta say that this product is amazing! Normally, most protein powders I've tried tasted "okay", but were nothing spectacular. Some even tasted atrocious! One example would be BPI's protein powders, which delivered a burning sensation each time I slugged it down. This protein powder is the most delectable of all the ones that I've had. It fits all of my caloric needs and gives plenty of protein! I'm definitely becoming a lifetime-buyer!

I got chocolate it tastes alright, great mixed with coffee but, after buying it I noticed it said 105mg cholesterol per serving and that pretty high. But it's fine for what I'm using it for just throwing a scoop in black coffee for a power mocha

This chocolate whey protein is really great tasting, and it mixes really well.  I put it in a mason jar, shake it up, and it is ready to drink without the clumps you get with some of the other brands. I previously used the chocolate whey protein from Sam's Club, but they changed the chocolate flavor to a a new lousy tasting flavor. I hope Body Fortress keeps this chocolate flavor and the great price.
yum
I like the taste, most protein don’t taste good, but this one just like a desert

Amino/Protein Spiking. Good for beginners who just need to up protein to a reasonable degree, but a poor choice for advanced lifters who need proper amino rations and truth in advertising regarding protein content. Also full of a ton of cholesterol

I've had many different protein powders in the past, but when my preferred brand recently increased their prices, I decided to buy this Body Fortress brand. Every time after using it, even just 250 calories worth, it would lead to feeling bloated, as if gas was building up for some reason. Then for a few hours after, it would feel like I was almost about to vomit. I have never had such a problem before with protein powder, which is why I didn't think twice to buy this brand. I have dairy products all the time, I don't have any diet intolerances or medical issues.I didn't understand what was happening at first, thinking it was something I ate. But after stopping usage of this body fortress protein powder, the nausea and bloating went away. The only way I could continue using it was putting only 5 grams in at a time, and mixing it with another powder that didn't cause the bloating or nausea.I noticed another user named Glasco Whittaker had the same problem. I had the exact symptoms he described, especially the bloating. Very strange.Thus I can only give 1 star sadly. I do not write bad reviews lightly, but this protein powder really earned it.The chocolate flavor does taste way better than the vanilla, though. The new vanilla flavor tastes like medicine.
This brand is by my favorite protein powder brand of a dozen i have tried. Tastes great, mixes well with water and milk. I wont even try new brands anymore. None compare.

Good flavor - I've tried about a seven or eight other powders and this is pretty good as far as protein goes. Decent value in terms of protein per ounce. I think this one is putting on slightly more bulk than other powders, likely on account of the creatine, hard to say. It's not hurting anyway. Flavor is good, consistency is good, not too much of that protein bitter you sometimes have with these supplements. Probably in my top five, behind Isopure.In terms of results, I've been plateaued around 170 for a couple years, and recently increased my overhead lifts from 2x25lb to 2x40lb, right around the time I bought this powder. Since then I've put on about 9lb of muscle over two months, without making too many changes to the rest of the routine. Obviously, as this is only five pounds of powder, that didn't all come from the supplement, but at least it is supporting the additional reps well.

I have been using this protein powder for a month and I really like it. I use a blender to mix it with water, unsweetened almond milk or regular milk and no issues. I do not add any fruit or anything sweet since it will be to much for me, but occasionally I mix it with Nescafé and it is a different and good flavor. The container is huge. I'm happy with the item.

Good product just add a few fresh egg whites, wheat germ and whole milk in your shake and drink up, do this quickly before thirty minutes during your recovery window, powerfull gains in muscle mass, but you have to work out hard for this to be effective or you’ll get fat.
I Like chocolate as it is thicker , also have been using for over 9 years , and best Value is here on Amazon

Love this stuff. Tastes great, mixes well, and most importantly is a key part in my training. I mix two scoops immediately following my morning workout to help give me a boost of energy and feed my muscles the protein they need when the need it most. Could be better stuff out there but this fits the bill for me being gluten free, price value, and flavor. Will continue to buy (on my 3rd 5lbs jug already)
40 year old that works out every now and then. Intake it right after workouts and helps minimize my joint paint. Seen improvement in my workouts too
Tastes good and mixes easily.
Very tasty
Definitely not the best tasting protein powder. Also doesn't really mix well with water or milk.I prefer vital protein.

Overall, taste is not nearly as big of a factor for me as value and effectiveness. This has got to be one of the cheapest isolate dominant proteins on currently on the market. No other protein even comes close. Taste is pretty darn bad on the vanilla, haven't had the chocolate yet, but they definitely need to spend more money on r&d to improve the flavor. Still rocks thoough

My wife and I split a shake each morning for the protein.2 scoops, 2 cups skim milk, 1 cup Greek yogurt and a raw egg.  Throw it in the Vitamix with 12-15 ice cubes for 30 seconds.  Around 50 grams protein for each of us for around 300 calories.We’re in our mid sixties and this is a great protein boost to ward off skin crepeing.Contrary to what I’ve read in some reviews, this stuff tastes great.

The ingredients are similar to most and the protein (g) is on par as well. The parts I don't like are the container and the chalky taste. The bags and the zipper functions tend to not end well over the life of the bag so I prefer the tub. The chocolate taste isn't the best. There are definitely better tasting chocolates out there with comparable ingredients and as well as the nutritional elements. But, on sale, this is worth it if you can get it.

Muscle Milk - The brand that has been in the whey protein business for a long time. A name you can trust. This is the first time I tried the vanilla flavor, it is definitely a vanilla flavor but not what I expected personally. Its okay, I can deal with the flavor but I will not purchase again.I should have stick with the ole trusty chocolate or cookies/cream flavors. Oh well, does the job.

I was extremely surprised when I first tasted the vanilla flavor. you can't really even taste that crappy protein after taste that i've learned to deal with when I went with other popular brands. This costs way less than most other big brands and it also tastes great.
Usually this is my favorite protein. But those bag is unusually gritty, not sure what they did different but I don't like it.
Best tasting protein powder yet.

It tastes better than Optimum Nutrition and is like half the price per gram of protein. Not sure how ON justifies double the price except for the shiny packaging. Switching to this brand til further notice.
This has a decent vanilla flavor, can definitely taste the protein type flavor in smoothies, but doesn't make it taste bad.  Huge amount for money.
The powder is fine and easily dissolvable. Good macros, good price. The main problem is as with many other whey powders is the sweetener - there's too much of it.

Very good protein powder for the money. On par with more expensive brands that ive used as far as ingredients. Tastes great and not as sweet as the other brands with same flavor. Definitely recommend.

ON Whey has been my thing...This is so artificial for the same nutritional value...  MM Pro is so delicious and so I had to try this for the price.  Not going to purchase again.  MM Pro for taste and when I get a deal, ON for daily needs.  This one failed.
I started using this due to braking my foot, however since using it my nails and hair are growing like crazy. This is a great product. I do use it with milk.
all
Tastes great and the sugar content is very low. All around great product for the cost. Definitely will be ordering again.
A bit difficult to dissolve in water, but overall good value for money
This has always been my go to protein powder. Tastes great, mixes well with shaker, just perfect.
This is probably the best kind of protein you can get
It’s ok
Pretty good flavor with high-quality protein. One of the lowest priced products on the market in the 5lb size
Me gusto muchos
I love the taste of this. It’s great to add in to your protein shakes along with peanut butter and bananas

A lot sweeter than the regular whey protein powder that most people buy on Amazon. Taste is probably equivalent to eating blue bunny ice cream but like 2-3 times sweeter (just guessing, I haven't ate ice cream since forever). Kind of wish they would reduce the sweetness by 1/2.
The vanilla flavor has a weird chemical flavor. I do not like it at all.It's a great price but the flavor is not good. Maybe chocolate is better.

I loved the price, with the coupon especially. Delivery was fast. I guess I’m used to the old school, creamy “milk” taste and consistency. It was not like the MM of past. Vanilla flavor reminded me of the cheap Walmart vanilla protein we bought on the way to the gym our first month training. For taste, look up the PEScience gourmet vanilla (absolutely spoiled me) or Rule1 vanilla whey (blue container, red container is kind of gross too). Syntha6 makes a good vanilla, but for 280 calories a scoop, it should be good.
For the price, this protein gets the job done. Chocolate flavor is ok, however it does have a gritty texture which lingers in your mouth and at the bottom of your bottle.

I used to be able to buy the five pound jar of the vanilla creme flavor. I can't get it anymore, so I tried this one in plain Vanilla. It's definitely not the same taste. Not too bad, but not as creamy tasting, so I don't love it like I do the vanilla creme. I'm hoping it comes back on Amazon again.

Mixes well, is what it's supposed to be, just don't care for the flavor. It's not overly strong like some brands that only offer double chocolate. It's just different... an odd flavor. I don't mind it too much but my wife truly dislikes it. Price wasn't bad but for flavor I'll go with a different brand next time.

The great thing about this one is that it dissolves so readily into water (I keep my calories low by using water instead of milk). The flavor is great - just simple vanilla.I mix with my creatine for my workout and just a few shakes of the bottle make it good to go. It's a HUGE bag, too. So great value.

I already use this brand for making things like protein berry smoothies and Shakes and it tastes really good and a 5 lb bag of this stuff for 40 bucks is an extremely good deal and I'll probably keep buying this online from now on
Perfect value for the money!

In general, I'm not picky when getting which kind/flavor of my protein. We use protein for protein. I grab whatever flavor that's on sale and I have tried so many across different brands and flavors. However, I have to say this MM vanilla is the worst I have ever tried by far. The STRONG artificial vanilla flavor blow my mind. It tastes so sweet and I did not like that. I know technically it's 2g of sugar but it is sweeter than the others I used. Even though it's such a great deal but I will not buy it again.

I'm comparing this to the gold standard powder and to be honest I don't understand why they call this "chocolate". It tastes literally nothing like it.. It's almost like they got vanilla mixed up with chocolate or something. I know gold standard costs more but it also tastes MUCH better. If they could sort the taste out on chocolate I'd say go for it as this definitely has the price right but it's just hard to swallow down every day compared to others.

I use about 8 ice cubes and 2 cups of water per 1.5 scoops to make it taste okay. I use a blender. If I use less it doesn't take great at all. I am use to buying the Chocolate version and this is the first time I tried Vanilla. It no longer comes with the plastic tub which saves space. I notice that with the Chocolate version, the Pro series, has more vitamins and minerals in the nutrition facts. This doesn't for some reason so please be aware of that. I would probably not buy this again or once in a blue moon when it's on sale for under $30 which is how much I paid.

Every Protein Powder's reviews are overblown claims of how delicious they are.  Most I've tried range from fine, to pretty good.  Sometimes too plain, sometimes too sweet, sometimes too artificially sweet / after-tastey.  To me, they nailed it with this chocolate, because it has the perfect amount of bitterness inherent in real cocoa.  Best flavor of any protein powder I've ever tried.  The bag is a little messier than a cannister, but I transferred it, all good!

I haven’t been in the workout game in awhile! So I started with muscle milk products since I don’t want to get too slim but I also want to stay with some meat! I replaced this with a meal and it filled me up with confidence to not want to keep eating! I will keep getting this for the price until I know I will get more serious and keep up the good work!

I still remote first time I ever has some muscle milk, it was amazing.I don't know if they changed the recipe since then, but this product has a very sweet taste, not a rich flavor. I don't really buy my protein for the great taste but you can tell the sweetness when you drink this one.

too much sucralose added. taste sweeter than any other zero-sugar drink you could think of. also the texture is nasty. I've had other brands (about 5) and this is the worse. the only good thing is the price
Mixes really well and taste like Vanilla Ice cream. Great value!
It has a water like flavor and is not rich even if you use milk. I drink it every morning no matter and it keeps me full until lunch time.
Convenient for that needed protein intake throughout the day.
This stuff is cheap, but wow is it sweet. It took a few times for me to get used to it, but now I enjoy the flavor.

Taste is good, not too sweet for me but I like sweet vanilla protein powder. First time buying this, usually buy another brand that is as good all around but price jacked up really high on it so watched prices and this one rated good and caught it on sale!

Compared to Isopure Whey Isolate Protein Powder, MuscleTech Nitro-Tech Whey Protein, or Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard 100% Whey Protein Powder, this stuff tastes awful.  It blends well, etc. but the taste is bad.  As in not good.  At all.

I like the milk chocolate alot better. This powder is good but not great. Better than most. Works decent in shakes with other ingredients. Does assimilate very well. You do get a lot of frothing though so clean up is a little more than other mixes. (This issue is common with all powders, it seems)

I got the chocolate flavor and I think it tastes very good. Muscle Milk makes good quality protein and this is one of their better chocolate flavors I’ve tried out. The value is fantastic, 66 servings for 49.99 is pretty much unbeatable. Definitely recommend.

I’ve worked out for yrs and have tried different protein powders. I’ve only had this for a few days and the vanilla flavor is good, but there is a weird aftertaste. It’s almost like a chemical taste. It does seem to be a good meal replacement, but is this aftertaste normal?

I have drink many many varieties and muscle milk was one of those that stood out… long time ago. It was known for awesome flavor. But now days it taste very generic whey protein with too much sweetness and too much distortion in flavor. It begs the question… who is in charge here? Who decides how it should taste? It definitely isn’t the original muscle milk I remember and if you never had a chance, this is nothing compared. We all know we bought it for the price.Mix ability is among 5/10..  most cheap protein doesn’t mix at all so 5 of 10 is not that great. Best one mixes in smoothly but also higher in price.Flavor sucks. Get vanilla so you can mix it with something else. You get tired of its strong sweetness and something that suggests it’s vanilla. So taste it first with a small batch. Don’t just buy a 5lb one.Price… Knowing it’s not great, I rather spend 5 -10 more bucks for something else that I enjoy. Because reward will make good habits form.
Unlike the ON protein powder, this one doesn't dissolve in milk so easily. I have to use my blender and then wash it evert time i want to have this whey protein powder.
So far the only thing I have against it is TOO MUCH SUGAR! I have to put a bunch of water in it to drink it. It says that only has 2g but I think is more than that.

I switched from O.N. Gold Standard to this to save some money. For context, I'm 6 ft/male/34/185 lbs/gym 3x a wk for 1.5 hrs.Here are my pros and cons:Pros: Same protein content as O.N., mixes well, affordable, 100% whey.Cons: Extremely sweet aftertaste of bubblicious gum. Although it's 100% whey, its a BLEND of isolate and concentrate, whereas O.N. is 100% isolate. in other words, the quality of O.N. is slightly better.Final thoughts: I think the 20$ savings make Muscle Milk better than O.N. overall. If you're a body builder, O.N. might be slightly better. For the majority of us that just want to look good naked, M.M. is the better product.

great product, it’s taste is definitely bearable compared to other protein powders, but i would 100% recommend adding more liquid than it says to. the instructions say to add 6-8 oz. of water, this will result in an overbearing taste (if you’ve ever eaten raw easy bake oven cookie mix… that’s what it tastes like).there’s lots of protein powders that taste a lot worse and there’s obviously infinite ways to make this delicious. just f around with it and see what works for you.great calorie count for the amount of protein you’re getting, and only 2g of sugar.for the price, this is definitely a gold mine for a gym rat.
I wish it was more chocolate flavored. It's more of a "malt" chocolate flavor.  It is still delicious far as protein powders go. It dissolves well even in coffee.
It is good. Good macros. Vanilla is usually good. This has a rather chemically aftertaste even with almond milk. Probably because of the macros. Can recommend if on budget.
Love chocolate flavor
No Scoop.  For whey protein it doesn't mix as easily as other brands. Taste was ok.

The advertised nutrition doesn't match what you get. For someone who is really tracking micros and macros, this isn't right. To advertise one thing, have someone pay for it, then give them something else is just plain wrong.
If you're looking for the ol Muscle Milk that we know and love, this ain't it.Looks like the brand was purchased by PepsiCo a few years back. It's just a generic protein powder with a brand name.
Like getting protein from this

The price of protein powder's exploded the last two years so I'm always on the hunt for good quality protein on the cheap. I used to buy strictly from Myprotein as they offered the best prices for high quality protein, but even with their 45% off code, they come out to roughly $10.60 / lb.With Muscle Milk's deals here, I picked up a 5 lb bag for $30. That's $6 / lb! And the taste is great as usual (I like to mix mine with milk in the blender).They have deals or coupons you can clip on here often, so highly recommend waiting for those to pop up.
i was hoping for a decent chocolate flavor. both the smell amd the flavor are really not good.regular muscle milk tastes good, why cant they get the whey to match?
Great tasting, easily dissolving and budget friendly protein! Definitely a great pick up 💪🏽
El producto es buenísimo a buen precio. Si. Embargo, ha subido mucho el precio . Cuando baje? De las mejores opciones que hay de una buena proteína.
Mixes well, tastes really good, and a LOT of servings for the money. I use this on anything and everything. Highly recommended.

So I bought this for $51 with no discounts or anything. Now it’s at $90. Probably won’t be buying this product again due to price but it did taste good. The price was really why i bought it but not anymore. Shame
I wish it was in container that had a screw top. Otherwise a good product.
Product has great taste and is very easy to mix

Value is good, the taste is strong and artificial for me. Leaves me feeling with a slight throw up feeling after. But I'm sensitive to that kind of stuff and don't eat sweets. Smell is also okay but if you need to take more than 40 g a day I would suggest another brand.

It might provide all the macros that are written on the package but the taste is horrible, at least the vanilla flavour. It has a strong medicinal, chemical taste that takes away all the pleasure. It is way under ON, Dymatize, Muscletech or others...Taste is an important factor when choosing a protein supplement and this MM does not qualify.
It tastes good. Sometimes I mix with water, other times with 2% milk….I like it with milk better. It just seems expensive for what it is.
The headline says it all.  Both flavors are great and are my "Hey, you worked out hard, here's your treat!"  Why can't I get this anymore???

One of the best value in terms of protein/price ratio. Would usually not complain but the taste is just horrendous. Imagine the most artificial ever vanilla flavor paired with a fatal amount of sucralose.Yes, I understand that people have genetically different tasting perception of sucralose, and I even liked sucralose before this. But this is just another level due to the sheer amount of it. I literally have to wash it down with extra water or I would feel the weird sweet aftertaste of sucralose in the next 2 hours.

I've been taking this for a week and its not bad, a little sweet for my taste. I'm also lactose intolerance and was worry that it might have too much whey concentrate.  But to my surprise it has not bothered me one bit.
Tastes better than any other chocolate flavored protein I've ever tasted, and I've had em all pretty much!

I've always enjoyed the taste of Muscle Milk. It's not overly sweet nor does it have that chalky flavor. One scoop and a 28 oz of water and you're good to go. Make sure you give it a nice shake so that it mixes properly. It honestly tastes like chocolate milk to me. I make one every morning and it's quite filling. At $0.62/oz it's a good value compared to other brands.

I've been lifting a taking protein powder for almost 2 decades.  Muscle milk, 100% whey, and syntha 6 are my go to.  Muscle milk is slightly heavier but it is the best protein powder for packing on muscle.  Flavor is also up there with the best if you care about that sort of thing.
One of the more affordable protein powders and I love that it's in a bag and not a giant thick plastic jug. Less money, less waste
The vanilla is a great taste, goes with a lot of things mixes easily with shakes as well as oatmeal.

This is a pretty good product. Cheaper than Optimum Nutrition, but similar nutritional stats. Folks complaining about the taste are worrying about the wrong thing. It doesn’t taste bad at all to me & I have tried both flavors.

I would not suggest this product to anyone based on a recent Clean Label Project investigation. 134 goods were evaluated for heavy metals such as arsenic, cadmium, mercury, lead, and the toxin BPA in this study. Muscle Milk was one of the bottom five. However, the amount detected in the study was not published, so it's possible that it's little more than the amount found naturally in food. Because plants absorb these metals from the soil, the majority of the low-rated proteins were vegan. There aren't many reasons why whey protein should be at the bottom of this list. If I could get my money back, I would, but do your own research and make your own decision. They stick to plastic to avoid the additional BPA. This must change. HDPE can also be utilized, however it is less likely to be employed due to its higher cost as a packing material. We will update the review if new information on the study becomes available. Consumer Reports has published a review of this study.
I love Muscle Milk.  I tried all kinds of different brands, and each one made me sick from the smell.  No MM - it's perfect! The flavor is smooth, no "protien" smell; it's nice. Def worth the buy.

I have been buying Muscle milk for years, easy to find and very affordable. My go to is the Chocolate. I typically mix with unsweetened Almond or Coconut milk. This latest shipment though, is different.  It has a new taste, almost like they added 100 packs of splenda or equal to it, and a much thinner consistency.  Not sure what happened, but its very hard to drink as a result.  I'm hoping that they didn't make a flavor change and that maybe I got a bad lot.  If this was my first time having Muscle Milk, i would never buy again based on the taste.  But I'll give them another shot one this bag is gone. If the overwhelming sweetness is still there next time, adios.

I started out looking like Joe average. After using this,+ some BCCA amino's, Terris Tribulus for higher T. & my Bowflex I almost look like a jacked Pro Wrestler. They cheat & are on the juice. You can too!  Sorry, no Pics. you'll just have to take my word for it.

Originally bought because it was one of the cheapest per lb I could find.Unfortunately, it clumps a lot and is very hard to simply stir in with a spoon. Wish it used Stevia, a more natural sweetener, instead of the old school sweeteners in it.Not horrible, but will try another brand next time since I hate all the clumps.

Muscle milk told me this is the same as cytosport 100% whey commonly found in the big 6 pound bags at costco, now discontinued.The ingredients are similar but the product is not the same.The muscle milk product is no longer hydrolyzed or micronized as the costco cytosport was. You can recall the cytosport whey was an extremely fine textured powder which would blend very easily. While this is a much fluffier powder which mixes very clumpy, and no longer has the very fine, dust like texture the cytosport whey had.What happened was, they stopped hydrolyzing/micronizing the whey and instead added a lot more soy lecithin to the whey instead. Then, had the audacity to increase their prices for a lower quality product. Recall the cytosport whey was $40 for 6 pounds. Sold in a store. Meanwhile this product is $55 for 5 pounds. For an inferior, cheapskate product which stopped micronizing the whey and added more soy lecithin instead.The soy lecithin and acefulsame potassium in the product causes acne breakouts. The flavor is a much grosser much more chemical tasting whey than the old cytosport whey. They have decreased the quality, stopped selling in brick and mortar, decreased the size from 6 pounds to 5 pounds, yet despite all that, have RAISED the price.I needed that old cytosport i was used to and was willing to pay extra for it due to how well it digested and absorbed. But not like this. This is a harmful, dangerous product.  The company claims no changes were made to the formula or quality.I bought cytosport 100% whey in the 6 pound bags for literally 5 years straight. I used 2 scoops every single day. Went through a bag a month. It was obvious what was going on as soon as i tried this product and the reformulated cytosport product where the enzymes were replaced with probiotics. Suddenly, as soon as the product texture changes, it now starts bloating me after drinking it. Then i wake up the next day and i look bloated, face looks red, some acne is forming. No changes to my diet or supplements besides the whey suddenly being a different texture with a chemical taste and smell. It is very obvious what was going on. The cytosport 100% whey was a very consistent product from 2015 to april 2018. They shut cytosport whey down and switched over to muscle milk 100% whey sometime in mid 2018. This 100% whey has the same ingredients list as the cytosport whey, but not the same quality.  It is unfortunate as well as insane that they chose to lower the quality and servings of this product while raising the price.

For two years I tried different protein powders off and on. I went through brand after brand and found myself just forcing them down, the taste horrible. I was convinced that the protein powder experience was nasty sludge that people drank purely for the benefits, so I forced my way through each bag/tub.Not anymore! This protein is over the moon better! The flavor is tasty, the consistency is perfect, the nutrient profile is good, it all comes together to form the ideal protein supplement! I think the lack of maltodextrin is what makes this protein palatable. It has a taste and texture difference unlike all of the other maltodextrin-filled proteins I had tried before.If I could recommend a protein powder, buy this one!

I was beyond amazed with this protein powder. I got the vanilla flavored one and It doesn't not tastes chalky AT ALL. Is very sweet, but is a nice treat when you're craving sugary stuff (which is me every day). It didn't bring a scoop so i had to use one of my own and it turns out that 35gr are around 2 scoops of the i previously had so i recommend you to check the weight the first time you use it and then plan accordingly. Also, i used my milk frother to mix it it does take a while to get mixed but i used very cold water and maybe that had an impact on it. I definitely recommend this, specially if the person is starting to include a protein powder in their diet.

So my container was opened. This review is for Triple Chocolate 1.82# version, with TJ Watt as brand ambassador.I have been using different versions of this protein for years, and cycle through some other brands as well when I can get a good deal or flush with cash.This is my offseason, but still training and doing types of cross fit and homemade crazy workouts on the soccer field nearby, Peloton, lifting, rowing, etc.I need the protein to keep up, but  I don't need a 60 gram serving of protein smoothie at this time of the year. This protein mixes well for me (either on the run in a blender bottle or at home in a small individual blender) and doesn't clump on the sides or at the bottom. For me it also digests well and never gives me a headache (there is no aspartame in this version) or a stomach ache or any of the other unpleasant side effects from some workout bevs.The triple chocolate flave is, to me, delicious. I have it plain with almond or other plant milk, or even full milk for a treat, or throw in a banana or a half depending on size and some ice cubes if using the blender. Dessert for breakfast!One scoop = 30 grams of protein and for this size canister, there are 18 scoops.  The front of the package shows "60 grams of protein" but you would have to double up to get that, and the protein alone would be 360 calories, for those keeping track.I also bought several other canisters of strawberry, vanilla, etc. because they were a super deal over Thxgiving, but they have not arrived yet, and will review those separately.Will be buying again.

For anyone complaining about the taste, they probably haven’t tried many protein drinks. As far as protein drinks go, this is one of the best tasting (I’ve only tried strawberry). Be aware that the instructions say to stir, shake or blend. You can’t stir it because it’ll be terribly lumpy. Even shaking left some significant lumps. I use a nutri-bullet blender and that does a pretty good job but still leaves some gritty residue on the bottom of the glass. If the flavor is still a concern, what I do is keep a pint of strawberries in my fridge and toss a few in before blending. As for it’s claims that it builds muscle faster, I cannot verify them. I’m pretty thin and need to build mass. I’ve been using the product for about 2 weeks and all I can note is that I have increased my weights when lifting but that could be natural progression of the regimen. And I haven’t gained any weight. I’m still pretty early in the process so it’s possible some changes could be evident in the future. There would need to be analytics based on several factors so I’m not sure that anyone could say for certain that this product delivers what it guarantees. But my overall assessment is that it tastes decent and if nothing else, appears to keep my energy up throughout the day. I’ll likely keep using it just for the creatine and protein.

So I held off from writing a  review until I had tried it every which way I could or was recommended. I ordered the Vanilla Flavor and the Cookies & Cream flavor. My concern with this stuff is always the flavor because I know what the nutrition facts are since they are printed on the package itself so whether they are true or not there they are, but flavor is different for everyone. They can say "greatest tasting ever" or "america's number 1 tasting protein.." but you can only know once you try it yourself. As for me I can easily say this has a really great taste to it I'm really loving it, the way I like to make mine is 8-10 oz of water per one scoop, any more water than that and it doesn't taste as good unless I add another half a scoop, it's the same for both flavors. Although the best taste definitely comes when you add a little milk to it. When I tried it with milk I had 4 oz of milk with 8 oz of water and one scoop of the powder and mixed it in a mixer and woooow the flavor was amazing! I used 2% milk since I had ran out of 1% just in case you were wondering. When I'm using this at home this is definitely how I'll be making them always it was really good, as for the gym I don't have access to milk so I'll have to stick to water there. As for results I'm not sure yet I just started using this for about 5 days since writing this review I'll have to get back to you all on that, but yes this does taste really good it all depends on how you like to prepare it for yourself and if the nutrition facts are true this protein powder is a real winner! oh and I recommend mixing, I had practically no clumps when I stirred it as opposed to shaking it, that is of course if you have something on hand to stir it with.UPDATE~~~  I've now tried all the flavors they're all great but my least favorite definitely has to be the triple chocolate

I have tried so many different protein shakes, I can't even remember the names of some of them. Typically what I am looking for in a protein shake, is naturally, the amount of protein, lower calories, and taste. More recently, I discovered that some protein shakes include glutamine in them, which saves me the hassle of having to take another supplement. I originally bought a protein formula from GNC that contained glutamine (it was an impulse buy) and when I went to buy it again, was unwilling to pay another $60 for it. So after some research, I bought this from Amazon.The taste is actually the first shake I have ever been able to mix with just plain water. It also mixes a lot better in water and doesn't get all clumpy. Naturally, I assumed it would taste even better with milk, but just the opposite, it tastes like really heavy cake frosting (the french vanilla flavor), which makes me want to vomit after a heavy work-out session. Most other protein shakes, I have to mix with milk because of the taste and they typically clump more in water, but I hate getting those extra calories from milk, especially when I am trying to stay away from dairy. So this is awesome for just mixing in water, which is also great when you are on the go.Finally, I am no expert on the amount of glutamine I have to take to experience the anti-soreness characteristic that is so awesome, but the amount that is in the serving size is just perfect. I can definitely tell the next day if I have not taken this shake as I am sore to point of it hurting to move the muscle group, and generally more out of energy. When taking the shake post-workout, I am still a little sore the next day, but more in the sexy feeling 'I-worked-out-and-my-muscles-feel-really-big-and-strong' kind of sore. So for a decently priced, decently tasting, decent protein shake with glutamine, you should definitely get this.

I been looking for another protein brand but I have not been able to switch you can not beat 32g per scoop, overall pricing ranging from 20$-30$ certain pharmacy and grocery store sale it quite high, dependable online is your best bet, i was once a skeptic that I relied so much on the protein powder to gain some sort of muscle mass, but in reality it’s through consistency, hard work, and determination, that really pays off, protein powder is just to assist you if your incapable of meeting your macros, and help you in replenishing what your body requires in order to build and grow that sometimes your incapable of obtaining by consuming food, it does contain a certain amount of creatine witch at first I was extremely scared to intake but in order to have such an impact for an individual you need to intake about 5g a day of creatine so overall ladies this is not bad, Regardless of anything with or without creatine your body still retains water through what you consume, you more than capable to find a supplement or a form of food to balance out your ph levels, I been taking this protein for about 3 1/2 years going on four and do not seem to find anything else other than this1-affordable2-great taste3-proper nutrients4-good amount of proteinI honestly can not complain I mix it as a smoothie, oatmeal dependable of what I’m craving through out the dayHappy lifting guys
Keeps me fit

I've been on SS protein for a few years now, strictly Isolate during the day and the regular whey at night before bed. I have absolutely zero complaints about SS protein, this newer flavor just widens the ability to change things up for me. It mixes fine whether manual in a shaker or even my weaker Farberware Blender. It's a great base to additives such as peanut powder, various milks and milk substitutes, even snack bars (try half of a Nutri-Grain or even the softer Nature Valley Granola bars in the blender with it). It has everything I've needed, presently need and will continue to need. I was regularly getting deferred back in mid-2014 for low protein counts whenever I hit my local plasma donation center. It was about a month after I started taking SS that I was hitting my numbers easily. This could be a meal replacement, I'd go 10oz+ and go a full 2 scoops if you're going that route.Early April 2017 Update: This continues to be my pre-bed protein, 2 nights every week I cut it with an 8 hour sustained release protein since I donate plasma the next morning.Late April 2017 Update: I have absolutely nothing but immensely positive things to say about this. It's not a rant or rave, it's a protein that just plain works for me. I have zero issues and still....zero complaints.Mid-November 2017 Update: This has been a staple in my cabinet and 4 year running diet (more maintenance at this point). I have absolutely nothing but positive things to say about it. I admit to using it as meal replacement frequently, but with my schedule and strictly zero-fast-food policy this is exactly what my body needs. 3/4 flavors are a 10 with me, chocolate is a few ticks lower, not the fault of Six Star more personal preference, but the few times I've had it the results were 1:1 on par with the other 3 flavors.
It says chocolate, but I'm not tasting any chocolate. Not really sure what I'm tasting other than something a little sweet. I really like the protein to calorie ratio so I'm going to keep ordering.
Nothing bad but nothing special. About the same as you buy anywhere.

-How do you use this product?Generally I take 1 scoop per workout and occasionally I'll take it on an off day when I do cardio or something light like pushups etc.-What similar products have you used, and how does this compare?Before buying this I tried GNC's Whey Isolate here: http://www.gnc.com/product/index.jsp?productId=2986026It costs almost 3 times as much as this product, but I enjoyed taking it and the results much better. Is it worth the price hike? probably not, but one should find something as good for a cheaper price.-What should other customers know when considering this product?Consider what you are buying a product like this for? Do you need the cheapest price/oz protein supplement and don't care what its like? You might want this.Do you want really high quality results and something that tastes good? This probably isn't for you-What aspects of this product do you like or dislike?The one good part about the product is that it does provide some protein supplement (it should right?) and doesn't taste "too bad" for that.The bad part is that it mixes terrible with milk. I ended up mixing it with double the recommended amount after awhile just to make it mix better, but for the most part I am eating a chalky milk mixture at the end of the day. The chocolate flavor by itself isn't terrible, but when it doesn't mix well, it tastes awful.I can't comment on how well it mixes with water, but if you are used to mixing it in a blender with other things and turning it into a smooth, you are fine. It mixes just find in smoothie form. It is only with plain milk.*EDIT* After buying a mixing bottle, I decided to make a minor edit to this review. I can say if you are using a mixing bottle (with the spiral mixing ring inside), it does mix *slightly* better. I would still recommend another product, but if you do use this one, I would say use more milk then recommended and use a mixer.-Was the quality of this product above or below your expectations?For the most part it was below. However, considering I only paid 18 dollars at the time, I probably should't complain much

I originally found this product at my local grocery store but for a much higher price. I like to put this in my coffee every morning. It tastes great and mixes easily. I put it in a quart Mason jar with 1/2 water and 1/2 coffee and blend it with a wire whisk. It was a game changer for me when I made the decision to change to a healthier diet and lose some weight. It gives me a good amount of protein and I don’t feel hungry for 7-8 hours. If I don’t set a timer to remind me to eat a light lunch, I won’t even think about it. I use it to make high protein waffles for the kids. They love the taste and will eat them plain or dip them in yogurt or peanut butter for breakfast, snacks or even “breakfast for dinner”. They love them and it’s so easy for me because I can make a big batch, keep them in the fridge and warm them up in the toaster.

If you see one you like, I would recommend the product, especially the 'triple chocoIate!' I like it in my hot coffee.

I am looking at this product from a strictly 'added protein' perspective.  Not dieting, not working out, just do not eat well enough to get what I need so i supplement and add stuff to smoothies.  This has a great flavor and a slight sweetness that i like.  It costs less than what they sell in the store and you get a LOT!  If you are older, and don't need a lot of protein, or eat enough in your diet that you just need a bit more, do not use the giant scoop that comes with it.  Figure out how much you need and use a smaller scoop that will supply your needs.  It lasts a lot longer that way and you do not get More protein that you should have.  Yes, you Can get more than you need and that will go to fat too!  Did you know that?  I don't think that is legal, is it? (Like birthday cake should Never be fattening).Anyway, I have this on my buttons and on my honey list, so I can get it when it is down and not up.  You should try it and see how great it is.

I bought this product hoping to have something different then the general vanilla and chocolate protein shakes I have become accustomed to. Now I see why it was so cheap - it is absolutely inedible. I tried going to Amazon and the product support page to ask about a return or replacement but could not get through the red tape of the return policy to even speak to someone. Buyer beware, do not buy the Cookies and Cream flavor.
Could not stand the after taste

59 YEAR OLD FORMER COMPETITIVE BODYBUILDER IS PROMULGATING... LISTEN UP! Six Star Whey Protein is as good as any, and better than most. It's made by industry giant Muscletech and renamed Six Star just to get it in Walmart at an affordable price. One scoop gives you 30 grams of protein, 2.5g creatine and good helping of BCAA's. I've been in the gym for 42 yrs, so I've been around the block a few times. I once attended a bodybuilding seminar given by Boyer Coe. He told us straight out that 90% of what you read in the muscle mags is BS, so don't get caught up in all the hype about all of these expensive proteins being offered out there. Just go with Six Star...it's more than adequate. Remember, it's all about the training and genetics. Train hard, train smart and train consistently. There are alot of pros out there that are pushing all kinds of supplements. What they aren't telling you is that they are taking HGH, Deca, synthetic testosterone, Winstrol, etc... If you want to get big and stay healthy, all you really need is Six Star protein, CLA, preworkout, boron, zinc and a miltivitamin. If you are over 40, add D-Aspartic acid. Oh yeah, and train like a man possessed. I'm in the process a formulating a homemade preworkout that costs 65 cents a serving. One serving will blow your socks off..stay tuned. Stay hungry, my friends!

I have enjoyed using this protein.  It has a great taste and mixes really well.  I do not get clumps using a shaker bottle.  I really like the fact that it has some research behind it, and that they have added BCAA's and other essential elements.  You could consume all the protein in the world, but if something is limiting the absorption of it, then it will not do you any good.  I feel like this protein has research behind it and some of the added ingredients to maximize protein utilization.  I feel like it is working for me.I keep coming back to this protein, and have purchased it multiple times now.  I have tried the cookies and cream along with the triple chocolate.  The cookies and cream is good, with a strong vanilla taste.  I think I would recommend the triple chocolate for your first purchase.  Anyway, I take this protein as a recovery drink after my workout, and it really helps.  Since taking this protein I have upped my workouts from 5 to 6 a week.  I think this protein is helping my recovery so that I was able to increase my workout volume.

My first time using six star protein, but not my first time using six star products. 30 grams of protein per serving are decent, I try to use just one serving per day since I have a high protein diet anyway and I want this tub to last a bit longer. I gave this one four stars because of one ingredient, sucralose. the taste of the artificial sweetener is strong with this mix. So far the only flavor I have tried is the triple chocolate, I will try the other flavors and update this review as I do. The servings recommend 4 to 8 ounces of water/milk but the scoops are so big I don't use less than 8 ounces per scoop. Pros and cons;ProsDecent amount of protein per servingAffordableMixes really well in the blender bottle, never have any clumps with cold milk or water,ConsSucralose, yuck. If not for that the the taste would be pretty good.Edit 8/28/2014: I could not get past the sucralose taste so I didn't finish my first tub. I have switched to a different brand of protein and won't be trying any more flavors of six star protein unless they change their ingredients in some way.
It was good but when it arrived the lid was slightly untwisted so there might have been some tampering with the product

Rated one star because you can't give negative stars.  I have been a loyal customer since that Consumer Reports study that found Six Stars among the lowest in heavy metal contaminants, of the protein supplements that were tested several years ago.  Since the product has changed dramatically since then I am no longer sure that is still the case.  What is certain is that Six Stars has decided its customers need massive doses of Calcium - 555 mg!!!! - and this in addition to 190 mg of Iron that I didn't ask for.  Both calcium and iron supplementation can cause constipation.  If you mix this chocolate flavored chalk with milk, like most of us do, that's another 300 mg. or so.  I had no idea what was causing my constipation so I tried a lot of things, laxatives gave me explosive gas, temporary watery relief, then back to dry black hard stools, and very rare bowel movements - but still lots of gas.  I also tried probiotics, especially Activia - my use of Activia may have done more harm than good since it also contains a lot of calcium.  Factor in your multivitamin or other calcium containing supplements if you take one, and any dairy you eat or drink, and any other calcium containing foods and you are ingesting a mega-dose of Calcium, almost certainly way more than you need.  If you take Tums for heartburn like me you might as well seal your exit with crazy glue, you may never crap again.This is a product marketed to healthy men primarily, who specifically do not need massive amounts of Iron or Calcium.  The amounts are indefensible, though I am aware high doses of protein may increase calcium excretion a little, this is just a ridiculous amount, and I can attest to the ill effects it will have on your bowel.  They should add a warning label.  I thought I must have colon cancer or an intestinal blockage.  Stopped taking this crap - NOW has a good supplement with no additives, that's my new priority in protein supplements.Also this contains articulate sweeteners that may also be harmful if used on a regular basis.P.S. Since I recently stopped this I had a dramatic reversal of symptoms, may have pooped out 3 days of buildup just so far today.  When you're constipated you have no appetite - because you're literally full of you know what - and you feel stale and run down all the time.  Never thought I'd be so relieved by something so mundane.

The ON platinum may be more expensive than other brands, but just remember, you get what you pay for.  After bariatric (GB) surgery, my doctor said I needed 60 grams of protein a day.  A lack of protein after GB results in hair loss, fatigue and muscle wasting.  I only rarely ate meat pre- GB, and even less now.  I began to have the classic symptoms, with the hair loss and fatigue being the worst.  With GB restricting meal size to itty bitty portions, and not being a huge meat-eater, I was desperate to find a way to get enough protein daily.  I tried just about every other brand of protein powder on the market with unpleasant results.  They were impossible to dissolve in liquids, stayed lumpy, had an off-taste, were gritty in the mouth, and were low in the amount of protein per serving.  After reading a magazine article about any contaminants or heavy metals found in commercial protein powders, it looked like ON was one of the safest, so I ordered the platinum hydro-whey in vanilla.  Wow.  No off-taste, it's whey (the best source), and one serving (one scoop) is a whopping 30 grams of protein.  When you first add it to liquid, it appears that while it mostly dissolves (hydrolyzed?), there are a few small lumps.  Just do a very little stirring.  Even so, I can't detect any lumps or grit when drinking it.I hope this helps fellow GB-ers in need of protein sources.  GB is life changing, and finding adequate protein has been a real challenge for me.  I'm not a morning person and can't handle a big breakfast.  A morning drink made with ON works for me and supplies me with half of the protein I need all day.  But you can have them any time you want.  Yes, my hair loss started stabilizing and is getting better.  My fatigue is improving.  I had really gotten myself down a hole 6-9 months after GB surgery, and I don't expect miracles overnight, but I'm really seeing my health improve after getting more protein in my diet.  I'll give my basic recipe for a ON protein drink, but you can try many variations on it.  Good luck to you all in your weight loss and health journey.In an 8 to 16 oz. mug or glass, add 1/2 cup more or less of water.  Add a teaspoon or two of instant coffee crystals (I use Folger's classic roast) and stir.  Add 2 to 4 squirts of Torani sugar free syrup.  Add one scoop of ON and stir.  Add more liquid to taste.  This can be more water, milk (low fat for less calories), coffee and milk, coffee, or?  I then like to add a couple of ice cubes, but that's optional.  The variations on this can be endless.  Use coffee or not.  Use milk or not.  Use Torani or not.  Try different Torani flavor combinations (1/2 caramel and 1/2 vanilla is good).  Vary the amounts/portions of any of the ingredients to taste.  I don't use any measuring cups or spoons now for this.  Less dirty things to wash and the measurements don't need to be exact.  Whatever glass or cup is handy, a spoon out of the silverware drawer and available ingredients, and a scoop of ON.  I haven't tried fruit juice yet, but was thinking that OJ and low fat milk (no coffee) might be creme-sicle-ish.  GB-ers be careful to check the grams of sugars in juice servings.  Not sure if Torani makes sugar free OJ syrup, but I know they make some sugar free fruit flavors.After running out using the small ON container size, I now order the 3.5 pound size and keep a spare on hand.  ON doesn't seem to be available at many retail stores, so Amazon is the best source I've found for speed and best price.  When I occasionally run out of ON and fill in with something else in a pinch - Yuck!

When I was setting up an "Insanity" workout schedule back in the late summer (which I had to leave off once allergy season started), I researched and bought a number of different health-shake related products. The short version of this review is that I tried ON's Platinum Hydro Whey first, as a supplement to the P90X formula; eventually ran out of it; tried the other things I bought; and am now giving them away to go back to this!Being somewhat lactose intolerant, I worried that a pure milk product would be a problem, but decided to risk it due to the hydrolyzed state. Perhaps because of that I never once had a problem with this product. (And I see some other reviewers didn't either, although some have in fact had stomach cramps, so apparently it depends on the personal biochemistry. Buyer be warned. UPDATED TO ADD: as of early September 2012, the product now contains a slight amount of lactose. Not enough to bother me, but could be problematic for other people.)I bought the vanilla version (also in other products) specifically for the purpose of adding some protein and now-missing vanilla flavor back to the new version of the P90X Recovery Formula drink. As many people here will be aware, this was a very popular drink in its original incarnation, largely due to its strong mixture of vanilla and orange flavors. The new version tastes more like Tang, but lacks the sugar and vanilla flavor to hide the vitamin/mineral aftertaste.ON Platinum Hydro Whey added that vanilla flavor back to the P90 mix; and also beefed up the protein to carb ratio. (The P90 has a lot more carbs than proteins.) To this I added a bit of real Tang.As other people have reported, the Hydro Whey mixes very easily and thoroughly (even moreso than the P90 mix, by the way, which is no slouch in this department!) On the other hand, I probably wouldn't try to drink this as a straight milk supplement or alone with water, as I doubt the taste, although very good, would be strong enough for me. On yet another hand, the taste has no mineralish bite or aftertaste to it (because there aren't any added vitamins and minerals, duh!)Buyers should keep in mind the report of other reviewers, that ON is being rather misleading about the supposedly superior amount of protein compared to their normal Gold Standard whey products. Mathematically speaking, there is practically no difference. I can't testify to any other differences, although technically I suppose the hydrolyzed state should metabolize much faster (and maybe mixes better). On the other hand, some people don't actually want so quick a metabolization, and would rather have the material digest over time. I don't know enough to opine on the merits of either theory, but as someone who has trouble digesting milk products I appreciate any quicker digestion!Anyway, I'm buying it again and getting rid of the other things I test-bought, as they don't mix as well or taste as good (although the latter is subjective and they do have advantages this doesn't. But of course I'm mixing this with something that has those other advantages already, so...)

Optimum Nutrition is not new to the scene and they certainly produce great-value products, like their Gold Standard protein 
Optimum Nutrition 100% Whey Gold Standard, Double Rich Chocolate, 5 Pound
 and multivitamins 
Optimum Nutrition Opti-Men Multivitamins, 180-Count
However, Hydro Whey is expensive and a lesser value, but why is it worth it?First off, for all the hard gainers like myself out there, the increased content of BCAA's is important for protein anabolism.  You can only create as much as the weakest link and without a single amino acid or fuel to create the essential ones, you are falling short.Secondly, this stuff mixes like a champ! We've all been there with the proteins that fail to mix well, leaving clumps to swallow and dry powder to lick out of our cups and shaker bottles.  I highly recommend a shaker bottle 
Blender Bottle W/Wire Ball-Large 28 Oz. Colors Vary
 for all mixing purposes, for its convenience as well as efficiency.  However, this is the ONLY protein I've ever been able to mix in a cup when a mixer/blender was not available and there are no clumps at all.  It does produce a more frothy, lighter shake than does Gold Standard or even Platinum Hydrobuilder, making it easier to consume and break down.  The taste is much smoother than its thicker Gold Standard counterpart. It will curb your appetite slightly (characteristic of all proteins), but not as bad as other protein shakes do which can be important when you need to consume that post-workout meal.Now, as to whether "hydrolyzed" whey is better than the regular stuff, that's for you to decide.  It has worked for me, and I'm not going back to Gold Standard anytime soon for all the reasons above, but remember scientific 'philosophies' or lab work does not all translate to the same benefits in real-life applications like the human body (where everyone reacts differently).  Hydro-Whey has been a winner for me, and I've tried many, many proteins before: Muscletech, BSN, Optimum, etc.Please do your research as different proteins have different applications and this stuff is reserved for primarily upon waking and immediately post-workout.  If you're looking for meal replacement or anabolic longevity, look elsewhere.  Hydro-whey provides instant fuel when your body needs it most, and to maximize muscle gains, I'm willing to pay a premium after working hard in the gym day in, day out.

Short review: This products works well, tastes great, and is easy on the stomach.  I would recommend it.Longer review:I'll start off by briefly informing you that I use this product specifically to supplement my protein intake after a workout.  Previously, I used Optimum Nutrition's Gold Standard Whey for the past ~2 years.  Before that, I've used a few others and concluded that ON seems to deliver the best overall protein.  That being said, I tried ON's Hydrowhey because hydrolyzed whey is absorbed very quickly after consumption.Taste (Turbo Chocolate): 9/10Vanilla soymilk is my preferred base liquid, and this flavor tastes great with it.  ...Probably even better than their Gold Standard Double Rich Chocolate flavor.Mixability: 8/10I've used the same blender bottle for about two years as well, and this Hydrowhey seemed to clump up slightly more than their Gold Standard and stick to the lid of the bottle.  Not a huge deal, but worth noting.Ingredients: 9.5/10Lots of protein and not a whole lot of other garbage that a lot of commercial proteins contain.  People will complain about artificial ingredients in their protein, but I'm not from that camp.  Personally, I'd be upset if they started dumping sugar into it.  It's also noteworthy that this protein powder (like other ON protein powders) has BCAAs, which is convenient, so that I don't have to order another product or even risk forgetting to take it.Digestability: 8/10I include this because there's a common talking point about hydro whey being tough on your stomach.  For this reason, I procrastinated in trying this, but I'm glad that I did.  Personally, this maybe had an effect on my stomach about 5% of the time (maybe 2 or 3 days out of the first month that I used it).All in all, I'd recommend ON's hydrowhey.  I only tried their Turbo Chocolate flavor, and it's definitely a winner.  It's a little pricey, but the quality of ingredients and taste make it worth it.  I paid full price for my whey and my opinions are my own.  If you found this review to be helpful in any way, feel free to tap the "Yes" button to indicate this was helpful to you.  Thanks!

Normally I sit on the sideline and just read reviews but it bothers me when people give misinformed reviews possibly swaying people away from a perfectly good product. First of all this isn't your run of the mill protein powder. This product contains hydrolyzed whey protein which your body metabolizes much better than other forms of whey, especially whey concentrate (check the labels of most protein powders and see what the first protein listed is, it's probably concentrate). Concentrate is easy to produce and is one of the least efficient forms of whey. It's not that it doesn't work but an awful lot of it get converted into waste. Also, since hydrolyzed whey is metabolized better an added benefit is that it is easier on your stomach (protein shakes don't always agree with everyone).The reason hydrolyzed whey is more expensive is because the refining process is much more involved and the yield is much less at the end of the process. The biggest negative to hydrolyzed whey is the taste. Hydrolyzed proteins typically are very bitter. The ON Platinum Whey tastes phenomenal for a hydrolyzed whey product. If all you want is a great tasting milk shake and don't care about the quality of protein then look elsewhere.This brings me to my biggest gripe with a lot of reviewers. Please stop comparing apples and oranges. Yes it is more expensive than ON Gold Whey but for the reasons I mentioned above there are additional costs in manufacturing and as a result there are added benefits to the consumer. 1 gram of whey concentrate is not equal to 1 gram of hydrolyzed whey. So stop comparing it to the Whey gold gram for gram. It's not just marketing hype, they market it as platinum because it is a better product.I've been using this product for over a year and I've tried a plethora of other brands but this by far is the best tasting hydrolyzed whey formula in my experience. There might be more pure hydrolyzed whey out there but the bitterness is nauseating.This is a great product by a reputable company. It isn't magic and it's not perfect, nothing is. Hydrolyzed whey isn't for everyone either. I agree with other reviewers, do your research. Just make sure you are comparing apples to apples, the nutrition info doesn't tell the whole story. Read the ingredients.

General:Extremely high quality protein. The price is absolutely justified. Know that most other protein powders out there are not made equal. They're mostly below this one in quality. A full scoop mixes very well with 6-8 ounces of water in my shaker bottle. Also mixes well with milk, not as good as water, but definitely still good.
