To me, it's not something that tastes so good that I couldn't wait to drink it, but it does not taste bad to any extent. It's kind of like water to me, I need it, I drink it, and done. Awesome. I give it an 8.5/10 on taste. Next, it mixes so well, sometimes the consistency of the shake was barely distinguishable from water. It's also very versatile! If you plan on adding multiple ingredients to your shake, chances are that TC will pair well. If you're trying the product out for the first time, get this one.Cookies and Cream Overdrive (CCO) - Ugh. No, just no. Don't get it. Protein quality is obviously the same, but just....no. It's especially bad as the first thing in the morning. I give it a 4.5/10. After having TC flavor, I decided to be a bit more adventurous. Got this one in the hopes that it would taste similar to Muscle Milk's cookies and cream flavor and boy did it tank. Optimum Nutrition dropped the ball on CCO. Not only does it not taste good, but it doesn't mix as well as TC does. Multiple times I've had some of the unmixed but wet powder lining the bottom edges of my shaker bottle. Had to dig it out with a spoon. Blasted waste. After my first serving, I dreaded that I had to wait at least a month to finish the stuff and go back to something better. I eventually got used to the taste, but please don't subject yourself to that kind of torture.Think I may just stick to Turbo Chocolate!

I ordered the double rich chocolate (DBC), thanks to reviews indicating it did not use sucralose (and it does not as of 06/12/18).I've never used ON before, I do not know if it "used to" taste better. As of 06/12/18 the DBC flavor tastes roughly like burnt brownie flavored cardboard. Consistency remains almost the same as whatever liquid you have mixed it into (adds no extra thickness). I tried both water and milk.On the positive front, it is jam packed with goodies with every scoop. It mixes extremely well (I use milk mainly) and when mixed with other powders, it continued to mix well (I add extra probiotics and stuff for my joints).I let it sit for a few hours on the counter, everything settled and needed a slight jostle, but (aside from being warm) mixed right back up and tasted exactly the same with the same consistency, which is great as I have had powders that turn to sludge if you let it sit for too long.

I've been using the Whey Gold product for many years. A little under 1 scoop 2x/day helps me keep my hard earned muscle mass. This Platinum appears to be marketed as higher quality/more effective protein, so I thought I'd try it out, even though the smaller 3.5 lb tub immediately made me suspicious of its value.First of all, the chocolate that I bought tastes fantastic and mixes great. But in comparison to the Whey Gold product, I feel the Platinum is a marketing gimmick and a product that mostly just increases profits for this company without really adding value to the consumer. Why is that?The most obvious trick that I didn't catch when comparing the two before buying: Scoop size/protein in grams. Andy Rooney always complains about this type of thing, so I guess he is my mentor in this case...Whey Gold: 1 scoop = 24 grams protein.Platinum: 1 scoop = 30 grams protein.So you figure you are getting more protein for your buck, right? More protein per scoop? Wrong. The Platinum scoop is bigger! What I missed was the serving size:Whey Gold: Serving size 30gPlatinum: Serving size 39gSure enough. The scoop they give you with the Platinum is bigger than the Whey Gold. Compare the two. I did once I got the Platinum shipment.So is the protein in the Platinum any more concentrated than the Whey Gold? It doesn't appear to be, at least in grams per comparable serving.The other differences...I see they put some "creamer" in the Platinum which is not in the Whey Gold. I also think the Platinum might be a little sweeter. My point here is that these 2 features improve the taste/texture of the Platinum vs. the Whey Gold and make you think the Platinum is better. I actually like these changes and wish they'd incorporate them into the Whey Gold - but don't be fooled into thinking the Platinum is somehow more effective because of this (unless taste is more important to you than getting high quality protein at the best price).Yeah, I could be missing something else here. Like maybe the Platinum quality - gram for gram - is technically a little better. But I'm not going to worry about that since I'll never be able to figure it out. I really don't think trying one for a while and then the other is going to prove that - they probably aren't THAT much different. Someone else can do the math, but I bet you could use close to twice as much Whey Gold as Platinum for the same price per gram of protein. So use a little less than twice as much, and you'll be saving money and getting more protein.If money is no object, the Platinum could be the superior product. MAYBE you can take less or the same amount and get better results. It definitely tastes good. But I'll just stick with the Whey Gold which I know works and I'm SURE is the better value.

Overall it’s a good, easy-to-drink chocolate flavor that isn’t very sweet.Texture: mixes easily but a spoon will leave a few sticky clumps floating around. To be honest it mixes well enough that I’m willing to deal with the minor clumping to avoid having to clean a blender or shaker bottle. Not too thick which is a good thing.Performance: obviously an opinion, but I feel a bit less sore the next day than I otherwise would’ve been had I not drank this after my workout. It works.Price: it’s more expensive than normal whey powder but the increased cost is expected with hydrolyzed whey as it’s a premium product. There are more and less expensive products on the market but I think you will have to spend significantly more to get a marginally better quality product so it’s priced just right IMO. Besides this isn’t intended to be your all-purpose whey powder anyway.I will be purchasing another container when mine runs out.
Tiene un sabor extraño, nose si sea de un químico, pero deja un sabor a especia en la boca,lo que hago es echarle mas chocolate para que no sepa tanto a eso, fuera de eso creo que esta bien.

I love working out, so I use whey protein and I love to experiment with different kinds. I mainly stuck with Now Foods - Whey Protein Isolate, because it has no preservatives or additives or any chemical crap in it and you can feel and see the difference in it. Well after killing 40 pounds of Now Foods, I wanted to try something new and didn't want chocolate or vanilla. I went with the strawberry Hydro Whey by ON. I'm not a big fan of ON because they use Maltodextrin and artificials that cause health problems and weight gain in the gut.I have to say, for a protein that has artificials in it, this is pretty good. I love the taste, it mixes very very easy with a blender ball cup and the taste of the strawberry literally tasted like strawberry. It is really sweet, so if you like sweet things, this is easy to down within seconds. I normally chug it because it tastes that great.To say for performance wise, after I drink this, I feel good but I sometimes feel that crash or lazy feeling you get from the additive crap in it.If ON would take out their artificial ingredient and just let it be, I would stick with it. but I have to say, this is a great protein overall if you don't believe in the artificial ingredients affecting your body. I for one can tell a difference from the Now Foods to this one.Overall, I would recommend this because it is one of the best Caseins out there for performance and taste.
6 months ago Hydrowhey was 59.75.now they increased the weight by .1 lbs and increased the price by $25.i like hydrowhey, but not that much

I am extremely lactose intolerant and have been looking for a protein shake that does not make me sick for a long time. After purchasing this shake, I can gladly say I've found it!Being extremely lactose intolerant, I often tend to get sick from things that taste like milk, even though the lactose content is minimal. This shake has a strong milk taste, which is the only negative thing about it. But, I decided not to mark it down as all protein shakes have a strong milk taste, and because you can easily go around the milk taste by mixing it with Gatorade powder or crystal light on the go packs (sugar-free). Without mixing it with something else, however, I can't drink it. If you do not like a milk taste, then I'd recommend you get the Strawberry flavor as you can easily mix it with out flavors... not so much with the Chocolate or Vanilla flavor.The best thing about this shake is that it really doesn't contain any lactose (other's say they contain zero grams, but still contain milligrams), and it does not upset my stomach. I sometimes feel a bit bloated, but it doesn't last very long as the hydro whey is quickly digested.As far as the results go, I am already starting to see result after just a few days. As far as the preparing goes, you really don't need to blend it, you can simply stir your shake and it'll be fine as well.My ratings:Taste: 2/5 (This is obviously subjective, others who love milkshakes will love it)Mixing: 5/5 (Stirring or blending works fine)Digestion: 5/5 (Quickly digested, perfect for people with lactose intolerance)Results: 5/5 (You'll notice results after a few days)Price: 4/5 (It's a bit more expensive than other shakes, but it's definitely worth the money)

I purchased this a few months ago after doing a ton of research on many different protein powders. I've tried a few different brands, both in powders and premixed shakes. I had gastric sleeve surgery almost a year ago so protein is a very important aspect of my diet. My biggest problem is flavor! I can't stand a lot of the products I've tried, it's either gritty or tastes awful, or usually, it's both. That being said, this powder is acceptable to me. It's not absolutely gag worthy but it's definitely not delicious either. It almost has an oat taste to it, which is odd but not really gross or tasty either. The protein in it is good quality and I can tell because it doesn't cause gas or bloating. My favorite is still Premier Protein shakes in chocolate but this one is good for after my workouts or if I'm really low on protein for the day. I mix it with fairlife milk, in a cup with a whisk and it blends fairly well. Please don't buy into the myth that your body can only absorb so much protein at once either because it simply isn't true. I'll still continue to look for a shake that tastes good without a ton of carbs but at this point at least I've found something tolerable. That in and of itself has been a challenge! I would definitely recommend this product tho, especially if you're like me and have extremely picky taste buds.

The macros are good, but between the price over ON's Gold Standard Whey and how watered down it tastes, no one in the household liked this protein powder. It's not the worst by any means, but I could see it more as an ingredient in high-protein meals (ie overnight oats) rather than a powder I'd mix into a drink.

So far so good. Still in my first batch ordered my second already. Been a long time consumer of the ON Gold one and decided to give this one a try. I am going to give you my honest feedback. The taste ? It’s actually better than Gold and it’s better mixed with water rather than milk. Coz it gets coagulated for some reason with milk and I know a lot of folks said the mixability is great and that Holds good only if you mix it with water so avoid milk and it tastes great. It does feel kinda full after I have the shake unlike with the Gold one. But you know what’s the best positive I do feel a difference in recovery time after heavy and intensive workouts. I think I have less body strains and my body feels refreshed the next day and I remember the ON Gold one never gave me such an instant impact. I would rate it as the best ever protein I have had till date but the 4 stars is only coz it’s not actually great mixing with any kind of milk ( tried peas , soy and Zero fat organic milk ) and not exactly fart free. Hahaha but I don’t care coz I feel the results and get the desired impact from what I need for my body!
Mixes well and with ease in water. Vanilla flavor blends well with any other flavors. Great in smoothies regardless of what you mix it with.
Must be out your damn mind if you think a tub of 3.5 pounds of protein is worth $100. This is were greed comes in. No longer buying ON products 😒

There are a LOT of protein products out there, and it can be really difficult to weigh the pros/cons between all of them.  I've tried just about all of them.  It doesn't help that some of those products will try and trick people by making their serving size 2 or even 3 scoops.  What I look for in a good protein powder is something provides a very high-percentage of protein with no extra fluff that might interfere with my normal diet and vitamin supplements.  And, no digestive side-effects are a huge plus, of course.Pros:- High protein content per serving (30g per scoop; each scoop is 39g, so you're looking at 77% protein by mass)- Very low sugar and carbs (only 1g and 3g per serving, respectively)- Low on vitamins, which allows me to take vitamin supplements without worrying about getting too much calcium, for example- No digestive side-effects; I can consume 120g of this per day and not experience the usual bloat you get from other protein powders- Tastes great mixed with just milkCons:- Price is moderately high, but it's not the most expensive out thereMy routine is to mix this with flax milk in a Blender bottle.  Since flax milk has no lactose and typically no sugar, I get a very clean protein beverage out of it.

Those who say it needs a better flavor should go try the ones with ungodly amounts of sugar. If you’re buying protein powder for the flavor then you can get another brand and slurp down a cookies and cream milkshake. I take this with water and a little bit of vanilla almond milk and it’s perfect. Not too thick where I feel like I’m drinking melted ice cream but still has enough flavor to go down easy. This is the 5th protein powder I’ve tried and it’s the best. Absorbs really well in a blender bottle, whereas other brands will leave you chewing on chunks. Never had that once with powder and I’ve been using for about a month now.
Good replacement for the ON Performance Isolate, almost same taste. However, I think its little expensive.

Look up Consumer Reports of April 2012 article re heavy metal contaminants in protein powders. You'll see that about half of the popular protein powders contain amounts of lead and mercury. This product does NOT. And it's got about the best profile of amino acids. It even tastes really good.
I like the taste and it is very good for exercising.I like the taste and it is very good

Seems to be working well. I can honestly say it performs  better than other mixes

Okay. I normally do not like these powders as they either clump up or have a weird after taste. I've been using this at work in the mornings to help keep me full. I read all the reviews here, and applied all I saw about using a little less water if you want a stronger taste or more water for a weaker taste, also after shaking it up, put it in the fridge for 30 minutes to get rid of clumps and chunks. I found this is what works best for me:10oz of water1 Scoop (the one provided)Shake up for 30 secondsput in 1 Serving of PB2 (good stuff)Shake up for 20 secondsPut in Fridge for 30 minutesDrinkSo far this method has worked flawlessly, I have no seen one clump of the powder or the PB2 and all I am using is a simple little 12 oz shaker for mixing it and drinking it.The taste is really good with or with out the PB2 taste, it kind of tastes like a chocolate drink and if you use less water you get that rich chocolate taste, it almost feels like I am cheating :DHighly suggest you try the smaller bottle before investing in the large one.

I love the pure chocolate flavor. If I stir it with just water, it tastes like pure cocoa drink. No digesting problems, It’s easy to stir, tastes perfect with strawberries, blueberries, peanut butter. This is my 2nd, and I will definitely buy it again as It’s sold out very fast
120 of 140 calories is protein. No digestive issues for me which other kinds of protein became an issue as I've aged. Using cold water with a shaker taste is pretty good.
Digests really fast which is a huge pro for me.I have been taking this protein powder for a long time however, the price seems to be raising gradually for some reason. Please keep price REASONABLE!

I consider myself to be lactose-sensitive but maybe not lactose-intolerant.  For calibration, I can put a little half and half in my coffee and be just fine.  But if I drink a glass of milk, I'll be miserable for hours.I have had issues with whey protein at Jamba Juice, and I can't eat protein bars anymore.  But this hydrolyzed whey protein doesn't affect my digestion at all.  It's great stuff!I wish there was a version without artificial sweeteners.  I'd like to have a powder that is just protein, allowing me to add my own sweetener if I want to.

I have finally found my perfect whey powder.  I've tried numerous whey powders and always had some type of issue with digestibility.  Even whey isolates sometimes gave me problems.  I decided to give this a shot after having issues with ON Performance Whey Isolate.  It caused bloating and stomach upset at times.  Once I tried this hydro whey, I knew I found a keeper.  The taste is the best I've tasted yet.  To me it tastes like Nestle Quick when mixed with skim milk.  Even when mixed with water it still tastes good, just a tiny bit more diluted.  With a full 30 grams of protein per 39 gram scoop, you get quality protein and nearly 9 grams of BCAAs without a lot of "proprietary blend" mystery filler.  I won't sit here and say this is the best source of protein ever, because it isn't.  I still get the bulk of my protein from the absolute best source that blows any protein powder out of the water: food.  However, if you're looking for a great tasting protein supplement powder that absorbs fast, tastes great and is easy on the stomach, this is it.  I only wish I got a little more for the price, but I plan to keep using.
This is the only protein I’ve found to agree with my stomach.

I've been supplementing with whey protein for a few years now and have tried just about everything. I used to just buy cheaper products but must have developed an allergy and now get shortness of breath anytime I use anything that isn't ultra pure. I assume that it is a milk allergy. I tried plant based proteins (disgusting) and pretty much every other protein (still gave me shortness of breath). I've been using this platinum hydro whey for about one year now and haven't had any problems. If anyone else has allergies and is still trying to supplement with protein I also recommend BCAAs. I haven't had a problem with the unflavored Optimum Nutrition BCAAs I use either. As for the taste of this stuff, IMO, the chocolate flavor is EXTREMELY good! I sometimes add some steviosides or even raw cocoa powder to this stuff and I think it tastes like hot cocoa! haha. I haven't tasted a better chocolate flavored protein powder, especially one without added carbs. I did decide to branch out and try the cookies and cream on one occasion but that was a mistake.... I was not a fan and didn't even end up finishing it. I've never really liked any protein flavors other than chocolate though.

This is a good tasting whey isolate protein. First I'll say only time will tell on any kind of results I get from this. But initial reactions are very positive. The most important thing for me is the taste. It smells and tastes just like hot chocolate. It's not gritty or weird and after mixing is very smooth. I've used water and milk and either way it still tastes great. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to try something new or that's looking to start supplementing to begin with.

This protein powder is the best powder I've used as far as settling well on my stomach (very lactose intolerant). Coupled with Silk Almond Milk, it doesn't taste that bad (VANILLA FLAVOR). To be honest, it's the smell and after taste that are foul. I would definitely recommend holding your nose while drinking and having some gum for after you drink it, but otherwise it's great. I mix it and put it in the fridge before I workout, and by the time I get home it's chilled and the smell wears off a bit.Other than the luxuries, the protein powder does just what it should. I Like this stuff.  I only buy the vanilla flavor so I cannot comment on the others - I like the taste - like a slightly sweeter Muscle Milk without the chalky aftertaste. I mix 3 scoops with a few ice cubes and 40 ounces of water in an insulated water bottle and shake it up manually - it mixes well.  Not as filling as some of the plant based powders but that's not what I'm looking for.  I have heard it foams up something crazy in a blender but I never blend it.

I do like the product. It tastes good sweetened by sugars and Stevia even though sweetness was not what I was after.Only real criticism is the packaging.  It doesn't seal well, making it difficult every day.  Even transferring into a jar or other container for daily use is unavoidably messy.

great

This product, in terms of quality, is top tier. Just look at the ingredients. There’s no amino spiking, no garbage. Just pure quality protein. Which I’m sure some of you don’t know about spiking, but most of your protein powders that say 25g or more are actually lying and you’re probably only getting 14g-17g of quality muscle building protein. Yes, it’s a little pricey, but understandably so. Regarding taste, it’s good. I’ve only had chocolate, but have found nothing offensive about it. Now it doesn’t have that super creamy backbone that some look for, but that’s probably a result of other poor ingredients to give you that mouth feel. I don’t find it to be overly sweet like some of the comments mention. In fact other products like Syntha 6 and such I find to be much sweeter than this one.To the people who said be aware of allergy concerns “it contains MILK!” Just shut up. Like honestly stop speaking. Where do you think whey comes from? You got bigger problems and need to do more education and research before you start taking supplements if you can’t make that connection.

I often don't like powders with sugar substitutes because they taste "diet" to me. Also, it's annoying how many vanilla powders are over the top artificial vanilla smelling and tasting. And there'll be either such low natural sugar that it's not sweet, or so much sugar substitute that it's overkill sweet but that "not real sugar" type of sweet.I just made my first smoothie with this and it was delightful. I usually use unsweetened almond or coconut milk and add fruit and greens. The texture, smell, and overall taste was great! Subtle sweet, natural vanilla flavor, blended well with the other ingredients to make a refreshing, delicious smoothie. I think I've found my new every day protein powder. Yay!

It's the best I've had. Better than melted chocolate ice cream imo. I drink this right on through out the day. I also give plenty of free advertising 😉. Thank you so much for such a good protein powder. I had to throw away my muscle milk powder after drinking this!
Excellent protein powder. I ordered this for my husband as a flavor to try. It is not his favorite but we love the vanilla and chocolate.

I usually dont write reviews like this but this product absolutely stunned me. The vanilla flavor was amazing and the ingredients were good as well compared to other brands. Just note that it is sweetened with stevia and not monkfruit. But besides that the product is amazing. It helps you recover from a workout with great taste and ingredients.
I needed protein post-op for recovery. My friend recommended this. I bougt vanilla. It fully dissolves in only 8 ounces. I have used plain water, grape juice, and a smoothie. Easy to drink.

The other flavors appear to use stevia, which is sometimes too sweet, so this is definitely the high bar for a minimally sweet, non-artificially flavored protein. Will purchase again from Ascent … possibly strawberry again.

I feel like I have tried a lot of whey in my life. Whey has evolved a lot. It's not all created equal. IMO ingredients matter. Taste and consistency matter. I hate spending money on whey that no one in my house will use. I originally found this brand at WF on sale. I like chocolate PB flavored anything. It mixes pretty well with water. I mix this with coffee a lot. I do not mind the taste. I recommended this brand to people when they're looking for a cleaner whey. I was excited to find this on a lightning deal since the retail price is on the moderate to high side. I am a repeat purchaser of this product

This powder mixes very easily just by stirring with a spoon. Tastes great, and also gives me a great workout and speedy recovery!

I'm impressed with the ingredients, both the types and quantities. Just a handful of ingredients vs. 20+ with other proteins. The product smells like cocoa, a very faint cocoa, but it just smells like a real food. As weird as it probably sounds, I like that it doesn't have sand in it, like most protein mixes. I know the sand used in other protein mixes is safe to consume, but I never really enjoyed the thought that I was drinking sand.I drink this type of stuff for sustenance, so I'm not too picky on the taste, but it actually has a decent taste. With 8 ounces of water, it's too thin to taste like much. 6 ounces of water and you can taste the chocolate a little more, it's good enough, but certainly not great. With 4 ounces of water, it just tastes like a hot chocolate drink that has cooled. This is the first protein powder I've tried where it actually tastes good with just 4 ounces of water. The less liquid I have to drink to get the protein I'm looking for, the happier I am. Others have more sugar or sugar substitute added so that it tastes better based on the 8 ounce standard. This has less sugar and so it can't support that much liquid and still taste good. I don't see it as a problem though because now it's just like a quick shot of chocolate protein and I'm good. Not some drink that I'm trying to choke down.My only complaint is the packaging. I can't stand these bags that some protein manufacturers use. Maybe it's more environmentally friendly, I don't know. I ended up pouring it into a large tupperware type container that's used for storing flour. Protein needs to be shaken up every now and then and it's risky to do so with these types of bags because they are very hard to seal. So put it in a solid contain so you can shake it up without flinging protein dust everywhere.Good stuff though. After 10 years of consuming maybe 30 different brands of protein, I think I've found a good one here.

This product dissolves great, however product label on amazon is not correct. I was told this does not  contain stevia (vanilla flavor), unfortunately it does. I can not have stevia but if you don't mind it, this product would be great for you! Great quality, dissolves quickly and good price for the amount you get.
Product is of good quality, but is slightly expensive compared to other brands.

It smells like cake mix! It blends like a dream, not gritty or chalky at all. It tastes pretty good, nice vanilla flavor. It is very sweet with a strong sugary aftertaste (that’s the stevia talking). The only issue I have is the sweetener discrepancy. The product photos of this listing show it's sweetened with monkfriuit, but the actual bag I received says stevia. I get migraines from sucralose/aspartame/acesulfame potassium, so it doesn’t matter too much whether it’s monkfruit or stevia. I prefer the taste of monkfruit over stevia though. This could be a deal breaker for individuals who have a sensitivity to stevia.

This product is great if you can just scarf down the drink. I used to use dymatize peanut butter and chocolate and that tasted 10x better for me. This has an artificial sweetener after taste and I have to now warm it up and scarf it down since I have bought it. If you are looking for good taste, this is not the way to go. If you are looking for good macros and don't care about taste then this is for you.
Mixes great hot or cold! Add to your morning coffee to get the protein you need!
I think the quality and flavor (chocolate) are great. It’s been the third time I bought it and has become my favorite so far.

It’s easy to mix with everything.  Sometimes I add Macha tea and almond milk, sometimes fruit.  It makes the best high protein smoothies ever.  On days when I’m in a hurry, or don’t feel like cooking…this is my alternative.
Highly recommend this protein. The ingredients are healthier than most, and the flavor is spot on!

The flavor is pretty terrible. It does not taste like chocolate or peanut butter. Metallic with a metallic after taste that lingers. I like the ingredients, I liked the chocolate only version. This one is one of the worst tasting protein powders I’ve had.

You'd never be able to tell that this protein powder is naturally sweetened. I'll mix this with a little cold water and milk (50/50) and it literally tastes like a good chocolate shake. Love this product.
Great tasting, low calorie source of protein.

The stevia sweetener really gives this protein a vile taste. I’ve tried many products and this was by far the hardest to enjoy. It really depends on how much you are comfortable with the taste of stevia but it is no unnatural tasting that I would rather have a small amount of normal sugar instead.

I'm a dark chocolate fan. This product lacks that chocolate punch...tastes more like milk chocolate. But to make it even worse, it is way too sweet. Don’t really like the packaging though. It’s a close seal like zip lock and all the protein gets stuck in it from the shipping so it wouldn’t close back up after opening the top off. Had to put into a different bag. Overall good protein for the quality.
Great taste and no issues with my stomach

To anyone who may come across this review,I ran out of my usual protein supply which is Forza Pro and is sold exclusively by Nutrishop (that I’m aware of) so I decided to go to the one down the street from my apartment. Turns out they were moving locations so I couldn’t get my usual protein. I went on Amazon and decided to purchase what I thought would be something that I could use to replace it in the meantime. I searched chocolate protein (I usually prefer chocolate flavored proteins) and came across this Ascent Native Fuel protein powder. Wanted some protein right away and it had next day shipping so I decided to give it a try without really reading too much on it or reading any reviews. All I saw was 120 calories for 25g of protein which is really pretty solid as far as protein powders go. I figured since it was $40 for 2lbs that it probably doesn’t taste too bad or anything. I was most definitely mistaken. It literally tastes like dirt mixed with cotton candy. I honestly can’t figure out the exact flavor but that’s the closest thing I can come up with to describe what it tastes like.I don’t even like to drink protein powders. I don’t like to make smoothies or anything, I mix it with water and just chug and I can tell you right now that it’s possibly the WORST tasting protein powder I’ve come across. I know that for the macros it has it’s hard to expect it to taste that good but this stuff actually tastes like dirt when I’m chugging it. And then when I finish I get this large aftertaste of cotton candy as if it’s going to make me go “wow now that’s great!”Now maybe it tastes better with milk or mixed into a smoothie but there are definitely other protein powders out there that I’ve had that have very similar macros and don’t taste nearly as bad. If you’re paying $40 for only 2lbs then it’d better taste pretty solid. For sure NOT getting this again. Going to just make sure to get my usual Forza Pro protein powder ahead of time before I run out so I don’t run into this issue again.EDIT: after reading some reviews I cannot believe that people are saying this stuff tastes great. They must literally have the most bland tastebuds on earth because this stuff actually tastes horrible. If you’re a normal human being that isn’t a gym freak on roids or Tren then don’t buy this ABSOLUTE GARBAGE.
I do like the protein powder but next time I will get a different flavor. Purchased the vanilla by accident.

This was delivered today and I just made a shake. The chocolate version. It’s incredible. Mixes without clumping (!) and tastes GREAT. This is hands down the BEST protein powder I’ve ever used. I may have this for breakfast, lunch and dinner. And It’s easy enough to take with me when I go out.The good reviews are no joke. Now there’s one more.Buy this.
Great product. Easy on the stomach and tastes very good.

A protein powder that is natural? Excellent.A protein powder that also tastes good? WOW.I cannot believe how much absolute junk is in the other powders from other companies. I'm extremely sensitive to chemicals and eat 100% natural, clean foods that are 99% single ingredient and only cook for myself. The other mixes from other companies to me are like liquid cancer.I'm also lactose intolerant and incredibly sensitive to any digestive tract upsets, and this is drinkable as is. Scoop of this, scoop of peanut butter powder, a banana and 12 oz. of fat free Lactaid and you've got a shake that is not only great for you, but packed with protein and delicious.10/10, will try other flavors. Note at this time I have only tried the 'chocolate peanut butter'.

I bought this protein after finishing another brand. I was looking for a great tasting protein, that was affordable and had good ingredients. This protein has been great. I’ve only used it a couple times at this point, but the flavor is fantastic.A couple points. The chocolate flavor I got has a deep, rich chocolatey flavor. It mixes really well and it left me feeling full for awhile. I would definitely suggest it.

The chocolate tastes great with just water, no milk necessary. But, please do not be fooled, you also need to workout to see results. I began drinking this every morning after doing three push ups and two jumping jacks.A month later I looked like The Rock, only stronger. I had to replace all of my doors because I would just pull the handles straight through the doors. I ended up removing doors from my house completely and using a bank vault door for my front door. Also, I can no longer drive my car because my foot went through the floor when I stepped on the gas. Fortunately, I run about 45mph from having insane quad strength so I no longer needed it. I simply crushed it down and carried it into my house. It makes a great coffee table, great conversation starter.Pro - Tastes great, worksCon - Could end up being too strong

Been buying ON protein for the past twelve years now, best tasting, plenty of protein in a scoop, mixes well, although, the price continues to go up with this countries current situation, it's a great product, well worth the cost!

I really enjoy this product. I use this for muscle recovery added protein. Substitute protein in between meal gaps. Quick protein if busy.

I probably wouldn’t buy this protein again, however, because it doesn’t taste super natural and is lacking fortification of vitamins and minerals like many other whey proteins include that also taste better - for example, GNC and MuscleTech.Your mileage may vary but I’d say if you’re looking for a solid, standard chocolate peanut butter flavor shake on a budget this is a good one to go with.

Seems like a good product and comparable to ones I've purchased in the past. Taste is good. I love Optimum Nutrition's Whey protein powders in general. I've never run into a flavor that is anything but great. This is the exception. Blends well in shakes, not too sweet and doesn’t leave you feeling bloated. Great product!

I had a jar of this given to me to try and loved it. When I ran out I did a scan of the item and found it on Amazon. Everything is the same but the quality and taste is not the same. This did not have the same creamy chocolate/peanut butter flavor. The powder did not dissolve in my hot coffee the way it had before, (which I would make and shake in a shaker bottle) so I was drinking clumps in my coffee and a lot of sand. Unbiased Review here folks. The taste is wonderful, I mixed one scoop, almond milk, a teaspoon of peanut butter and half banana. I'm taking this for dinner and fasting 12-15 hours (this stuff along with a few protein bars, controls my hunger that long). The Taste is unbelievably delicious, have you ever had that one peanut butter protein drink at Jamba Juice? well, this taste as good as that one (if not better).  I've been on it for about 4 days, it gives me the extra boost at the gym (4-5 days a week, 1.5-hour workouts),  it relaxes my muscles. The following morning I wake up energetic, I haven't felt like this for years!  I'm 6' 2", 280 lbs looking to get to my desired goal of 220lbs by the end of the year. I'm no bodybuilder, I'm just an average overweight guy looking to get back in shape, lose serious weight and strengthen my Arms, Chest, Shoulders, and lose belly Fat. I will update my review from time to time, as of now, I'm very pleased with this product.
Great product and delicious, blends well

Finally! I am so happy I found this protein powder. I used to by "Oh Yeah", but I think it was sold to another company. So after having a hard time trying to find it, I have been trying others. I have gone through several brands, and none impressed me. Most of them had an aftertaste. After researching and thank goodness to several positive reviews, I decided to try this one. I am so impressed! No after-taste, decent calories, high protein grams and the chocolate-peanut-butter taste sooo good.  I add half a banana and a tsp of honey peanut-butter (because I am extra) and who needs a candy bar when you got this? I will be trying the other flavors soon.

I'll try to keep this to the point but it may end up being long (skip to the end if you just want the summary).One day I was feeling lazy and didn't want to go to the store for my usual Protein, so I browsed on Amazon and found this. Huge amount of positive reviews (that I am now EXTREMELY skeptical of) so I decided to try it.Fast forward a few days to the order arriving. I'm immediately in love with the presentation, the black container is very solid, heavy and pleasing to the eye. I cracked open the container and immediately grinned; it smelled amazing! I excitedly blended it up (with milk) and took the first taste, expecting pure ambrosia.The results were...far poorer than expected. I have tried quite a few proteins in my day, and this one tasted the worst of them all by far. Imagine taking a cheap protein powder (which this is not BTW, it is actually fairly pricy) and storing it on the shelf for 5 years or so until it is good and expired. That's what this tastes like, expired inferior product.To add insult to injury, it makes you fairly gassy (it's not just me suddenly intaking a bunch of protein, I take my usual mix every day with no issues). As I write this, I have just given it the benefit of the doubt and tried three scoops with water just in case it was the milk affecting the taste. I am currently belching and have no doubt my gym peers will suffer as well this evening.In summary: Tastes terrible (tastes a lot like chemicals; this taste usually happens when food expires), gives you gas and is not cheap enough to justify just buying it for the protein and ignoring the side effects. This may be the first protein powder I actually throw out, it's that bad. If I could give zero stars I would.
As expected and great value
When I opened my package it was a little dusty then I could see that it expired in January 24th I am not happy and I couldn’t even get a refund
I don’t know what it tastes like but it’s barely chocolate and definitely not peanut butter.I’m not that picky when it comes to flavor of protein shakes but this one is just gross.

The peanut butter chocolate flavor honestly sucks. Tastes like chocolate with some chemicals, peanut butter sucks in this. Mixing is way clumpier than their extreme milk chocolate for whatever reason, which is a much better flavor. Pretty disappointed.

I bought this specifically because of the protein-to-carb ratio.  I have another protein powder at home that has more carbs than protein.  I'm on a low carb diet and am having difficulty getting my 160g of protein without blowing my carbs out of the water.  At 24g protein to 4 g carbs, this is an excellent choice.I was floored the first time I mixed this in with some lukewarm water after my workout.  There were no clumps.  It was smooth, and was not chalky.  Even better.  It tasted good.  I just got done with a workout and mixed it in with some chocolate almond milk and it was DELICIOUS.

Good amount of protein and amino acids.  Low sugar and carb content.  Love the PB Choco flavor.  Blends well and makes your smoothly taste fantastic.  Prefer this over most brands of whey protein.  Definitely helps with starting the day and keeping energy levels up.  Price is pretty good as well over most brands.
This tasted really good but unfortunately gave me a stomach ache. I would caution anyone who has IBS or other stomach problems to stay away.
Solid ingredients, and very easy to mix in water. Dissolves better than other brands including Muscle Milk and GNC products. Solid ingredients.

This is a close second behind Vanilla ice cream and Extreme chocolate milk.  For my drink I use one cup whole milk and one cup water.  The flavor definitely reminds me of a Reese's peanut butter cup and I am super OK drinking that.
By far the best protein I have ever tasted, it blends really good and taste is amazing 10/20 recomend3d.

When I got this product I was a skinny guy with depression now...... I'm still that but with a buff hamster I got a hamster for my birthday day and when I was going to go and get some powder for him to roll in I accidentally been giving him the protein powder and I've been hearing grunting from the corner of his cage I miss his tiny little squeaky voice now all he calls me is "bro" and one day I couldn't find him I stopped giving him the powder and he bent the bars and is roaming my house what can he want is it my lunch money or more powder I layed down mouse traps but I found him doing reps with them am I hunting him or is he hunting me

Doesn’t taste like chocolate and peanut butter but it’s still really good. This brand is the only protein that doesn’t hurt my stomach. Got a customer for life (or as long as I still use protein powder)

This mixes well, pretty good ingredients but my god it tastes like feet smell. Raaankkk. You literally have to add pb2 to tolerate. I got the “chocolate” .. nothing chocolate about it, tastes like stale lake water.

I love peanut butter. When I saw this I thought it would be worth trying. I currently use the cake batter, which I like. Quality product and chocolate peanut butter tastes really good. This is my first Optimum Nutrition product, and I would buy again.

So I just started working out on a daily basis. I needed a protein shake after my workout. I actually enjoy this protein shake. The taste is great, no complains at all. It smells like peanut butter (which I love). I don’t blend it, I put it in my shaker with almond milk and shake it then I add ice.
feeling relax after drinking this post workout

I’d love to post a photo but am not for privacy reasons. This is a supplement brand I stand by. The choco hazelnut and choco pb are the best testing. I bought this chocolate peanut butter variety recently after having used other varieties of gold standard whey protein over the years. I figured, “hey, I like peanut butter AND chocolate, so this is a no brainer!” When I first opened the container I got a nice whiff of what, one can only assume, was artificial flavoring mixed with stale cardboard. But I thought, well, maybe it will be better once mixed in with some almond milk. So after I went ahead and mixed a scoop in with my standard drink shaker, the taste started to grip my taste buds without letting go. It tasted like one of my toddlers had vomited on my front porch, let it dry, ground it up, and mixed it with some cocoa powder. I am honestly unsure how any of these other reviewers find the chocolate peanut butter delicious. Did I just get a bad batch? Are my taste buds genetically predisposed to not likening this (apparently) popular flavor? Personally, I would by any other variety before this one.
Love this protein and have been noticing results quicker when followed with the correct meal plan and workouts! The taste is more like a chocolate hazelnut it doesn’t taste like peanut butter at all.

I like this brand of protein powder and was hoping it would come in a bucket and not a big bag, I was disappointed it was in a bag.

Normally, I'm hesitant about vanilla flavors, they usually taste very artificial and even bitter to me. This had a good promotion on it, so I jumped on it as I'm always getting protein powder and wanted to stock up. I found the flavor to be good, and mixability was crazy good. Flavour is great but perhaps the brand 'Legend' delivers a better product. The product can clump a little so needs a little more effort to mix compared to other brands. Overall a more than acceptable alternative to what I usually buy at home. But if flavour and blending power are particularly desirable then 'Legend' is also a good option.
This by far better than Vitamin Shoppe's branded protien shake.

I have bought 5 of these 10 lb bags in the last couple of years, and they have always been 10 lbs.This bag received several days ago says 9.98 lbs on the label, with correspondingly less serving amount.I went back and checked the verbiage as well as a photo of the label, and it says and shows 10 lbs.  I think ON Protein is the best, but was very disappointed by this.  It appears to be misleading advertising, but I don't want to go through the hassle of returning this. This is really a matter of principle, but with the sudden extreme cost of this and other protein powders, it is disappointing to see and Amazon hasn't responded yet to an inquiry.

I have been consuming this brand for years. It mixes and dissolves well without clumps and the taste is great. When mixing with foods or drinks, I find vanilla is the most tolerable, the other flavors are okay but months of chocolate is actually not that great.
This has been my go to since i started going to the gym cant go wrong with this flavor and the results are pretty good. Highly recommended

Hii..bit about me --i practise Muay Thai along with Jujutsu. Mostly my workouts involve a lot of plyometrics, High Intensity Interval training (sprintiing and shadow boxing based) and lot of weight training (medium weights, high reps). Been working out for more then a decade now.In the past i would mostly try to get my proteins naturally (Milk, cottage cheese before sleeping, Eggs etc). it worked well but then i thought i had hit a plateau and whenever i tried to push myself more i would end up feeling tired the next day. This coupled with a day job made it difficult.Finally bit the bullet and bought the 10lb bag of ON gold standard (Vanilla, max servings among other flavors, also less of fillers from what i understand). I hate the taste of it as against Double chocolate version (tried earlier) but thats the leeast of my worriesI had considered a couple of other products as well (cheaper of course) but then i realized one ends up paying almost the same with them since the protein per serving ratio is way less then ON and hence the cost comes to the same almost. Also, ON manufactures all of its stuff in USA and extracts them there (no third party outsourcing) so that kind of tilted me in their favour..Difference / Observations --Things have started looking up no doubt. Able to shed that last bit of stubborn fat from the waist and i can go all nuclear on my ass with respect to workouts daily without that tiredness.Additionally, lactic acid buildup is down to a minimal and muscle definition plus growth is a definite YES.Word of caution -- i have been supplementing with L-Glutamine(early morning and late night) and BCAA's(pre, during and post workouts) as well (ON again). Me thinks that they have played some role in the overall improvement as well but then there are loads who believe GLutamine is just expensive Urine and BCAA's are useless since 1 serving of ON Whey already provides 5.5 gms BCAA's and rest one would get from their daily diet. (seperate review on Glutamine and BCAA's under the respective products).Also, i have been very strict with my diet as well off late so that is another reason for the vast improvements. (abs are made in the kitchen like they say :D)Rating -- 4.5 stars (i dont want those fillers in it but then thats impossible to avoid for this kind of protein right)Next in line --get rid of glutamine and BCAA's and jump to Creatine and Beta Alanine instead. this would be a game changer for sure. will sit on it for sometime and then take the plunge.(the water weight gain from creatine is a concern since i need to be faster more then bulkier)..

ON protein is in my opinion by far the best protein powder around, nothing compares to it and I mean NOTHING! The flavor is delicious, it blends well, there’s no grittiness to it, it doesn’t taste like plastic or chemical, nor does it smell like it and, there’s a good amount of protein being provided per scoop.My favorite flavors are vanilla ice cream and extreme milk chocolate, the smell is great and they taste delicious. I use protein powder as a "supplement" to my nutrition and fitness regimen. I’m not a fitness competitor or body builder but I do love to workout and have done a great job of building muscles so, having protein powder on hand as a supplement is important to me especially after I workout, I have a shake to feed my muscles immediately after. I’ve used ON for years but I’ve also tried a lot of protein powders by different brands (some good, some bad); I was even sponsored by two different well known sports nutrition supplement companies before but, nothing was as good as ON, I found myself going back to it and now I stick with it.I use one scoop of protein with unsweetened original almond milk, it tastes better than using water, I’m not a fan of any protein powder combined with water, it’s not as pleasant.I’m not sponsored by ON, nor do I get anything for leaving this review but as a consumer, I LOVE it! I also like reading reviews because it helps me when purchasing products so I do my best to leave reviews because I know it helps.The bag was completely sealed from the inside out, the scoop was just under the surface I didn't have to dig far to get it. The first scoop out of this bag went to my protein smoothie, yum!
Great flavor, great product. It is cheaper to buy two 5 pounders at Costco than a 10 pounder on Amazon, but Amazon does have a better selection of sizes and flavors.
Size comparison to the cosctco five pound bag came about 60-70% full and used my Amazon points to only pay 15$ totally worth it great taste and quality product and not to mention almost full.

This is the best protein powder out there hands down. I have been bodybuilding for years and tried various protein powders. It mixes easily with milk, almond milk, or water and tastes great. It also mixes extremely well with other fruits for smoothies. The only issue with the product I have over the years is the increase in prices. Hopefully if other customers like this review it will show we would like a price reduction in the protein we so desperately love. Cut the cost please!
La bolsa llegó rota,eso fue lo que no me gustó

Well, i have previously rated this protein in a different, worse flavor and gave it 5 stars, but after having tried the BSN Syntha-6 products, the most i can give it is 4/5, but that is in the flavor department. I can not put them at the sasme level. That would be unfair to Syntha-6 and anyone reading reviews to try to make a decision on a purchase.In terms of quality of the protein I think everybody knows this is a very high quality product. If you are training and are not supplementing with protein you are probably not at your 100% because the requirements of protein for a good balanced diet are way above the FDA suggested ranges. This product is very good for people trying to lose weight because it gives you a lot of protein and practically none carbs and fats. Mixed with one cup of skim milk tthe shake has barely 200 calories giving you a total of about 30grams of protein (24g the protein powder and 6-8 the milk).As i said, this is a very tasteful produt, but if you are trying to get something to make the protein comsumption delightful you need to look to Syntha6. You will have to pay a much higher price per dose though. That is why this product must be consider excvellent too: it is one of the cheapest protein that you can buy, making it very good bang gfor your buck.
By far the best protein source I have every tasted and this size has a great value to it.

First off, the seller is great. Got the product in perfect condition in a timely manner. (Two days for me w/ PRIME.)The protein tastes as good as any other whey I've ever had. It mixes very well and I just use a small shaker cup and water and/or milk. No clumps or anything with one scoop whey. So everything is as to be expected.My only issue is the bag. The seal is like that of a cheap plastic ziplock bag. For me, opening this once or twice a day, the seal just doesn't seem to last. Once the seal doesn't close tightly, the protein takes on a bad taste (probably it going bad huh? haha), but I usually just stomach through it. I have left over 5 lb tubs, so what I do know is just dump in straight into the 5lb tubs and store it with those. A friend of mine just uses one 5 lb tub, and then wraps and seals the 10 lb bag, until done with the other.Either way I recommend you look into a new way to store it, but really I think Optimum Nutrition is the best protein I've had. So far all the flavors have been decent. Just take into consideration what you may be mixing it with. Like don't buy coffee flavor to make fruit smoothies, :)

I love this powder. I’ve tried so many and this is by far the best, in terms of quality and results. Here are my 3 huge reasons to buy;1)Optimum Nutrition is an extremely legit company, and is constantly tested.2)The flavors are NOT bad. If you get vanilla don’t just mix it with water, add fruit/fruit juice and it tastes great.3)The Gold Standard includes 5.5g of BCAA’s and 4g of glutamine. This is amazing. Those are great for building muscle and recovery, and most protein powders don’t include them. A lot of people pay way extra for those, but this powder already had them...insane deal.

First of all, HUGE BAG. Did not read the fine print. Not a problem though. I was out of milk and then ice and even with gross lukewarm water this blends well and tastes great. Can’t speak to results yet since I’ve just started using it but no regrets so far!

Not my first time to decide I have had enough with Gold Standard and decide to change with other Whey protein, not after very long I decide I have taken the wrong decision. I am an old gym fanatic who has been weight lifting for 8 years. Gold standard is a good choice for your if you are a beginner or someone who is trying to build adequate physique, probably not the best if you aim at taking parts in body building competitions, then you may need one with zero carbs.

Just received my 10 pound bag of vanilla ice cream gold standard whey. First things first, The bag weighs a little over 10 pounds and it is FILLED to the brim! that seems to be a major problem with protein lately is a huge tub only filled up half way, well that is not the case here.Taste, I love this stuff because its easy to slam down quick and in my opinion that is what a protein shake is for. I have some Amplified Wheybolic Extreme from gnc that I had to buy in a pinch a couple weeks ago and I can honestly say the Gold Standard stuff is unbelievably better... not only taste but how it mixes up and the serving size, I don't even wanna mention the cost lol, think the 3lb gnc wheybolic cost around $60 and I payed $97 for 10 POUNDS of gold standard...Needless to say I have found my go-to for protein now!
This is some of the best protein powder (hence the 10lb bag :). The flavor is good and it blends well. I use this in most of my baking and it works great, you wouldn’t even know it was there.

Like most protein powders, flavor and mixability are not fantastic.  However, it is one of the better I have found in terms of mixing (I mix with room-temp water - it  clumps in cold).  The vanilla flavor is less chalky than the chocolate.
My favorite protein powder.I found a slightly lower price at an online retailer, that I have purchased from before. With Prime, shipping was 1-2days vs over 2 weeks from the other source.

One of the better kind of Whey out there. I've been testing out other whey brands but Optimum Nutrion's product provides just the right balance. You'll know you are getting your money's worth when you buy this product. A week or two after using, I noticed that the gains I've been getting is  more than that of other whey powders I've tried. The vanilla flavor is not too shabby. Perfect addition to black coffee or a base for a shake. Get the 10lbs pack for maximum savings. Product expiry is about 18 months from purchase which is plenty of time.
This is a quality protein. The vanilla flavor is not overpowering and does not have a strong aftertaste.

It's priced exactly what you'd expect for a 10lb bag. ON Whey is about the best balance between quality and cost, and calling it "gold standard" is very appropriate. Whatever your dietary goals are, you have very little carbs/fat and strictly protein. 110-120 calories a serving (excluding milk if you mix it with that), I'd think it to be a staple of whatever active lifestyle you have. I've been buying this for over ten years and don't plan to stop as long as they never change!

What's not to like about this protein powder? It works great and tastes even better. I've been using this protein powder for years and recommend it to others. I found that blending it with milk really works well and makes it enjoyable to drink. It tastes like a vanilla milkshake. I only found the metallic/chemical taste to be true when blending with water.
Save at least 10-15 from buying the tubs.  Its has a top seal so it wont go bad.

Upon reading about ON and their quality supplements, there wasn't a doubt in my mind that they are one of the top producers of whey protein in the market. Before I was using BSN Syntha-6, but wanted to try something different. So when I saw the 10 pound bag of ON Gold Standard, in the vanilla ice cream flavor, selling for around 80 bucks I jumped on it. I just received it in the mail today and am excited to start using. I like this protein powder and flavor, but they sent a 10-pound package that's expiring in less than 7 months... It's just not plausible for me to finish all of this until then, they need to be more careful about close expiration dates.

I used to buy the 10lb vanilla icecream flavor for only one reason, it came with 154 24g servings instead of 140 or 139 like the other flavors. I beleive this was because it required less flavoring and coloring than the others so you would get more protein for 10 pounds of the powder in comparison to the other flavors. When I got mine the packaging was different and it said "NEW AND IMPROVED GREAT TASTE" and the servings per bag dropped to 146. I know that 8 servings isn't much of a difference but that is 192g less of protein that you are getting and the only reason I really bought this flavor was because of THE AMOUNT OF PROTEIN I was getting for what I pay, because flavor isn't what matters.

My personal opinion is that I didn't like the vanilla. I tasted the chocolate. That was better. I chose this one because it had the least amount of carbohydrates. I would be happier if it had Zero carbs. Like flat line zero but then that would be a whole different product: amino acids.

I was doing a lot of research and looking for a good whey on amazon and my conclusion was that this product will give you the best value for money of all the whey.I believe that it's not the very best in the field but it tastes good, mixed good with no grains of whey left in the shaker,it's will do for half a year with one dish every day.All and all a very good product.

I received this product and after inspection of the expiry date, I realized that I have until July 2021 to use this; the manufactured date was July 2019. Ordinarily I wouldn't have mind this, but why sell a product so close to the expiry date? I don't usually use this as consistently so I thought this bag could last me a while. Now it looks like I'll have to be bathing in this thing so I don't let any go to waste. Disappointed.
10lb bag of protein powder was ripped upon receipt.

I've been using this for years. Yes, it's more expensive than some of the other brands, but it mixes well and tastes good.  I use this mixed with whole milk to take my vitamins as soon as I get up in the morning. It leaves me feeling energized and at 55 years young it really helps me maintain my muscle mass and tone.  I've tried other brands of whey protein and this is the best I've used.  In this case, you really do get what you pay for.

Completely and utterly disappointed with Optimum Nutrition. I jumped on a recent discount of the Ice Cream Vanilla flavor expecting to receive the same product. However, to my dismay they have pulled a fast one on me, and perhaps other consumers. They have branded their product with the infamous "New, Improved Great Taste" sticker. That was foreshadowing. A bad omen if anything. Upon checking the nutritional facts you find out that they have gone to the dark side and chosen to add more filler to the protein by reducing the protein-by-weight by 5%. If you were to compare it to a previous product (or maybe even the 10lb bag) you will be surprised to find that the protein-by-weight ratio is the original 82% and not the now 77%. Also, upon further comparison, you find more evidence to reinforce their probable protein spiking by looking at the serving size. The serving size has increased from 29.4G to 31G. You be the judge, but unfortunately for this company, I will no longer be purchasing from them any longer. I  may also seek to ensure my friends/co-workers/family are notified of such an esteemed product breaking down and following the crowd. I bounced between this product and an unflavored whey protein isolate from NOW, which I am definitely considering returning to. At least their product has not changed their "formula".

This is yummy! Mixes well with water or almond milk. I also add it to my smoothie for some sweetness. High in protein and low in carbs/fat... perfect for anyone who needs to supplement with protein. This powder is finer than other brands I've tried, although it doesn't really make a difference once it's dissolved into the liquid.It comes in a large bag that's very difficult to take in and out.. I pour them into smaller buckets that I have... easier to store and minimizes air exposure.
We are on our 5th order and often combine this with fruits, vegetable, or PB powder and bananas..best easy breakfast to start the day

First, I am not a discriminate taster and this review is based on Vanilla proteins only. I seek a solid Cost to Quality deal over all others. With that being said, the ON Vanilla Ice Cream is by far the worst tasting protein I have ever tried. It tastes like a medicine that attempts to mask its ingredients.I am a huge fan of ON in general. The price is solid when you consider the level of BCAAs and Glutamine that are included. When it came time to replenish my Protein stocks several months ago, I came across a great deal on MET-RX Natural Vanilla Whey and decided to give it a try. Let me just say wow…that stuff is incredible. I use it in my veggie smoothies to mask the kale, broccoli, and spinach as well as pre and post workout shakes . With this ON Vanilla Ice, I have to add Gatoraid powder. MET-RX lacks the glutamine.So…..I would still by whichever protein has the cheapest price per serving. Stay away from ON Vanilla Ice Cream and if you can score MET-RX on sale, give it a try.

I started to not bother writing a review as this product already has a lot of favorable reviews. I decided to go ahead so I could tell my story.I initially started my weight loss journey in March of 2022. Mainly through intermittent fasting. I quickly started losing weight and I was ecstatic. At that point, feeling hyped up by the weight loss, I decided to join a local gym. My main focus was weight loss. I only really cared about seeing the numbers drop on the scale…and drop they did. I am 5’2 and my starting weight was 156. I have a small frame and have been anywhere from 103 (high school) to 122 (after having 2nd child). Most people felt 156 looked great on me…maybe so but to me it was too much. My stomach always stayed relatively flat, so the weight was in my thighs and butt.Anyway, I digress. So after joining the gym in May I was able to get my weight down to 128 by mid August. Although I was down to 128 my body didn’t look tone. I was thinking it was because of my age (45). I was disappointed as I thought that would just be the way it was.I ended up having a conversation with someone in the gym and they suggested I increase my protein intake and start focusing on weight training. I agreed. After about 2 months of consistent weight training (4-5x a week) and consistent whey protein intake my body started to transform. I COULD NOT believe it. Maybe subconsciously didn’t think it would work. I also increased my caloric intake as well because I was so focus initially on losing weight I was in a severe caloric deficit. I am now at about 130-132 and I’m am loving the way my body looks and feel. I’m not done sculpting yet but I am so excited to see what I’ll be looking like by May 2023, which be a year since starting the gym.I’m not trying to look like a pro body builder or anything like that, I just want to be nicely toned.I LOVE THIS WHEY PROTEIN. It is the way to go if you are trying to build muscle and tone. I ordered it in vanilla flavor and the taste isn’t bad. I definitely recommend! 👍🏾👍🏾

I am working toward a goal of a 1200lbs total in the big three lifts and purchased this for its more complete formula than my previous post workout shake. It has absolutely made my recovery more effective and helped me move closer to my goals. With that being said I'm not sure I'm thrilled with the taste (milk chocolate), its not terrible but its not great either. I would also say that my gut has suffered, and those around me have suffered for it as well, its a pretty common symptom of protein shakes but ive gone a while without experiencing it and i have not experienced it to this level before. Other than gastric distress this is a great product, if i find a way to mitigate that ill purchase this again.

I am still relatively new to the gym and buying protein powders, but from what I have ordered, this is the best tasting powder by far. I have tried Optimum Nutrition's Cake Batter flavored Whey, Body Fortress's chocolate Whey, and XTend's vanilla ice cream Whey, and this one beats all of them buy a mile.I'm not a huge fan of making protein shakes, so instead, I like to find other ways to use protein powder. I start every day with a mug of coffee from my Keurig and add in a scoop of powder. Body Fortress's chocolate protein powder produced a lot of clumps of stubborn powder at the top of the coffee, and underneath, it didn't really do much to make the coffee taste like a mocha. It was alright, but it definitely didn't improve taste much. Nitro Tech, on the other hand, mixes perfectly into the coffee when stirred. There is still some of the froth at the top like Body Fortress, but it isn't nearly as much protein powder. On top of that, it tastes amazing! After passing through the frothy layer, it tastes like I mixed 50% hot chocolate with 50% coffee! For someone who doesn't like the taste of straight black coffee, this is an absolute win!Another use I like is to make protein pancakes! It's easy: add half a cup of milk, two eggs, and one scoop of your desired protein powder to a shaker bottle and shake until homogenous. Then, pour onto a pan on medium heat until they are ready to flip for three light, medium sized pancakes (or one large one if you're like me :) ). Again, this powder comes out on top! The chocolate taste is a little subtle, but sweet! And it doesn't have the clumping problem other powders have.If you are sitting on the fence about picking up this brand, I urge you: give it a try! Getting my daily protein isn't a chore anymore thanks to this stuff, and now I can focus on more important things, like getting these gains!

It mixes well in water or milk, tastes great and could see considerable difference in muscle mass with exercise. I believe this brand got me as a loyal customer. This is my 3rd purchase.Value for the money is on point!

I personally don't have any food allergies and I have a tough stomach. I can eat almost all prepared foods.I read the reviews talking about people getting sick from drinking this, and that it tastes terrible, and I was really worried. The negative reviews are very scary! But I tried this anyway and I am SO GLAD I DID !!!I didn't have any problems with the taste or digestion. Its an excellent tasting product honestly and it gets the job done and its an excellent value for your money at 30g of protein / serving! I believe in this product and will be buying it monthly.Edit: I also want to comment on authenticity and respond to those who are saying this could be a fake powder. Just download the authenticator app (instructions on the bottle you will receive) and it will authenticate the powder for you. Follow the instructions and double check your work if you like. If it comes up as anything but authentic, then return the bottle!

I've been bodybuilding on and off for 15 years. This is hands down the best whey I've ever had. It mixes well, the taste is actually enjoyable!

Outstanding product. 30g of protein with each serving, plus BCAAs and creatine. Chocolate tastes so good, it’s like dessert, it’s that good. Vanilla, kinda meh. Calculate cost per serving and protein quantity and you’ll find Nitrotechnos a pretty good value as well.
excelente

Pretty high quality isolate with creatine and bcaa built in, which replaced my creatine and bcaa capsules. Almost double the servings for the same price as my usual plant based protein powder. I like to go back and forth between the two. Way better quality than the crap at Costco.
I find this product helpful in healing of the micro tears of the muscles.  I’ve seen some really good gains.  This is a re order of a 10lb pound bag.
Nada
Easy to mix, taste amazing, and it doesn't give nasty gas like other name brands protein powered. I'm taking about you Syntha 6. I'd definitely go for the 10lb bag. Better value there by far.

I have strength trained all my life and am very disciplined.  I have always been in good shape.  Tried this product, and it does work.  You will bulk up some and gain a few extra pounds of muscle.  But you have to stay on it.  Once you stop taking it, any gains will be lost.  For my part, considering the cost, remembering to take it every day, it just isn't worth it.  As I said, except for a little extra bulk, I do just as well without it.
Taste like chocolate dry cat food, you really need to force yourself to eat this stuff. Can't deny that it works, get it for the gains but beware the smell will nearly make you gag.

I’ve been using muscletech protein since a year and really is a good product with no side effects.Works good on me and cost wise also it is good.The taste of this product is really greatRecommended 👍👍
Really good protein for value. Mixed very well with milk and water! BUT, mix can be a little TOO frothy for my liking...

Im sure the macros and micronutrients are all as advertised but this is probably the worst tasting protein powder I have ever had. Bought it to save some money over optimum nutrition but it ended up taking me 8 months to get through the 10lbs. That's about 4x as long as when I have a shake my girlfriend and I enjoy. I only ended up powering through the majority of this (by myself) after stocking up on pb powder and bananas to blend with it.
Por que un envase tan grande. Si solo tiene la mitad del producto. Eso no tiene sentido y parece estafa.😡Me arrepiento de comprarlo.👎Solo espero que el producto sea verdadero y funcione .😥

This is my favorite protein powder of all time so I bought a lot of it. Unfortunately it tastes like it’s been heat cycled and tastes off

Great flavor and the results in strength can be felt!
Good quality protein but that taste is almost unbearable and the smell is even worse. I spent $65 and now I have to finish it but it ain't gonna be easy
