I received the chocolate peanut butter flavor, and it tastes very stale/almost like cardboard.
Tastes like peanut butter scoop. Throw a banana some strawberries, ice a shot of expresso and you got one hell of a smoothie

Protein powders can be very complicated. You don't need extra stuff. You just need a high quality whey protein which this is. Have used this for years. It is very high quality. No extra stuff in here. Plenty of flavor options too. I recomend peanut butter chocolate. As a practicing medical doctor I trust this product and use it every day whether I work out in the gym or not. I lift about 3 to 4 days a week.

Not all flavors are created equal at Optimum Nutrition, fact of the matter is, the taste of powdered peanut butter is still one that remains a few light-years off the mark.There are lots of great flavors of whey here at ON, but Chocolate Peanut Butter is not one of them.Can't Recommend.
Always the greatest. Nothing compares. Quality
You can go wrong with gold standard one of favorites in flavors and results

I've been using this product as my protein supplement after workouts for about a year now. I have gained some serious weight by consuming this product after every workout. I also like the fact that it has so many flavors to choose from, so you won't get tired of it.
The flavor used to be better, not such a bad aftertaste. I'd recommend going with the Extreme Milk Chocolate, Double Rich Chocolate, or French Vanilla flavors instead.

This is pretty much the pinnacle of modern protein powders, just about any bodybuilder,power lifter,strongman, or weightlifter is going to be using this brand (or they will have used it before). Now in all my experience of protein powders, anything that isn’t chocolate flavored likely tastes terrible (I’m not sure why that is but others seem to be of similar opinions). Now with all that being said it’s a nice protein powder and if you ever need a break from it I recommend the Rule 1 brand.
The chocolate peanut butter flavor is excellent. Mixes easily with a blender bottle and helps build muscle and gain weight after cancer treatment.
Great for breakfast and/or post strength training recovery. I love this flavor and how easily it blends!

People talk about the chemical flavor with this one, I would agree, but you kinda get used to it.  I absolutely hated this flavor, but figured I'd eat it since I couldn't return it.  It kinda grew on me to be honest.  At the end of the tub it's not as bad as the beginning.  But I'm excited for the double chocolate again.

This is my new favorite flavor! This company co to yes to impress me with flavor, how it mixes up, and the effect of the protein it advertises. I have used this company for years and have seen great growth both in strength and size of muscle. It would be very hard to get me to try another company.
THis isnt a bad flavor but its not for me thats for sure. It taste a lot like a peanut butter malt but i cant get past the taste it leaves in my mouth.

Protein levels are on par with other, less reputable brands but you are OPTIMUM! How about you guys do something and try to make the messy ass powder easier to use? Sure the protein is good but I'm sure everyone understands the powder mess that gets wasted consistently.  I've been on and off with this brand for a LONG time and feel they should have tried to improve something by now. The powder density, the scoop spoon, something!
I only use ON products but the peanut butter chocolate is so foul I can barely get it down. I take this not for the taste but this stuff is so gross. Avoid this flavor at all costs.

I ordered the 5 lbs jar of chocolate and peanut butter around super bowl time frame. It lasted approximately one month and in that month I truly believe this product is jem.Excellent taste I could drink more shakes in day with this product, but at $60 a jar I believe that’s just a little to step.

I thought that the chocolate peanut butter would be my favorite. But it is not good at all. But chocolate mint is wonderful, mocha cappuccino is wonderful and so is the banana. Strawberries and cream and vanilla ice cream is meh.
When delivered the top was broken with powder coming out of it.

So, I've tried a ton of proteins over the years. Optimum has always stood out in my mind. It blends super easy (even without a blender ball), tastes better than most protein powders (FYI, I think they all taste terrible), and is a product I trust.
I blend it by hand with a knife and a cup.  The flavor does actually resemble that of chocolate and peanut butter.

Honestly best protein around.1. Doesn’t give you a stomach ache 🤩.2. Mixes well 🤩.3. This flavor is amazing 🤩.I was not sure if I wanted to spend the extra money on flavor but I got tired of drinking double chocolate, and now I don’t want to go back! Trust me if you like peanut butter and chocolate then this is a win.

Let me just say this; you can't go wrong with protein, no matter the taste.With that said, this is a weird flavor. I purchased chocolate peanut butter and didn't really know what to expect. I thought if anything it would just taste like chocolate and nothing else. I was wrong. This stuff has such a uniquely weird smell and taste that I still can't wrap my head around it. Sometimes it tastes like salsa, other times it tastes like corn or even carrots. It's not technically bad, but it's definitely not chocolate and peanut butter. To put things into perspective, I bought the 5lb tub and plan on consuming all of it. In no way is the flavor repulsive, but it's just not good. Hopefully that makes sense. I'd recommend the Chocolate Coconut or Chocolate Mint. Anything is better than this.

I've been using this brand (Optimum Nutrition) and it makes a good protein shake. Personally I use unflavored almond milk. I bought this thinking that they'd get the flavor right... nope, not for this one IMO (Chocolate Peanut Butter). It does taste like chocolate & peanut butter, but for me there is a weird taste that I can best describe as "artificial". It's tolerable but I don't think I'd buy this flavor again. I've enjoyed the "cookies & cream" and "rocky road" flavors in the past. Hopefully they can improve their recipe for this flavor in the future.

A friend of mine got me started on Gold Standard.  My first 5lb tub was the chocolate.  The flavor was fantastic, even with water.  Because of that experience, I didn't hesitate to order the Chocolate Peanut Butter.  Generally speaking Chocolate Peanut Butter is my favorite flavor of protein.  I was very excited to try this one.However, to say I was disappointed is an understatement.  It tastes nothing like Chocolate Peanut Butter.  The closest thing I can think to compare it to would be a very cheap version of shelf-stable fake cheese in a tin can that previously contained dog vomit.  I have drank it several times hoping it will grow on me, but it hasn't.  Normally my post workout protein shake feels like a reward for a good workout.  Now it just feels like punishment . . . and I still have 4.5 lbs of this.  I will definitely stick with ON Gold Standard, but NOT the Chocolate Peanut Butter.

I've tried four flavors of ON protein, and chocolate peanut butter is now my least favorite due to taste.  To me, it tastes somewhat bitter, like when a few burned peanuts make it through the screening process in a jar of shelled peanuts.  I'm tempted to return it.  I may try mixing with other ON proteins to reduce the bad flavor.I guess the low price (of the six flavors Amazon had in stock at the time of order) should have tipped me off that someone was trying to unload some bad product quickly.  I hope ON corrects this mistake.

I’ve tried other products, and I have to say I will never stray away from this protein powder ever again. This flavor is amazing, it blends so smooth and fast. Do your self a favor and get this protein powder, you can’t go wrong with one of the most trusted companies in the game.

This has rich chocolate and peanut butter flavor, plenty of protein, and there's a lot of servings in 1 container! The downside (and it's a big one) is that it does not mix well at all. I've tried water, milk, almond milk, cashew milk, rice milk, and coffee (all cold & hot) but still just clumps together once it touches the fluid. I've tried stirring, shakers, and blenders but this stuff just sticks to everything.

The Chocolate Peanut Butter protein powder is by far their best tasting flavor. That said, BE WARY of the ingredients on each different flavor, as they all differ. Chocolate Peanut Butter, in this case, has MALTODEXTRIN in it. I for one am disappointed, as it is my favorite flavor so far, but I will never buy it again. Maltodextrin, as you may know, if you're educated in nutrition at least, is by far the worst sweetener known to the world right now, with the highest glycemic index. If you don't know what that is, it means it spikes your insulin higher than any other sweetener out there. Table sugar is a 65, and maltodextrin is typically 110, to put it in perspective. Just use table sugar in your flavor if you want to cause slow diabetes, Optimum Nutrition, not maltodextrin, which will ROCKET people into diabetes.

This stuff is awesome. Normally whey protein has a grainy and gritty type of taste(Those who use protein regularly probably know what I’m talking about) but not this stuff. Tastes great, works great and mixes very well. I’m a little extra so I add 4 tablespoons of PB Fit to it to give it just a little extra PB flavor and protein, OMG. 👌👌👌👌 Love it

I have tried Vanilla Ice Cream and regular Chocolate before, and they were fantastic. However, this "Chocolate Penutbutter" flavor or whatever it is is sub par in terms of flavor for the price. I will be selecting a different flavor next time.
Fantastic ingredients and beautiful flavor, can globule/settle at the bottom of shakers though. I recommend some liquid first, then your scoop(s), then the remainder of your liquid.

I like Optimum's products. I enjoy their standard chocolate flavor a lot, so when I saw their chocolate peanut I thought it would be tasty. Holy crap I was wrong. The aftertaste is unbearable. Whoever approved this flavor deserves the death penalty.
I’ve bought many kinds of protein powders and would recommend this one in a heartbeat! Flavor is fantastic, and the price is fair market.

How do I measure the powder without a scoop? I dumped the entire contents of the  5 pound tub into bowls & there isn’t a scoop...Just editing my previous review: we figured out that you need just under 1/2 cup of the powder per serving for each shake... and I used water... it tastes decent. I still would have appreciated a scoop... but I’m guessing it was a packaging issue.
almost all the other flavors are good except chocolate peanut butter.

ON is a good brand. It is a fine powder but I would not say it tastes like choc PB. Syntha 6 has a better choc PB flavor but unfortunately, more carbs.I shall get used to it, but will possibly get plain choc next time.

I have tried several other flavors from this brand and so far this flavor is the absolute worse one for me. Soon as I open the container it smells really strange and chemically but I thought maybe that was just the smell and the taste would be much better but boy was I wrong. It just isn't a very good flavor at all. I can't describe it exactly but the only thing I can say is while trying to drink it down I am having force myself to drink it and I have never had that problem with any other flavors. I in fact usually consider it a treat but it almost feels like a punishment to drink this stuff.

The flavor is really weird if taken by itself, but this one for some reason blends a lot better than any other whey protein I’ve ever bought. The quality of the protein is great, though, as you’d expect from this brand.
The top brand in the protein business. Doesn’t disappoint, with good flavor and nice amount of whey protein.
I’ve tried many protein powders. This is by far the best tasting. Chocolate peanut butter 👍🏻
I really liked this flavor. It has a slight chocolate taste with the peanut butter. At least to me, it does anyway.

This stuff is awesome, smells and tastes great in my peanut butter banana smoothies.Low in carbs and has all the ingredients you need whether you’re looking to bulk up or just supplement some protein for your weight loss diet.

This protein powder blends really well in a shaker bottle. I do not like the flavor at all, it’s very bland. I like other brands because one scoop has 30g protein where this only has about 24g. It could be better.
Oh boy more protein powered the spouse wanted that’ll never get used. Why is the jar always so big
Mixes very smooth with a shaker bottle and tastes great.
This item came full but no seal. I dont trust unsealed products.  It was an open product
Whatever other brand I use, I always come back to this old school
This is a great protein don’t get me wrong. It’s just the flavor is not that good.
This stuff is delicious and works well. It's great for post workout and you'll actually see results if you put the work in. It also makes for very tasty peanut butter protein bars.
Our blinds good in the blender

This chocolate peanut butter flavor was BY FAR the best flavored protein I have ever had. I had multiple people tell it smelled good LOL and it was tasty with some PBFit powder mixed in there too. Would order again.
I don't know if I would buy again. Has a funky smell and doesn't really taste like peanut butter.
Well worth the investment, enjoying this flavor very much every morning! Always love the ON brand.
Isnt called the “Gold standard” for nothin’
I've seen many reviews about the flavor being terrible, I absolutely love the peanut butter especially with milk. Great product I highly recommend and will be buying again.
Best tasting and best quality protein I have ever had!
I mix my chocolate peanut butter with almond milk and some glycine. It’s tastes so good. Would recommend!
Went in with low expectations, but the taste is great. can be hard to blend at times, otherwise i have no complaints
i give this whey powder an A++ works great and taste really good
Liked the taste & larger container lasts for a long time
My family used this daily!! Can't beat the price and it taste great mixed with my Herbalife Formula 1!

The taste is horrible!  Tastes like dirt.  I love chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, chocolate coconut and rocky road.  The coffee flavor isn't that great.  Should be able to comment without giving 1 star.  For taste, it's definitely a negative.

First, let me just say I've tried most of the flavors of this protein powder. Double rich chocolate, French vanilla, vanilla ice cream, cookies and cream, even coffee and all were very good. The chocolate peanut butter is not good at all. It has a strange, almost chemical aftertaste. It doesn't really taste like chocolate or peanut butter for that matter. This formula also seems to be a bit finer than the others. I also bought a 5 pound tub... so wish me luck getting through this.
Just tastes like chocolate, disappointing but at least the chocolate flavor is good.
Most protein powders pack in the protein but not so many pack in the taste. This one does!

I ordered the 5lb. Chocolate Peanut Butter flavor twice over the past 2-3 months. The first one I received tasted and smelled great, had no issues. I ordered another one last week and the smell and taste was completely different. It had a very weird smell to it and I was nauseous and sick within an hour of drinking it. I felt completely fine after a couple hours and decided to try it again the next day to make sure it was the shake and not something I ate. Again, I was nauseous and getting sick. Not sure if I got a bad batch or if the seal was compromised during shipping or what. I've seen a lot of similar reviews are they are correct. You don't know if you're going to get a good or bad product. Not worth the risk just go to a store that carries it. I was able to get my money back and bought the same product from GNC which I am currently using and it tastes great.
Great product, tastes fantastic, good value

Llegó en excelente condiciones y por el precio es bastante bueno buen sabor se disuelve rapido en el vaso buen aspecto aroma y color el envase es grande la cantidad dentro es aceptable es una buena inversión.

I've used this Whey Protein for years mostly the dark rich chocolate.  I decided to try the Chocolate Peanut Butter and it was a big mistake, never again.  In order to tolerate the taste you need to mix in natural peanut butter or some other mixture to mask the flavor.  Whomever designed this flavor, should be fired.  I will continue to use ON Whey Protein but not this flavor.
This fake peanut butter flavor is very unpleasant. It finishes horribly.
No scoop in it. I guess because they think I will measure it with my hands.
I tried different powders but this is my favorite brand it  taste good and works well with my daily workout.
The flavor is really bad, i prefer cappuccino

Am I the only one that thinks the peanut butter flavor taste like dirt? At first I thought it tasted like what old socks smell like, but then I thought more like dirt. Honestly, I love double fudge flavor but decided to try peanut butter flavor because I love chocolate and peanut butter. I don’t understand people gave it five stars for the flavor category. I’m guessing their taste buds are out of whack. It made me feel nauseous.  By the way, what does the blending powder category mean?

I got the chocolate peanut butter. It tastes great for a split second, and then a horrible chemically aftertaste hits you. I did some research to make sure I wasn't poisoning myself and it seems like it's caused from high amounts of sucralose in the powder. This used to be my favorite brand back in the day, but coming back to it years later they destroyed the taste.
Best protein I’ve ever had!
Great whey protein but chocolate peanut butter flavor is disgusting, taste like fake peanut butter....

This is bomb. I like the bulk so I can keep it at work for a good month or two without worrying about getting more. It's way cheaper getting this much at a time. And tastes freaking delicious. Good sh** 🤙🏻🤙🏻
not bad for a protein powder this flavor is definitely one of the better ones i tried. blends well with only a blender ball

I bought this to put in coffee. I've been doing the low-carb diet for like 8 months & I'm still trying to find my groove. I eat many veggies & can stay in ketosis well but with some of my health issues loss is very slow. I've lost 35 lbs though so I'm sticking to it. I would always go up and down a couple pounds every couple days . I was happy just not to gain so I haven't stressed it. Well I started using this protein (only like a month cause I only use one scoop) and while I stay in ketosis, I went up 4.5 lbs in a 2wks. I didn't understand & then decided to stop this in my coffee, within a week I've lost those extra LBs again. Something in this stuff stalls my loss and had me gaining a tiny bit. Just fyi. If your low carb and still trying to lose/having issues, try cutting this. I don't love breakfast, so having protein coffee was perfect and filling but it's not working in my low carb goals.

Container came half full that was expected since it is SOLD BY WEIGHT! not by the size of the container so who cares if it is full to the top or half full?!?!?!?!?!?  Didn't anyone complaining about half full ever buy a bag of potato chips?Mixed this with 1 carb per 8oz vanilla milk and about a scoop and a half of the chocolate mix and blended it up with a small mixer and it was awesome. The 8oz ended up frothing up a lot and filled a 16oz cup. Very light and fluffy. I put some in the freezer and I can't say it was just like ice cream but it was really good!

Some of these protein powders are both expensive and laden with sugar. We as Americans know the game, add sugar and everyone likes it. This has lower sugar than most (1 gram per serving) 30 grams of protein and is 150 calories. I mixed mine with unsweetened almond milk (Kirkland brand from Costco) and mixed it in a small blender. It turned out creamy and like a milkshake, which was great as a breakfast drink replacement. The trick is to be satisfied with just that in order to lose weight. I am working on that part. It is initially filling, but if you are like me, an hour later you're saying, "what else is for breakfast". That is just me.

I'm surprised at many of the other reviews, it's like people are getting a different product then I did.I think this whey is great, though I never had it in bottle form so can't compare it to that. Bottled premixed shakes are almost always different and overall better then the shakes made at home but its always been that way so should be expected. People saying this "doesn't taste like coffee" but the flavor isn't even coffee, it's cafe latte. I assumed it would taste something like coffee and it sort of does. To me is tastes like the smell of coffee you'd smell walking through a mall. It's a great whey and PP is one of the few brands that don't use soy.Only complaint is it doesn't mix all that well, though for me making a shake consists of putting 2 scoops in a water-bottle via funnel after taking a few sips out of it and shaking it. I noticed over the years this method works easy with some brand/flavors and not with others. I still recommend it highly though, just don't expect it to taste like starbucks mocha whatever it's called and use a blender!

I wanted a very basic flavor with a low carb count. I am currently using 1/4 cup of Jordan's pina colada skinny syrup. With almond milk fortified with a bit of heavy whipping cream for added creaminess and a cup of ice cubes in the blender, I have a very satisfying smoothie with a great taste and a low carb count. I am quite satisfied with this product and have been using it daily for 3 months now. No plans to switch to a different product.

I usually drink the pre-made bottled product. I happened to see the powder and thought I would try it since the Cafe Latte is my favorite flavor. Also, the bottled drink has gotten way too expensive. I think the flavor is really good. However, I am confused as to how much to use. The container directions say to use 2 scoops, the directions in the write up of the product say to use 1 scoop. Which is correct? I do believe I am going to use more liquid as I find 2 scoops of the powder to be very sweet.

I've been on a protein journey for about 6 months now. I've tried a few brands but premier protein seems to be the best as far as being smooth and pleasant taste goes. I went with cafe latte. It is everything I was looking for. I pair it with a sugar free salted caramel syrup and it's delish! I love that it has high protein so even when I just want half a scoop I'm still getting 15g in. Great taste and the price is lower than most 👍

I mix with 2% milk to take my pills/medication in the morning. I just had a total hip replacement and need to up my protein intake to at least 100mg a day. I just put a scoop in a mason jar, add milk and just shake it up. Mixes well and taste great! On my second container!

I was used to buying the premier protein premade shakes, and compared to that, this is a little chalkier. It is hard to blend well unless you do it in a smoothie with a nutri bullet or ninja type thing. If you are just doing water and the powder it gets foamy in the blender.

I counteract the globbing by mixing my smoothies in stages and adding my frozen items when I add the powder. The abrasion of the broken up frozen items seems to reduce globbing of the powder. I like it.

I'm surprised with the great taste this protein has. I read other people reviews and they do not make justice to this product. The taste is really good, it's also not too sweet, although I've tried just one scoop (instead of the two indicated) with 8 oz of milk and 1/4 cup of plain nonfat Greek yogurt and some ice and it was perfect. The blending power is good and the price is great. I was looking for a cheaper protein powder but with good flavor and I think this is.
Es necesario utilizar licuadora para que se mezcle más o menos bien. Con batidora o shaker no se mezcla y queda desagradable

As with any ON protein powder, this is a very good quality product.  However, I would not describe the flavor as cafe latte or anything near coffee.  It took me a while to place it but this actually tastes exactly like caramel corn.  I grew to like the flavor once I'd figured it out and of course found it to be a nice departure from chocolate and vanilla.

I hardly ever review products because I am not one to leave reviews. However, I felt compelled to write this. I don’t know why anyone would complain about the powder. The taste is amazing. It doesn’t have an after taste, it’s not chalky. It actually tastes delicious. I put two scoops of protein powder in, 8 oz unsweetened almond milk and shake it up in my bottle blender, that is it. I don’t add ice, sugar or anything else. Really great in the morning of you don’t have time to eat, or if you want to substitute a meal. And for a low carb protein powder, the price is very very good.

I use this protein powder for making pancakes. I have type 2 diabetes and was really missing things like pancakes. Now I can have them. I use 2 scoops of powder, 2 Tbs of almond flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 egg, & 1/4 c of almond milk. Mix well. They are not perfectly rounded pancakes or very thick, but they taste good. They have around 4 carbs ( according to my calculations).  This recipe makes 4 good sized pancakes for 4 carbs. It has not raised my glucose. I will definitely keep purchasing this protein powder.

This protein powder tastes fantastic! No gritty texture and is smooth on the tounge. I get this for my 90 year old kon. She loves it for her breakfast. Gives her energy. Sometimes she mixes it with coffee for a special jolt! Lol. Fantastic product. Too bad it is so expensive although it's not as much for far less quality products on the market.
Tastes great! I put it with either coconut milk or my morning coffee. Really helps me get my protein in when I’m rushing around in the mornings.

I frequently use this.  Love the taste and it helps me stay on track with my weight loss goals.  It's good by itself or even better if you add some coffee and ice in a blender, makes it like a Frappuccino.

Have now been using this for three weeks. Originally had a VERY strong reaction to the caffeine in it, but my body seems to have adjusted. I have significantly reduced the amount of food I eat every day, and the flavor is so good that I really look forward to drinking it. It's not cheap, but it's cheaper than the meals it's replacing.

This product is not to be used to help you lose weight. It is meant to be used as a meal supplement/replacement when you just don't feel like preparing food. While instructions recommend using water to mix in order to keep the calorie at a minimum, I used it with water and ¼ cup of whipping heavy cream. I am on a carnivore/keravore diet, so extra fats are ok for this diet. And heavy whipping crean have virtually no sugars. Thus this combo makes for a super yummy and creamy shake.Carnivore diet: Beef, bacon, butter, eggs- and when feeling lazy, enjoy your shake.I began at heifer weight of 192, and after 6 weeks of Carnivore and these shakes (1-2) per week, sometimes less— I am now at 160 lbs, and dahlias, I look mahvelous!
I use this everyday in my smoothies. I only put one scoop in (instead of the serving size of 2) and it still keeps me full until lunch.
I've been buying this off and on for 3 years now and it's been great every morning ... I use a ninja blender smoothie container and mixing great in 2 seconds.

I use this protein powder to make my daily protein shake which includes 39g of protein powder, 50g of oat, 55g of nonfat Greek yogurt, 70g of frozen blueberries, and either choices of water or whole milk. It gives me approximately 500 calories and 50g of protein with milk. At first, I was using milk, but the powder didn't blend well with milk, so I switched to water, and drank milk on the side. The flavor is good, but somehow it gets really sweet with milk.
I blend the powder with plain yogurt, a banana and ice cubes.  Wow! A great tasting protein breakfast
It's got a good coffee flavor. It doesn't blend as well as other brands I have used. Just takes longer in the blender. Would buy again.

I loved the pre-packaged cafe latte protein shakes so I thought I would save some money and buy the powder. Just want to start out by saying that they don't taste the same; blended with water, the protein-powder version drink tastes almost like butter, which becomes off-putting after a while, but definitely nice to switch it up now and then between this one and another protein powder that I like. Blends well. Price is ok, although its annoying how you are paying for a huge plastic bottle that's basically half full. Not saying you're not getting what it says on the packaging, but the size is misleading!
Excellent source of protein and vitamins, taste good , I take it with milk and a banana & ice cream, the best and a full meal!! RG
Good tasting and smooth.
I use with almond milk and fruit in blender. It’s really yummy
Doctor told me to drink protein,  and I love my coffee, so mix the powder with my starbucks iced coffee.  U can also put vanilla yogurt in also.
Great product. GINORMOUS box for such a small container.
This produce helps me to stay on point with my calorie count as I use it as a meal supplement for breakfast ! It’s flavorful and mixed in my coffee great ! Enjoy !
Amazing protein without the gritty after taste.
I only drink protein powder in my coffee this powder allows me to only have one cup of coffee and no need to mix any cream or sugar.
I mix the Cafe latte with half cup of caramel vanilla creme coffee,  half cup or more of almond milk, and ice.  Shake it and it tastes just like a caramel Frappuccino from McDs.
Yes, powder mix as well and doesn’t clump Espetus others I’ve used! The flavor is not too strong and putting bananas or other fruit. It takes on those flavors instead.
Nice flavor would recommend it.
I guess it needs lots of air to stay good 🤷🏻‍♀️
The coffee powder doesn't have a strong coffee taste unfortunately. But I will be buying again because the price is good for the amount of protien

It’s only half full of the product. Wish these companies would get their acts together to give you a true visual. So beware!
Tastes great. Chocolate is very good. Cafe flavor is pretty good. I haven't opened the vanilla yet. Can't wait fir tge summer to make smoothies.
Delicious! Best price I've found so far.

Love the flavor in my coffee!
Blends wasy, tastes great, nice evening snack.
This is our go to product. No chalky flavor/after taste.
Great supplement to daily nutrition!

This has been my FAVORITE protein powder for years now. I've ventured off and tried other brands but I ALWAYS come back to this one! Great blending, tastes so good and I even use it to make pancakes!! Definitely and highly recommended!
high protein low carb diet

It is easy to get good amount of protein when you trying to fulfill your daily macro nutrients. 30g per serving is a lot, and works for me. It does take some blending to mix the protein powder. The flavor is bit sweet, but still doesn’t bother me much. I only care about the amount of protein I can get, so flavor is not my priority.
Highest protein level with best taste. I am never going to say a protein shake tastes great, but this is the best.
I use this protein powder for my morning shakes, great taste and easy to blend.
Love this stuff. Throw in a few blueberries or frozen bananas then oh my goodness. Love it.

Great taste, low calories, high protein, low carbs!!!
The flavor is not the best I added a banana it whip up nicely in a blender, I will likely choose a different flavor next time.
Does not mix well unless you use a blender.
This is great protein mix for the value. Purchased many times!

The flavor wasn't to my liking but it was decent enough. I can tell you I probably won't be repurchasing the Vanilla flavor again. It blended well, but that was about it. It didn't make my smoothies more creamy which is something I really like about a protein powder. I will, however, probably end up trying the mocha one to see how I like that.
Love this product!! So yummy and worth every penny!! I will definitely be ordering more!
I am a coffee lover amd the flavor of this was on point. I can't wait to order another one. Probably my absolute favorite❤❤❤
I bought it because I love chocolate and I wanted to try something different .I should have stuck to my usual protein powder .it taste chemical like..it’s bad
If you are into adding one of the best protein powders on the market at an extremely good price, then this is the one for you!!
I always used the liquid form of this product but I am extremely happy  This product blends extremely well and the flavor is great
Easy way to get in extra protein amd it tastes really good without many carbs.
I LOVE PREMIER PROTEIN THE FLAVOR IS EXCEPTIONAL, IT BLENDS PERFECTLY AND THE VALE FOR YOUR MONEY IS EXCEPTIONAL!!!!!!!!!
My son loves this and the vanilla , he  started making me a smoothie at night when l usually am looking for something sweet and it is good tasting and better than a few cookies.
Bottles and cartons are more convenient.
El sabor es agradable

I really liked the carton version of this, but this powder is hard to mix when the instructions say "just add water". I tried to add to my coffee and had a gloopy mess. You really need a blender for this stuff. Not bad mixed in with yogurt. Has caffeine! Always a plus.

The day I ordered this I just got diagnosed with diabetes and I really needed to make a change in my diet, but, I have a huge issue with sweets.  I knew that abstaining from sweets was just not going to work with me.  I bought this due to the price cause I was low on money and most diabetic shakes cost about double of this brand.  It was delivered the very next day and I immediately tried it.  I put the water, ice and powder in my Blend Jet and at first taste I was amazed, it actually taste really good, has a bit of an after-taste to it but not that much and its very filling which is another upside to this shake as a snack and meal substitute.  I could really live with this and it will help get my sugar and sweet cravings under control.  I even added a scoop of the mix to a cup of coffee (cause I can't have flavored coffees anymore) and it was Delicious!!  I'm very grateful!
Great flavor, it blends really well. I've even used it like creamer adding it to my coffee to make it protein-packed and extra yummy.
This flavor tastes like iced coffee. It is absolutely delicious and very filling. I would highly recommend it to anyone I will also be buying this again.
Tastes great with almond milk,blends well,fits my bariatrics diet plan,I mix it with the vanilla to mix things up,good stuff

So... I was waiting for this to go on sale (original price after tax was around $30 for this) and I got it on sale for $17 after tax.The product is fresh, was sealed properly, tastes good, etc (doesnt mix well, though...) What I recieved was an only HALF full container. In the photo, this hasn't been opened. I held it up to the light and lo and behold!!! Half full.I can't imagine spending FULL price on a HALF full container! Waste of plastic, ya know? (and cash...) But, for it being on sale it was worth it! I'm sorry for those who spent the full price to receive half a container.
I like the flavor

This is my favorite flavor of Premier Protein. I love the flavor and add espresso shots to it, iced, daily. I bought the powdered version to have on hand for camping/random times when I don't have a carton around. The price for the powder is the same as the pre-prepared cartons. So it's not saving any money, but I can easily add a scoop if I need to, to random items (great in overnight oats). If added to a bottle at the top, it doesn't always shake up and blend in as easily as I would like. Overall I like this product, just wish it wasn't the same price as pre-prepared drinks.
I like this product because it is easy to mix and a really good taste with all the protein!

I had been buying Premier Protein prepared drinks from Costco in the 18-pack for years. With the onset of the pandemic and prices going nuts all over I decided to give the powder a try. One of the biggest pros in my book is less single-serving waste  - these containers are recyclable plastic. The flavor is on par with the packaged drinks (be sure not to use too much water - 6 ounces will do just fine!) but the most obnoxious thing I have noticed is the need to use a blender. I have tried every alternative to NOT run the blender at o’dark thirty, including making the night before (product settled weird if you let it sit after mixing), shaker-blender bottle with the metal mixer ball (leaves in-blended gobs) and even hand-mixing with a whisk (not sure how I thought this would be more effective than the blender-shaker bottle). The only thing that blends this to a smooth mixture is a proper blender (or smaller version, like a Nutri Ninja).
Not too strong, quickly became my morning favorite.
I can’t vouch for the flavor I’m on this. It’s definitely my least favorite but it’s still a great product

So I am lucky to find a number of high protein powders available. This mixes fine for me and it is high in protein (30 grams) per serving. When Amazon had protein powders on sale, I bought quite a few. Two protein drinks daily and a low calorie meal each day.
I loved the idea.  But it is not as good as the premade drinks in this brand/flavor.  It mixed kinda chunky, had to really shake it up or blend it.
This to me is a good quality product. I use milk to mix mine and the taste and consistency is always good. Helps me feel less hungry and helps me get my daily intake of protein up.
This is the best protein powder I have tried. It has everything you need, 30 grams of protein and low carbs. I love it!!

I’ve bought the prepackaged small ones for months and decided it may be cheaper to buy the whole container and make my own shakes. I use sugar-free almond milk and the taste slightly like chocolate milk but not a nasty chalktaste like other protein shakes. I have a blender shake bottle that has the metal wisp in it. I recommend having a bottle with that because it does get clumped up if you don’t shake it well.
I like these products, flavors are good but cause a lot of gas!  You get more servings buying the powder but it also gives you more options.
Good quality for the price.
I love coffee everything and this has an extra shot of protein
My only disappointment was it was only half full. Why waste the plastic for only half the product? Good News is I reuse plastic products like this

I have been a pre mix user as it a fantastic way to get one of the better protien per gram to calorie ratios.  So seeing the powder version I thought I would give it a try even knowing often the powder version are worse and to be clear it is.Now the powder is cheaper than the premade ( premade being 18 servings for $33 versus powder 17 servings for $21) that said it is nowhere near as flavorful.With water it tastes like nothing, with milk I never tried, but even with the calorically cheapest Almond milk (around 40 calories for 12 fl oz) the point of 150-160 calorie efficiency is gone.Mixing it with coffee is the closest it gets to the Premade but still is not as creamy, but is enjoyable at that point.As mentioned by others the containers are huge but half filled, but apparently that the nature of these after the powder settlesI recommend the powder if you already drink coffee in the morning this is decent but the premade is still my recommendation

One of the best protein powders for me. Low sugar, low salt, great taste, blends well. Perfect for people with dietary restrictions. Mixes very well with other powders like ginkoba and beetroot. Good chocolate flavor without being overly sweet. If you mix it with milk or vanilla ice cream, its similar in taste to the Wendy's frosty.
I use this IN my coffee to give me a protein boost first thing in the morning.
Taste is great

The flavor is incredible. I blend it with bananas and dark cherries for a fantastic smoothie. Very filling. I just have a problem with the packaging. I drew the blue line where the product comes up to. The container is twice the necessary size. It would be much easier to store in a smaller container, also.
It doesn’t tastes like the premium already mix but it’s ok Like the 30 grams of Whey which the drink is not whey Don’t like the two scoops you use more
The is sweet even though there is 1% of sugar. No much taste of coffee
I mixed in with my fairlife milk. Yummy.
Nice smooth flavor, im able to blend it moderately well with just a single chopstick, havent noticed any discomfort or issues. Would get it again.

I expected there to be some type of chocolate flavor in here, like an Oreo. Instead this tastes much like a buttercream frosting or birthday cake? Much too sweet for my liking, and unfortunately no returns or exchanges. Would not buy again.

Did NOT expect to like the flavor this much!!! Literally the best protein powder I’ve had thus far. Ran out of my Strawberry flavor (that was so good with either milk or plain water) and decided to try the cookies and cream flavor to change it up. This brand never disappoints! Excellent source of protein when you’re struggling getting the amount you need in a day. Mixed well and did not have a chalky taste. Blend with a cup of almond milk and 1/3 of a banana (I used the black ones in my fridge smh) and it was the best smoothie I’ve ever had. Great reward after a hard workout! Buy it!!
Best tasting flavor of Gold Standard Whey Protein!
A little hard to get all the clumps out with just a blender ball, but otherwise very good.

I needed to add more protein to my diet and this does it for me.  I can’t believe how DELICIOUS the COOKIES & CREAM flavor is!  I add it to vanilla yogurt with a frozen, sliced banana and anything else that pops the “flavor of the day “ (peach, dark cherries, peanut butter, mint, etc!) I highly recommend this product!

If your hesitant on which flavor to buy look no further because cookies and cream is absolutely delicious and its easy to blend with water or milk I recommend milk for a broader taste but the choice is ultimately yours. JUST BUY IT AND GET THOSE GAINS💪
Does not mix as well as I remember in the past. The flavor was decent and the ingredients are clean, however when you mix it without a blender I tended to get powder chunks.

My first purchase of Whey Protein power was from GNC.  It tasted really good and had 110 calories.  I wanted something cheaper but with similar ingredients. I found this after a lot of research.  The taste is good but seems lighter than the GNC flavor.  I mix it in a Ninja blender with cashew milk and it dissolves very well. I will try strawberry next to compare flavors.
The taste is good

This saved my bacon when I could not eat and we needed it, but the flavor was a bit strange and gave it a weird texture with the cookie crumbs. I felt them in my mouth for an hour after each time I drank it. I got through it OK and the good thing is we found out that you can buy the same thing in many different brands and flavors for the same price or cheaper at the local supermarket.  Be careful though if you are drinking this as a meal supplement since it has a very limited amount of vitamins in it. There are far better options. I am allergic to B6 and this has none so I went with this. It is a good source of pure protein and a good supplement for working out and it will give you an extra boost if need be so it has a place in your diet if you need it.

I have tried 3 flavors of this stuff, Rocky Road, Mocha and Cookies and Cream. Best one is Rocky Road, followed by Cookies and Cream and then Mocha. The Mocha is not bad, but it just doesn't really taste like coffee, and I find fake coffee flavor to be a bit off-putting. Cookies and Cream does have the little bits of "cookie" in there, but I actually kind of like that. Especially for smoothies. Rocky Road is a delicious concoction that does actually taste like it could be dessert. I followed that one review that claimed it was the best flavor and I believe them.I think this powder is very reasonably priced. I take one scoop a day, and one of the tubs lasts me about a month. There are cheaper options, but they taste terrible or don't mix well. Speaking of which, this mixes wonderfully in my shaker bottle. I never get clumps or anything weird.I'm just going to trust the other reviewers who vouch for the quality of the protein. I have tried other brands that have that all organic, no preservative, vegetarian powder. But the problem is that it tastes terrible and doesn't mix well. I couldnt even finish some of the other brands. I make sacrifices for my health, but I draw the line at quickly swallowing a shaker bottle filled with clumpy powerdery protein that tastes like it should be inedible. This one however, makes the experience pleasant.Overall, I think this is a sold, quality product and I'm going to keep repurchasing it.

The taste is good my only concern is the deception behind the container in it of it’s self. The container is only filled 3/4 of the way. I wouldn’t be disappointed if the container was the size of what it actually holds. It’s my first time ordering this product, I was to give it a try, but not again. Other manufacturers a least have the courtesy to give you the amount of the size of the container.
This is simply milk flavored with few tiny bits of 'cookies'. Good product, poor flavor choice! Cream flavored powder with 0 cookies... I prefer the chocolate/peanut butter
Still tastes great, but the vanilla ice cream has it beat for sure.

I’ve had a cookies & cream protein shake (that’s now discontinued by the manufacturer) that I loved.  It actually had bits of cookie in it that didn’t dissolve unless you mixed it ahead.Now I’m searching for a comparable protein powder and sadly this is not it.This product is probably very good for those who like a rich vanilla with hints of chocolate.  It looks like vanilla in the canister.  After mixing, it still looks like vanilla, but with a tiny amount of brown specks in the bottom.After looking at other protein powders online, I saw one that commenters on mixing instructions noted that only 4oz of water/milk was recommended per scoop.  Even though this protein powder does recommend 8oz, I tried doubling the amount of powder for the 8 oz.  the only difference I noticed was a bit more brown particles in the bottom of my shaker bottle.I’m kinda picky and don’t prefer plain vanilla, so I will try returning this & try yet another brand.
I’ve love this brand, the flavor has been consistent over the years and the ingredients are clean!
Sooooo, where’s the rest? I paid almost $40 for half a container? Other than that, 5 Stars.
Muy buena me gusto mucho pero me saco mucha acné por el sabor
The extreme milk chocolate is a 10/10. I tried cookies and creme and it was not bad but does not compare. For the price and quality/flavor you can't beat it.
Awsome taste and my go to whey

Try ingredients in this are all great, the amount of protein compared to carbs and calories is amazing. The Cookies and Cream flavor I personally did not like. I bought Vanilla after and liked it much better

The media could not be loaded.
                



 Excelent price for a good product.

On a scale of 1-10 with 10 being best ranked, I’d rank this protein as a 7. The ingredients are good but the taste and consistency are not the greatest. I know isolate tends to be a little grainier, but somehow that seems to also affect the flavor. That being said, it mixes well in my morning oatmeal and with water as a shake. Good source of whey isolate, I‘be just been spoiled by more expensive ones (hence my choice here).

This review is only regarding flavors. So far I've had 3 different ones.Strawberry: taste like Strawberry Nesquik with milk/water. Great for shakes. Guaranteed yum.Double Rich Chocolate: Absolutely delicious. Not too sweet or chocolatey. Taste like the perfect chocolate milk. 10/10 would recommend if you're feeling basic.Cookies N Cream: WOW. This took a couple drinks to get used to. It taste like someone took all 3 packs of Oreos, removed the filling, put it in a blender with water (or milk) and mixed it together. Definitely more of a Cream with a dash Cookie kind of flavor. It's the kind of sweetness that makes your mouth go dry. Don't recommend for fruit/veggie shakes, unless you're into that sort of thing. With thing defined here as something seriously weird and unsettling.

I have been trying to find a whey protein flavor that i actually could learn to love.  In the past i've bought GNC's and as much as i know the quality is good i just can't stand the taste.  This brand (ON) as well as this particular flavor when mixed with milk (vanilla or chocolate) works really well for me.Here's my rating in terms of flavor (1 lowest - 5 highest):GNC Chocolate - 1.5ON Banana - 3.8ON Cookies and Cream - 4.0For the packaging it came sealed and was delivered on time.I also found the powder for ON easier to mix with water and milk (using my blender bottle) as opposed to GNC's.I'm happy with the purchase and will most likely order again as well as try other flavors (french vanilla, strawberry banana, etc.)

Well, I haven't been lifting that long, so I can't give too much info on this, but as far as the taste, and mixing goes, it all gets 5 stars. I bought a BlenderBottle along with this purchase, so as far as the mixture goes, that is the source in which I am using.I shook for about 30 seconds, and there were not any clumps, or any signs of bad mixture quality.As far as the taste of Cookies & Cream goes, it doesn't really taste like cookies & cream, but the taste is still pretty good. I'm using one scoop of the protein, and 8 oz of water. The taste is kind of odd, because it comes after you swallow, so sort of an after taste, but nevertheless it is good. I'll be trying with milk tomorrow, so I'll update which is better. If you are worried about the extra calories associated with mixing with milk, don't worry, the water mixture taste is still top notch.Taste - 5/5Mixture 5/5
I went out on a limb (not a good idea for a fat guy like me) to try this. Was not impressed with this flavor. I will stick with strawberry from now on.
Not bad flavor. Cheap and quick. Will buy again
There were some chunks of cookies after mixing it with water. Definitely doesn't mix well. Unless you like it very bland, wouldn't recommend.

I really like this powder.It's promoted and known to be the highest quality protein powder as far as I know.It's my first time buying a protein powder, and I think it's worth the investment, since I know I won't be inserting anything unhealthy into my body.I bought a 2 pound tub of "Cookies and cream", and to be honest I quite dislike the taste (although after a workout, being thirsty, I can finish it pretty quickly regardless of the taste).I'd recommend going for the Vanilla one for a first tub, as there are a lot of yogurt/fruity smoothies you can make with it.Also, I wouldn't suggest going for a big tub on the first few purchases, at least not until you've chosen the taste you like the most.** Something I wasn't sure of before purchasing it: IT DOES come with a scoop!

4 stars for the great macros. I ordered the cookies and cream flavor and I will not repurchase this flavor. The cookies and cream flavor is overwhelmingly sweet (and I LOVE sweet) and the only way to get rid of the chunks is to blend it in my ninja blender for at least 30 seconds. When I use this protein in a standard shaker bottle, I can't shake out the chunks. This is the only flavor that has complaints about it being chunky. I have one or two scoops left before I can order a different flavor, which is going to be rocky road. You can't go wrong with optimum nutrition, even the cookies and cream wasn't TERRIBLE. I drank the whole tub anyways!
The cookies and cream flavor is just ok, nothing to write home about. The vanilla ice cream is the best but wanted to try something different. It blends well.

Cookies and cream flavor is NOT good. Double Chocolate IS insanely good. Unfortunately I strayed from what I knew to be good and paid the price for it. Either way the product in its function works great. 5 stars for chocolate

Cookies & Cream has a really nice "cream-filled cookie" flavor. Not artificial-tasting at all. One slightly annoying thing is that the little cookie crumbs don't dissolve, and they tend to bunch up at the bottom of my shaker cup.
One of my favorite fart powders. If big gas is what you seek, then your ass will reek.

Sooo good! Protein oatmeal is a morning ritual 😋 cookies and cream has been the best so far.I mix it in with stevia and ground cinnamon, leave it in the microwave for a few extra seconds.And that’s my cinnamon cookies and cream cake, topped with fruit. Having abs has never been so easy 🥰
El sabor feo pero cumple lo que promete acompaño con ejercicio dieta y verás resultados
I always get this flavour but usually it costs a bit more. So the fact that it’s the same product but for a lower price makes me super happy

When I got it the protein was sealed on the outside but on the inside of the cap there wasn’t a seal and it was about half full. I’ve bought 100% whey before but it’s been a while so I cannot remember whether or not it was sealed under the cap and whether or not they filled it more than half way (possibly since is determined on weight rather than capacity). Other than that I’ve always enjoyed this supplement the past times I’ve bought it.
This protein powder is hands down the best I've ever had! It isnt gritty and mixes super well. I'm really impressed and pleased with this product. The cookies and cream flavor is delicious.
Blends well, cookies and cream doesnt taste good on its own.

TLDR: get a different flavor than cookies n cream it’s nasty, others are greatI’ve been using gold standard for a few months now to help me to get enough protein. I (20M, 6’, ~200lb) have put on an amount of muscle I am very satisfied of while becoming more cut at the same time (although definitely increased in weight too). I definitely attribute this at least partially to my use of protein powder in conjunction with going to the gym and setting macro/caloric goals.This time I tried getting cookies and cream and well, it makes me want to throw up. With my previous flavors I enjoyed the drink, going so far as to say I liked the flavor so much I could have drank it just for the flavor alone. However, the cookies and cream is so vile it makes me feel nauseous; to get it all down I can’t sip on it, I need to chug the entire bottle (I usually do 3 scoops, ~90 grams of powder and ~ 22 oz of water). Needless to say I will be getting a different flavor next time. I’m unsure if I’ll even be able finish this tub
I bought this for my son he loves it says it the best tasting one he has used so far. Not chalky either.

I got the cookies and cream flavor and I would say it doesn't taste that good when I'm only mixing it with water. Also it doesn't mix that well without hot water. So I searched a recipe that I can do with this flavor: 1 scoop of whey protein powder, banana, 1spoon of PB, and milk of your choice (I use almond milk) and it turned out to be so yummy! So thats what I am going to do with it from now on.
The flavor is great and one of the best protein powder for the price you can get without walking into a store.
I love having a powder that I can mix easily with a spoon instead of getting the blender out. I love the Cookies and Cream flavor. I'll be ordering the larger size when I run out.

I'm writing this review ONLY based on the flavor. There's numerous other reviews that talk about the benefits and you can always just look at the label. I ordered the cookies and cream flavor with high hopes. After already ordering my 2 lbs I began to look at the reviews for that particular flavor (I know, rookie mistake). It seemed as if no one liked the cookies n cream but I decided to try it anyways wants it arrived. I love it! It doesn't take exactly like cookies and cream but it does taste somewhat like a sugar cookie. There are little pieces of brown "cookie" in the powder that could easily be picked out if you wanted to. I do advise though that this powder is extremely sweet and that not many people like that when looking for a post-workout shake. Hope I was able to help.
I would not purchase again. It came unsealed and half empty and it appears many others have had the same experience. Stick with vitamin shoppe.

This is by far the best protein powder I've used to date. All other powders I've tried have a funny or nasty after taste that I just assumed was the protein itself but not this protein powder. The smell alone set it apart from other powders as this had a real cookies & cream scent. But the taste waa the big kicker for me. Tastes great w/ just plain water. I use protein drinks as a meal replacer & 2 scoops of this holds me over for a long time
very decent thickness, flavor is amazing. one negative for me is the foam, i’m not a fan of it, but i don’t really care. i definitely recommend mixing with milk.
it has a subtle cookie taste that is quite good. other cookies and cream protein products have been disgusting but i actually look forward to this one

I've been working out for six years, and I've tried lots of supplements.This whey protein has to be the best one I've ever tasted, and the results are amazing.If you're reading these reviews to see if this is a quality, good tasting product, rest assured that you have discovered the hidden secret in the world of whey.I'm the type of person to read every comment before buying something, so I get you.No need to read any further. You won't regret this purchase.My glowing review and recommendation is well deserved by this product.I just wish that the commenters would advise more on the flavors they liked, I loved the strawberry but the double chocolate wasn't as good.

Gold Standard from ON is always reliably trustworthy. Bought Cookies N Cream on a whim because I wanted to try a new flavor and it was amazing. Tastes exactly like Oreos and mixes well with other flavors or milk or just water. Flavor did get very old about halfway through the tub so I began mixing it with vanilla whey in my shakes.

While I know protein shakes are kind of supposed to be gross I thought I'd go out of my comfort zone of chocolate and get cookies and cream. Not that great. Tastes like cake batter and the cookies are hard and contribute nothing to the flavor. Still not bad though and my expectations weren't that high.
As expected from optimum nutrition, great product. One of my favorite protein powders and this flavor is great too
Best whey protein there is! Excellent product! And that's my favorite flavor. Perfect with banana, with coffee and even with cakes and cupcakes.

I've seen many reviews talk about how the canister was more than halfway full, when I received mine..... it was the total opposite; it was less than the halfway mark. I wouldn't have mind spending an extra 10-15 dollars for a much more full canister.
The container lid was not sealed and half of the product was gone.
They're a good brand, this flavor wasn't my favorite and due to diet changes I no longer can use their products at all.

I bought this for my son of 15 years of age.  He had just started to workout with weights to build muscle.  I wanted to get him on some protein and he was told by some older school friends that this was a great flavor.  So I purchased it.  It must be great as he is on his second container.  He said he puts a scoop in a blender bottle and takes to cafeteria at his school and adds milk and had prior to having dinner.  He said he loves it.  Protein is a necessity for kids getting into lifting weights to build muscle.  It will help elevate the soreness that comes after a workout.
Whey is always a great protein but the taste is nothing like cookies and cream lol not bad though but not cookies and cream!

I've been working out for about 8 months but I just started using protein shakes recently...I was told that this was a reputable brand...when I got my 2 lb of cookies & cream the tub was not filled to the brim like I thought it would be but then I realized the tub was the same size as the 3lb I got of another brand...I weighted it myself & it was actually 2 lbs...I think ON uses the same size tub & just puts the desired amount & label based on the order...taste was phenomenal with milk & water

I originally intended to buy vanilla, but saw that this was slightly cheaper and it looked interesting. It didn't taste like cookies and cream to me; much more like vanilla. It works out for me in the end.

I like this brand and flavor (although I haven't tried another flavor yet) for these reasons:1) It tastes pretty good in milk-no overpowering "protein taste" and only a subtle flavoring.2) According to ConsumerReports research (google "Consumer Reports protein drinks" and it should be the first link), Optimum Nutrition is very good about keeping down the amounts of dangerous heavy metals in their products.3)It's high in protein, including most of the essential amino acids, but it doesn't have a lot of carbs.  Carbs are necessary for post-workout recovery, but this allows me to control my carb intake much more easily.What's not to love.  I can't guarantee that you'll like the flavor, but you won't know until you try.

The Cookies and Cream flavor is amazing!!! I'm not a big fan of protein drinks normally. Plus I am not a chocolate fan, which most protein powders are chocolate flavored. My friend told me about this product/flavor combo and I decided to try it out. Amazon had a great deal on it so I ordered a 2 lb. container. I was shocked by how good it was. No chalky taste! I tried with both almond milk and water, which I liked the water better. I added ice because I found it tasted better. Would definitely purchase again. Think I'll try the salted caramel next.
This the only whey I can take over and over without any problem with drinking , getting bored or after taste. It’s so easy to drink, blends well, it’s really easy for daily basis routine.

I've tried a few different proteins over the last few years and I had thought that EAS Whey Protein was the best. I was wrong. Optimum Nutrition makes without a doubt the best protein on the market. The taste is very mild and if you mix it with water it's not very thick. Some may or may not like that, but for me it's perfect. This protein has excellent reviews on many forums and those are well deserved. If you're looking for something that tastes and works great look no further, plus it's a steal at this price. Don't waste your money with other overpriced proteins that don't even work or mix as well.

I feel like protein powders meet a need, but for me personally-none of them taste good!  This one is the one I can get down the best.  As for consistency and texture it is fine.  It is more the fake tastes they try to add to them that always bother me.  It is a very strong/bold cookies and cream flavor.
The strawberry flavor is very artificial tasting, and is hard to disguise with other ingredients.

Boyfriend was trying to find his first protein power for shakes when he would work out. (His first time working out) He loves oreos and cookies and cream related stuff, and he absolutely enjoys the cookies and cream one. My brother also enjoys this brand the most and is affordable and tastes great. Would recommend.
I’m new to going to the gym.  It’s early in the game for me but I can vouch for the taste.  It’s something I look forward to drinking after my time in the gym.
The cookies and cream doesn't really mix well with hot water and leaves residues on top. It's not exactly nice to have to chew the powder....
not filled to the top. only filled half way

It was my time buying the cookies and cream flavor from this brand as I usually just stick with the chocolate, but I decided to mix it up. I really like the flavor and will definitely continue buying this flavor in the future. Love the gold standard brand gives you a good amount of protein with not a lot of calories.
Great product. This is my go to Protein supplement. Only had one issue, in which I received the wrong flavor in a mislabelled container. Luckily, I didn't mind the switch up, but not ideal

Great taste!

Maybe I just haven't tried a lot of protein shakes, the flavor is honestly good,  I just need to compare this one with more varieties.

Okay so all the hate I saw in the reviews scared me but it wasn’t bad at all.So I’ve been working out lately (actually started working out in like March so I bought my first bag around that time) and I wanted some protein powder to help with the healing and building of muscles and this is the brand I chose. I did all sorts of calculations to make sure I used the right amount of powder for my weight with the inclusion of aiming to build muscles as stated by the DRI (Dietary Reference Intake) and to stay within my calorie limit intake.(SCOOP aka MEASURING CUP: ) Also you don’t need a scoop if you already have measuring cups. Just Google “grams to cups” and then it gives you measurement conversions for cups, grams, and ounces. And if you can’t even figure out which measuring cup you need with it literally spelled out for you like that then you must not have graduated high school or even made it pass middle school bro 😭💀💀(TASTE: ) At first I just used water and the powder but I legit threw up in my mouth cause it tasted like baby formula lol, buuuuut later I had the thought to just turn it into a smoothie!! So now I use 1c of frozen strawberries (45cal), 1/2 banana (53cal), 1c hemp milk (100cal) or 2c for (200cal), 1 or 2 ice cubes, and sometimes I add some chia seeds or a fiber one bar. And I have to say I can’t even taste the powder anymore!! I use one of those ninja single serve blenders to blend all that stuff together and drink one in the morning to start my day and then one right after I finish working out in the evenings. I haven’t had it clump on me so far and I’m on my FOURTH bag already.Though if your going to make a smoothie out of it don’t put the powder in there first cause it can get stuck at the bottom if you put the liquids on top of it. Instead put in only half of your liquids first (your preference of milks or juices), then your solids (your preference of veggies, fruits, or nuts), then your protein powder and lastly the other half of your liquids. Putting in the liquids like that helps the powder spread around evenly in the blender and decreases the chances of it clumping or getting stuck on the sides of the bottle. This is from experience of putting my powder at the bottom with all the liquids on top 😬😭😭 I had to scrape the powder off cause I was too stupid to even remember simple science and common sense like that 😭💀(BAG: ) Yeah the zipper doesn’t work but have any of you ever heard of folding it and then putting a clip on it?!? To ya’know, keep it closed? Or even putting it in another bag or container, lol.(PACKAGING: ) Also haven’t had a problem once with shipping and/or packaging. Sometimes I order a bunch of stuff at once and then the powder comes in a plastic bag inside a cardboard box with the rest of my items and if it’s my only order then it’s just in a plastic shipping bag and the delivery guy just leaves it on my bench next to the door. Haven’t had the bag come opened or torn in anyways and remember this is my FOURTH time ordering.(VALUE FOR MONEY: ) My mother likes to buy already pre-made protein shakes and it’s like 10 for 18$ which is just ridiculous in my opinion. This bag here gives you like 30 servings for 30$ which is a wonderful deal compared to getting pre-made shakes. In order for my mother to reach 30 shakes that’s like 50$ for 30 shakes, smh (smh means “shaking my head”).(SMELL: ) The powder doesn’t really have a strong order to it, but it does smell a little like baby formula. It’s not an overwhelming smell, and it doesn’t smell really foul or like chemicals. It just reminds me of the baby my grandma babysits, lol. On rating the smell on how bad it is from ‘0 - no smell at all’ to ‘10 - foulest most putrid scent on the planet’ I give it a 2 or 2.5 because it really has like NO SMELL. The reason I was even looking for a smell in the first place was because people were like “it smells like chemicals” and “it gives off a VERY strong odor that just puts me off.” Nah fam, it’s not even that strong, you might just have a very sensitive nose or something. (Though it does taste like baby formula a bit too so def use a smoothie recipe and mix in the powder into that.) (def means ‘definitely’)(REPUTABLE SOURCE?: ) Though this is what finally sold me!!! The fact that in their info they put that they use third-party testing to demonstrate their products’ safety!! That is basically a guarantee that they are a reputable protein powder brand. I read “healthline” and in their article about protein powders they said,“Be sure to buy powders that have been through third-party testing — they will say this on the label.” Though idk if they meant their nutrition label, on the bag label, or just their general label. (‘General label’ as in the label that defines their company or the summary labels they put up on their website.) I found their label in their information they put. Idk if everyone else reads that stuff but I do, lol.Anyway this brand is definitely a 4.4 out of 5 in my personal opinion! Will definitely continue to buy this!

I'm glad I found this whey.  It has completely changed the way I look at...whey.  I got it today and have had several servings already, as today's workout was quite intense and I didn't eat a whole lot.  To give some history on me, I've been lifting weights for a little under three years now, and I've always gone with the commercial whey powders you find in the supermarket or at supplement stores.  No problems gaining muscle, I've been able to blow up big time by force feeding myself protein of all kinds and working very hard.  I've come to realize that in order to get the most out of your lifts, protein powder is an easy way to work towards that, and becomes a mainstay for any avid builder.  To put it simply, this is all anyone should want in a whey protein powder, because it doesn't have anything else in it.  For every 122 calories, you get 27g protein, which is a great ratio.  And for $25 (the 1kg option), you get 50 servings, which is 50x27=1350g of protein.  That's 54g of protein per $1 spent(!!).  That's a practically unheard of value when you compare it to other whey supplements out there.  The last whey I was using regularly, also in $25 amounts (I won't mention the name), which I thought was actually a pretty good deal, comparatively only yielded just under 22g per $1.  And on top of that, it is higher in calories and requires way more powder to deliver the same amount of protein.  Those extra calories come from all kinds of additives that are designed to make the commercial whey powders taste good...usually chocolate or vanilla, which I was never crazy about, regardless of the brand.  And on top of that, those other whey protein powders are not especially easy to dissolve into liquids, yogurts, or whatever you're trying to use as the vessel for your whey.  I'd always get nice big powdery clumps even after stirring the heck out of those powders.  Sure those results weren't ideal, but I figured that was the way whey had to be.  Wrong!This BulkSupplements whey is completely different.  First is the taste.  It isn't supposed to taste like anything, and it doesn't especially.  To me it tastes sort of like milk or something, I actually like the flavor.  It's subtle and is not at all sweet or sickening like those other much more artificial and commercial whey options.  And secondly, it's white, fluffy, and filled with protein and only protein.  That means it dissolves very easily, and gives a great protein to powder ratio.  So you won't be dealing with some thick, over-filling, clumpy protein shake that forces you to have some weird artificially flavored and sweetened desert drink any time you want your whey.  To me this BulkSupplements whey is a great option and indeed probably the absolute best option for people who understand that to build muscle, you need lots of protein...and that commercial whey powders are overpriced and loaded with unappetizing and unnecessary extras.  Hey, if you are totally into the taste and price of those name-brand gimmick supplements, avoid this great whey powder.  But if you're like me, you'll love this stuff, especially because you can actually get it delivered same-day with something like $35 spent.  To me this is something to be really excited about that will make a big, positive change in how I get my much-needed protein!

Like many others, I started a new diet in the new year, and I needed a good quality whey protein powder to make my daily shake. I knew I wanted something clean with no added garbage ingredients and no sweeteners (natural or artificial). I spent an hour or so looking at the options on Amazon and the websites of local stores, reading reviews and learning about emulsifiers. I decided on the Bulk Supplements whey protein powder because of the price and good reviews. I have never used plain whey protein powder before, and I was a little worried about the taste (if you have ever tried plain rice protein powder before, you would understand my qualms). I mixed one serving (30 grams) of this with unsweetened vanilla almond milk in a blender bottle, and I was very pleasantly surprised! It's creamier than other whey protein powders I've tried, and I honestly think it tastes better than many of the vanilla flavored powders out there. I had Designer Whey French Vanilla yesterday and had to choke it down because it tastes so fake, but this powder just tastes clean and creamy, even with thin, watery almond milk. Now, an hour later, I can say I never noticed any aftertaste, either. This is not the case with Designer Whey, which is also full of garbage ingredients. And speaking of ingredients, I read quite a bit about soy lecithin, an emulsifier and the only other ingredient in this product, while researching protein powders. While some people may not want to consume it because of concerns with GMO crops, soy/estrogen issues, or soy allergies, I read enough to assuage any concerns I had over using a product every day that contains a small amount of soy lecithin. Here's one article I read on it that others may find informative: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/amanda-greene/soy-lecithin-why-is-it-in_b_2891780.htmlThe only negatives I have on this are related to the packaging. I didn't expect anything fancy (especially for the price), but I could not get the package to reseal. I plan to put it into a glass container anyway to store it on my counter more attractively, so I'm not taking any stars off for it, but it could be an annoyance for folks who are just going to use it out of the package. I ended up putting a piece of press & seal over the top of it this morning and will transfer it to another container after work. The second potential negative is that there's no scoop in the package (at least not that I've found yet - sometimes they are like the hidden prizes in cereal boxes that you have to use half of the product first to discover). The standard protein powder serving is 30 grams, though, so you can use a scoop from another protein powder product if you have one, which I happened to have.

You're going to need it. The Product is great. Package $ucks.
