This happened the first time and on this 2nd bag. Seriously $.03 could make it a better experience. For now, expect to transfer it to another container. Open it over a sink because the powder goes up inside the tear off for the zipper. Try to shake it back down and open carefully.I researched the price/same protein serving of other brands and found my standard go-to 'Cabot whey' actually costs more and it's not even isolate. This is a deal.I took off one star for the package I hate. At least you can recycle a plastic jug. This is only one of four products I use from BULK. Good stuff...poor packages.

July 2019 (Revised Review):So, I have enjoyed this powder for the first three orders and felt it deserved 5-stars.  In the past, I have tried flavored whey powders, but always felt the taste was just 'tolerable' and never really enjoyed drinking them.  This unflavored powder actually taste good to me, when mixed with whole milk, and I genuinely looked for ward to drinking it after my workout.Fast forward to my fourth order....Something changed in the manufacturing and the newest bag left an awful sour aftertaste.  It tasted like drinking bad milk... yuck!  I contacted the company, and went back and forth a bit (with what seemed to be a few different people), but I didn't feel any of them were sympathetic to my complaint.  They said nothing was changed in the process and  that I could send the remainder of the bag to a test facility for analysis.  If it came back as bad, they would refund my purchase.  I was okay with this, up until the part where I was responsible for the shipping charges for sending the product.  I felt they should have immediately sent a replacement and paid for the item to be shipped to the testing facility.Alas, I really needed a replacement, so I went ahead and ordered another bag myself, hoping that I would get a batch of the original formula.  Nope!  What I got was slightly more tolerable, but still had a sour aftertaste.Neither of these batches caused me any side effects, so I continued to use them.  I found that if I don't breathe through my nose while drinking, I don't taste the sourness.  I can then eat a couple spoonfuls of peanut butter immediately after drinking, and it covers the sour taste.  This is now my new routine.I plan on finishing off the rest of this product, but will have to find a different brand from now on, which is unfortunate because the price is good and the original formula was actually a good taste for me.  I'm really surprised that not many other reviews reflect the change in taste that I have experienced.  It makes me somewhat skeptical as to the validity of them all._________________________________________________________January 2019 (Original Review):Headline:  Definite Increase in Muscle Mass with Cardio (Rowing) RoutineMy workout routine (for well over a year now) consists of 40-minutes on a rowing machine everyday before work (5-days each week).  I started using this supplement (along with the creatine powder) about three months ago (October), and can already see a quick increase of the muscle mass in my arms.  My wife has noticed, and even my Mother-in-Law made a comment about my arms, when she was visiting this past Christmas.I'm not sure if the results are more from the protein powder or the creatine (or more likely, the combination of both), but whatever it is, it certainly works!.  I have already been through one full-sized bag and am now on my second order.  It seems to be a pretty good bang for the buck.

I love this product, I'm on myy second bag. It has low sugar, high protein, has no visible flavor (quite palatable as is) but I can add flavoring if I so choose (e.g., orange juice, cocoa, vanilla).  It makes me feel awesome in a healthy way and when I ran out for 2 days, I could visibly feel why - no protein drink that day! I've tried MANY others - this is the real deal. Also has amino acids very much need; no need to take pills. Love the low sugar, and the trace amount of soy lecithin is an emulsifier (keeps product from sticking together I think). MUCH less than soy-based protein powders, which are no good for anyone, let alone me (thyroid issues). I wanted to leave feedback for this product prior to being offered a free sample of another one Bulk Supplements' products, but that was just an added bonus. I selected the smallest size of Organic Whey Protein powder (which I don't even now see on Amazon).  That product has a higher level of sugar (1 gram, no good for me) but NO SOY. It has a visibly sweet taste, actually quite good. And it's organic, which I liked, but I can't have high levels of sugar nor do I like sweet drinks. My health has improved daily after adding the Whey Protein Powder Isolate to my every day regimen, I've lost a bit of weight, my blood work is improved, and I have much more natural energy and far fewer cravings for "bad foods." As if that's not enough great reasons to buy it, when you buy these larger bags (they stay fresh if get the ziploc closed for sure), they last longer, you don't run out as quickly as the canisters of protein powder, and it's cheaper in the long run!!! Hint: save one of those empty canisters of other products, clean it out, then store your Bulk Supplement in it for daily use, then refill it when it gets empty. These equates to less daily struggles to ensure the bag is indeed closed. I shared this product info with my older brother who has been taking a different brand of protein powder for years, then that manufacturer changed it so that he can no longer tolerate the horrible taste --this is a COMMON complaints from many protein powder drinkers.  THIS PRODUCT tastes great as is, but I add 1-2 ounces of orange juice, along with daily greens and psyllium husk, and it tastes even better. My brother just informed me that he switched to this Bulk Supplements product and LOVES the taste, as is, and also sometimes adds vanilla extract (his favorite flavor). Buy it; it's great tasting and great for your body and health.

I'd like to preface this review by stating that about a week after receiving this, my first BulkSupplements purchase, the company reached out to me and offered me a "free trial" of another of their products, under the promise that I would write a review about it and this purchase.If that alone isn't a reason to buy one of these products (and from other reviews it seems that getting this free stuff is pretty common-place with this company), there are a ton of other reasons why you should. First off, the gorilla in the room: price. I'm new to the "bodybuilding" world of supplements and buckets of powder and all the other stuff, but I'm a big researcher. For a 90% whey isolate, I'm not even sure where I'd begin looking for a better value, with a lot of servings, for a lower price.Furthermore, while this product is pretty much tasteless (not an issue for me, although I know that's a key point for some other people), it completely dissolves instantly in whatever you put it in. This is important for me because I combine something like this with ON's Mass Gainer, and the last thing I need is more clumpy powder on top of the fist-sized half serving that goes in my blender.There are two reasons this product didn't get five stars: first, there is no measuring scoop (at least that I've found). I'm a college kid, and getting measuring cups wasn't high on my list of things I needed for my kitchen, and I threw out the measuring cups from other protein buckets. This has left me with the aforementioned fist-sized scoop for my Mass Gainer. Everyone likes to know that they're actually getting the protein they think they are, so I'm not sure why there is no scoop. The second thing is that the ziplock on this bag is impossible to actually close. Just awful.However, the benefits of this product -- easy mix-ability, incredible price, 90% protein per gram, the fact that this company will almost certainly reach out to you and offer you free stuff -- easily outweighs the negatives -- no scoop, a finicky ziplock, and lack of taste (although you can't really complain about that when there are only two ingredients that go into this, which is what you want from an isolate).Do yourself a favor and try this stuff out. Fantastic use of 25 bucks.

I highly recommend this whey powder as an option to increase protein content of most foods and  liquids. I often encounter people who have a need for a flavorless (nearly) product.  It dissolves better in warm /hot liquid (soup, hot cocoa, coffee, etc).  It can be added to hot/warm water and cooled.  I've used this  to make powdered milk, water down juices, and added flavored water enhancers such as MIO Sport which also contains electrolytes.  It's wonderful in creamy/saucy foods such as whipped/mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, and Alfredo and tomato sauce  I've added it to baking mixes such as cookie dough, cake batter, & pancakes.  I have not tried it with bread mixes or anything that rises.  I encourage you to experiment in small batches.  I have made homemade dip using greek yogurt, chicken or beef bullion, onion flakes, bulk whey powder, and spices. I like using Tajin', Frank's Red Hot,  and various Mrs. Dash flavors.  I also add it to flavored yogurt and used it in frozen yogurt cream pie, as a fruit dip, or to increase protein content of lower protein (not Greek) yogurt!  Finally, it's an excellent smoothie addition!

What can I say... it's clean whey!I haven't purchased whey protein online in quite a while, being that I'm always the type that would prefer to hold and lift and inspect a product as much as I can. Unfortunately, you can't always find the best deals on a quality product within the reaches of a brick and mortar store.Lets reflect on the pros.-Price : On point. Seriously. You can't really find much of a better deal on 2.2lbs of protein that isn't practically a powdered milkshake.- Ingredients : Whey Protein Isolate 90%. Check. Oh and there is also soy lecthin used as an emulsifier. Yeah, its not free of soy but its free of sugar (the big one for me), yeast, gluten and corn.-Grams of protein : So each serving size is 30 grams. With every serving, there is 27 grams. Yep. That's what sold me as well. 27 out of 30 is all I want. I don't want the sugar or the "trick your brain" fake flavorings.-Taste : Its what you expect plain ass whey protein to taste! Its a fine flavor to me but also keep in mind I'm a person who have no troubles mixing anything with water and drinking it up like it is a sugary milkshake. Other than water I've tried mixed into pineapple juice, the whey is barely noticeable to the disconcerting tongue.Cons- Well, this should be quite short - and it is. My only gripe is the resealable lock for the bag doesn't feel as secure as I would like it. I feel that it pulls apart a bit too easy. I'm considering dumping it into a decent size screwtop jar. While dumping it, I hope a mini scooper (that doesn't seem to come with this) falls out.In conclusion, all in all its exactly what I asked for and is exactly what I'm looking for. The product is plain ass whey isolate without any crappy filler. Its at a great price. It shipped fast. The packaging is solid (minus the not as secure as I would like resealable zip top). I certainly would be willing to try out more of their products for sure.

My original review of Whey Isolate from Bulk Supps praised the product for its high quality and consistency. I regret to say that is no longer the case. I have been buying the same Whey Isolate powder from Bulk Supps going on 2 years now, so I am very familiar with the product. Unfortunately my most recent order from 12/2016 completely changed my view of the company.I noticed almost immediately after I opened the new pouch that something was "off". Their normal whey powder is very fluffy and white, and this wasn't the same powder. The color was closer to a beige color and the powder was heavier and more coarse. I didn't really think much of this fact until I began actually trying to mix it with water in a glass. It took forever to dissolve, and left nasty little chunks of powder no matter how much I sitrred. The liquid was a strange sort of goopy vomit color which I didnt find the least bit appealing.When I tried drinking the protein I was taken back by the ghastly, horrible flavor. Now I was sure this wasn't the same powder, because the product I was used to never tasted this bad. I begrudgingly finished the glass and 30 minutes later I had some of the worst upset stomach of my life. This really pissed me off because the whole reason i switched to Bulk Supplements in the first place was because their powder gave me none of these issues.I used to drink cheap Wal Mart protein powders before I switched to Bulk Supplements and this new powder was consistent with the low quality and flavor I remembered from the Wal Mart brands. It became increasingly clear that this "batch" wasn't from their usual supplier, and not the stuff I was used to paying for. They substituted with a different, cheaper powder for whatever reason.I promptly sent out an e-mail to Bulk Supplements explaining my issue along with the batch and lot number of my pouch of protein. Within a day I got a response from their associate Amy. She explained that she looked up the batch number and that yes, they did in fact switch suppliers during that particular time and that they have switched back to the correct supplier. That was it. No apology, no attempt to rectify the matter by sending me out the right product, no offer of a refund or anything. She basically shooed me away to Amazon customer service and that was about it.Lets face it guys; Bulk Supplements charges a high premium for their products, but we as the customer are OK with paying it because they (used to) have a high standard of quality and consitency. I think its very dishonest to temporarily switch to this clearly inferior product without #1 informing your customers and #2 continuing to charge the premium price for the bad product.I replied to Amy, explaining that this doesnt solve my situation at all, and that I was still stuck sitting here with the crappy product which I didnt want be stuck with for the next few weeks. I explained to her that the reasonable solution was to send me the correct powder, and that I could ship them back the "fake" powder they orignally sent me.At this point Amy said this wasn't going to be possible, and that the fake powder was all they hadin stock. Its important to note that this completely contradicts her earlier statement about switching back to the original supplier. I pointed this out and she basically switched to generic customer service responses from that point on.I really liked this company. I recommended them to all my friends and family. I use about seven other products that they produce, but the way they handled this situation disappointed and disgusted me. I have spent well into the thousands on their products and they couldnt handle an issue as basic as this. Also, their dishonestly about their product consistency I found very unbecoming in regards to the company I was used to doing business with.

Very clean product that really has no flavor at all. You can mix this with water and still pretty much not taste anything. The actual protein in this product is a huge reason to purchase this. If you are wondering how to find out the actual protein in your powder then use this calculation :Yield refers to the percentage of protein per serving that is obtained. Mathematically it appears as follows:(Grams Protein Per Serving x 100) / Serving Size In GramsFor example, say we had a protein powder that had a serving size of 100 grams total mass. Lets also assume that in that 100gm serving size 50gms was protein. This would be a yield of 50%. Therefore, when purchasing the product, you would be paying for 50% non-protein! Not a good deal. If you want protein you should pay for protein, not non-protein [some of which will be filler].With a product like Optimum Nutrition's 100% Whey, for example, observe the calculation:(22 Grams Protein Per Serving X 100) / 29.4 Grams Serving Size = 74.8%The only two drawbacks I could mention regarding this:1.It does not mix well in a shaker cup with juice, milk or any other supplements it seems. It seemed to clump a little when I did this. The clumps are not a major deal but it could deter some from using this again.2. It seems to have a froth or foam after shaking this up in the shaker unlike many protein powders I have used before. There may be something they put in the others as an additive to keep this from happening.I think this is perfect for blending with a smoothie or just with plain water right after a workout. I personally will order this again, but will not have this as my only protein powder due to the bad mixability with juice or other products.

Why you'll love it:My first time ordering from BulkSupplements. I didn't do a ton of research beforehand, but have a few friends who do competitive bodybuilding and say that the brand is very legitimate.I was a little worried about nitrogen spiking or amino spiking as some supplement brands have recently come under fire for cheating tests and misleading the true protein content. From my understanding, ingredients like creatine, taurine, and glycine are added to boost the test results and give higher than labeled protein totals. Looking over the ingredients, BulkSupplements uses just whey protein isolate and soy lecithin (for an emulsifier). I looked over the amino acid profile and see that glycine is listed, but from my understanding there are trace amounts of this that occur naturally in whey protein and it is not listed as an added ingredient in the list.Taste profile:I did this plain in room temperature water and was easily able to down it. I've had MusclePharm and it comes across as too sweet. I can see myself maybe adding a little cocoa or powdered peanut butter at times, but this tasted no different from skim milk. I even added a little glutamine and it was terrific straight out of the bag.I've yet to use this long enough to see any results, but there have been plenty of pictures on here of people who have had success building lean muscle mass.Why you won't love it:BulkSupplements obviously saves money from using bags and I firmly understand that they are better for the environment (both in logistically and recycling). Unfortunately, the quality of zipper that is used is rather terrible. It's very hard to seal at times (especially if there happens to be some powder stuck in the track) and I am a bit worried for keeping this dry. Thankfully it doesn't get too humid in Michigan, but those in more temperate climates may want to invest in a better storage system (or perhaps toss some silica gel packets in).

I have been searching for a protein that is basic, with minimal or no fillers and unnecessary extras ingredients. I wanted something I could easily add to meals without having the taste of a protein shake be too obvious. I make a lot of recipes with my proteins and I wanted something that could be flexible with multiple different flavors.With all that said, this protein is exactly what I have been looking for! It is the smoothest protein I have ever had, with not a single clump, even when simply stirred with a spoon. It has a very slight protein flavor, as expected- but hardly noticed when mixed with milk or put into my recipes.Alongside having a healthier, minimalist protein, I have noticed I do not get nauseous or have as much reflux like I do when I typically drink other protein powder shakes. UPDATE: 5/2018I've stopped buying protein supplements altogether.  I have discovered that it is more beneficial (and enjoyable) to just eat eggs.  Each egg has about 6g of protein.  Therefore, I consume 3 eggs to get 18g of protein blending them with frozen pineapple or frozen berries or combination thereof. That's all I need. It's a recovery drink AND a protein drink that contains many natural vitamins and minerals as well. No food coloring, no emulsifiers, and no preservatives. It's all natural.  Some people think that eggs have too much cholesterol but the truth is, they have the good type of cholesterol that your body uses, not the bad kind that gets stuck in your arteries.  Anyway, I eat tons of oatmeal every day which protects against absorption of the bad type of cholesterol.  I buy a carton of 18 eggs for $2.79.  That yields 6 servings of protein drinks. Bulk Supplements Isolate Protein powder package yields 33 servings for $26.  I can get 36 servings buying eggs for $16.75.  I save $10, get more servings, get a mega dose of vitamins and minerals, and still get an actual usable dose of protein.  Are you really getting 30g of protein in each serving of Bulk Supplements?  Even if you are, will your body really absorb all 30g of it after your work out? Unlikely on both fronts.  I've definitely seen an increase in my muscle mass vs. when I was using Bulk Supplements.  My recommendation is to go all natural in your diet and don't fall victim of the supplement industry's marketing.  You can definitely build muscle and burn fat without it.UPDATE:  2 months of useI've been taking this protein mostly as a post-workout (weight lifting) drink. I work out pretty much every day and have taken this supplement accordingly.  In a nutshell, this product hasn't made me sick or given me any side effects. That's the good news.  The bad news is that I haven't seen any noticeable improvements in my muscle mass even though my weight lifting exercises have been stepped up appropriately for building mass.  My diet has also been modified to accommodate the increase in workout intensity so I should have seen some kind of dramatic improvement akin to when I used other more recognizable brands such as Muscle Milk (I know it's terrible stuff but it did add bulk).At this point, I've got one serving left in my 2nd bag (I purchased two).  I'm considering purchasing 1 more bag to give this product one more month to show me something.  I want to believe this product works & is exactly what it says it is.  The product didn't come with a scooper and I don't have an exact table spoon measure so I've been using a scoop cup from a previous protein brand.  Judging from my research on Google, it seems that a scoop typically holds 30grams of protein powder.  But this doesn't mean that the amount of actual protein in that scoop equates to 30 grams or even 27 grams as the label on the bag indicates is in a single serving.  I found a site that said 1 scoop of whey isolate contains about 17grams of actual protein.  So if I go by that, I'll have to increase the amount I put in my drink to 1 1/4 or 1 1/2 scoop of the Bulk Supplements whey protein isolate in order to get approximately 30 grams of actual protein.Alright, I have decided to order one more bag and increase the amount of powder I put into my drinks.  I will update this review a 3rd time when I've completely run out of the product.  In the meantime I've docking this product 1 star and bringing it down to 3 stars.....for now.  Stay tuned for my next update.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW (JULY 15, 2016)I just received this product. It arrived quickly and on time. The package was as described with no damage and zip locks completely.Given that I just received this product, I can not yet say how effective it is. I can say that it mixes with water or juices very well and very quickly.  It doesn't have a taste but I can tell that I've added something to my fruit juices or water.  I use an automatic juicer to juice veges & fruits & then I mix in this whey protein powder.  I've been using it for a week.  I'm giving it 4 stars for now & will update after a month's use to determine if I'll add a 5th star or dock it some stars.  I can say right now that I don't feel bloated after taking this supplement much like I used to with other protein powders and protein drinks I'd buy from the store.

So far I've tried Bulk Supplements unflavored, unsweetened Casein, Whey Isolate and Egg White. I always use unflavored/unsweetened protein powders in my fruit smoothie recipes because I get plenty of flavor and sweetness from ingredients other than the protein powders, and the minimalist protein powder ingredients allow me to avoid excess sugar. In addition, I love that the Bulk Supplements Whey Isolate powder does not add any off flavors. Its milk-like scent is not apparent once blended into a smoothie, and it enhances the richness of the dairy I use (usually plain yogurt or kefir) which makes for a very satisfying smoothie. I use a Vitamix to blend the smoothie, so I have not noticed any chalk or grit. It does foam up when blended on highest setting. To avoid this, I blend everything but the protein powder on high setting, then add the Whey Isolate and blend a few seconds on a lower setting. With Bulk Supplements' great options in packaging sizes, I was able to try more types of protein powder without a huge investment. It turns out that Bulk Supplements Casein worked better for me than the Whey Isolate, because it held my appetite far longer. However, Whey Isolate is still a super product, and if I mix half / half with Whey Isolate and Casein, I can get the best of both fast and slow acting protein.I don't have anything too critical to say since the product is effective, the price is great and the packaging is not fussy. My only hesitation in repurchasing is that I am trying to avoid soy, and many of the Bulk Supplements products include soy lecithin. I would prefer either sunflower lecithin or none. Regardless, this is a super product for those who want control over what goes into a smoothie or other high protein snacks. My ranking of Bulk Supplements protein powders I've tried: 1-Casein, 2-Whey Isolate, 3-Egg White.

Whey is a component of Milk Protein, with the other being Casein Protein. Whey may be healthier than other forms of protein. The benefits of whey are due to the protein itself, while casein may be a better muscle builder.Whey protein is one of the two proteins found in milk, with the other being Casein Protein. When a coagulant (usually renin) is added to milk, the curds (casein) and whey separate. Whey protein is the water-soluble part of milk.Whey is used as a protein supplement. It is very useful for hitting targeted daily protein goals. Whey is absorbed faster than other forms of protein, which means it also increases muscle protein synthesis used to break a fasted state.Whey also delivers a large amount of the amino acid L-cysteine, which can alleviate deficiencies that occur during aging and diabetes, as well as other conditions. While whey has also been claimed to increase fat loss, this is a function of protein, rather than the whey itself. This means that the whey itself does not reduce fat, but taking in more protein often aids with fat loss efforts.Whey does not harm the liver or kidneys, but it can exacerbate pre-existing damage. People with damaged livers or kidneys should exercise caution when increasing protein intake quickly without the guidance of a doctor.If you are an athlete or highly active person attempting to lose body fat while preserving lean muscle mass, a daily intake of 1.5-2.2g/kg bodyweight (0.68-1g/lb bodyweight) is a good goal.If you are an athlete or highly active person, or you are attempting to lose body fat while preserving lean mass, then a daily intake of 1.0-1.5g/kg bodyweight (0.45-0.68g/lb bodyweight) is a good goal.If you are sedentary and not looking to change body composition, a daily target of 0.8g/kg bodyweight (0.36g/lb bodyweight) is a good goal.

We began working out seriously at the beginning of 2016 and found that eating relatively healthy and working out 4-6 days a week was not really making our bodies change as much as we hoped.  We then decided to include supplements into our diet and the main supplement was whey protein (the others are a multivitamin and fish oil). The first 4 or so protein powders we tried were flavored which made the switch to drinking protein shakes easier but these flavors sometimes were not very good and the powders tended to have large amounts of calories. Also, flavored protein shakes make it difficult to add ingredients like veggies since you have to take the flavor into consideration. We decided to switch to an unflavored powder and found  BulkSupplements Whey Protein Powder Isolate in Amazon. This is the second bag I've purchased and we love it.  Although unflavored it does have a very slight vanilla taste, but you do not taste it once mixed with other ingredients like greens or fruits.  It mixes very well and it is not chalky like the other brands we tried.  The 1Kg bag of Isolate is the same price as a 1 Kg tub of cheap concentrate from Walmart. Only issue is that the bag is sometimes difficult to close as the zip is not the best quality.  Not a big deal as I just roll the bag closed. This is a great choice for those that are looking to gain lean muscle while keeping both calories and money spent low!  We already have a few other BulkSupplements items in mind to purchase as they all have great reviews and I suspect we will be very happy with their quality.

As far as the description of the product and past products I have received from BS, they work as expected and the purity is as good as how my body deals with it, which is also good so far.  I have purchased many different supplements as I make my own pre workout.  So far I have created the best pre workout I have ever had, and I have about 20 years experience using supplements.  So I know the supplement I buy work as they should.  I wish I had a lab in my kitchen where I can test the purity of all these products considering the supplement world is so chaotic and dollar driven.  Like many of you, I do not trust China products or anything they lay their hands on, but you can only get so far with that.  Which leaves me only with the trust of the company's integrity.  I have to trust that they test their products, and I understand some issues may fall through the cracks and reach consumers..that's business.  But as far as a company to consistently stay on top of their products so to protect their consumers, I trust them so far.  The whey tastes clean, I'm lactose intolerant and only experience very light if any bloating and inflation when taking this product.  Remember it is only 90 percent isolate, so 10% has a percentage of lactose which falls inline with the amount of irritation I feel, which is not much.  I continue to take it because it gives me better results than plant based protein with less bloating believe it or not.

I will get straight to the point with this review. I have used tons of protein powders over the years, and within the last 2 years I became very concerned about where my protien powder was being manufactured. Upon doing tons of research on brands strictly made is the USA, and testing many of those brands out I have chosen Bulk Supplements as my go to whey. It is sourced and manufactured in the USA, which first and foremost was the most important factor to me. Now, I am not a body builder by any means, but I am a woman who has always excercised and weight lifting has been a part of my fitness regimen for the last 7 years. At this point I know my protien powders and my body and it’s recovery times well enough to say without a doubt that this is a great protein. I can see an increase in strength, and a reduction in recovery time. I find this powder mixes very well. I mix it with room tempature water and I have no problem getting it to dissolve. I do not “make protien shakes” as I feel the protien serves a purpose, and that’s to help repair and rebuild muscle not casually sip for enjoyment as one would sip a cappuccino or cocktail. With that being said I do not mind the taste. It is a flavorless powder. Does it taste good? No. Does it taste bad? No, it doesn’t really taste at all, but then again I’m not drinking it for pleasure.....I’m drinking it for purpose. Over all for the price and performance this is the best you can get, and it’s made in the USA!!!
This is a good protein powder. Mixes great with my coffee!

My son has a bad habit of not eating before school now that he's 16.  When I offered to make breakfast he's usually just not hungry yet because it's so early. So I knew it was time to make sure he got his protein and other needs and then easy to do way.  So I researched and researched what do I need to get, what would be best for his need.  That's when I came across the way protein.  The first time I decided I was going to be the guinea pig so I made a protein shake and it came out fantastic. I could not taste the powder in anyway, and I didn't notice any foaming.  The next day I tried some milk and I put a little chocolate powder in it.  I stirred it up and had no clumping issues, and I still could not taste the powder. This stuff is fantastic! It's so easy to use  and whatever you want to make on the go. I had no stomach problems no issue. So the hard part with my son notice. So over a week I made smoothies, and did different drinks.  Everything I made he thought was fantastic. I showed him  The protein powder and had him read the information on the bag. Finally my son is taking the time to put the protein and a drink or make a smoothie before he's out the door. And I know in my heart he's getting the things he needs. I cannot thank Bulk supplements enough!!!  Don't change anything you've got a great product!

I've been supplementing whey protein into my diet for the past 6 years and have tried many big name brands but have always had issues with them. Whether it be price, taste, texture or how they would make me feel. I'm not the type to care whether they have artificial sweeteners or not but I must say that I would find the flavors to grow old on me fast and or would downright taste awfully fake this preventing me from wanting to finish the tub. I finally decided to give Bulk Supplements' unflavored Whey Isolate a try as I could mix it with whatever I wanted to adhere to my taste preferences.I have to say that upon opening the ziplock bag it came shipped in I could immediately tell the level of quality protein this was. It's texture is incredibly fine and fluffy. Needless to say its mix-ability is incredible. As its unflavored, the only thing you really notice is a light milky texture it adds to whatever you are mixing it with. This will continue to be my go-to protein supplement moving forward and I can't wait to try the other supplements Bulk Supplements offers.My ONLY criticism is that though I find the quality of the storage bag exceptional for the most past - the ziplock portion is not. Maybe it was just my bag but the zipper did not create a seal that I would feel comfortable with keeping the contents inside without spilling out if tipped over. Luckily I had an empty 2lb container from a previous protein I had taken so I just poured it in there. Problem solved.

Good 90% whey protein that doesn't have all the added stuff. The seals on the bags could be better. I transfer the bag into plastic containers, but I see it being a problem for someone wanting to scoop from the bags. doesn't come with a serving scoop

This is my first order from BulkSupplements. I had tried some off the shelf protein powders from shoprite/trader joes before, but most of them didn't agree with me. After some online research, I switched to pea protein which worked well for most part except its very caulky taste. I have recently been following advice from a nutritionist who suggested that whey protein is the most easily digestible and complete of all protein supplements. Being a vegetarian, it is a must that I supplement my diet to reach my protein goals. Despite fear of digestive issues from switching back to whey, I decided to give it a try. What was important was to look for quality and clean products. This protein powder is clean, mixes easily with any smoothie without leaving a taste (although I prefer it with water, straight). It's protein-carb-sugar ratio is ideal as per my nutritionist (over 20 grams protein and and less than 5 gram carb/sugar). I like that it has no added flavors (just pure whey isolate, with a bit of soy lecitin as an emulsifier, but it is GMO sourced as per some research so I hope they get rid of this) is from a grass fed source and low in calories. I often still use prain old greek yogurt as my post workout protein, but this is a nice addition to my attempt at clean eating and getting enough protein. My only complaint is the packaging. The zipper portion is flimsy and doesn't adhere well, so I was forced to invest in a jar and transfer contents.

This product got so much hate in the reviews that I ended up buying a different whey protien powder just in case.So, the product I purchased was the 250g bag.  The bag itself is stuffed full, and would not reclose because of the protein stuck in the plastic recloser.  So I put it in a container and moved on.There was no weird smell.  It smelled very lightly like powdered milk.  The taste was a bit neutral to me.As others have pointed out, there is no scoop.  The serving size is listed as 30g, or about 2.5-5 tsp?  I guess mileage may vary on people's teaspoons.  If you are looking to hit specific macro numbers, you might want to get something that definitely comes with a scoop, or invest in a metric kitchen scale if you don't have one.  I don't have one, so I did my best.  I mixed about 2 tablespoons in with some peanut butter.  It tasted just fine.  Also, I did not get ill like some previous reviewers have described when they used this product.My biggest complaint then is the product came with no clear way for me to measure a serving size.  I'm going to guess most people have scales,though, so overall the product is fine.
Been using this now for a year, it has been pretty consistent so far. Not much for taste but to be expected for not having all the extra ingredients that is not needed.

I used to buy various 10lb bags of more mainstream brand whey proteins. Since trying this specific whey protein, I've been convinced that I'm going to stick to with this brand for the foreseeable future because of a few pros for my situation:1) Cost - A few more servings per bag as compared to other brands of comparable size.2) Size - Slightly smaller size compared to other brands of comparable size. This makes it easier to store in my small living space.3) Convenience - Whereas a lot of proteins are made to be mixed with water in shaker bottles, I've found that I can just mix this in with juice or other drinks (that I'd be drinking anyway) without it clumping, skipping the use of shaker bottles altogether. I found other whey proteins to be too full of fillers that clump to be able to do this.The only one con I have to mention is taste. Without fillers and taste enhancers, this protein may not be agreeable to some people's palates. From reading the reviews, there seems to be two camps of people: those who don't discern any taste and those who find the taste horrible or unpleasant. I found the taste to be very slightly unpleasant if mixed with water. However, the protein's taste will be overwhelmed and unnoticeable if it is mixed with anything that has even the weakest taste, like juice.

I don’t eat sugar or other sweeteners, but I wanted to increase my protein, and this is exactly what I needed. I mix it with cold water in a blender cup, and it doesn’t taste like much of anything. Not bad at all, just vaguely milky.

We got a great recipe for chocolate peanut butter protein muffins that called for protein powder.  In scanning around, we weren't sure what brand would work best in a baking situation, so we tried this product.  It blended perfectly with the other ingredients and really added no odd flavor or texture to the muffins - which turned out to be the bomb.  My overall issue with any protein powder is that the pricing is all over the place, but felt this was fairly priced for the quality delivered.  My only problem with the product was the zipper seal not working after we opened the bag, but that was solved by a paper clip and putting it into a separate Ziploc bag.

Great Product!This is just a review of the product's taste and mix-ability. The serving size is 30 grams, but for those of us that don't weigh our whey it's just under 1/3 of a cup. 1/3 of a cup is 5 1/3 tablespoons, and the bag indicates that 1/2 a tablespoon is 3 grams. Times .5 by 10 and boom, 5 tablespoons. Now that that's out of the way, the term "unflavored" is being thrown around fairly loosely. This whey has the taste and consistency of coffee creamer. That being said, it really goes well with most liquids because it really just adds a milky taste.So far I've combined the whey with:1. Water - Not great. It tastes like instant milk, but if that's your thing, have at it.2. Milk- Not bad, it makes a thicker, creamier shake. Fairly unnoticeable flavor.3. Milk or water with chocolate Nesquik - Great! So far this is my "go to" post workout shake. Tastes like any other chocolate whey.4. Orange Juice - Pretty tasty. It kind of tastes like a cheap Orange Julius.5. Apple Juice - Nope! It may just be me, but milk and apples don't pair well.Overall I really do like this product. The powder dissolves easily and I haven't had too many lumps when using a blender bottle. It can be combined to take on new flavors, which adds variety, because there's nothing quite like getting half-way through a five pound container of "orange creamsicle" whey just to get sick of the taste.
I like that it’s flavor is basically nothing and don’t notice it changing my smoothie much. The bags suck and don’t reseal.

This is by for the most clean and pure protein I have come across.  I was unsure so I only ordered 250 grams, boy do I wish I had ordered more.  If you aren't looking to break your bank and over spend on protein this is the way to go.  For those that don't know much about the different types of protein out there....Whey Isolate is one of the better routes.  It is some of the most pure and digests the quickest (best for post workout).  If you are looking for a protein that will fill you up for an extended period of time, don't go isolate.  Instead aim for a blend/concentrate or casein.  Personally I tend to get hungry at night so I will drink a casein shake slightly before bed so my body can continue to grow as I sleep or have it in the morning for breakfast.  I received my Whey Isolate quickly and as advertised.  It is very rare that you will find a 90% protein powder, heck it is rare to find anything over 80%.  After all the flavors and fillers added to most big name supps.  Once again if you aren't looking for that candy flavored protein, this is the route to go.  Just straight whey taste, smooth silk iso texture, and if you need flavor add a little ice cream sauce :-)I highly recommend.  Looking forward to trying other products by BulkSupplements.

Finely powdered - mixes easilyGood valueBag is technically resealable, but the zip-lock kind of sucksIt doesn't come with a scoop and the recommended serving is in weight so I had to guestimate -about 1/3 cupWorks well - I had been lifting for years without supplements when I hit a plateau and decided to start. It's been about a month and my muscles are noticeably bigger, and all of my lifts have gone up in weight. Additionally I used to be tired all of the time and never realized it until I started supplementing protein, now I have much more energy and recover more quickly.Only an ingredient - I discovered the hard way that all the reviews about it being "tasteless" did not mean it was a good standalone shake mix lol. The first time I tried it I mixed 1/3 cup in about 8oz. of water and it was so gross I nearly threw up... twice. But if you mix it in OJ it goes down ok and it's actually pretty good in chocolate milk. This didn't work well for me because I needed something that I could just mix in water at the gym and be on my way. I have since ordered a different protein shake mix, but I supplement it with a tablespoon of this.

A little faint flavor but a pleaseant one,  seems a little like milk since its whey concentrated.  Its more convenient to buy the 500gr. bag because it last a month for me that I train four times a week with weights and take the supplement these four days and one more the day when I rest.  I use two scoops in a day.  One after training and one before going to bed.  I am also combining lately (few days ago) with the Creatine from BulkSupplements of the same presentation 500g.  aproximate 8 grams a day.  About the results I am very happy and satisfied  with.  First of all my stomach doesn't suffer at all when I take the Whey, it settle very well ,  no heartburn at all,  with creatine its different because I feel a little heartburn for, lets say..ten to fifteen minutes after I dirnk it,  then I feel normal again.  I have notice improvements mostly in my muscles definition so I am very grateful to God, and then with this excellent and great quality supplements that has no added chemicals to its flavor but the natural one.  I have to remind you that the changes you want to see are a result from hard exercise and a suitable supplement like the one from BulkSupplements which is my first option today.

I've tried a LOT of protein powders over the years, and this is my favorite.  Most protein powders come flavored, so you are limited as to how you mix it.  For most of my life, this was not an issue as I was the only one making protein shakes, and vanilla flavored protein powder worked for me.  When my kids became old enough where we wanted to throw some protein into their sugary shakes, I had to deal with their tastes as well.  One wanted vanilla or fruit based shakes and one wanted chocolate.  And all of them disliked the taste of the flavored protein powders.  So the unflavored protein powder from BulkSupplements was the perfect solution.  It mixes well with whatever flavor shake you want (chocolate, vanilla, berry, banana, etc).  I mixed it in milk, and I could barely discern any flavor.  And none of my kids has complained about the protein in their shakes.  My only issue, and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5, is that I cannot stand the ziplock on the bag.  It's essentially useless.  I just fold the top over and use a bag clip to keep it closed.
I couldn't get it to blend it was chunky

I had been searching for a "plain" whey protein that doesn't have any sweeteners or other flavors added. I finally found the product to meet my needs. I first bought BulkSupplements Creatine which lead me to investigate their other products, which lead me to the Whey Protein. I have never liked flavored Whey regardless of brand or flavor. They have always left that nasty artificial sweetener aftertaste. And sometimes I prefer getting a little more simple carbs in and to take an already too sweet protein shake and add more sweetness isn't an option for me.After buying the 1KG of Whey, I have added it to pancake mix and other foods that my kids like to boost their nutritional value for me and them. I've even added it to biscuit mix and I honestly can't tell a difference. Obviously you don't want to eat like that all the time, but I'm pointing out it works. Mix the whey with the dry ingredients first and you'll be good to go.I normally use the whey with 16 ounces of whole milk and 4 tablespoons of NesQuik (for additional carbs) and one teaspoon of BulkSupplements Creatine after my morning workouts for my first meal. I do this instead of breakfast simply for convenience because I don't eat before my workout. If you are looking for no bull crap supplements, you can't go wrong with BulkSupplements.
Too expensive
I would buy again

I love the minimalist packaging of this company's stuff.  No dumb weapon/explosive bro-names and logos (I'm looking at you N.O.-XPLODE, C4, Force Factor® VolcaNO, Jack3D, Pump Fuel v3 INSANITY, MusclePharm® Assault™, GNC Beyond RAW® RAVAGE™, ERECTION JOE'S SUPER SICK XPLOSIVE BRO-TEIN (ok that one I made up), etc, etc, etc).  I hope they keep it this way.As far as the actual product, I haven't been using it long enough to give a real in-depth review for this reason: I had face-melting farts with Whey Concentrate (Optimum Nutrition), and I've had none of that with this.  Everyone around me is appreciative.  The amount of protein you get without all the other junk they put in the concentrates is great, and you don't have to worry about not liking a particular flavor and needing to choke it down to get your money's worth.  This stuff, thus far, has effectively disappeared, flavor-wise, in the stuff I've put it in.Here's a great way to consume this stuff (how I do it at least):  Take a banana, some vanilla greek yogurt, some peanut butter, and some lactose-free milk (I've been using that new FairLife Chocolate Milk aka "Coke Milk" because of the increased protein), and a scoop of this.  Throw it all in a magic bullet or equivalent and you've got a delicious protein shake that doesn't taste "good for a protein shake"- it tastes straight-up GOOD.

BulkSupplements seems to have made a great and affordable "Pure" Whey Protein Isolate supplement. This is only my initial reaction to the product, as I have yet to have time to see any results (1 week). The lecithin really helps this powder break down smoothly in any liquid. (sub 120 degrees, don't want it to curdle) With only two ingredients, there is next to no taste, and can be a transparent addition to any shake or juice. I personally drink it in plain water before and after my workouts. The best description of the taste in water is if you were to stir in a couple of tbsp. of milk into 20oz. +/- of water. It is easy to drink and you're avoiding all of the other byproducts contained in other heavily flavoured powders.The packaging is somewhat of a letdown, but I personally don't care... There is no scoop and the "zip lock" on the bag is already full of powder when you receive it, so you'll never be able to use it.Summary: 4 stars due to the lack of time to see results and poor packaging. If it does the job it will be hard to beat this isolate @ $0.02/gram.

Product received fully intact and closed, not as some others have complained about. Day 7 of taking 2 servings per day. I'll give another update within 4 weeks. I've taken a ton of different protein powders being a vegetarian for 23yrs now and here's my review.PROS:Love the bag it comes in. Better for the environment rather than a large plastic container and easier to store in the refrigerator.Zero taste. Zero aftertaste. This is of huge importance to me.Not chalky at all, smooth consistencyDissolves very easily in water with just a spoon and zero clumps (see photo)Mixes well in a blender with fruit and recovery powder (see photo of pink drink)Zero gas. No stomach upset. I'm lactose intolerant so this is a big deal as I often have sensitivity issues. Although I think it may be causing mild stomach bloating but I'm still weeding out foods to determine the culprit.Powder is dense, it has a firmness to the texture of the powder so it doesn't easily blow all over the place and make a mess like a lot of powders I've tried.CONS:The zip closure part of the bag doesn't seal great. So I roll it over and use chip clips to keep it sealed. Not that big of a deal.Overall this is a fantastic whey isolate.

****Update 9 January 2017****No changes.  I'm on my fourth bag of Whey Concentrate from BulkSupplements.  It has fully replaced my more expensive Isopure.  It still has the same taste, mixes well, and helps just as good with my recovery.  I still mix mine only with water, but occasionally add some flavor.  I recommend trying a wild variety of flavors like lemon juice, part of a Noosa or Chobani yogurt.  You get the idea.  Anyway, I intend to try some of their other products.  Let ya know.****Original Review Below****BulkSupplements CLEAN Whey Protein Powder is as good as a more expensive whey powder I purchase & use (Isopure Whey Protein Isolate, Unflavored).  BulkSupplements mixes slightly better than the Isopure.  Both smell and taste almost exactly alike (I mix mine with water only, no flavor).  I have not experienced any issues (unexpected bowel movements) or other physical issues people have mentioned.  Additionally, my package was in good shape.  I ordered this with another container of Isopure so I could compare them side by side, daily.Summary: I will be replacing my more expensive Isopure for BulkSupplements.  I will occasionally try another protein to keep everyone honest.  Let you know if anything changes.

I make pancakes, breads, muffins, etc. with this stuff. I've even added it to my sauces.Anyone who does protein SERIOUSLY (as in 1.5g for each lb of LBM) knows how hard it is to get that much protein in a day. I personally would have to eat a dozen egg whites, eye of round lean beef and chicken breasts for all 6 of my meals to get to that much protein. Enter protein powder. I buy two kinds: A flavored for my shakes and this product for adding to much of my cooking.Fantastic quality from the always reliable bulksupplements.com .  Ordering and delivery was top notch.

I can't tolerate one serving of powder without having severe cramps and gut issues. If you want to supplement protein intake, this is an isolate, the right stuff. Try the 3 oz portion to see how you digest it.

I have tried just about every combination of proteins available from various companies. Out of them all, I enjoy bulk supps clean whey. The consistency is of water, tasteless and you can easily mix 60g of whey isolate in one shaker bottle and flavor it with BCAAs and it's not like drinking pudding. Not only does it mix well but you can put it in anything you want and it has a higher protein per serving ratio than the leading competitors. From optimum nutrition to machine whey and animal whey, Bulk supps beats each brand by 3-4g of protein per serving. Only downside is you have to use your own scoop or measuring spoon/cup. But the serving size (amount of powder) is less than the others that I've tried. Instead of only being able to fit one scoop comfortably into a shaker bottle, I can throw 3 of bulk supps in it and I'm fine. Without a blender spring and it still mixes perfectly. The only downside is the bag it comes in, it'll pop open sometimes but that's no big problem, I'd prefer the current bag over spending a few extra dollars for the same amount of whey. Regardless, it's my new favorite protein while I'm on season or off season of bodybuilding or powerlifting.

I got it for free to do a review.  i use powder mostly in my morning shake with all kinds of greens and too many powders and herbs to list here, and also at night before bed because i sleep better on a less than empty stomach :)my fitness protocol consists of full body weights once a week, tabata (10/20) once a week, hot yoga 3x a week, and the tread climber 3x a week.  basically every day i'm doing some kind of exercise and if work gets hectic and i don't have time, then at the office, i take the stairs down 8 stories to the outside and walk around the pond.  so i'm not a fitness fanatic but i do try to move my lazy IT butt at least 20 minutes daily.anyway....- mixes well with almond milk, with no lumps in a glass with plastic fork- no sugar = mild vanilla flavor, so i use stevia or fruit like bananas or berries- no added sweeteners or flavorsI already bought another bag of this.  Since the chocolate pnut butter stuff i was buying from amazon raised their prices again, and their cookies and cream is no longer available, i believe i've found my next house protein powder.  good price for good stuff.pic attached.

I recently bought this product, because I cannot stand the taste of flavored protein powders like optimum nutrition, for example. While that product is just fine, the taste really bothers me - so I decided to try something that didn't have any artificial flavors and I came across this product. A lot of people complain about the taste, but to me (and this is very subjective) I would rather drink this than all that flavored stuff out there. I noticed this product foams/bubbles more if you leave it in the blender for too long, but I just put it there for 10 seconds and it mixes really well.I usually drink it with 2 cups of milk, so it is pretty diluted, and there isn't really much taste at all. Sometimes, I mix in half a scoop of optimum nutrition chocolate flavored protein and it gives the drink an ever so slight chocolate taste without any weird after taste. With that said, I don't mind drinking the product by itself at all and will definitely use it as my go-to protein.I also like that there is no weird chemicals or other bogus whatevers in it, it seems to be all natural whey which I really appreciate - and that is a huge added bonus.

Love this protein powder, it mixes really well into my morning breakfast smoothies and no funky after taste.  I've been using it every morning and replaced my old protein powder with this.  It's a much better buy for the price and without any weird after taste or residue.  I'm definitely going to be making a regular order of this product in the future.  The only thing I would say for any one buying this; if you don't already have a storage canister, I would get one as the zipper to the packaging can be a little difficult.  Aside from that though the product is flawless, it wasn't clumpy or packed together when it arrived.  It dissolves easily into liquids compared to other protein powders and makes a great meal substitution when paired as a smoothie-helping fill you up and not be hungry 5 minutes later.  I've managed to lose 3 pounds in the last 10 days of using this with no additional changes to my daily routine, just replaced my old protein powder with BulkSupplements.  Seller also responds VERY quickly if you have any questions or comments and they are very efficient and polite.  I'm already planning on replacing all of my current supplements with their products.

I have not been paid for this review...I was overweight (obese I think is what it's called) for the last 2 decades and have struggled to get my health back the past 6-7 years. Then last year I found the right combination of nutrition, exercise, and supplements. I have been using protein powder (as well as other) supplements the past year as part of my nutrition for weight lifting/strength training.After using flavored ones (chocolate, vanilla) and not really liking the after taste I searched for an unflavored "clean" substitute that I can add to anything. After trying this product I can say I think I found my "winner winner chicken dinner"!!! No bad aftertaste... in fact no taste other than a slight hint of milk. AND it mixes and dissolves completely and can be added to just about anything. I now use it daily in my meal replacement shakes and it also seems to add a nice creamier texture to the shakes. My current favorite is a vanilla meal replacement shake with a scoop of Bulk Supplements Clean Whey Protein, a cup of fresh squeezed OJ, and a cup of ice. Tastes like an orange whip shake but has all the carbs and protein my body needs either pre or post workout.

I bought this brand because I like the other products I have purchased from them, and I was looking for an unflavored protein powder with more protein grams per serving. This one has 27g protein per serving (9 more than my other brand), is unflavored and unsweetened, and it mixes up into milk without clumping. I had no clumps stuck all over the inside of the glass like my other brand of whey protein (which is concentrate, not isolate like this product.) I feel like I'm not wasting product and I'm getting my money's worth. Just be careful when opening the bag- it's vacuum packed and whey will fly everywhere if you don't open it carefully. I saved the container from my other protein and transferred the contents of the bag into it, and I kept the scoop too. A flour canister would work as well if you don't have anything else to put it in. This whey protein has not upset my stomach like other brands I have tried in the past so I am pleased with it. I think the lack of fake colors, flavors, and sweeteners helps with that a lot.Update: My nails are growing noticeably faster since I've been using this product so I can tell it's doing the job.

I was looking for a pure whey protein. One that does not include vanilla or chocolate flavoring and all kinds of additive supplements. Just plain whey if you please. This product is it. Other than an unidentified amount of soy this product is pure whey.  The soy is probably soy lecithin which is commonly used as an emulsifier. The product comes in a thick foil package that is quite strong. It can be punctured by a sharp point but but is unlikely to get ripped or to burst. When I opened the package it had a minor musty smell. But after it aired out for a while the musty smell was gone and the product has  a sweet fruity smell. I store it in the refrigerator. The powder has a very fine texture and is light and fluffy. I add it to my morning cereal mix. It mixes well with the other ingredients. Since it is so fine and fluffy it takes more volume for the same amount weight of  the powder I previously used.  It is an an Amazon Prime product and the price is good. So I will continue to use this product and recommend it to anyone who wants pure whey but can tolerate some soy.

For months I have been searching for a good clean protein and I have finally found it. This product is great if all you want is simply pure protein. Overall after sampling this product in different settings it is wonderful! There are just a few things to make it only have 4 starsPros:Clean protein (no artificial sweeteners or added carbs)Taste (not really bad, but does not have "no" taste which is impossible)Arrived quicklyExceptional customer serviceCons:(more aesthetic than the actual protein)The bag does not close wellThere is no scoop (thus leaving me measuring out protein on a food scale and using one of my previous protein scoops)You cannot mix this with water ( I am sure others have but unfortunately, I could not tolerate the milky water taste it created. It does mix well in a smoothie, juice, and oatmeal.Overall, it is a really great product.UPDATE***** After now around 6 months of using this product I have found that I will never use another protein powder again. This is a wonderful company and this protein is simply just protein. I love that it's clean and flavorless so I can add it to anything! So glad I found this product!

This protein is just fine. I was starting a new 12 week program and needed 5 scoops of something per day. Went with this and am completely happy with what I bought. It is unflavored (though as another reviewer mentioned it does have a powdered milk kind of taste...which isnt bad, but its not "delicious," its just protein water haha). Since it is unflavored, I mix this with my pre and post workout powder, which makes it easy to have everything at once, and not have to have a separate shake for all of them.The only reason I don't give it a 5 star is because it is crazy frothy. Put a scoop in with water, mix it up, and you get about as much foam as you do liquid. I just drink the liquid and wash out the foam...no harm. Just odd. If you need bulk protein, can't go wrong with this stuff.

After researching different protein supplements, I decided to try BulkSupplements Whey Protein Powder Isolate, mainly since isolate is supposed to have better bioavailability than the powder, and because of reviews stating that it had the least offensive taste. That's certainly true, for me at least. It does have a taste - I can't exactly put my finger on it, but it kind of vaguely reminds me of plain yogurt, but not as tangy. I'm on a medical weight-loss program that includes a low-carb diet - my most recent body composition analysis showed some muscle mass loss, so I'm trying to increase my protein intake while keeping carbs at a minimum. So far it's been easy (and tasty) adding the powder to my cold drinks, smoothies, and yogurt concoctions. It mixes well, and the mild taste is easily hidden by the flavors of whatever I'm mixing it into. Unlike a lot of other reviewers, I haven't had a problem with the packaging. I let the contents settle for a day after I received it, then carefully cut open the 1 kg bag. No giant poof of powder. Instead of trying to zip the bag, I rolled the top & used a bag clip. I'll be purchasing this product again!

Definitely saw some results after going to gym whenever I could and ate a sufficient amount of protein. This stuff, is tasteless, meaning it's not pretty to gulp down. I'd mix it with cocoa powder or something of the sort or blend it in with fruit smoothie if it's that intolerable for those others out there. My weight was more or less the same throughout the whole time.A minor thing I'd like to note is that it started to make my protein shaker smell funky as I use this product. One day a bit of the powder actually coagulated into some adhesive state, almost like wet gorilla glue which took a couple of runs in dishwasher to actually get off!Otherwise I think I could've seen better results due to my lifestyle choices. I'd definitely buy the 20kg bag next time as soon as I completely exhaust this 1kg bag, as well as re-evaulate my lifestyle *cough cough ALCOHOL*

This is a very clean Whey Protein powder mix that does not have all of the additives like some of the other protein powders out there. It is very easy to mix and does not have a thick or heavy after taste at all. I mix mine up with some soy milk, yogurt and fresh fruit for a great smoothie. If you are looking for something with more flavor I would suggest making sure you order one with that already mixed in as this one has zero flavors but that makes it good to add to multiple juices and such. That just makes it have a thinner texture than a traditional protein powder but again that is good if you mix it with a juice as well.I would give it 5 stars except for the packaging. The zip lock type bag can be messy after opening and the fact that it does not come with any type of scoop makes it more difficult than it should be. Besides that, it is a very good and clean protein mix.
tasteless mixes easily, I have tried it in pancakes, and oatmeal. does not alter the taste or texture, plus it is a good value when buying larger size

I am not a professional body builder but simply someone whom tries to live/eat healthy......for most of the time. I've tried a few other protein products that you can easily find on the market either online or in store. Unfortunately, either ended up with upset stomach or the taste is just terrible to deal with. Plus, for those of you who've been using protein, you would know some of them are hard to mix well and the chunky feeling is not enjoyable with the disgusting taste. Things being said, this protein is fairly nice product. It practically doesn't taste anything but it's not EXACTLY tasteless. When it's mixed with Gatorade, it does alter the taste a bit but not disgusting. When it's mixed with juice, same thing. One big thing I appreciate is the fact that it dissolves EASILY. I put them into juice, stir a bit and let it sit for couple of minutes, it's completely dissolved. All I can tell is that there is a little foam on top, no chunk or particles left behind. I have not used it for long enough to share whether this is good for muscle building/recovery yet, but if it is, I will definitely stick with it.

So far I used Gold Standard from Optimum Nutrition and in comparison the Golden Standard has better taste and so far it was better blended in the protein shake. I put this BulkSupplement only twice into blender and once somehow a lot of protein stuck together into small balls that tasted like tasteless bubble gums. And also a lot of it remained glued at the bottom of blender. This is the bigger problem for me so far and this is why four stars.As for the taste - as I said it is tasteless and somehow I can feel the difference even though I put a lot of different ingredients into my shake. But it is actually my own choice. The better taste of Gold Standard comes from additional ingredients, including sucralose and artificial flavors and it also has bigger sodium content. So I think I will continue to use BulkSupplements because it is one of the purest proteins (at least as declared). I didn't remove stars because of taste as it is natural "sacrifice" here.

I never appreciated protein powders that are loaded with dangerous artificial sweeteners and flavors. Being a health conscious person, I wanted something that is pure and clean, so I thought I'd try this brand.The first disappointment when opening the bag was not finding a scoop ! Anyway, because I had scoops from other whey products it wasn't a big problem. However, the powder is not easily measured in a scoop because of the fluidity of the powder, so better weigh the serving on a scale.The taste and smell are slightly unappealing, but the powder mixes very well, in fact much better than other powders I tried lately.Bottom line. Whey protein does not have to taste good, whats important is the protein content. Flavor can be enhanced naturally by mixing with milk and adding cocoa and sugar. To me, a few calories more  is better than a low calorie shake filled with dangerous artificial sweeteners. I recommend this product to everyone, and I'm planning on using it again.

I was interested in switching to a clean protein because all the added chemicals and flavorings in other proteins had a tendency to make me feel a little sick.  The sweeteners added always taste disgusting to me as well.  I've had this product for a couple weeks now and I love that the product is flavorless so I can add extra protein to my almost any meal.  Add it to oatmeal, coffee, cereal, soups, and of course the ever favorite smoothies.  I will say that it does not blend the easiest with just a spoon as it tends to leave a few powder clumps, but it blends just fine with a shaker bottle or blender.  I've definitely had proteins that blended worse, and in all fairness, I've never met a protein that you could blend smoothly with just a fork or spoon.  My only real con is that it did not come with a scoop, so I'm never sure exactly how much I'm getting.  (Unless it's buried somewhere in the bag!)  I've already recommended this to several of my gym friends, and some strangers as well.  I will definitely continue to purchase this.

I've used a couple of different brands of protein power in the past and they always ended up with a horrible chemical aftertaste. After some digging around for other options I decided to give whey isolate a try instead since isolate has less lactose and fat in addition to not having the sweeteners and artificial flavorings that regular protein powders have. Since I've had good experiences buying from BulkSupplements in the past, I opted to go with theirs and I wasn't disappointed.The isolate fresh out of the bag is a bit grittier than non-isolate whey powders but it dissolves much more easily in liquids. I'm also happy to report it doesn't have the nasty aftertaste either. Others have described the aftertaste of the isolate as "slightly milky" and that is quite accurate but it is subtle enough it doesn't overpower. The serving size of 30 grams translates to two tablespoons of powder and each serving has 27 grams of protein. The only ingredients per the package are diary derived whey protein isolate and soy lecithin used to emulsify.All-in-all it was a great purchase and I will buy this again. It is perfect for mixing in smoothies and yogurt to give them an extra protein boost.

The product came shipped as described. This is my first order from Bulk Supplements. I have only recently started researching bulk products. I am a 23 year old male and I am very active with physical activity. I have tried many products and spent a decent amount of money over the years. Having recently gotten very tired of all the marketing hype that is associated with fitness products I started researching bulk, clean and verified for purity products. I like that the recipe is very simple and that it seems to not have very much additive. Pretty much just pure protein (hopefully). I drink it with Chocolate milk so I still get a chocolate protein shake, and I use just about 30 grams using a previous protein box's scoop. Overall the taste is great, and it mixes very easily. I did try it with water the first time and that was not exactly the greatest taste, so I suggest using milk or chocolate milk for sure. There are probably other ways to get the chocolate flavoring but for now this seems to work fine for me.Overall Great product, love the fact that it is straight forward and simple with the ingredients.

I was somewhat skeptical of reviewers that claimed this powder could be mixed easily with juice and you not taste the powder.  Having used many products over the years I was used to clumpy, odd tasting powders that had to be mixed with something in order to make the shake tolerable. A product's taste is very subjective and even though the last product I used was well reviewed I did not care for it. I figured it was worth trying something new and I really wanted the other reviewers to be correct.I mixed a single serving with orange juice in my shaker bottle and sure enough it was barely noticeable.  The same was true when I mixed it in Greek yogurt with some fresh fruit. I could not taste it and it did not add a gritty texture to the yogurt as other products have.  It is just what it states, "CLEAN Whey Protein."  I did not realize just how much "flavor" was in all the additives used in other brands.  I guess not tasting is believing.I like the hype-free packaging. BulkSupplements could improve the bag by widening the base as it tends to fall over.  A 2 KG option would be nice as well.

My main purpose in purchasing this protein was to help my daughter's defenses, which I found just by chance that happened with whey protein, as well or maybe better than Vitamin C. The brand I was using and trusting was discontinued in my country, so I urgently needed to find a good replacement. And BulkSupplements's just passed the test with flying colours!First and way most important, my kid has not catch even one flu or any other infection within 3 months that I've been using it with only 5-6 servings a week, which is a great success.Secondly, but not unimportant for a child, it has no taste, so she can combine it with any of her fave flavours and it doesn't change them, even with just plain milk. And please note, my daughter has a very sensible nose/taste!Third, it dissolves super-easily into warm milk, but also easily with fridge-cold milk or yogurt. It doesn't do well with hot milk, though.Fourth, the price can't be beaten.Fifth, the service and delivery was flawless.I tried but I couldn't find a sixth thing to ask for, so this is perfection for me. I feel very grateful with the provider and I would and had definitely recommend it to anyone.

There are very few products I feel I am qualified to review as an absolute expert!  Protein just happens to be one of them - as an avid Ironman, marathon and cycling participant = protein is a core ingredient for all aspects of my training.  I utilize multiple types of protein (Whey, Whey Isolate and Casein) for different aspects of my prep and different amounts depending on time of the year (bulking or cutting) and even time of day ((whey and whey isolate morning and post workout and casein for evening).  There are very few protein brands and types I have not tried - the key for me is a protein that is as close to 4 calories per gram of protein and very few "fillers" with a quality range of BCAA's (Branched Chain and complete Amino Acids). When I saw Bulk Supplements Whey Isolate and reviewed the product content I was eager to try and I'm glad I did!  The overall structure, taste and value are unsurpassed in the supplement world and that is saying a lot!  Since my initial Whey Isolate purchase I have added CLA, DHEA, and Casein Bulk Supplements products and completely satisfied with every product!  Great work Bulk Supplements!

I love this protein powder!#1 you get an incredible deal : it’s “isolate” whey for less than the price of generic “concentrate”.#2 it’s pure and free of any additional macros therefore you can add ingredients to it based on your Macros. Add milk for extra calories or low calorie nut milks for reduced caloric intake.#3 texture and taste wise it resembles baby formula and that says a lot about the quality.#4 tips: if you are using this to reach your daily  protein needs on a fat loss faze, do yourself a favor and don’t drink your calories. Do not drink this as a shake unless you’re really in a hurry. People should eat food more than drink smoothies.Extra tips: take one serving of this protein, add one egg, 1/2 tsp of baking powder and 1 or 2 tbsp of water and mix well. Preheat your waffle iron and pour this mix in. In about 3 minutes you’re left with amazing low calorie protein rich waffles that taste amazing.Enjoy!

I purchased this product to supplement my daily protein intake. I am a woman who practice a ketosis diet and perform high intensity interval training along with other strenuous physical activities. Needless to say, my body requires a great deal of protein! I have found this product to be a fantastic way to accomplish that end. I mix it with water in a blender bottle and drink it up. It has a little bit of a taste, but I do not find it to be offensive. It kind of tastes like powdered milk, go figure! I love that it does not have a bunch of ingredients that not even chemists can pronounce. It has caused me some GI bloating, but nothing that is too terrible. I will say that my spouse also drinks it in the same manner as I do, and he has had many troubles with heartburn afterwards. That being said, he has ameliorated this side effect by taking pre and probiotics daily (which are just a good thing). With those supplements, he has had no issues.

Pros-Good value-Very pure and good source of just protein. 27 g of Protein, ,< 1 g of Fat and Carbs per serving.-Mixes well and fast-Almost tasteless if mixed in with something sweet (ie. Smoothie)-Doesn't clump too much after shakingCons-Bubbles after shaking it in a shaker bottle-Tastes terrible if just mixed with water or milkConclusion: Overall, its a good value for the price, considering how much product you receive and what it contains. I generally use this as my morning protein and mix it in with a smoothie. The only big issue I had with this, is it tasting terrible if i mixed it with just water or milk. It might be just me or the milk I was using as I saw other reviews that claimed it would completely dissolve and have no taste regardless of what it was mixed in. Aside from that, good protein powder, and good product to get JUST protein in your macros.

I think the protein has done it’s job. This was my first protein ever and I think I picked good. I’ve had days where I’ve used it and days I haven’t and I think it’s shown. Obviously it’s hard to tell because growth also relies on your routine, but I do see growth. So it does its job as a protein. As a Mocha flavor though, it’s debatable. It is good, but it has this aftertaste that I don’t really like. I’ve had it with water, milk, and a smoothie but the aftertaste is still there.
