I like chocolate so that’s why I got it, but maybe consider a different flavor. Another thing, this may be a user error but every time i mix it there’s always some clumps of the powder. I don’t have any fancy shakers or anything I just use a fork or just shake the bottle really hard. (I usually find the shaking method better) Overall, I would recommend but maybe try something other than the chocolate flavor
Ami hija le gusta
I use this everyday.  I wish it had a stronger flavor but I just put a scoop of peanut butter in it. It mixes well, but I do mix it with ice in a blender because I put the peanut butter in it.

Everyone knows Optimum Nutrition is the best protein powder on the market so I'm not gonna say anything about that. My review is about the reviews claiming this is fake. Mine, too, came without a seal. This did worry me as older protein powders from ON came with one. So, when I ran out, I ordered directly from ON and it came without a seal as well. The only seal the company direct one had was on the outside of the lid and it had the normal shiny hologram on that plastic seal. So, you don't need to worry about it being real or not because it is confirmed that newer ON protein tubs come without the inner seal now.
The cappuccino flavor taste much better than vanilla.

Obviously optimum nutrition is a known name, im happy with the macros, the protein content but mocha cappuccino is a difficult flavor to swallow. Even when making a protein smoothie, its difficult to hide the cappuccino flavor. Its easy to mix as well.Yes to macros, no to flavor
Used it after i went to the gym .. iv been using this product for years, its really good

This is my 3rd Mocha Cappuccino and LET ME TELL YOU!!!! This flavor is 100/10 and even better with milk. It very indulgent and like a sweet treat that I just want to keep sipping. If you are tired of chocolate and vanilla AND like a bit of slightly sweet coffee flavor, GET THE MOCHA CAPPUCCINO!  It blends really nicely by shaker or handheld mixer. Good with water (aim for 6-8oz or less for better flavor...unless you feel like consuming more liquid?) but try it with your choice of milk. Adding in an espresso shot makes it even better :)

Got the Mocha Cappuccino flavor. As expected, the package arrived in a box and the product safety tampering seal was dislodged and stuck in the lid (this is caused by heat separating the glue, as long as a white paper is inside your lid then it had a safety seal at one point). Some brown paper was used to prevent rolling around but otherwise nothing else (and nothing else needed).My review will include a couple of the important points, but I won't go into too much detail.Previous powders used:Body Fortress Super Advanced Whey Isolate -- ChocolateElite Series Whey Protein -- Strawberry SmoothieCompared to the Body Fortress, the mixing is easier and isn't as clumpy. It's also for some reason easier to digest (a lot less burping and no upset stomach). The Optimum Nutrition (ON) tastes less strong, so it can definitely be used with something like peanut butter and you'd barely to moderately taste the protein.Compared to the Elite Series, ON is about equal in mixing but is still a little less clumpy. The taste is night and day; much, much less "fake" flavor. Digestion is many times better, the Elite Series would make me sick to my stomach and I eventually just gave up after using half the container.I give it a 4 because the flavor doesn't really replicate mocha cappuccino. It's a very mild cocoa flavor, with a bit of coffee as an aftertaste. If you've ever had semi-sweetened watered down cocoa, that's about the flavor I would say this has. Smooth texture, easy to consume, and I definitely recommend it as a versatile flavor that can be consumed joyfully by itself or with additions (like a banana and peanut butter) without making it taste like an awful nutrient concoction.

Mocha is the way to go... I love the taste.  The mocha cappuccino flavor leaves no funny aftertaste that some protin powders do and its not overly sweet....it actually quite delicious.  I substitute my mocha shake for my second cup of coffee so I thought this flavor would probably work best.  I am NOT very hungry when I wake up in the morning so I have used this to replace breakfast so they don't usually even eat by mixing it with 8oz almond milk and a tablespoon of red powdered maca (also very delicious and less expensive from nuts.com). This gives me what I need for my afternoon workouts.  A 2lb container contains  28 servings based on a 6-8oz shake and the scoop is 32g in other words no gigantic shaker necessary.  There is 120 calories and 15mg of naturally occuring caffeine per 6-8oz serving. This is meant to be used as a food supplement not used for weight reduction in other words replace one of your meals with it and the eat a balanced amount of protein throughout the day. Alergen precaution: it contains milk and soy (lecithin)ingredients.  I will probably try other flavors just for the experience but I am perfectly happy with this flavor and will return to it if I don't find something I like even better.  I would totally recommend this product and flavor for anybody wanting a yummy protein shakes the only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because you would think that you would get more serving for 2 pounds at only 6-8oz servings.

I'm switching from 0 carb isopure and let me tell you it has always been a struggle for me to drink supplements because of the taste. I've only ever used isopure (strawberries & cream) and it's been my daily shake for years on and off after working out. The problem was I could never stay consistent with it because I hate the taste. I only liked isopure because it was zero carbs and 50g of whey protein (2 scoops). Sometimes after a hard workout I wouldn’t mix any isopure because the taste made me gag.So now here I am with optimum gold standard and I can’t believe I ever forced myself to drink disgusting things—for so long! This shit actually tastes good and I can’t believe it. One scoop contains 24g of whey protein and matching isopure’s serving size of 2 scoops—it’s basically 50g and that’s all I need.Let me say this again this actually tastes good! This is a drink that one can definitely stay consistent with. I believe a consistent diet is truly the key to massive gains.Note: I’ve only tested the mocha cappuccino so far and it tastes great cold and at room temperature.
Tried the mocha cappuccino and it's not my favorite,  May be for others that like chocolate flavored powder.

My husband and I love this protein powder! 5 stars!! I have tried many. Not gritty. Great flavor and taste great iced or with almond milk. I don’t get excessive bloating or dare I say gas with this brand. Totally great value!

I loved the flavor, I have opted for a subscription too.Love the variety of flavor it has to offer.It is amazing to make protein smoothiesAdd some berries and nuts and you are good with your breakfastIt is light to consume but keeps you full for a long time.
This protein powder is delicious. If you like cold brew coffee, I suggest adding a splash to this. It makes it even better. It mixes very well in milk and is not gritty.

The flavor is SO YUMMY!!!! Sometimes I like to add a little bit of coffee, for a special, extra little kick. Like most protein powders, it does take a bit to blend it well, but the occasional chunk of powder isn't gritty like most other powders. Absolutely recommend!!
Love it as my morning shake.

Taste way better than I thought it would and goes well with either water or milk [i prefer the latter]. Scooper was deep inside of the powder so you have to dig around for it. Look forward to buying again.
Had to buy this after my other brand was discontinued. Definitely was delicious and now I’m hooked on this one
I put mine in coffee in the morning taste great, good way to start your day.
The powder tastes just fine but Amazon sent the wrong flavor which is a bit disappointing when spending some decent coin on protein powder

I'm new to protein powder so if you're looking for professional/advanced advice, I don't have it. From the reviews and various columns praising this stuff I've added this to my regular workout routine. I must say it makes the before and after affects of exercise feel much better. Overall my body feels good and I don't feel like I've "worked up" an appetite right after I'm done. So in essence it's helped curb snacking or the need for wanting to fill up on food directly after a workout while trying to lose weight. For newbies like me, the jar is sold by weight and not the size of the container so don't freak out if it's not filled to the top with powder. It comes with a little scoop inside that may be buried under the powder. You also might want to invest in a "shaker" bottle to mix the powder in liquid. I started off with stirring it first and it still tasted okay. As for flavor, the Mocha Cappuccino flavor isn't bad at all. It doesn't carry an aftertaste and it's a tolerable enough to drink more than once a day. These days I don't even taste the Mocha anymore and it's become just a foamy liquid drink to me. I highly recommend.
Worst tasting protein powder I’ve ever had. 👎🏻
Love the brand and this flavor became my top 3

In need of a new flavor, I ordered the mocha. I was going in blind on this brand, having never tried it. The price at the time of purchase was great, the reviews lined up well sso I purchased. And I'm glad I did. The taste was good but not flavorful, however,  a big improvement on other brands. Chocorute remains the flavor king in my opinion, but this one is up there. Abig factor for me were two things: servings and price. The serving count is strong for the price, throw in the mix the quality ingredients and good taste, this is a steal for anyone looking for a new protein powder. A bonus is that it consistently mixes well, hot or cold. Will order again.
I have yet to find a protein powder I like more than this. I like the mocha flavor because it’s not overwhelmingly sweet. Blends easily into milk/water.

My issue with previous proteins is lumps. I hate lumps. Cannot stand lumps and it was a crucial part for me to have a good blending.And it has! It has! It is amazing and I can give it 20 out of 20 just for having that. Shake it for 30 seconds and you will be happy as I am.As for the nutritional aspect... well, I was recommended that protein by our nutritionist and I believe she knows her stuff.Had a Mocha flavor, I am trying rocky road next :)

ON was a recommendation I found through research of protein powders and their effectiveness. This stuff has an average taste {for protein powders} and does what it is supposed to.The two slight problems I have with it are that it smells awful when added to liquid (hold your nose while drinking), which is expected but also the container of powder could be half the size. It’s what all companies do I guess; use large containers for advertisement. It could be the same container used for their five pound powder because you get this container that is probably ¼ full of powder. The large container takes up space and makes it unlikely to fit in cupboards but it works so I guess it can just take my bed.So really it gets five stars because this product does do as advertised, if you work out you will see additional results with the use of this product. Fight through the smell and if you are serious into getting big then get the five pound powder, it’s usually worth it. I do like the Macho Cappuccino flavor but I will try others in the future and update this post to tell you how that ends up tasting.

Only get the Mocha Cappuccino if you are into black coffee. Like coffee ground and water only. It was ok at first but it was unbearable for me to chug the rest of it down. The smell is strong and hits your nose. (Could just be me with a sensitive nose).

I feel like this mocha cappuccino flavor would taste way better with milk , it's definitely better than all the walmart brands. It has no clumps and mixes pretty darn well. As for my journey to find a good tasting protein with water ,we will have to keep searching.

I think this is the best favor out of all available favors here. This is my first time using protein powder and buying this favor is so good (with milk) that I treat this like eating ice cream (of course; in this sense, you would be indulging every morning and night haha). But I never thought these protein powder would taste great at first (always thought they taste like your grandfather's medicine flax drink and you would have to stick it up and drink it). This is the best protein out there in the market, only about 1g of fat which is nothing (I usually put two scoops with milk filled to the brink on my blender bottle after a intensive weigh lifting) and 46g of direct protein! This will make your muscle's lean and even more!I recommend getting the the ON Casein Protein powder (take this when you sleep which will slowly digest the protein overnight for your muscles to grow/stay at that level) and ON Creatine Powder sustains muscle, so you should check it out.usually Bodybuilding.com has a cheaper deal on ON products (because they are the top-selling distributor on the internet forums)

Product:Optimum Nutrition is and has always been a leader in protein, it does exactly what whey protein is supposed to do and without the marketing of additional supplements not typically necessary for the average person ...I said average before you fanboys jump down my throat.  This is my first try with the mocha cappuccino and it's actually not bad, I may actually mix it with a little cold brew coffee and ice tomorrow morning.  No, O.N. isn't the best tasting protein but it's not terrible and it works great!  It's also a flavor that's not bad by itself and it mixed really easily.For those of you complaining about the vanilla(s), here's what I suggest that has made it one of my favorites:• 1 Spoonful Almond Butter• Honey yogurt (I prefer Trader Joes)• 1 Banana• Ice• Almond Milk (or regular if you prefer)• I sometimes throw Blueberries & Strawberries in the mix.Shipping:Ordered Saturday night, arrived in time for post workout Monday evening. Gotta love Amazon!

I love this powder. It tastes great. I mix half with strong coffee, cashew milk and ice. It blends so fast, tastes great and no nasty burps. I feel great after replacing breakfast and sometimes lunch or dinner. I have more energy, feel much better and I will buy more. I do want to say I have health issues and it's helped me.

There's a few things that I look for when I'm looking at purchasing a new protein.1.  Cost per gram of protein:  5/5 this product is one of the most cost effective protein supplements on the market, inexpensive to fit into your daily regimen .2. Mixability: 5/5 I have such a tough time when I get lumps in my protein, it's terrible tasting and makes me not want to drink it. When I was using this protein I noticed no lumps, even after putting it down for a few minutes.3.Taste:  5/5 The chocolate flavor is the best out of any protein powders that I've ever tried.  Still leaves a little to be desired, but it's really good.  Beats all of the competitors in this category.
I’ve tried many different types or protein powder and they all tend to have this powder nasty taste. However this brand it is very tasty! I love it
Flavor was great and mixed good

Omg you should do this recipe with this protein after a hard workout ! Literally taste as a milkshake!Protein + ripped banana + 1/4 cup whole oat + tablespoon of peanut butter!! And a lil of almond milk plus ice crushed !! Omg omg to die for! I love the flavor and also the texture and it blends so easily!! I’ll buy it again

Just received it a couple of days ago, I had not been working out due to a hamstring injury so I was eager to get back into a routine and I was looking for the right supplement.  It seems like they are too expensive, or so cheap they taste like crap, and most are full of artificial ingredients. I ordered the Mocha!  Mixed with unsweetened Almond Milk, half a banana, and one tablespoon of peanut butter, it made one of the best protein shakes I've had.  It does have a small amount of artificial ingredients, but is mostly whey and cocoa, which I like.  Compared to most other protein supplements, short of buying pure whey (which is hard to choke down) this is a better option in my book.I have the 2 1/2lb. container and at one shake a day it seems like it will last awhile.  All in all, not the cheapest or maybe the best, but in my opinion it is easily the best value for folks looking for a protein supplement to their diet.

I love all things mocha, but this is one case where the traditional chocolate flavor shines over mocha. The taste of the mocha cappuccino powder seems artificial and just leaves me wanting for real coffee and caffeine. As usual, Optimum Nutrition provides a high-quality protein with a formula that is easy to blend with a shaker bottle. My only qualm here is the flavor.
By far my favorite flavor!!

This is a fine protein powder but I ordered the mocha flavor based on many good reviews, I gotta say its pretty underwhelming. No coffee flavor at all, tastes off-chocolate to me. I was using a Premier Protein Latte flavor that I liked much more than this.

I bought recently the mocha cappuccino and it taste’s great!!! Not synthetic at all!!!I must admit that I was not sure about the product at all because I already tried the vanilla flavor and the plain one and Both of them had horrible synthetic tasteWill definitely buy again the mocha cappuccino!!

I just received my order and it was crammed into a box far too small for the container. I thought about returning it in fear it had been tampered with. Then, I opened it and there isn’t a scoop? Weird. The mocha flavor is so good though.

In all my two years of drinking different proteins not one has tasted as good as this one. Usually I choke down whatever protein im taking only because I know I need the protein. Not this one. I actually enjoy drinking this flavor so much I forget its for protein purposes.

Pretty easy choice... high quality whey protein, majority isolate but with some bcaa and other building blocks which is not a bad thing despite a lot of the "100% isolate" hype. Great for immediate pre and post workout. Get a casein/blend product for morning and nights and you're set. The flavor of the mocha cappuccino is awesome. The double chocolate also very good but I think I like the cappuccino even better. Mixes easy and digests easy. Slighty more expensive than some other great options too but they call it gold standard for a reason ;)

You cannot go wrong with ON protein, as long as you get the flavor you like. It works, it gives you a good amount of protein per serving, it mixes pretty well with anything and does not get chunky, and it is very affordable.

If you're looking to get more protein in without a bunch of extra junk, this is the stuff you want. I rarely enjoy protein flavors but the Mocha Cappuccino is quite good, it's more of a coffee aftertaste but it's not gross at all. Can help cravings a bit as well, if I drink one instead of going for candy it curbs the desire for sweets. Grab a blender and you can make some great smoothies as well.A heads up, the rim seal does come off sometimes. It may look like it was unsealed but if you flip the cap over you'll see it in there. Happened twice to me so just a heads up.

My absolutely favorite go to protien powder and flavor! I blend this with my plain iced coffee every morning and it is perfect! Blends perfectly and leaves no powder at the bottom of my cup. Taste is fantastic and if you are a coffee lover you will love it!

I've tried several different protein powders, and this one is my favorite by far. It's perfect for what I'm looking for, which is a good tasting powder to supplement, low in sugar, and reasonable in price. My favorites are the Milk Chocolate and Mocha Cappuccino, both of these I think taste great just mixed with water or almond milk, and the chocolate tastes great mixed with various fruit or peanut butter. I also like to blend a scoop of the mocha, some ice, a cup of coffee, and some almond milk which makes a delicious after workout treat or a quick breakfast. There's no chalky texture or weird aftertaste with any of the flavors I've tried. It's also not overly sweet and is low in sugar. I definitely recommend this powder, and it works perfectly for my goals.

My personal trainer recommended the Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard 100% Whey Protein Powder. The powder blends well water and is not gritty. It does not taste like  Mocha Cappuccino, but taste okay for 120 calories

I'm a hard-gainer with an overly lean frame, so I knew I shouldn't skimp when it comes to whey.  Been using the Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard for several months now, and it's the best whey isolate I've ever used (but that's common knowledge anyway, there seems to be a consensus in the fitness community that this brand is the best).The Mocha flavor is really good, the best one I've had so far out of three (Strawberry Banana, Double Chocolate, and this).  As I said, I'm not a coffee drinker, and this is still my favorite.  Protein shakes always still manage to taste worse to me, compared to a standard milkshake of the same flavor.  This one was different - something about the coffee flavor does a great job of masking the "protein shake" taste.  Mix this with milk and it tastes just like a coffee-flavor shake from a creamery.

Tastes really good! I was surprised, especially since I don't usually like the taste or texture of whey powder.  I put this in the Silver Bullet with ice cream and milk for milkshakes (for the kids), or with just soy milk for myself.  My kids are picky, and they really like it.  It mixes in easily in both cases - no clumping or dry powder residue to deal with.  Now I have higher protein content and much less sugar in my daily shake, compared to the Carnation Instant Breakfast I'd been drinking for many years. And no, I wasn't compensated in any way for this review.  This is a good product and I'll definitely order more.

Mocha Cappuccino.  With unsweetened Vanilla almond milk it tastes like powdered hot cocoa.  Pretty delicious.I do recommend if you dont use a blender,  to let it sit for a few mins after using a shaker or stirring like crazy. The lumps will disappear after a few min sitting. Blender, otherwise, no lumps that way.

I'm pretty skeptical about protein powders because of the texture.  This one has literally been my all time favorite and I will use the entire tub instead of throwing it away. It's that good! I mixed it with water and coffee instead of milk/almond milk. The texture is so smooth and not grainy or Powder like one bit. I will definitely be ordering this from now on. It makes it easy to mix with my coffee and substitutes my creamer for taste. Yum!

This flavor is delicious! Sometimes I just want to drink it without doing any workout at all just because it tastes so good! It even throws off my workout routine because all I want to do is drink it when my workouts are over. So you know, faster workout = quicker protein intake = happy belly.In the time I've used this, I did see a lot of change in my physique. Though I will forever have a fat build, I was finally able to, for the first time in a very long time, see through my fat and see my thought-to-be-non-exsistent muscles. I think this works. Still delicious though.

If you're a fan of creamy coffee drinks, then chances are that you're going to love this protein powder.  It's good enough with just water, but when you're looking for more substance & you add milk, that's when it becomes downright amazing.  When mixed with milk, this protein powder seriously rivals drinks like Starbucks Frappuccino drinks.  Perhaps the coffee taste isn't as strong as those drinks, but it's definitely there and it's good.  Hopefully I didn't overstate how tasty this protein powder is, but I'm just stating my personal thoughts on it, so take them as you may.  In all honesty, it's hard to go wrong with Optimum Nutrition when it comes to whey protein and this is a perfect example of another great flavor from them.

I have never had a protein powder that I actually enjoyed drinking until I tried this one.  I chose the mocha powder and just mix it with water with one of those mixing cups with a wire ball.  It mixes better than my previous protein powder which would leave un-dissolved balls  which were disgusting.Do wash your cup mixed your drink in right away or it starts to smell.  I usually make it in the morning and drink it in the car.  If I don't take it in at night it really stinks the next morning.So, with both taste and consistency this is probably the best protein powder I have ever tried.

Really like this FLavor. It has a very natural flavor where the cookies and cream was ok, but a bit too sweet.  Next to the double chocolate flavor this is my favorite.  And all the flavors I have tried have blended very well.  Note,  I do mix these with either milk or almond milk rather than water.  So you will have to check out other reviews as far as how good it would taste blended with water.

This is probably the best tasting protein powder I’ve ever tried. It blended great with just cold water in a blender bottle with the wire whisk ball. There was barely any detectable unwanted aftertaste. That alone makes this easier to sip and enjoy versus chugging it to avoid nasty chalky yucky aftertastes with other protein powders I’ve tried. Finally, a sip-able protein. Another great plus is the caffeine. This is definitely going to be my take along breakfast for work. Thanks for a great product.

I love the brand I've been using it for years. I love the mocha flavor but I also drink a lot of coffee. So if your a coffee lover you should enjoy the mocha. I also use the mocha to blend and make a coffee smoothie. I use vanilla greek non fat yogurt, almond milk, 1 scoop protein, 1-2 cups of coffee cooled off not hot. Sometimes banana and cinnamon.

I’d you’re looking for a protein powder that is true to its flavor with no bad aftertaste, this is the way to go. I’ve mixed it with water and the flavor is prominent and does not seem diluted at all. Not overly sweet, but definitely gives the taste of a coffee flavored beverage. Easily mixed, although when chilled it will begin to stick to the sides of the container. Give it a quick shake and you’re good to go.
Tastes so good, I got the Mocha Cappuccino flavor and it’s amazing. Dissolves easily
I absolutely LOVE this protein drink mix it mixes well tastes GREAT what more couldyou ask for really

The media could not be loaded.
                



 I have used other Whey products which is why I know that it's not supposed to be only filled to like 60% of the container capacity when you first open it. Haven't tested it yet but this first thing I noticed wasnt fun.

Purchased the chocolate mocha flavor - it is very subtlely flavored with mocha AND chocolate. Flavor is alright, mixes okay, nothing special. It reminds me (with milk) like one of those Starbucks Mocha Frappachino drinks that come in a glass container.I can't really comment on the end results of this product, as I always felt funny after taking it. Bloated, gassy, stomach cramps. I made some protein cookies with this and felt the same way after eating one. I'm a 27 year old female that strength trains 6x a week, and I've tried a few protein powders. This is the only one I have found that does this to me. I would prefer my higher priced protein powder (1st Phorm is my go to, and all flavors are INCREDIBLE).

I have tried many different protein powders and this is my favorite. It blends smoothly, has a great taste, and is definitely worth the money. I have been struggling with energy levels and being able to put on that extra muscle that I was looking for but every since I tried this product I have been able to increase my gains and increase my energy levels.

Don't get this if you're sensitive to caffeine, I purchased the Mocha Cappuccino flavor and nowhere in the pictures or ingredients did it say that it contains caffeine. When I got it, it said on the side it contains 15mg of caffeine per serving. Disappointed.
Tastes so good in milk, but also tastes good in water. The ingredients are very good. This is one of the best in the market.

Quality wise the is one of the best and most trusted brand in the business. You are getting everything they claim on the level plus more. One of the few company's that does not spike their protein. They own there own dairy farm in America so you don't have to worry about them import their protein from outside our country. I only give it a four star because it is not the worst tasting protein but there are other protein that taste much better.

My main issue with protein powders has always been flavor, so this review is mostly about the flavor, as the protein content seems fairly standard.Flavor is not a problem with Optimum Nutrition! Even in water, I have no trouble getting my protein shakes down. I have tried several flavors so far and have not been disappointed with any of them:Mint Chocolate ChipDouble Rich ChocolateMocha CappuccinoI am writing this review as I drink my first protein shake made with the mocha cappuccino flavor. It is, by far, the best flavor I've tried up until now. If flavor/texture has ever been a problem for you, try one of these Optimum Nutrition protein powders; you won't be disappointed!
Tastes just like the chocolate one but thats not necessarily a bad thing.

I have only had the Mocha Cappuccino flavor but that alone is worth 5 stars. There is no cruddy after taste and real coffee is actually one of the ingredients. I actually crave it randomly on my rest days and will mix it in a blender with ice and some milk as a "treat." Highly recommend. I am trying the Rocky Road flavor next as I've read that it is one of the best. If you're considering Mocha Cappuccino, you can't go wrong. Very happy I found this stuff, even if it is a little pricey it's definitely worth it. Adiós Six Star, Body Fortress, Muscle Milk...

I'be tried 3 flavors from this brand: vanilla, double chocolate, and mocha. My favorite so far of them is the mocha! It doesn't have a super strong chocolate flavor, but still has that coffee-y type of flavor profile I'm looking for. It's definitely more flavorful than the double chocolate too. The vanilla is pretty sweet, so I like to add this to my ice cream, pancake batter, and smoothies instead of injesting it. The big container lasts fairly long and more than 60 servings too (I do a flat scoop vs. a rounded scoop).

Best flavor of any whey protein brand I’ve tried in the past 2 years (Mocha Cappuccino). I plan to buy the banana cream next. Mixes very well in water (better than Isopure and Bulk Supplements). Tastes excellent when made in protein pancakes/waffles! Just mix a scoop with 2 eggs and baking powder and top with sf syrup before devouring. Perfect for cutting on PSMF/Keto/low carb - and the price! 👌🏼👌🏼
Flavor and consistency great but no scooper was in the container.

I usually buy this at GNC, but I like having 2 day shipping with Amazon Prime especially since I just moved and don't know the area. Good product, have used it before. Using it to help me add breakfast to my routine. I normally don't have time so a protein shake with a little bit of green powder and probiotic. Yum. Bought a pack of two shaker bottles. I make them the night before.

I mix with water and some crushed ice in with blender bottle only for 30 sec.  Comes out like a slightly frothy iced mocha....love it!  Never clumpy, no mix problems....only issue is wife has broken into it because of the flavor :)

Flavor for:Strawberry Banana : meh, not great, but doesnt make me gag.Machiato : Pretty decent. Smell wasnt too great but wasn't appalling, just has a weird coffee bean smell too it that I don't like.For the strawberry banana container, there are small clumps of powder sitting at the top even after shaking, but maybe that has something to do with the seal coming off immediatelywhen I first opened the container.Other thoughts: I like the product no doubt about it, I just wish the consistency didnt feel like I was drinking water. I like my protein shakes a little thicker without having to blend fruits and other stuff into it.
Tastes great and mixes very well with almond milk. Would definitely buy again.
The jar came to me already opened. I had to throw it out for safety.
Tastes like protein, mocha is nice, but there is no escape from the protein

Flavor is on point. I love the taste. This whey protein is not heavy on the stomach. The French vanilla creme tastes pretty good, especially when blended with strawberries and bananas. I have no complaints with ON and it's flavors as of right now. I would buy the mocha cappuccino again.I have tried the syntha 6 protein (not whey protein) and noticed that it was heavy on my stomach.  It's the same amount of scoop compared to ON but noticed the consistency was a bit thicker. Gave me a slight tummy ache. Maybe because it's meant for a meal replacement rather than a post work out.
It is good but in my opinion the best flavor is double rich chocolate but the warm one is unsurpassed like most ON products
This product was received half full. This is a SCAM, why the big container, if the content is only half of it??Although, Good taste and good blend, but that half content ruins it all.
Tastes great. A good alternative flavor to just chocolate.

I got this product after getting a taste of the Caramel Toffee Fudge which I absolutely loved! I decided to try something different and went with the mocha cappuccino. It isn't Starbucks but it's also not overly sweet or fake tasting (does that even make sense...??). If you like coffee then you might appreciate this one! Minimal clumping in shakes so far which is awesome.I only give it 4 stars because I for sure like the caramel toffee fudge more. :)

I've tried a lot of different proteins and have a pretty fine threshold for taste tolerance (too sweet, etc.).  Mocha Cappuccino is a pretty subtle coffee-ish (frappachino?) flavor and is easy to consume daily.  I find all the ON gold standard flavors to mix fairly well.  Thinking this might be my go-to flavor for awhile.
Flavor not good ,
I enjoy the cappuccino flavor and drink it daily.

It's one of the better powders that are out there, though I was expecting more of a coffee main flavor rather than chocolate main flavor. Dissolves pretty well, and does not leave you feeling weird after you drink it. It tastes fine if you like chocolate shake flavor, and it has a slight coffee taste to it. Does not taste strange or fake. Satisfies your hunger for several hours. Good product.
Best protein powder I’ve ever had. I got the Mocha flavor. Mixes so easily with anything. I do two scoops with hot coffee and oat milk + ice. Tastes like a Starbucks drink!

I bought this product for my husband. He has now finished the product. He wanted something that would help provide nutrients as he is working out more now. I believe the product is ok, but I think we were looking for something that would help him bulk up a little. It did not help with muscle mass but it did provide energy. I have used the product as well but not as much as him. I don't believe it taste like cappuccino so much as I was an avid cappuccino drinker. It more has a vanilla and chocolate mix kind of flavor.

If you are buying ON then you already know its the gold standard when it comes to protein.About the flavors:Everyone is different but I am not feeling the mocha capp.Lets talk about the Choco Mint though... this tastes like liquefied Thin Mints and is all around deliciousI have tried the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor as well and it is a good flavor to base off of to make, for example, fruit protien shakes.

Absolutely love this brand & the mocha cappuccino flavor. It's not overly chocolatey & has a suddle coffee flavor which I love. I usually blend it with a cup of unsweetened almond milk & it comes out perfect every time! I always make sure to keep a tub of this stocked at home.
The mocha capp. flavor is fantastic. I also got chocolate but it's not near as delish. I mix it with a bit of almond milk and sometimes iced coffee and it's a sweet treat.
I tried this for weeks and stopped it after. It was more on the side of artificial flavours rather than Moccha Cappucino. I'd recommend go for double chocolate.

This review is for the Mocha Cappuccino flavor.Overall, I am very satisfied with this product. After every workout, I mix milk with a scoop of powder and mix it with the Blender Bottle. The result is a clump-free, scrumptious concoction that I end up chugging in a matter of seconds. The flavor is great and, as stated by many other reviews, tastes like a less sweet but delicious Starbucks Frappuccino.I'd highly recommend this flavor and brand. I've had a try of my friend's Banana flavor, and I've got to say it's next on my list!

I bought the mocha flavor and was at first thrown off by the smell.  It smells like tootsie rolls, which I do not like.  However, it has a nice coffee taste, not too strong or fake, and dissolves very well!  I previously used EAS whey protein and it was impossible to get all the clumps out.  This is much better!

This was an okay product it gave me very great pump and energy for the gym but the flavor kind of threw me off a little its not nasty but its not the best either other than that its a great product and I do recommend it for those on a tight budget or track macros just be aware of taste!

First off I very only tried th peanut butter chocolate. When I was looking for a protein I wanted somthing with clean ingredients and little to no sugar. The flavor of this protein is spot on and not overly sweet like so many. I find myself craving it as a snack. I prefer taking with whole milke for extra calories. It mixes well with smoothies.the fact that it has probiotics is a plus. I am also a fan of Jocko and what he stands for. I am very satisfied with this protein. Looking forward to purchasing more of this protein and other products on the jocko line.

The chocolate flavor is probably the worst I’ve ever drank but after the first couple sips you honestly can’t taste it anymore. Just a hint of flavor. I think that has a lot to do with the casein protein in it. Even in the smallest amounts you can never make casein protein taste decent. The nutrients aren’t as good as a brand like Isopure but there are pros and cons.  My review is based on strictly mixing with water, which I believe is the baseline for all powders.Con: not as premium with same vitamins and minerals. Taste is very mild (chocolate).Pros: Has casein protein which is slow release for all day and night recovery. You will absolutely feel full after throwing down two scoops of this. Probiotic in it. Casein protein is notorious for not mixing well but this mixes with no clumps even with the bare minimum of water. So you’re definitely not going to leave anything stuck to your shaker bottle. Low carbs for those on keto.Would I buy this again? No way. Is it a solid attempt at being a high performance premium protein. Absolutely. This for sure would also be a good wind down evening drink. Your body repairs itself at night and this protein blend will keep them gainz fed.Price point is solid for the type of product. So no buyer’s remorse there. The taste (chocolate) just lacks. It’s not bad but it’s not even close to being ok. It’s just mehhhhh. I’m sure if you made some sort of shake with this the flavor profile would be adequate or neutral. Bought and have no remorse but this is it. One and some for me.

I use an immersion blender to mix this up and it blends very well.  The resulting shake (made with whole milk) is creamy, frothy, and absolutely delicious!  None of that artificial sweetener after-taste with this one.  Excellent protein shake; the best-tasting one I've ever tried and it provides everything I need.  Will definitely buy it again as it's cost-effective too.  Some of those other shakes are ridiculously overpriced.

I’ve read all the reviews on here I can only speak for one flavor which is chocolate I feel that’s the safest to go with and that’s always been the safest one I also add it with 1% milk I never do protein powders with water I’m not a big protein powder with water fan also when you have protein powders with milk you get more protein with the milk I also use a shaker that has one of those mixer balls on the inside certainly it took me more shakes to get it to the consistency of other protein powders that I’ve had so I would definitely recommend getting one of those shake mixers with a ball inside and I just shake it up  and it mixes OK the first few shakes I did it was a little bit clumpy not terribly clumpy a tiny bit clumpy and So just a few more shakes most of the very small clumps were gone well it’s not even really a big issue I’m a big flavor guy by the way a something doesn’t taste good I don’t want it I won’t have it  this wasn’t the best chocolate protein powder that I’ve ever tasted but then again this is probably the first one that I’m having without artificial flavor like sucralose in it which I’m not really keen to put into my body I like this because it has all quality natural ingredients the price seems pretty decent and the flavor is not too bad at all you know and I guess if you were mixing it at home you could always throw some strawberries or banana in it and it would certainly enhance the flavor but if you’re just putting in a mixer with water I can’t say  what it would taste like with water or how it would mix with water I’ve mixed it with 2% milk and 1% milk and with using a shaker with one of the balls inside it has mixed no problem little bit more effort than usual on other protein powders and the flavor has been fine as well no issue with that I can’t speak of other flavors I probably won’t order the other flavors maybe I’ll try the mint chocolate at some point but I like chocolate and always find chocolate a safe option. I hope this helps people decide I’ve been drinking protein powders for almost 30yrs so a know when some powders have bad taste and this flavor is just fine

Took me forever to try it but finally pulled the trigger. Great flavor, subtly sweet which is nice because it’s not over powering or chemically tasting. Made in the USA and used by Jocko, what more could you want?Subscribed for a monthly deliver for overnight oats!

Really good stuff. Dissolves beautifully too. Only issue I have is that the banana cream tastes more like vanilla than banana 🥲 4/5 would be 5/5 with more banana flavor. I just ended up ordering banana extract to add

Love this product. I've been using peanut butter chocolate flavor on and off (due to laziness) for a few years now so, needless to say, I really enjoy the flavor, especially as there's no added sugar.
I’m pretty sure this is my first review ever on Amazon. Just had to share that, personally of course, Banana Cream is by far the best protein I’ve ever tried. Flavor: 10/10

So I bought the banana flavor, and this review will be covering that. If you are more concerned about the actual proteins and the stuff inside the mix, and want to compare this between other brands to figure what's best for your workout plan -  then there are other reviews for that... I'm mostly going to talk about the mouth feel and flavor instead! Banana is my favorite breakfast drink/smoothie flavor of choice, and I tend to be really picky with stuff like this, and so far most of the banana flavored powders I've tried have been either wayyyy too sweet, or the banana flavor is so faint I can barely taste it. Jocko mölk however, is not like those other brands! It's very banana, but not too overwhelmingly in a "candy-like" (think Laffy taffy) flavor way, but in a "I blended up a real banana" flavor way - which is what I was craving! Some people love chocolate, and I'm like that with bananas lol, what can I say? I could always blend an actual banana up of course, but sometimes I'm in a rush and milk+powder in a shaker cup is all I have time for, which this stuff is great for! One thing is no matter how much I mix it in a shaker cup, is there will always be a few chunky bits in my drink, but it's mostly at the bottom and that's pretty much a universal thing everyone deals with. When I use the powder in the blender, I don’t have that problem... Anyways, bonus points as Jocko mölk is a funny name, and makes me laugh every time I open up my cabinet and see the label. 10/10 would mölk again!
This is a great product! It tastes great with no nasty protein aftertaste.
I have dreams about this stuff.

I’ve tried a LOT of whey/casein protein powders over the years and every time I end up with stomach issues, not to mention the tastes being weird.I took a chance on this after reading some of the reviews and I’m so glad I did.This is the best protein powder flavor and “stomach issue neutral” I’ve ever used.Great job Jocko and the team who came up with this!
Fairly descent tasting, however does not mix well in your on the go mixer, and leaves a few clumps. Also buyer beware..zero and not eligible for return.
My Go to protein powder!! One scoop a day makes you more productive in every sence of your life!! Get AFTER IT

Disclaimer: I'm biased. I drink Jocko Go energy drink daily and also use one of the supplements. I'm a huge fan of American made products and cutting out artificial sweeteners.Taste: I expected the taste to be below average. I've used several other whey proteins in the past that have been either sweetened with sugar or artificial sweeteners. Monk fruit has a distinct taste, so I was expecting it to come through on the vanilla flavor. I don't really notice the taste of the monk fruit and the taste is fairly bland, which is good for breakfast smoothies.Mix: it blends very well for me. I didn't have any clumping at all. We'll see over time as I get new jars if the mixing stays consistent, but it's good so far, even in a standard shaker.Amino acids: I love this blend of BCAAs. Jocko really puts in effort to make sure each product is top notch and this is no different.
I will use this till the day I die.
I was very skeptical of the flavor, but Molk is GREAT!  So happy I ordered it, will subscribe.

I’ve previously been using gold standards whey protein for years and I’m glad I made the switch to jockos. The flavor is great, and I feel extremely nourished for hours. I love that I’m getting high quality grass fed soy free protein out of jockos product!

I’ve had the choc the choc peanut butter and vanilla. So far the vanilla is my favorite followed by the choc PB but all the products are super clean working great for me. definitely a fan Jocko products.  Thanks for keeping a clean product without the garbage sweeteners.
Tastes great, mixed easily in my shaker. Highly recommended. I'm looking forward to trying banana, that I just ordered as well.
Hands down the best protein powder I’ve ever had. Flavors taste natural, mixes well and digests great. No protein farts with this stuff!

I like the ingredients and branding but the flavor was very disappointing. Chocolate peanut butter doesn’t have much taste of chocolate or peanut butter. I was trying this instead of Ghost protein that I’ve enjoyed.
This is the first time I have gotten a protein where I can actually enjoy the flavor and not have to chug it down before the nasty flavor hits

The media could not be loaded.
                



 Definitely recommend this product. Thanks Joko

I've tried three other Jocko Mölk flavors and this one is surprisingly one of their better ones. I'll usually mix one scoop with a little over one cup of plain greek yogurt for a banana pudding like texture and taste. It mixes fine with my greek yogurt but like their other flavors, it doesn't mix well with water or milk and you'll need a blender. It also works well with fruit smoothies.

I mix the vanilla powder with coffee in a blender.  When I get done blending the volume increases by 4X.  This only happens with the vanilla powder. Strange.  I like the taste and texture but I always need a larger cup to drink it from.
Best tasting protein I’ve had. Legitimately enjoy it.
It’s hard to find a protein powder this clean these days.  Tastes great too!

Love the probiotics which help keep stomach in check which really helps with a high protein diet. Mix this with half a scoop of massjym vanilla mass gainer powder. Trust me. It tastes just like banana cream pudding. Can’t get enough of it and 37 grams of protein go down with ease.
Tastes amazing, replaced breakfast with it and keeps me going til lunch time easily.

I had no idea who Jocko Willink is prior to this purchase and bought Jocko Mölk on a whim based on the ingredients and price, so I think my review is unbiased. This stuff is good. The ingredients are simple and there's a decent variety of protein types and sources. It's very filling and has been great for fighting hunger, especially when blended with a cup of milk (I've only tried the peanut butter flavor so far and definitely recommend it). I've been able to hit my protein targets much more easily on weight lifting days without having to consume large portions of food. I'm trying to burn a substantial amount of fat, and taking Mölk has definitely helped me to reach my nutritional goals and lose weight while building muscle instead of losing it despite being in a calorie deficit.
The best tasting protein around. I've been in the game for over a decade, my only complaint is they don't offer five pound containers.

The flavor is horrible in my opinion.  Almost any other protein I have tried tastes better than this.  But the quality of the ingredients seems to be really good.  So if it actually tasted good I would have left 5 stars.

I bought this because the ingredients were quality compared to most whey proteins out there. I'm not one to care about taste so long as the nutrition is top tier, but this... this is by far the most bland tasting protein I've ever tried. Comparable to CVS brand protein. And it has this ability to counteract anything you add to it and just make it part of the blandness.I like Jocko.I love these ingredients.This tastes like dirt.
Tastes so good. Especially with nut milk

Molk is great! I have to say I really like the overall profile of this protein, I think they really took things down to a granular level and tried to develop a protein that not only is a good protein profile but also to provide you with nutrients and different items that will help with the absorption of the proteins.Now if all you care about is that big number in grams of protein, this might not be the best product for you. If you’re looking for a well rounded protein that will help to curb appetite that will help with absorption that will help you help you be your best self I think that this is the protein.The profile is definitely there, I can agree that 22 g for the premium price when looking at a protein powder is a little on the low end. I would not object to them upping that number. At the same time I understand that the price comes in when you look at the rest of the goodies like probiotics.
Great complete protein for the kids.
The best protein shake!

I was skeptical to try this protein after initially trying the Jocko Go RTD drinks.I’m glad I found this protein tho. I have drank protein for the past 5 years. Other protein powders are over bearing with sweetness. Molk has a great flavor with the too sweet flavor. Also blends well and has probiotics so I don’t get no bloating after drinking this. Will continuously buy. ***Mixing w/ almond milk***

Gone through a good amount of these. This time I almost swallowed a small black colored piece of plastic that was in the powder. Not sure what it was or where it came from. Maybe a piece of a machine from the packaging plant? No clue. But yea, one of the better tasting low sugar, low cal proteins out there. Still good. Just hope I was the only one that got pieces of plastic in theirs…
Perfect for my sensitive stomach!

I LOVE THIS!About me: I have a really high metabolism.  I have an ectomorphic body type, so I generally burn more calories sitting down than some people do working out.  When I work out, I have a hard time gaining weight.  In college, the football coach suggested I increase my caloric intake to double the normal daily recommended amount, so I would just eat like crazy.  I was finishing each day with an entire pint of Ben n Jerry's ice cream.  I was maintaining weight while working out twice a day, but I was not gaining weight.I'm older now, and work out less (still do jiu jitsu, run, and lift), and I actually lose weight if I work out a lot because I cannot eat as much as I once did, mostly due to time.  I tried a few protein shakes (Muscle Milk, MetRx, Sun Warrior, etc.) to see if they made a difference, and while they would quell hunger at night, I was still losing weight, and worse yet, some had weird side effects thanks to additives or ingredients.  Muscle Milk made me feel jittery and MetRx made me incredibly thirsty for hours (I believe it's because MetRx is made with aspertame).  Sun Warrior just didn't work for me, and it was expensive.  Eventually, I decided to just not work out heavily and avoid excessive cardio to avoid losing weight.Enter MOLK: I've been drinking this mixed with 8 ounces Strauss Milk.  It tastes like chocolate milk.  It mixes easily in just a blender bottle, too.  Eating regularly, and taking Molk on workout days after working out, I've noticed that I'm actually gaining weight again!  A few months ago, I decided to go hard in the gym and start lifting heavy again.  Drinking Molk with milk after workouts and still eating regularly, I am able to gain weight (adding muscle mass), and I'm not waking up hungry in the middle of the night.I highly recommend Molk.  It's the best protein supplement I've ever had.
It upset stomach, I loved the flavor. I gave it to my grandson and he loves it. He was thrilled to get it.

I am definitely not a fan of protein drinks. I have been using protein drinks/powders for years and I was skeptical at first. After buying one of these and tasting it, I am hooked. Mix it with a nice cold glass of milk, and the shake tastes like melted ice cream. I have no plans or intentions of ever changing protein drinks again.

Im a big fan of jocko's books, podcasts, etc so i bought into buying his supplement product. I got the chocolate molk and honestly nothing special about it. The flavor is decent, about the same as any other chocolate protein you'd buy. didn't notice any time recovery benefits that are different from other leading products. Also, beware of the marketing scheme this company and many other protein suppliers use, this bottle is less than half filled up, so you are buying a bottle that is about 40% filled up, maybe even that. This is pretty disappointing since you hear him say how his stuff is better than(competitor name) and then you get the same stuff as you get anywhere else lol. Not a terrible product but you can find better stuff elsewhere

There are enough meme reviews, so I'll give a more straightforward take.  So far I've tried chocolate mint, vanilla, and pumpkin.  My usual method is to blend in a shaker bottle and around half the time blend with ice.  When it is blended I make the pre mix as concentrated as possible.Pros1.  Best tasting protein I've ever had.  Chocolate mint is my favorite, but vanilla has been nice as well.  I started adding some cold brew coffee to the vanilla shakes and it really is a dessert.  I half way wanted to make another shake just for the taste even though I didn't need it.2.  Mixes very well.  I have a hard time comparing this to too many other proteins because I only recently started using shaker bottles.  The only other protein I've tried with the shaker is Primal Fuel which is also great, but doesn't mix very well at all.3.  No BS.  There is no proprietary blend full of God knows what, no BCAAs, no glutamine, creatine etc.  Just what is on the boxCons1.  It is 100% whey concentrate.  No whey isolate to be found.  Not the biggest of deals, plus the cheaper ones are probably 90%+ concentrate anyway.  They just have isolate on their ingredients just to say that they have some.2.  The price point is a bit on the high side.  Both Molk and 6 Star 660g of protein per container and 6 Star is $18-$20.  Then again it is another one of those get what you pay for type of things.  6 Star is the Wal-Mart brand for a reason.  Molk is more competition with Legion.  Legion is great for only having Isolate, but they sweeten with stevia so it doesn't taste as good.

On one of his podcasts he compared this flavor to a mint chocolate chip milkshake.. I mix this with milk and it doesn't even come close to that. That said, high quality ingredients and made in America so I like that. Price is on par with other high quality supplements, but the flavor is nothing like what you get with a product like Syntha-6 from BSN or Optimum Nutrition flavors.
Tastes great. It just doesn’t blend as well.

It will all boil down to how important taste is for you, and if you like the taste of monk fruit or not.I for one don't mind the taste of monk fruit, and I still think the taste is mediocre. That's not to say it's bad! There are just much better tasting ones out there, and if monk fruit taste bitter to you like a friend of mine, you are really going to dislike this.From the research I've done, the price is pretty comfortable with other high in protein products. Truth is, they'll probably taste better than this. But I'm not looking for dessert, I'm looking for high-quality, clean protein. That's why I will continue to buy this brand. My best advice is try to get a sample of it before you commit to purchase.

A solid Eh+.  The flavor is nice, the macros are fine, it just doesn't mix great.  I just feel like I'm just drinking a slightly inferior product. I'm going to finish the bottle, I'm just not going to buy it again. With so many products on the market, Jocko just seems like a 2nd/3rd tier one.  If it works for you, cool, if it fits your price range, cool, I don't regret trying it out, this is just not a protein I'm enthusiastic about in any way.  It comes out kind of grainy and chunky when mixed with milk and I haven't noticed any significant accelerations in my gains over other proteins.  In summary, I don't have a lot of negative things to say about it, I just don't have any positive things to say about it either.I've tried a lot of proteins in my career as a personal trainer, and I'd give this a solid Eh+.

I've tried just about every flavor, the only one that isn't fantastic to me is Pumpkin and that turns out is best as a hot drink.Use any milk or non milk milk for a GOOD outcome. Use water if you have to, just know you are getting a ham sandwich.The Bad reviews need to improve on their ownership skills. If it tastes watery don't use water, if you want it hot mix it GOOD or add it to hot liquid, people looking for a free meal leave 1 star. Man if it doesn't taste good say its just not for you. If the portion seems off, its to keep the powder from jumping when you scoop it because the particles are so light and fluffy. Get Some or Get over

I love that the ingredients are clean, it's tasty, rigorously quality-controlled, and that it's made in the US. I'm living overseas and I'd rather order this stuff than buy anything locally. Chocolate mint is my favorite.  Also, thanks to Jocko I got turned onto monk fruit. I'd never even heard of it before and it ended up tearing down almost my last bastion of sugar intake, my coffee.
I have been using this product for over 2 years now. I'm finding that it sometimes clumps in the milk/water which it never did before.
I have tried a few, but this is the best flavor and quality for the price.  I have told many people about it.

Previously had the chocolate peanut butter which was delicious. Definitely seemed like a dessert/treat.Not so much for the vanilla gorilla. Had an odd taste I didn’t care for, ended up buying some powered peanuts to add to the shake to improve the flavor. Can’t wait to finish it and get another Chocolate and peanut butter tub.

Everything about this powder is probably amazing. I need a protein powder that not only delivers on a Keto ( Low Carb ) option but also a great tasting one. This one however only delivered one thing. It does not taste very well at all. I'll probably have to mix it with another protein powder but it is what it is I suppose.

If your strict on the quality and ingredients then this is a protein for u if u prefer something that taste good and u can continue to add to you daily life style then this is not for you. This is not a beginner protein this is fuel not taste 💪

*Pure monk fruit (no added sweeteners!)*No sugar*Probiotics*Basic natural ingredients*22 grams protein per scoopJocko is the man! I recently got off artificial sweeteners and did not want a sugar filled protein powder. I'm also allergic to stevia, so to say it was hard to find a protein powder is an understatement! Although, not as sweet as other powders that use sugar and sweeteners, Molk uses pure monk fruit and does not add artificial sweeteners or sugar like most monk fruit products. Monk fruit is extremely beneficial and healthy and has zero calories and will not spike your glucose levels. I recommend mixing this with 8oz of unsweetened vanilla almond milk for a great low calorie, sugar free shake. I use a ninja nutri blender and never have chunkiness or powdery residue.

I've tried all the flavors other than chocolate. I'm a fan, they mix well (chocolate mint didn't mix as well as the others) and have a good flavor. Here is how I would rank them starting with the least favorite- 1. chocolate mint, 2. vanilla gorilla, 3. banana creme bomber, 4. chocolate peanut butter, 5.strawberry. Note I am not a chocolate fan, but love peanutbutter. The strawberry is dessert without being too rich (I've tried other brands that were way too rich). I've tried them with whole milk but prefer water for personal dietary reasons (high protein low carb for years). I've also noticed some other brands advertise a higher protein amount per serving but then you notice the serving is two scoops (molk is one scoop), don't fall for it, get you some molk, stay the path!

Update June 27, 2022: Banana revelation....Ive been drinking molk for a few years now. Still the best protein powder Ive found. Better than ALL the other brands Ive tried. Tastes great and easy to digest. The chocolate flavor was, until recently, my go to. Great tatse. (I mix it with almond milk.) The peanut butter chocolate used to pretty close second for me in terms of favorite flavor. But now Ive tried banana....and oh my gosh....just try it. Its awesome. Easily my new favorite flavor!When I first heard of Mölk, I was looking for a top quality protein that is effective, easily digestible, and doesn't taste like I licked a dirty blackboard. (Don't ask. All I'll say is that elementary school wasn't exactly the most obedient, trouble-free time in life. And I had some inventive teachers.)I bought the chocolate flavor. In short, I love this stuff. It's my go to protein supplement. The chocolate milk I gave up when I decided to get truly disciplined about my diet and lifting/running/doing functional fitness workouts 5-6 days a week has been replaced by mölk and almond milk. The combination is delightful. Also, if you freeze mölk with whipping cream, it makes a wonderful ice cream-like treat. Soooooo good. Especially if you add a little butter to the mix. And I don't even like ice cream! Some reviewers have mentioned a slightly odd, almost artificial sweetener like after taste. I noticed absolutely zero of that. It tastes like a chocolate milkshake to me.Mölk lives up to it's excellent reputation in every regard. It's a great source of both whey and casein proteins (fast and slow release.) Tastes great and is easy on the stomach. It's well worth the price...in fact it's rather inexpensive when you consider the quality of product you're getting.  After 35 years of being a serious hobbyist athlete, I've tried nearly every type of protein supplement on the market. Mölk is without equal. Buy it. Try it. You'll love it too.

Recently, I purchased the Mint Chocolate flavored Mölk. I have been searching for a protein mix that is made naturally and does not contain sugar filled lies. If you are an average joe who likes to get after it, a young whippersnapper in a high school lifting program, a soccer mom who drinks breakfast shakes, or a barrel-chested beast at the gym, Mölk is for you. In the past, like thousands of others, I have used a wide variety of different protein blends that always seem to be too expensive, do not mix well, and taste like teacher chalk.  However, Mölk offers a perfect combination beneficial functionality, fast delivery time, and affordable price.Mölk contains an exceptional balance of flavor that does not leave me with cravings after it is gone. The Mint Chocolate flavor is not overpowering and it tastes GOOD. Normally, I drink Mölk in the mornings with breakfast, and once after my workout. Unlike other brands, it does not clump together when you mix it in a shaker bottle with milk. I was blown away by how well it mixed and how smooth it went down.  Additionally, Mölk is a powerful combination protein, probiotics, and vitamins that give you a supernatural recovery. The best aspect of Mölk is that it does not contain any sugars. Rather, all the flavor is created from all natural sources. Mölk has an incredible taste no matter how you blend it.After ordering Mölk, I was impressed by the speed that it arrived at my door. With impeccable timing, it was waiting on my front step when I returned home from the gym just a few days after placing my order. After indulging it for the first time, I was automatically able to dead lift 1,000 lbs. If you are looking for a product that maximizes swollness, this is for you.  Overall, I would recommend Mölk to anyone I care about. It is in the middle of the spectrum as far as price goes, but it is absolutely worth it. GET SOME.
Great product really like it. Been using it for several months now. Only negative I can say is I can never get a full scoop to fully dissolve. Like 10% just won’t, unless I use an immersion blender.
This tastes horrible but it has great macros
Great protein powder and so I ordered 3 vanillas. I was sent 2 mint chocolates and told “No Returns” not cool!
Yo this Molk taste like chalk. I gotta buy another protein to mix with it to make it drinkable. If you’re mixing it with icecream and candy it might be iight.

I've been looking for a non-sugary, non-gross, non-chemical-laden chocolate flavoured protein powder for my AM Ritual for a long, long time and hadn't hit many results. I don't do well with Stevia (headaches, dizziness) or most sugar substitutes - but at the same time, I also don't want to be drinking 16g of Sugar in the morning or even worse, corn syrup.I chose this because of the grass-fed whey and because of the monk fruit extract (which doesn't cause me any funky side effects). I'm also allergic to soy, and the no-soy promise was another major reason for purchase.In all honesty, I didn't have high hopes. I just assumed I'd be disappointed, either the flavour would be way off or it wouldn't mix well, or I'd feel horrible afterwards.This morning, I threw together my almond milk and the Chocolate Jocko Mölk into my blender bottle, and drank up. It was amazing. Dissolved easily. Didn't take OVERLY overly like a chocolate syrup, but, definitely tasted like chocolate, and no freaky after effects. Awesome.The only thing is the container is massive - waaay larger than I was expecting, so that'll take up some counter/closet space, but, totally worth it.

Typical Jocko product in that it is clean, simple, and effective. A bit pricey compared to other powders I've used, but found it to be worth it for the ingredients and taste alone. Never had any upset stomach issues with this as I've had with some of the off the shelf stuff at Vitamin Shop or GNC and as far as vanilla flavored protein mix goes, this was the one with the least sweet/oppressive taste that I've had, which is good for me since I tend to mix with all kinds of different fruit and veggie blends and I don't want the protein overpowering the other flavors. Also seems to blend a bit easier/smoother so you don't get those "chunks" in your shake.

Heard a lot about this powder and when I finally decided to get off my lazy ass and start working out I ordered some of this and man it is delicious and really good for you! Will definitely be buying more of their products.

Great flavor! The best part is that it is basically a meal on the go. Drink one for breakfast and you can go til dinner without eating no problem. If you are looking to lose weight and dont want to feel like you are starving all day give this a shot. By just using this for breakfast in 6 months I have lost 6 inchs off my waist! Zero extra exercise, I eat whatever I want for dinner, great product!
Have bounced around protein shakes for years but this one has been the best for me. Tastes great and has solid ingredients.

The perfect way to drink this is with oat milk, no ice. Weird - I know. I experimented with ice and oat milk (usual go-to) but this seems to be better with just the oat milk. I like to use a smaller oat milk to protein powder ratio.Huge Jocko fan, and was driven to Amazon after learning he had his own protein, Molk, amongst products. Apparently I've been living under a rock. That being said, I've tried what feels like ever protein under the sun - Tera's Whey, Orgain, Vega, Nuzest, Garden of Life, to name a few.I ordered the Chocolate Peanut Butter only because the Chocolate Mint wasn't available via Prime*. Personally, not a big chocolate fan, or peanut butter fan, but am a big "peanut butter and chocolate" fan than chocolate alone, thus, here we are.Mixed 1 scoop of the protein with a handful of ice, some oat milk, 1 tbs ground flax seeds and some water.Verdict: not as dense and chocolate-ey as I thought it would be, which is, personally, nice. It's actually a very light flavor profile, so if you're expecting a huge chocolate kick - maybe try the plain "chocolate" flavor instead. The peanut butter is subtle too.Blended very easily, felt good after consumption, and cleaner ingredients than many others on the market.Will repeat purchase - this time, trying the mint.Wish it had less sugar (has 2g) - but I don't particularly see the need for this one to have 2g, while the mint has 1g.Photos uploaded indicate the amount that came on the bottle - seems like a standard amount, standard scoop.

Taste is just ok, nothing amazing. Price is a little on the high side but within reason. My biggest complaint is that it doesnt mix/ dissolve very well compared to other brands. I wouldn't discourage anyone from trying it but I think there are better brands out there.
This is absolutely the most delicious protein powder I’ve ever had. I have tried so many and always ended up throwing half of it away. I can’t wait to try the other flavors!

I have tried nine different protein powders over the years. Some good and some bad. For me personally, this is the best protein I’ve ever used. What I love about this protein is that it substantially thickens your drink which helps me a lot because I drink it with UNSWEETENED almond milk (Simply Almond, best brand). It’s closer to the dark chocolate side and with the thickening of the drink, it doesn’t have that super watery feel. However, if you’re looking for the tastiest protein of your life, not sure this is it; it does taste decent though. The ingredients and benefits are what’s most important. This stuff gives 22g protein which may not be as high as some other competitors but here’s the thing, it has digestive enzymes, infused probiotics and NO Gluten or SOY which is huge in my opinion. All of this together with the value and manliness, it’s your best choice especially if you’re new to fitness. Highly recommend!

I am Senior ie old. In my age group too much soy can be a problem. I have been looking for a protein powder to replace a New Zealand product I used to buy. None measured up. This surpasses.  I like that it also has the digestive enzymes which as one ages diminish. It is also delicious even with water.  This IS the best product I have found.

I love it.. I bought mint chocolate and never looked back.. however, I, much like jocko, am always looking back, side, up, ahead.. these are traits instilled in me since consumption of the warriors nutrition.. ultimate awareness and default aggression are now systemic to me..I’ve become a hopeless mölkaholic.. I gave up my business and all who have ever loved me in favor of GETTING AFTER IT!!... I entered my local BJJ gym and was a black belt 15 minutes after my first roll.. it shall be written in the annals of history that Mölk delivers superhuman strength as well as a tactical advantage that precious few on the planet can attest to simply because those who stood in the way questioning that are now at their devine reward.. god have mercy on their souls but even more mercy on the few of us who have taken the one step.. the one step in this miserable existence to do what is needed, indeed what me MUST.., and that.... that one thing is drinking Mölk.. ( read in Leif Babbins voice)

I've been using protein from Costco for years now (because, you know, they have good deals on bulk items). Any how, I decided to give the MÖLK train a try. I jumped on the interwebs and order that mint chocolate MÖLK. In the meantime, while I was waiting for my MÖLK to arrive, I ran out of "the other guy's protein," so the need for protein started to get real. Needless to say, when the MÖLK finally arrived, I couldn't wait to try it after my deadlift workout the next morning. After deadlifting 315 lbs (I haven't tried Jocko DISCIPLINE yet, so I'm short of the 8000 lb deadlift), I came home and ripped open the MÖLK! Cracked open the milk! Then the smell of sour milk sent my olfactory nerves into a flurry of sadness. After much contemplation, I said to that sour milk, "stand by to get some!" And jack hammered that MÖLK right into its soul! Long story short, the amount of American patriotism that is contained in every scoop MÖLK was enough to cancel...nay...OBLITERATE the taste of sour communism right out of that sour milk. I was astonished! I immediately ran to the grocery store to buy new milk just to see how the pure majestic glory of the mint chocolate MÖLK was suppose to taste. I was not disappointed. You may now catch me riding the tasty goodness of the MÖLK train to the end of time. Thank you, Jocko. Thank you, Origin and thank you, Nate Dawg for providing the goods!
I love the taste. I can't stand overly sweet protein powder. I drink it with unsweetened almond milk and it's perfect for me.

I’ve mixed this with water and it’s good. Mixing it with milk is awesome. I did one scoop to 6oz and it was think and taste. Almost like thin pudding. With 8oz was really good and easily drinkable. This was my first type of protein drink. I’ve listened to the show for a few years now and it’s nice to support Jocko. I’m not a health nut. I drink one of these instead of a Mountain Dew. Swap some sugar for protein and I’ve had less sugar crash in the evening.
I’ve tried many different brands. By far this is the best I’ve ever had. Mix really well with water or milk. Best with milk. Chocolate mint is by far my favorite.

So I ordered this, excited to have found a grass-fed protein powder in one of my favorite flavors (mint chocolate), and the included digestive enzymes and probiotics were just the cherry on top. The ingredient quality is all there – but there are a few critical things that bummed me out about this protein powder:When blending this with your liquid of choice, you'll need a minimum ratio of 1 scoop to 8oz of liquid. I like to make my protein shakes with ~10oz of almond milk with 2 scoops of protein powder, but with this one, it just wouldn't blend properly. I realize that the instructions suggest 10oz of liquid for each scoop (I think), but even when I didn't add it all at once, a lot of the powder still coagulated. Maybe it was just because the almond milk I blended it with was cold, or perhaps it was just some of the ingredients in this powder. However, I am able to blend it with great vigor.The flavor I got was Mint Chocolate, and it wasn't very good, rather earthy in taste. Not undrinkable, but certainly nothing to look forward to; it definitely felt like I was only consuming it for the properties. This is a supplement, after all, but many other protein powders have a taste well enough to offer a pleasant experience that adds to the supplementing. Again, the taste could have been affected by the other ingredients found here, or perhaps Mint Chocolate was the wrong flavor.

Look I don't think Jocko's trying to compete w/ the big boys so you have to take this stuff for what he's willing to put on the label.  That said this is probably more of a $29 can of protein than it is $45.  But I'm always out for something new, especially good flavors and I can mix them; ie, strawberry + banana.  I've tried peanut butter, banana, chocolate mint, and strawberry.  My number one complaint: you can taste they whey more than you can the actual flavor.  I remember when Jocko first started promoting this and relayed how his friends were blown away by the taste.  Sorry not the case folks.  A bit disappointing especially coming from someone like Jokco.  Flavor needs to be increased by at least 25%; if not 50%.
been using it for a few weeks now feel good and strong my biggest complaint is it mixes really poorly i even use an electric mixer to really mash it up but some sips you still wind up chewing some

Ok lets get the negatives out of the way. It's expensive and it's an arm workout to mix in a shaker without having clumps. Now that we've established that.... Mixed with milk this is really awesome! Tastes better than even my previous taste favorite from Optimum Nutrition. It has a delayed slightly chalky aftertaste but no big deal. With water it basically tastes like a watered down Muscle Milk so stick with some milk or almond milk. I don't know how to pronounce half the amino acids but I suppose that's probably a good thing. I recommend it. As Jocko says, standby to get some.Follow up: definitely use in milk if using a shaker. Much better at dissolving that way. Results... Muscle mass improved....in fact I've gained 7 lbs. My wife has noticed more bulk on me. Just some side effects to be aware of. Had almost what I would describe as moon-face for awhile like when you are on a steroid. Went away. Also acne has been a bit of a side effect, but I know some of the amino acids in this are known to cause that. I still like it. I like the taste....I like the recovery....I like the improved results over my old protein.
This protein powder, is not like any other protein powder. Tastes really real good for a protein powder
I love Jocko molk, it is the perfect post workout protein supplement and I am a big supporter of Origin's business model. But it does hurt the wallet a bit paying nearly $2 per serving
Overall tasty and better than other protein powders I've tried, in taste and quality of ingredients.
