Aftertaste is terrible.

tl;dr: it's lead, and it's nothing.I've been using this powder for years. My latest shipment, for the first time, had a sticker on it that says "California Residents Proposition 65 WARNING: This product contains a substance known to the State of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm." Even though birth defects are not an issue for me (I'm male, and I'm also not planning on having kids), it drove me crazy that they didn't say what substance the warning was for. I also failed to find the answer anywhere online. (NOW Foods does have a "California Residents Proposition 65 Warning FAQs" page, but it doesn't specifically cover this product.)I asked a question on the Amazon product page, but just got the usual collection of replies from people who don't understand that you're NOT SUPPOSED TO ANSWER IF YOU DON'T KNOW. Sheesh.So finally I figured out that I could contact NOW Foods directly (they have a question submission form on their web site), so I did that. They answered the following day. Here's their response:"The warning is based on legal settlements with attorneys that proposed the Prop 65 regulation for the State of California that mandates even low lead levels found naturally in the Whey protein be stickered. See our site on Prop 65 info: [link to the FAQ I mentioned above]".So there you have it. California requires this label if there's a chance of more than 0.5 micrograms per day of lead in a product (I assume for this product they figure people will have one or two servings per day). Obviously it's still under the federal legal limit. The federal regulations seem to be a bit complicated, but for example, they seem to allow up to 15 micrograms per liter in drinking water. They allow 0.5 micrograms per liter (not per day or per serving) in baby food.So, basically, it's not a concern for most of us. Use common sense. Don't try to live on this and nothing else; the lead is unlikely to hurt you, but the lack of other nutrients will. It's a supplement, not a meal.I think this is an excellent product. Almost all protein powders have horrible extra ingredients for "flavor"; with this one you're in control. I usually just go with a scoop of powder, a banana, and water for my post-workout shake. (Actually I only use about 2/3 of a scoop; I think they oversize the scoop a bit.)

I'm surprised by the taste of this whey. It has no taste at all, just like cold water. I've been using Nutrabio whey for 2-3 years, but when I tried this the first time I completely change my mind. I also go to its official website to compare the EAA's profile with Nutrabio whey, and the result turns out to favor Now Sport more as it has more L Leucine and L Trytophan in whey powder ( these 2 amino acids are the most important and expensive in the EAA's). So from now this will be my choice!Plus, I don't know why the price is so cheap compared to its website. 5lbs of Whey protein Isolate should be around $110, but Amazon is selling at $60-$70. This is unbelievable!
Good powder, but I’m ngl this might b one of the most disguising tastes. Even mixed with milk it’s hardly tolerable

Yes, I am yelling it for all to hear that 1) Do not want or like sweetener in their protein powder, especially fake sweeteners or the natural yet awful-tasting stevia or monk fruit, 2) want a mild tasting, easy to mix/digest whey protein powder.I mix one scoop of this powder with 2T chocolate syrup (optional, only 100 calories, gives just enough sweetness & flavor), a cup of ice give or take, one cup of unsweetened original almond milk, in my little blender, for a protein-packed, 260 calorie, tasty, easily digested, chocolate shake. Whey protein isolate is generally recognized as the most efficient and complete protein you can buy, so at least 3 stars for that alone.  This one gets 5 stars from me after using a number of other protein supplements that turned out to be less than pure.  After reading that much cited Consumer Reports article on protein supplements I narrowed my list of acceptable alternatives, and for years used Six Star whey protein; unfortunately like a lot of protein supplements Six Star adds a lot of things you probably don't need or want, including artificial sweeteners and way too much calcium and iron among other non- protein ingredients.  They recently increased the calcium content to about the same dose as Oscal, which would be great if you were feeding this stuff to your elderly grandmother with osteoporosis.  Healthy males in particular don't need all that calcium and iron, and considering that most people mix this in milk, and may take other supplements, say a multivitamin, also containing calcium, and add to that all the dairy and other calcium sources in your daily diet and you really end up getting way too much.  Both calcium and iron constipated you, and calcium in particular can cause bowel blockage.Anyway I speaking from experience I would recommend the purest form of protein you can find, without additives of any kind - the price is not high when you consider the size of the container and the quality of the product.  It is not flavored, but I find it tastes better than my old Six Stars chocolate chalk: I add a teaspoon of cocoa (Ghiradelli is good but any will do), a banana, a teaspoon of creatine (optional), a teaspoon of glutamine (optional but recommended), and 1/16 teaspoon of pure stevia.  I get the pure stevia from Amazon, the stevia at the grocery store is adulterated with all kinds of things, some contain dextrose (corn sugar) but still claim zero calories - how can that be?  Some have sugar alcohols, also controversial and not really calorie free either.  Get the pure stuff, it has no calories and tastes great, extremely sweet, a small amount goes a long way.  No one has a measuring spoon for 1/16 teaspoon, but you may have one for 1/8 teaspoon, which you can fill half-way.  You probably don't want more than that.

Pros: Some of the cheapest Whey Isolate available; mixes easily; minimal ingredient list; trusted name.Cons: Can't think of any.I found that mixing 16oz 1% milk, 1 scoop of this, 1 scoop of NOW Micellar Casein, 2 Tbsp of PBFit peanut butter and chocolate, and 1Tbsp olive oil makes a delicious 685 calorie shake with superb macros.

I've seen people review and ding it for taste. It's straight whey protein. It has an inoffensive but distinct taste.  You ever mixed collagen with water? That's about what it tastes like. Is it bad? NOTE: As I have only been using this product for 2 weeks, I cannot comment on its primary effectiveness as a muscle builder. I will post an update in 2 months time.I have compared this product to my old whey isolate which was made by Body Fortress (vanilla).Price (8/10):  this was my main selling point. I got this for roughly $60 for 5 lbs.  That's $12/lb. My old protein was $48/3 lb, about $4 more per lb. Seeing as I take anywhere from 2-4 scoops 6 days a week, it was adding up. While the price is lower than almost every other whey isolate I could find, it would be nice if it were under $10/lb, but I know I'm dreaming.Taste (3/10): yes, it's "unflavored", but don't take that to mean "flavorless".  I mix my pre/during workout whey with unflavored creatine and orange flavored BCAAs.  With my old vanilla whey, it tasted just like a Dreamsicle. But when I used one scoop of NOW, it tasted more like watered down orange Kool-Aid. When I use 2 scoops, it tasted worse, very chemically.  Even holding my nose didn't help because the metallic medicinal taste still hit my throat. I tried missing it with orange and pineapple juice, and that helped, but since I am my macros allow for only 25% of my calories to be from carbs, fruit juices are a tough addition. I may try Mio, something to even out the taste without adding carbs. But if you can afford the macros and calories, juice is your best bet.Mixability (8/10): for the most part this whey mixes pretty cleanly. I've used both a top filter shaker bottle and a wire ball shaker bottle with good success. Even with cold liquids there are no clumps. Very slight grit, but not sure if that's the protein or the creatine (probably creatine).Purity (9.5/10): you can't much purer than this. 25 g for 110 calories means per serving there are only 10 calories derived from something other than protein. Those calories are mostly BCAAs and soy lecithin, which is used to help it dissolve. Those are the only three ingredients, so not dealing with sweeteners or random fillers is a big plus for anyone who is cutting while trying to maintain muscle. Also, the high concentration of BCAAs is great, but make sure you are taking a BCAA supplement that gives you the proper 3:1:1 ratio because this one is half essential and half non-essential. Still good but needs a boost, especially post workout. I love ON's orange flavored 5000mg BCAAs. But that's a different review.Overall this is a solid product. Based on most reviews, I'm sure I'll notice the results soon.  Just too early to give an honest review of its ability to repair and build muscle but I have noticed I am leaning out a bit more. Again, not sure if that's the protein or mostly diet.  Either way, I am happy so far with this product, just need to work on the taste for my preferences.

This is one of the very few Whey proteins I can tolerate mixed just in plain water (for the substantial calorie savings over using juice or milk).I can definitely say this is the closest thing to "unflavored" whey isolate I've found & I use it to help keep energy levels high (and my normal blood sugars level) throughout the day.I have a mentally challenging job & find that protein helps me maintain mental energy all day long with no 3 PM slumps.I'm athletic & average weight, but definitely find that protein is a terrific energizer for me.  I'm definitely not in the "low carb" camp, but I do believe that reasonable protein supplementation has positive and tangible benefits.I learned quite a bit about the value of protein supplementation after reading 
Mastering Cortisol: Stop Your Body's Stress Hormone from Making You Fat Around the Middle
.  The author suggests that as we age, allowing blood sugar levels to run up and down (by skipping meals, going more than 3 hours w/o eating) can raise cortisol (the hormone) levels, leading to expanded waistlines and other baddies that can make that weight difficult, if not impossible, to lose.  Lower the cortisol & your metabolism improves* (*this is definitely an oversimplification of the book's great points--I highly recommend the book as a useful read to anyone over 35).If I'm eating a low-protein lunch, for example, I'll supplement with about a half a scoop of isolate in water just before eating.  If I have to go more than 3 hours between meals, I'll take another 1/2 to a full scoop. I also start the day with a homemade energy drink (protein, Vit C, lecithin, dried greens, 
NOW Foods Liquid CoQ10 Orange Flavor, 4 ounce
, etc.).If you can't take it plain like I do, use a teaspoon of 
Tang Orange Powdered Drink Mix (Makes 22 Quarts), 72-Ounce Canister
--gives it a pleasant "orange creamsicle" flavor.  If you're shunning carbs, sweeten with 
Pure Stevia Liquid Extract - 4 oz - Liquid
.Amazon's price is great on this high quality supplement; highly recommended for those who want to improve their fitness levels!

Remember when comparing the two ON was complete and I didn't have to doctor it, Now Foods I did because it had no additives. Which is better? Who knows? I've been using the two a total of 6 months. With exercise and diet along with the Whey products I have gone from 268 lbs. to a current 218 and I am lifting and I am working out 4 times a week and doing cardio at least 5 days a week for an hour a day. Hope this helps.

The best source of protein you can choose, as far as having a good balance of all the essential amino acids and lack of toxins is going to be lean meat or seafood.  Chicken Breast, Sirloin Steak, Sockeye Salmon.  Those are examples of real food you should consider eating before relying on protein powder.  That said, smoothies can be quick and convenient and often a good way to get your fruit and vegetable intake.  When you make smoothie it is often nice for it to have a source of protein and protein powder fits that bill very nicely.Whey protein isolate is the best protein powder you can choose.  Here’s why:Whey protein isolate vs concentrate.  Concentrate is cheaper.  Isolate removes the milk fats and carbohydrates and leave almost pure protein.  It is important to remove the fats not because all fats are bad for you, but because some types of fats probably are bad for you.  Milk fat contains approximately 65% saturated, 30% monounsaturated, and 5% polyunsaturated fatty acids.  Those 65% saturated fats are the ones most scientists believe are unhealthy.  Also the carbohydrates in milk include lactose, which a very large number of people have trouble digesting.  Because whey protein isolate doesn’t have the saturated fats and lactose of whey protein concentrate most scientists consider it to be healthier for you.Soy protein isolate is another alternative.  Soy is considered a complete protein in that it contains all the essential amino acids.  The main downside to Soy protein isolate is that it has a concentration of Saponins of 10.6 g/kg.  The full health effects of Saponins are still being studied, but several peer reviewed articles have shown Saponins to increase intestinal permeability also known as leaky gut. Leaky gut can cause low levels of inflammation throughout the body and other short term and long term negative health effects.In summary, Whey Protein Isolate isn’t quite as good as eating foods naturally high in protein, but it can make a healthy smoothie even healthier.

I have tried many protein powders and this is by far the best. It is not flawless, just better than the others. It has a good amino acid profile, a decent price, and it tastes good. No really, it actually tastes decent even though it is unflavored. I have tried many whey powders and they always have this revolting whey aftertaste. No amount of flavoring or mixing can cover that taste, but this powder doesn't have it to begin with. This is good, because it doesn't really mix as well as some powders. If you mix it with a spoon you will get some lumps. It's just that the lumps won't bother you, because they taste OK---not delicious, but palatable. It's closest competitor is Isopure which mixes better, but tastes horrible and is loaded with sodium (Isopure has 170mg of sodium per scoop, NOW has 45 mg, that's about 75% less.) Isopure also doesn't tell you its amino acid profile which is strange.The scoop that it comes with is baffling. It is a long rectangle that is just longer than the diameter of a glass, this means it is hard to transfer the powder into a glass without spilling. A really poor design. I may just use another scoop, if I can find the right measurement.One other thing: The bottle I got had a huge crack in it. I didn't notice it at first, but I wondered why there was so much powder on the outside of the bottle, and why it was partially empty. When I opened it I saw a huge crack in the side, that went from a dent in the side up to the rim. It must have happened at the warehouse, because the box was undamaged and it was packed well. The crack may explain the lumpiness if moisture from the air outside got into the powder. That could cause it to cake up. I won't lower my rating because Amazon resolved the issue to my satisfaction. They are so good about that sort of thing. I will definitely be ordering this stuff again.

most brands that claim to not have flavor with their plain products often have a bad taste to them. this however i mix with milk and the drink still tastes exactly like milk. you can tell theres something mixed in but it doesnt mess with the flavor at all. for right now as long as the price remains low market wise, it will be my go to for protein powder.
We like this product because it is unflavored and does not have artificial sweetener or stevia in it. Dissolves easily.

Made s&p shrimp, fried pickles and fried jalapeños. Yummy yummy! Tips: season well before hand and keep the shell on. Otherwise it’ll dry out the shrimp. Only con is that when it gets on your hand it’s hard to come off and with Water it gets sticky and clumpy & still hard to come off your hand. Overall id buy again.

Mixes up very well and ends up like water with no clumps.  Has that slightly milky taste, but it’s hands down the best tasting flavorless protein I’ve had.  Can’t beat the value for such high quality at 10 lbs.
Milk gets curdled when heated, pure whey powder should not do this. There must be something in this that is not mentioned in ingredients list.
Good product, however a $13 price increase. But hey, at least we’re not in a recession.
Will buy again

I have been using NOW Unflavored Whey Protein Isolate for years.  The quality is always exceptional. You can tell it's the real deal and high quality just by looking and feeling the powder.  After you have tried several brands you can spot the difference.  One of the things I like about quality whey protein isolate is it will not give you horrible gas like cheap whey proteins do.  I like the unflavored one because I like to mix it with a  couple packets of single serving crystal light strawberry energy (has caffeine).  It tastes great and gives me my caffeine kick.  I change the flavor by changing the flavor of crystal light.  Been doing it for years.

I've been a fan of most of Now Foods products for the past 5 years.  I've used the creatine, l-glutamine, omega-3, and whey protein isolates.  I'm a 5'9 185lb male and lift weights 5 days a week and run 5 times a week.  I'm really glad I tried this Pure Protein product.  I used to use the Now Whey Isolate (Chocolate), but never cared for the taste and often felt a little queasy after an intense workout then a 1.5 scoop (40g) serving. I read about this product a few months ago and decided to try the 1lb tub for $22 to see how I liked it and how my body handled it.I used up the 1lb tub in two weeks, and it was fantastic.  I love that it truly is pure protein with no artificial flavors, no preservatives, and uses only whey isolate.  So many others cut their proteins with mixtures to save cost, and you get an inferior protein.  This stuff is really good.  I know many other reviews liked this product because it was unflavored and you could add your own flavor to make it taste great. For me, I don't want to spend the time making a recipe and cleaning a blender after my workout, so I mix it straight with cold filtered water in a tumbler with a fork.  It's very drinkable that way.  No big chunks and tastes like nothing.  I'm only drinking it to get my protein in, so what do I care.  :-)I've had no queasy after effects with this protein,  it mixes easy, and because of that I'm taking it more often and putting on more lean muscle.  I love the 10lb bag for convenience, and store it in a few smaller containers to avoid going into the resealable bag over and over. Solid product and I'll continue to buy.

I have been using whey protein as part of my supplementation for over 15 years.  I have tried just about every brand, every gimmick and even the generic brands.  The primary issue I have with 99% of whey proteins on the market is that they are filled with artificial ingredients and chemical compounds you can't pronounce. Even other "all natural" whey protein's such as Optimum Nutrition All Natural, Dymatize Elite All Natural, Jarrow Formulas, Whey Factors, Vitacost brand, etc. all have guar gum, xantham gum or xylitol or carrageenan in them.  I don't want any of those "natural" but possibly damaging substances in my whey protein.  If you do any research, all of those can cause serious problems with digestive health.  That is why Now Sports Whey Protein Isolate Unflavored is the best whey protein on the market.  It's nothing but pure whey protein isolate (the other "natural" whey's are blended with concentrate which is inferior to isolate and cheaper to manufacture).  This Now Sports Whey Protein Isolate Unflavored (I keep saying unflavored because the flavored now whey proteins also have gums in them) blends great and can be flavored to your liking.  I use this pre-post workout in my single serve ninja blender with half a banana, some almond butter and some glutamine.  Some reviews have said it has caused stomach discomfort - that is due to having trouble breaking down proetin's and protein powders that don't include digestive enzymes -  pickup some now super enzymes which help to break down proteins to help correct the issue.  In short, if you want an all natural whey protein, this is the best and most natural one you will find on the market today.  Remember to read labels and know what you are putting in your body.  As long as they keep making, I will keep buying.

When my trainer insisted I consume protein before my 6 a.m. training session I searched for a powder that wouldn't provide unnecessary chemicals, carbs, fat & cholesterol because who can eat @ 5 a.m.? Not me! Thankfully I found NOW Unflavored Whey Protein Isolate. I enjoy a protein "smoothie" every morning on my way to the gym.Although it doesn't always mix as easy as other products, using a blender easily remedies this. Plus, it is one of the few (if not only) protein supplements that does not contain added anything. Also, contrary to popular belief, this product is a fabulous weight loss tool b/c it supplies much-needed protein while being extremely low in carbs, which is perfect for those following a healthful weight loss regimen.For those who aren't fond of its taste, try being creative: Using a blender, mix one scoop protein powder (or two if you're a male body-builder), 8-12 oz water, a tablespoon of ground flax seed (aka flaxmeal), a pinch of Stevia to your liking and a few pieces of FROZEN fruit (any combination of banana slices, whole unsweetened berries, pineapple, etc.) and voila, you've got one tasty & healthfully nutritious beverage. Another of my favs: blend together one scoop protein powder, 8-12 oz water, a teaspoon or two of dry unsweetened cocoa powder (I like Hershey's Special Dark), a spoonful of instant coffee, a dash of Stevia to your liking, optional flaxmeal and 3 or 4 ice cubes and you've just made a lovely and nutritious "frappuccio" for a fraction of the cost to your wallet and no cost to your waist line. In addition to a pre- and post-workout protein fix, this recipe fits the bill when you've simply GOT to have something chocolate but don't want to ruin an otherwise on-track day.The only cons are (1) inabiity to purchase it locally; (2) not compatible for use in hot beverages. I'd love to be able to add it to my morning "latte".Cheers!

As other reviewers have said, this is a great value.  Although you can do the math and figure out how many servings this jug contains (81), the photo does not do justice to the massive size of this container.  Some people have said that it doesn't dissolve properly, but if you keep reading reviews you'll find that the key is to mix it into the liquid rather than mix the liquid into it.  I personally add this to my daily health shake (banana, milk, ascorbic acid, plus other items depending on what I want/need)...so I'm putting it into the blender...but I add it after pureeing the other ingredients.  Never noticed any bad taste (I don't think it has much flavor) and not once has there been any of it that is undissolved, and I really don't process the whey powder that long.  (Saw a video of an MD making a whey protein shake, and he gave it only around 5 seconds in the mix after adding it last.  Not sure if it makes a difference, but this technique works fine for me.)  I once also read that human milk is much higher in whey protein content than the cow's milk we consume, which is why I originally looked into this.  Just something to keep in mind.  While there are other brands of Whey Protein powder that may be higher rated, this one is unflavored and contains no sugar.  This allows for the greatest control over the final shake or smoothie if that's how you decide to use it.  I've added vanilla extract before and of course it tasted like vanilla!  Well, don't hesitate to buy this based on flavor unless you are a very picky eater.  In that case, I've got no advice because everyone's different.  Maybe purchase a smaller amount to begin with to see if you like it.  (This review is based on the 5lb. Canister.)

Review from a 25 y.o. female who exercises moderately about 5 days a week.I am a firm believer that carbs are from the devil and protein is crucial to your health and well-being. The cupcake addict (and nurse) in me can testify.25 grams of protein per one 28g (1/4 cup) scoop2 ingredients: Whey and Soy lecithin (Calcium, Potassium, Phosphorus, Magnesium as listed in the Ingredient list are not supplemented but naturally occur with whey)Now for the actual product review: UNFLAVORED WHEY 5 LBS1. You still get a mild, and I mean mild, whey taste when you mix it with your liquid in comparison to Optimum Gold Standard which has a strong whey flavor, in my opinion, regardless of flavorings.2. NOW Unflavored whey is tolerable if mixed in plain water if you hold your nose and chug really fast. My favorite way to drink it is with a little milk, peanut butter, honey, and banana for a 350 calorie/33g protein shake .3. I have not experienced any clumpiness. The product mixes almost instantly - it needs an encouraging shake or two in a shaker cup. I have not tried to stir it.4. I do not notice a thickening property, I've never mixed it with less than 6 ounces of fluid though (as stated in other reviews).5. This product is approximately $0.75 per serving. Take a couple fancy herbal supplements and a vitamin and it's still less than $2 per serving (eat that, Shakeology).6. Whey is the most bio-available and rapidly absorbed protein to date.I will purchase again.ONE CON: SOYSoy is another devil but its nearly impossible to avoid any soy additive in a protein supplement. Men: if you are looking for SOY-FREE try Pro7ein Synthesis by VitaSport.NOW foods is a GMP certified company with high quality products that I trust.
Unlike many whey protein powders out there this stuff tastes bland and does not generate room clearing farts.  My family thanks you.

I’m a healthy adult, fit and I train a few weeks a week. I don’t have any health issues. I consider myself an educated consumer, I compare lots of products and I carefully review the nutrition facts of each product. I purchase the unflavored version of this product, and I have been consuming this protein for over 5 years. That said, this is my review about this product:PROS:- The unflavored version contains the most protein (25g) per serving (28g) I have found in the market. This is important to understand, you get 25g of protein per 28g of this product, meaning that fillings (flavorings, etc.) are only 3g. Review your protein and tell me if you get this much protein.- The cost of Now Whey Protein – Unflavored (under $100) is so far the best value I have found.- It mixes well and easily with different drinks and since it is unflavored, you barely notice it.- In the 5+ years I have consumed this protein, I have never experienced any gastrointestinal issues.CONS:- It is unflavored therefore lacks of any taste, but I guess this is expected.OVERALL RECOMMENDATION:- I definitely recommend this product, cost/value is probably the best protein out there.
Flavor reminds me of very weak powdered milk. Without the sour. Blends well with water, milk and yogurt. Great in orange juice. Does not add a strong flavor to already cooked food.

Quality: 5/5. It's a two ingredient whey isolate. As to the actual production process used, I have no idea. But based off of the amino acid profile, this stuff is legit. It dissolves well enough for a protein powder. Foamy you say? Wash your dishes a little better.Taste: 5/5. It tastes exactly as it's supposed to, like nothing. It's unflavored, best I can describe it when mixed in water is a bit of a chalky taste. I've added cocoa powder and stevia to make it chocolate. It's no where near as bad as some of these folks describe it. If you can handle an unflavored protein shake, put down the weights and go back to your safe place. You're not wanted in my gym.Value: 5/5. 5lbs right around $11 something a pound. It's not 2010 anymore and you can blame the huge increase in whey prices on Gatorade for introducing their sports recovery drink line. Economics 101 people, supply and demand. Crossfit probably didn't help either, oh by the way that's not a real pullup.Disclaimer: I started competing in weightlifting competitions when I was 14 (I'm 33 now). I've used 5 different proteins in all these years: 1. EAS...ok 2. MuscleTech.. crap  3. ON's Gold - 10+ years of satisfaction  4. NOW isolate 5+ years of satisfaction. 5. Muscle Milk - ok but too much sugar.If you're not worried about the carbs or extra ingredients get ON's Gold standard. If you want 25 grams of raw protein that's tasty, eat a steak. If you're like me and just need a quick no-carb protein boost and aren't a crossfit hipster, this is your protein.

This is a budget friendly option for those looking into a whey isolate supplement. Most whey isolate supplements are either a combination of whey concentrate and isolate or if they are 100% isolate they are prohibitively expensive. The powder mixes well with water and doesn't get chunky. As previous reviewers have stated the taste of this product is almost unbearable by itself. I don't know of anyone that would really enjoy drinking this without some form of addition to their shake. But at least you get to choose what those additions are without all the fillers and garbage that is put into most of the protein supplements out there. I usually add two packets of Truvia (Stevia sweetener) to my shaker bottle and it tastes just fine. I will sometimes add a teaspoon of PB2 powder for a change of flavor. Because it dissolves well in a shaker you will have no issues if you put it in a blender smoothie or something else. I have not attempted to use this in cooking or baking recipes as it seems like a waste for that purpose. I have not had any digestive issues with this product like I have had with some others which was a pleasant surprise.My only complaint is the included scoop. It is a large rectangle and therefore makes pouring difficult in all but the largest mouth shaker cups (ie. Classic Blender Bottles just barely work but the Sportmixer Blender Bottles don't have a large enough opening and will cause you to spill powder unless you use a funnel). While this is a small complaint it does seem like an odd choice as every other supplement uses a round portioning scoop.
Tastes fairly neutral. Still has the flavor of whey, which there's no real avoiding.I bought a 10 lb bag. The quality of the powder is great. Mixes just fine.

Got this whey protein from one of those recommended from an u tube site for making hamburger buns, seems to be ok after mixing with other ingredients, ( that’s why I am giving it a 3 star, just to be fair ). as far as; am I going ti buy it again; we’ll; that would depends if I can find another brand y try after I finished with this bottle jar.

This is the best whey protein isolate I have ever used. I like the unflavored because I can add whatever I want to it to flavor it as I please. I have a sensitive stomach when it comes to whey and I have ZERO issues with this product. It is satiating and perfect post workout or as a snack between meals.
It's unflavored it tastes like powdered milk put one spoon of sugar and some blue cap milk and it tastes like creamer.

After a lot of research this and one other 100% organic whey seem to be top-dogs in protein powder markets as far as specs and quality go, this includes all the modified types and creatine. FYI whey is far more neutral(healthier) than creatine, and these pure whey blends are the best of the best.I went ahead and got the 5LB at sixty bucks to save almost ten-dollars a pound. This is impressive as it economically beats every competitor and physical-retail price I've seen.I don't buy dietary and muscle building solutions based on taste and look like others, but this is better than most I've had.Also if buying based on marketing this and the other organic whey won't show up in your radar.. Trust me spec and health wise they are the best of the best, but feel free to spend days researching yourself. You'll see mostly powders with high ingredient lists and insane levels of marketing.I do 3 25g(84g protein) scoops in a low-cal no-sugar vitamin blend a day to go with 3 600cal high protein low-carb low-fat meals a day because I'm building metabolism with muscle to lose stored fat, after I'll probably do 4 with a lot of carbs and fat. It has 80 scoops in the 5LB, so do 2 scoops a day for 40 days or 3 a day for 26 days. It actually makes more sense to get the 10lb a save a lot of money.UPDATE: I do a 2200 cal. gainer every other day and conserve this since it has enough protein. This with cheap high-cal, high carb, high fat foods seems to be ideal for builders though..

This is a great option for anyone who is looking for a good whey protein isolate that is easily absorbed.  I am a bariatric patient and so I have to get in at least 50 grams of protein per day.  This will now be a staple in my pantry.  In the last year I have tried all sorts of protein; cheap ones, expensive designer ones, supposedly 'delicious' ones, but this one beats them all!  I love it for three main reasons:1. It lives up to its promise of being unflavored, in that it has has very little after/side taste. Anyone who says that there is a protein without ANY after taste is lying. I have tried a bunch of different unflavored ones including PURE by Inspire, and this is a better product. The great thing about a good unflavored protein is that it becomes anything you want, sweet or savory.2. It dissolves very well and is not prone to curdling in higher temperature liquids.  I mix it with a little cold water first and then I can dump it into a cup of hot tea or soup.  You still don't want to mix it directly with boiling water, but for the most part you can combine it with hotter drinks.3. The price is wonderful! This product gives you 25 grams of protein per scoop. I like this because I have tried other powders that claim to have a higher amount of of protein, only to discover that you need 2 or 3 scoops to get the amount of protein you need, so a container goes by fast. I ordered the 5lb container which has about 81 serving and will last me the whole month.  This is great value for money and makes the price of being healthy a lot less prohibitive.I am VERY glad I found this and I hope they'll keep producing it for a good long time.
I am sensitive to artificial sweeteners and flavors in most protein powders but this is not affecting me at all.
I mix with water. Super blend able. Easy to just chug

I'd say this is closer to 3.5 stars. Better than 3 stars, but I can't give it 4.This is pure whey protein isolate. It has no artificial ingredients and is the unflavored variety. Now, keep in mind that when it says "unflavored", it doesn't mean it has no flavor. It just means it's not artificially flavored. This has the pure whey protein smell/flavor, which is like mild spoiled milk. It has nothing in it to mask the flavor. I have tried other unflavored whey proteins and this one doesn't taste as bad as the others.So, if you're looking for something with no artificial ingredients and no added sugar or sucralose, this might be for you. I've tried this in water, and could hardly get it down. But, if I put it in juice of some kind, it's bearable.It's a fine powder, but it does not mix completely (unless you use a blender, maybe). If you use a blender, it makes it foam like crazy. I personally just use a fork to mix it in. I'd say it mixes about 90%...and the rest kinda forms little pasty clumps. Not a big deal. I've actually discovered that if you use soy milk, it dissolves completely, instantly. I'm not sure why! And, if you want to use water, just let it sit for awhile and it'll eventually dissolve completely. I use water and just plug my nose so I can't taste it.It has 25 g of whey protein isolate pure 110 calorie serving, which is awesome. The nutrition facts are spot on. So, if you want a pure whey protein isolate powder and you're okay with just a few clumps and a mild spoiled milk flavor (which is a part of whey protein unless it's masked), this is a good product.As a side note, the 1.2 lbs container said it has 19 servings, with each serving being 1 level scoop. I did not get that many. I took one serving per day, leveled off, and it lasted me only 16 days. Weird.
I ordered this protein powder for making smoothies in the morning and the flavor is not it. I will just keep looking.

I don't eat dairy unless I absolutely cannot avoid it -- not because it's trendy but because it actually really upsets my stomach.  But a friend recommended whey protein isolate as a "safe" dairy-derived protein powder to try, and it's true -- this product does not upset my stomach *at all*.  Everyone's different, of course, so consume at your own risk if you have issues with dairy, but I couldn't be happier.  I've been trying to work out regularly for about a year, and protein smoothies have become a big part of my daily life.  This stuff mixes into smoothies really easily and is basically flavorless.  You don't really even need a blender to mix it in!  My body has definitely changed (it has been about a year of lifting weights  and smoothies with a few weeks off here and there), and this powder has helped me manage my protein intake.  I think I wasn't getting nearly enough protein in my diet before, now I know the minimum I take in every day (I use 4 scoops of this stuff per day!).  This protein powder is WAY cheaper here on Amazon than I can get it locally, and it's also the best price for whey protein isolate here on Amazon.  I get it Subscribe & Save so I don't even have to think -- I just always have it on hand.  I can't imagine living without my smoothies now, I take a bottle to work or whip up a fresh one in the evening if I'm especially hungry.  Highly recommended.

This is my first time trying this product. It definitely has a taste, though not unpleasant. It tastes vaguely of vanilla, though I ordered the unflavoured kind. It is a fake vanilla taste. It is grainy and doesn't mix as smooth as I would have hoped, but for the price, it is good enough. Not terrible, not fantastic. Just mediocre.

Five stars. Because, just the few days I've used WPI - I now have veins popping out of my arms when other products didn't accomplish these same results, no matter how hard I've worked out and how long.I have much more energy now when working out, am now on the treadmill for 30.min up from 15.min and could run longer too  ... as if ... my muscles wasn't getting the right proteins from the other products I've tried within five years - now,  at 46 years, I have the energy and body of a 23 year old - the prefect sculptured body - with the help of my sweat suite I've invented. Flax Oil just came in today, now am waiting on my Hardcore Micellar Casein-4lbs to arrive. Everyone's bodies and metabolism aren't equal so, what works 4 me may not work for you, specially for those who haven't cut out meats from their diet. They claimed that WPI is not a weight loser, but I lost two and a half lbs in less then two weeks and am only taking it every other day.  I Am 5/6.FT and 156.lbs - all muscle, completely cut up all over because I eat .... very ... very, little or, I may eat a few peanut butter sandwiches and bananas the whole day and still workout. So, you got to go on how your body respond and react when taking anything, because we are all unique individuals with unique bodies so, listen mostly to your body then, to me or anyone else. I would recommend this product to all those who are serious bodybuilders - and not to someone whose looking for a magical pill or protein that will make them out of SUPERMAN! Your search is OVER!

I've used NOW products on and off through the years, and it's always the consistency with the products they offer that keeps me coming back. I recently switched back to NOW for my unflavored whey protein isolate. It's not the most inexpensive, but it's still a great value, especially when the quality of the actual product is factored in. The protein powder mixes easily, doesn't clump at all, and it's easy to digest. Never have an issue consuming this protein powder in a shake or added to my morning coffee!

I am mildy lactose intolerant. Regular whey protein (ON Gold Standard Whey) gives me terrible bloating all day long. It's very uncomfortable and takes a while to get the gas out. I also get gassy and bloated (but doesn't take long to gas out as whey) when I eat stuff that has heavy cream or mac n cheese. Some stuff will make me go to the bathroom bad. Just to give you an idea of my intolerance.I don't have any problems with this whey protein at all!! No longer do I have to choose between being bloated all day vs terrible chalky plant protein. This one does cost more than regular whey, but it is still cheaper than the fancier plant protein ones that aren't a terror to drink. It's worth the extra money to me, for the most part.. If you don't understand, this costs more because they filtered out the lactose. This is typically known as just whey isolate, but they hydrolyzed it to add more to the cost and take out more lactose and more. I wish they sold the larger version of the plain iso100, as it should in theory cost less since not hydrolyzed. I had not bloat problems with that one either, but the 5 lb hydrolyzed tub is cheaper than the 3 lb regular tub.. hydrolyzed protein is really only necessary for like pro athletes who need to be fine tuned as there's millions of dollars on the line.Taste is good, but not excellent. It is a bit too sweet, but I guess that's the American way. The regular iso100 is the best flavor for chocolate. The hydrolyzed version is sweeter, which is strange because this model should be marketed to athletes and those who are less likely to have sweets. I'm going to try some other flavors than chocolate. Hoping peanut butter chocolate is less sweet due to the peanut butter. The gourmet chocolate isn't that far off from drinking a liquid twix bar.

A little bit pricey, but worth it. This doesn't have a lot of excess garbage in it, it's pretty clean all things considered, other than some ingredients they put in for texture or mixing purposes. I am not crazy about all the flavors, but I thought the Cocoa Pebbles and Fudge Brownie were pretty good.My favorite thing about it is without a doubt the fact that it doesn't make me bloated and gassy the whole day compared to concentrates. I can't drink protein concentrates anymore after this. I drink a few of these throughout the day, and I am totally fine, no gassiness or bloating. So, if like me you are lactose intolerant, this brings an upset stomach down to like a 1/10, max a 2/10. That alone makes it worth the price, and some of the flavors are fantastic too.

I have purchased Dymatize ISO100 Hydrolyzed Protein Powder 4/5 times and I have to say that the taste is great, especially the Cocoa Pebbles flavor. It is a pure 100% Whey Isolate Protein powder which is fast absorbing and easy digesting. Each serving contains 25g of protein and 5.5g of BCAAs. It is also gluten-free. The only downside is that the price changes quite often, but overall it is a great product. I highly recommend it for those who are looking for a high-quality protein powder that not only tastes great but also has a good amount of protein and BCAAs per serving.

I’ve consumed a lot of protein powder, all kinds, plant based, casein and all the whey’s.  For whey I prefer Isolate because it is clean and effective.  I love this flavor, it’s like drinking the milk left in the bowl after Fruity Pebbles.  If you are looking for lean gains this is a great product.

I was skeptical to order the birthday cake flavor but I went ahead and did it—no regrets. Some protein shakes don’t sit well and cause bloating or gas but this brand had none of that.  At only 110 calories a serving with 25g protein and amazing flavor I will absolutely be ordering again.  I usually mix mine with a cup of almond milk and ice and blend to make it more of a shake type drink.

Loved the flavor and I ordered Cocoa pebbles next. The fruity pebbles one tasted just like the cereal although after a while I started to dislike it since I drink it everyday and it is very sweet.. I'm going to order 2 different flavors so that I can switch them up everyday next timeSo far I can see a huge difference in my workouts and I can do 1 hour cardio and 1 hour crossfit everyday for a month now thanks to this along with extra creatine ane collagen

I ordered the Fruity Pebbles flavor because it was the cheapest. Worried it’d taste like old cereal milk I was hesitant but glad I ordered. Great, fresh taste and the quality is top notch. All protein powders are now crazy expensive but I know what to expect with Dymatize and they never fail to deliver quality.
Wow, this is thee best! I love it and I'm will definitely be purchasing again! Mixes awesome, tastes awesome. Did I mention how much I love it?❤️😁 Smile and have a great day and try this!👍👍👍👍👍

Taste just like Fruity Pebbles...this has been my go-to protein powder for a few years now. Very nice to swap it with my chocolate flavor. I ordered one last night at $79 with a random 20% off coupon, saving me $16 for a total of $63. If you're not in a rush, stalk the price.

Love the Fruity Pebbles flavor...not the price.  The Fruity Pebbles flavor is the best I've tasted out of the many different brands and flavors of protein powders that I've tried.  I mix it with 8 to 10 ounces of skim milk.  I used to mix my protein powders with water until I tried it with milk.  Milk just makes all the flavors taste 10 times better.  I've tried it with skim (0%) milk, 1% milk and 2% milk and couldn't detect any big differences.  Since milk fat is not good for older adults, I stick to skim milk while my kids drink 1% or 2% milk.  Milk also adds 1 gram of protein for each ounce you drink.  So 8 ounces of milk mixed with 2/3 scoop of protein powder still gives you about the same amount of protein as 8 ounces of water mixed with a full scoop of protein powder.  It's just one way to make your protein powered last longer and save some money.  The only problem I have with Amazon and Dymatize ISO100 protein powder is the wildly fluctuating prices.  It could be $75 one day and $99 the next.On a side note, if you find this powder too fruity you can always mix it with a vanilla flavored protein powder to reduce the sweetness to your liking.
This is probably the best tasting protein shake you will ever have

Dymatize makes the best protein powder, only 10 calories of anything other than protein. The Pebbles birthday cake flavor is pretty overpowering, though. It tastes like you just crammed a handful of icing in your mouth while smelling some yellow cake.

Remembering the old days of muscletech plus many other horrible chalky and sour  tasting protein powders, fruity pebbles and cocoa pebbles flavors by far, hands down, win any taste contest in my book. Fruit loops should be the next flavor, or corn pops honeycomb something, I'd get behind those. A+ for me across the board.
perfect

By now I've tried both the chocolate and fuzzy navel flavors (my first review commented on vanilla only).  Both chocolate and fuzzy navel taste outstanding!  Highly recommended along with vanilla!  I now keep all three available to supplement my daily meals (vanilla, chocolate, and fuzzy navel).  I've been using the vanilla and chocolate much longer than fuzzy navel, but so far the fuzzy navel flavor is nearly addictive to my tastes (my craving for it may eventually pass, but so far I like it as well if not better than chocolate or vanilla).  The fuzzy navel flavor tastes close to vanilla with a very light touch of peach and orange added.  In a way the flavor reminds me of the "lemon" ice cream or frozen custard I ate as a kid; it really didn't taste like lemon at all, but was more interesting and tastier than vanilla.  The fuzzy navel flavor is so subtle you could probably use it in frozen fruit smoothies instead of vanilla (I haven't tried this yet) and not notice much of a difference (and this would allow you to reduce your inventory from three flavors to two flavors by dropping the vanilla).I am on my 3rd 5 lb container of vanilla, 2nd chocolate and 1st fuzzy navel. I often pack a lean lunch (including a small amount of animal protein, fruit and vegetable) and premix four servings of ISO*100 to take with me when I go off to work for the day (following something similar to BFL, eating a meal every two hours or so) and all flavors keep well throughout the day when premixed (or even keep well overnight).  I still prefer to mix on the fly when I am going to be around the house (see my previous vanilla review for how to chill your water with ice without blending any foam into your delicious meal replacement). When I start weight training again I will add two additional daily servings of ISO*100 (to bring daily protein intake up to one gram of protein per pound of body weight when including my two regular meals).It does not matter whether the IOS*100 you buy has a white or black plastic container, or whether what you buy is labeled as a "gourmet" flavor or not.  Don't pay more; if you hunt online price you should be able to find 5 lb quantities for somewhere around $60 or less.  As far as I can tell, Dymatize has replaced their old blends with new blends labeled "Gourmet" and part of that upgrade involves changing the container color from white to black.  The last time I ordered online, the picture of what I ordered showed a white container and did not include the word Gourmet on the flavor label; what I received in the mail was the black container with the Gourmet labeling.  My first two containers of vanilla were the old recipe in the white containers; and compared to the newer gourmet black container this older style vanilla was slightly "grainy" when thoroughly mixed compared to the newer ISO*100 products from Dymatize (my chocolate and fuzzy navel were ever grainy but these have always been in black containers).Regarding Dymatize's use of Sucralose; although you can find some limited negative press on this particular artificial sweetener, it is one of the most recently developed zero-carb sweeteners and considered by most authorities to be much healthier than earlier popular artificial sweeteners.  If anything better comes along in terms of "health" and "taste" I'm sure Dymatize will be quick to pick it up.  In the meantime, having a pure high protein low carb drink is a great convenience.  I still have not found a better or comparable product.  Thank You Dymatize and all the retailers selling this at affordable prices.

 I like the taste , dissolves easily with water . Like to buy it here at Amazon because it saves me around $20,  local stores prices a little higher. Will keep buying it . Overall, I'd say this is one of the best protein powders I've used. It has definitely helped me gain muscle while losing a bit of fat on the way. I've had 5 flavors so far: birthday cake, cinnamon bun, gourmet chocolate, choco peanut butter cup, and strawberry. All flavors have varying quality. I'll break it down below!- Birthday cake was way too sweet but it was pretty tasty. Mixed well and can't go wrong with it.- Cinnamon Bun mixed well too and tasted like milk mixed with cinnamon toast crunch seasoning. The flavor was a bit overpowering and not to my liking but it was not that bad.- Gourmet chocolate was the most neutral of them all. The taste was probably its biggest advantage as it is usually hard to go wrong with chocolate. Mixes well!- Choco peanut butter cup tasted more like straight peanut butter. At first I disliked it but after a few days it grew on me and I did not mind the flavor. Mixes well but I did find some weird residue in it.. also some days my chest would feel weird when drinking it. I would not say to steer away from this flavor since it was probably just an unlucky batch. Mixes well!- Strawberry is my most recent purchase. It was the cheapest of them all for the 5lb tub ($51 vs the usual $66). I read reviews of the strawberry not mixing well and having a weird taste. I can agree to the mixing aspect of the negative reviews as it does not break down well at all. I did find today after my workout that if you mix it and then add it to the fridge for a bit, and mix it later again it broke down evenly. I mixed/placed my shake in the fridge in between my main workout/ab workout and it worked wonders. The taste is actually my favorite. The after taste isn't pleasant but you get used to it!After my current tub runs out, I will not be using Dynamatize anymore due to other protein brands having similar quality and better competitive pricing. Dynamatize was my most used protein powder but I realized I go through a 5lb tub monthly which eventually had me seek out a new powder. I highly recommend Dynamatize though! It's helped me gain a lot of muscle which I find difficult due to my genetics/body structure.I should also mention that when I was deployed in the middle east, Dynamatize was hugely popular, often flying off the shelves the day it arrives at my base. Judging by that, it must be worth using!

Dymatize ISO100 is the best mixing, best tasting, best digesting, and overall my favourite protein powder I have ever used. Tastes *sorta* like that fake candy banana flavorBirthday Cake - 0/5 Tastes like chemicles. nothing like the classic birthday cake flavor or the cerealChocolate - 2/5 Basic chocolate always sucks. This one is no exceptionChocolate Coconut - 0/5 Tastes like a burnt version of the regular chocolate which is especially upsetting when you are expecting an almond joy flavorChocolate Peanut Butter - 5/5 An incredaible combination and tastes like a dream come trueCinnamon Bun - 5/5 easily my favorite flavor, but they should have named it Horchata, because that is what it tastes more like.Cocoa Pebbles - 3/5 Not a bad chocolate, but it's not quite up to the actual cereal milk flavor they are going forCookies and Cream - 2/5 I don't think C&C has ever been good thoughFruity Pebbles - 4/5 Tastes just like the cereal milk! I love itFudge Brownie - 5/5 Tastes like an Iced Hot Cocoa. This is the first time anyone has ever gotten a 'plain' chocolate flavor right.Orange Dreamsicle - 5/5 Easily, my second favorite flavor. It tastes like a desert and I love it so muchStrawberry - 3/5 Its pretty good, nothing to shout about though (do NOT mix with banana. It's bad)Vanilla - 1/5 Does anyone actually like vanilla protein?

So where is the value in "ISO 100" (Dymatize) protien compared to "Gold Standard" protien?I'll give you 2 good reasons, and 3rd ok reason this might be better for you1.) The Taste (chocolate)!-Gold Standard isn't bad, but ISO 100's chocolate flavor is noticeably louder, and significantly better in my opinion. I was not expecting how chocolaty the "Gourmet Chocolate" was going to be compared to Gold Standard's "Double Rich Chocolate". (Which i've been using for a good part of a year). It was like going from a mild Chocolate Milk to a rich (but thin) Chocolate shake. . Just 3-4 times more flavor.2.) Very little Lactose.- if you have an intolerance this should be much easier on you to consume :D.3 (for the few).) As far as which is healthier... -Technically ISO 100. Having single 1 "whapping" GRAM of protien per serving more than the competitor, as well as 1 less gram in both fat and carbs... really they are about the same nutritionally. For beginners to adept (even advanced) fitness people,1 gram isn't going to make much of a difference.BUT if you are on the level of Professional/Expert athlete that is super focused on being pinpoint accurate on your nutrition/diet and pumping iron at least 2x a day like a Beast! Then this could be significant to you.Overall, it's good but more expensive that Gold Brand with near identical nutritional value. ISO 100 in more of a luxury for its flavor, great for those sensitive to lactose, or for the few trying to fine tune a godlike machine they call a "body".
One parts this to two parts isopure for maximum protein and a less fruity pebbles taste (it tastes good if you like FP but it can be overpowering over two scoops+).

I have bought this kind for a very long time. I was happy with the quality and the price ( not cheap but affordable). I went to order today and I was shocked to see the 36% increase in price. Last order was placed in the summer.  Don't get me wrong I know things go up in price but like this? No way. I'll be looking for other places to buy it. It just seems outrageous to me.

Before I got this, I'd been using a cheap-o product from Sam's Club that cost me around $45 for 5 lbs, and honestly I absolutely dreaded drinking it. I would mix it with water and choke it down as fast as I could to avoid tasting the sub-par flavor and feeling the undissolved lumps of powder slither down my throat as much as possible. Feeling a need for something better, I did some research and this stuff (the Dymatize powder) was recommended by a couple of websites for their high-quality flavors, and I decided that buying something that I actually enjoyed drinking would be worth the extra twenty bucks, so I gave it a shot...and...I will never go back. I got the fudge brownie flavor, and I almost immediately knew it would be better just from the simple fact that it actually completely dissolved in the water. I was quite happy to see that there weren't a bunch of globs of undissolved goo floating around in it after a modest amount of shaking, and it is very smooth to drink - maybe just the barest hint of grittiness but that could be the fact that I didn't shake it enough. The real star of the show, however, is the flavor. Unlike the other stuff I was using, this powder tastes absolutely delicious. In my opinion, both flavor and texture-wise the fudge brownie tastes EXACTLY like drinking powdered cocoa, and it's excellent. I now look forward to my protein shake. Rather than just choking down the entire thing as fast as possible to avoid the taste and texture, I savor each sip, and I'm even a little sad when it's gone. I am very impressed and very happy I spent the extra cash to get such a high-quality product. Oh, and upon receipt (since it came up so often in other reviews), I insured the container was sealed (it was), the container was full (it was), I looked for signs of bugs (none that I could see, but I'll keep an eye out), and I placed it on a scale that rated it at 5.2lbs, so everything seems to be in order on the quality assurance side of things. All in all, very good product, high amount of protein, low carbs, low calories, and the flavor is spot on. What's not to like? I think I'm just going to throw my old stuff out and drink this from now on.
Was consistently getting this stuff in 2020-2021 for $50-$60 now all of a sudden it’s over $100??? It’s great protein powder but wow.

I've purchased two of the 5lb buckets and I can say without a doubt, it's an exceptional protein powder. The first flavor I purchased was fudge brownie; I was extremely delighted with the flavor, and it managed to meet all my expectations including the ingredients I would want in a protein powder. The fudge brownie flavor was very palatable while mixing well with milk, water, and/or shakes. Unfortunately, the second flavor, cinnamon bun, I purchased was not so scrumptious. I have not tried any other flavors other than fudge brownie or the cinnamon bun so take my opinion with a grain of salt. To my disappointment the cinnamon bun flavor does not deliver as the fudge brownie did. Although it still mixed very well with any fluid and has a lot of great ingredients that I look for in my protein powders, the flavor was simply off-putting and lackluster. It's the type of flavor that I often tend to try and avoid when choosing which powder to buy, but I was feeling so very optimistic after the impression the fudge brownie had left on me I dubiously decided that I would take a leap of faith and try the forbidden cinnamon bun flavor. With high hopes and broken dreams I was yanked to the reality where my apprehensions came to fruition. Overall, the cinnamon bun flavor is tolerable AT BEST, and I genuinely mean, At Best. In conclusion, fudge brownie was a flavor I felt safe with, like a toasty bed on a frigid winter night. Whereas the cinnamon bun was a calculated risk. I knew the pay-off could have been legendary, but I was also aware of the looming price I may have to pay. You may ask, "Why didn't you get a smaller size if it was a flavor you weren't sure of?". To that, I must reiterate a distinguished saying from father gains himself; "Just like in bodybuilding, failure is also a necessary experience for growth in our own lives, for if we’re never tested to our limits, how will we know how strong we really are? How will we ever grow?" (– Arnold Schwarzenegger). I can say with a pump in my veins and a sight on my gains, I have grown from this failure. This protein powder not only changed my physical gains, but it has also changed my mental gains. I will take what I gained from this experience and keep it with me for the rest of my life. I can only hope you learn from my mistakes, and choose your flavor wisely. For in this scenario, there are right answers and there are wrong answers. No one lifters answers may be the same, so you must find it within yourself to ask with great caution "Am I sure and am I ready to commit to this flavor of protein powder until the bottom of the bucket?" May you pick wisely and with great confidence.Thank you kindly for your attention and time,  I wish you all the gains in the world.Michael BarnesProtein Powder Enthusiast

I was happy to get through the vanilla so I could switch to anything else. The vanilla’s foam was insane too!2: the foam from the fruity pebbles has become unbearable! It had made my protein consumption time go from moments to around 15 min waiting for this foam to settle if it ever does. On top of that the bubbles have been cause awful GI bloating and discomfort. I’ll be searching for a new brand until you can get that foam under control.

So this is definitely the best protein ive tried to date. My only issue is it is sweetened with splenda. I wish they would sweeten it with monk fruit, but I can live with it. Ive only tried the Cinnabon flavor and its actually on the verge of being sickening sweet. Some people will love that, but I have to find ways to tone it down. One of the reviewers here is correct about large producers packaging their whey isolates under a variety of different brand names, but I was only able to find a few hydrolyzed whey proteins offered from all the products currently available online (there are many).  I only found a few similar to this one with the distinction of being hydrolyzed which is presumably easier to digest and contains the highest available percentage of protein.  A 28 gram serving of this product contains 25 grams of protein or 90% protein by weight.  I have been buying whey protein powder for more than 15 years and used all the popular brands.  This is simply the best whey I have ever used and tastes different than any others I've known up till now.  Zero fat and zero carbs per serving.  I no longer use or recommend soy isolates and while I have found some good quality brown rice protein powders the taste is so unpleasant I would stick to whey.Since I was recently new to this whey product, I always start by purchasing vanilla since that's usually the most difficult flavor to do well (in my experience).  If I don't like the taste, vanilla is always good to have around for adding to fruit smoothies (a smoothie easily overwhelms any subtleties of an objectionable vanilla whey flavor). If I like the taste of their vanilla I'll serve it solo as well as in smoothies.  Once I know I like the vanilla, chocolate is usually next.  This vanilla is excellent as far as vanilla goes and I'll be ordering more flavors soon.  I use a VitaMix to quickly and easily mix a tasty 12 ounce serving.One trick I can pass along for making a delicious glass is to start with a 16 oz measuring cup.  If you have a crushed ice dispenser in your frig door put a few ounces of ice into your measuring cup and fill with water up to the 12 oz mark.  Dump the ice and water into your VitaMix and blend at high speed (the idea being to make the water very cold while making any evidence of the ice disappear).  With the VitaMix still running at the slowest rpm (stir speed) quickly add one scoop of this protein powder into the freezing cold water and run another 10 to 15 seconds.  Pour into a glass and serve while cold.  WOW!  Is that Good!  I don't like running the blender fast with the protein powder already in the water because it makes a foamy drink I don't find enjoyable.Great for diets, snacks throughout the day, for feeding your muscles after weight training.  This is a great product.  If you are looking for the highest quality whey isolate at the best possible price, this 5lb size is your lowest price best value deal from all comparable labels (at least at the time I'm writing this review).  Be sure and shop price because I you can easily pay more than twice the lowest available prices.

This product is by far one of the best whey isolate protein powder that I've ever taken. If you're someone who works out regularly, this product is the product for you. It mixes almost instantly without any lumps and powder residue at the bottom of your shaker bottle. I know some of you are afraid of protein powders that don't mix well with certain beverages like milk or juice, but ISO 100 blends in such a way that leaves no clumps in whatever you choose to mix it with. In comparison to ON's Gold Standard Whey, this product mixes way better than ON. As a person who has purchased ON for the past 2 years, I can advocate for that comparison. I've tried many other protein powders in the past, with my most purchased being ON's Gold Standard Whey, that product was my favorite before trying ISO 100 but now I think I will switch my product loyalty to this product, and I think so will you.If you're like me and you go to the gym at least 4 times a week, you might be in need of a product that contains a significant amount of BCAAs that aids recovery and BCAAs fuel your skeletal muscles during training, which can help give you the edge you need to push your limits. The 2.7grams of leucine supports the activation of protein muscle synthesis which is key to muscle growth. You also want a product that is low in calories and one that doesn't bloat you, this product only has 120 calories per serving and it doesn't bloat you at all. You will not be disappointed in this product at all, I've been taking it for a month and I've seen significant growth in my body in just the span of 4 weeks. But of course, the results vary from person to person and not everyone will notice growth in the first 4 weeks. However, you will be surprised at how this product makes your muscles leaner and your strength will improve gradually as well.As for flavors, personally, I've never strayed away from anything chocolatey tasting, but you guys might have different taste preferences. So, if you are planning to purchase this product, I would highly recommend the Gourmet Chocolate flavor as it doesn't taste too generic and it goes down easy. I would rate the Gourmet Chocolate a solid 8/10, you might feel differently about the taste but that's just my opinion. I don't do any other flavors besides chocolate for protein powders. This product surpassed my expectations by a mile, I thought it would be inferior to ON's Gold Standard Whey, but it turned out to be significantly better in my opinion.I would 10/10 recommend this product to anyone!

This product is used by some of the best bodybuilders in the world- including a glaring endorsement by the famous Dave Palumbo- a legend in the sport.  This is a product used by people who measure everything they eat, obsess about every gram of carbs and protein they ingest and who - by rigorous trial and error- discover ways to change their body composition that defy belief.  The way I see it, if organic bodybuilders who look like a million bucks swear by this product, and knowing how much they consume on a daily basis (thousands of high quality calories daily), then it's going to be good enough for me.  And sure enough, I've been through several jugs of this already, and I am LOVING it.DISSOLVES INSTANTLYI put in two scoops+8 ounces of water, and it completely dissolves.  I stay busy and have to supplement my protein intake and so I take 3 shakes a day.  I love that I don't even have to use the metal wire-whisk ball that goes in my shaker cup.  I just add about 8 ounces of water, and stir with an ordinary spoon for about 15 seconds.  It barely changes the consistency of the water (no thickening agents), and goes down easily.  I drink the vanilla because I love the taste- not too sweet, and no "off" flavors or aromas.TASTES AWESOMEI've used 40 or 50 different protein supplements, and the worst has to be the protein supplements derived from vegetable matter.  I've had protein powders that literally tasted like chalk dust.  Dymatize has a winning product here with the taste being so simple, smooth, and free of surprise odors or aftertaste.  It's just really REALLY good.  My 12 year old son keeps swiping shakes when I'm not around because he loves the taste.HIGH QUALITY PRODUCTI'm using this product to help with putting on muscle.  So far, I've had great gains in quality muscle, and I can drink this stuff at any hour (even late at night) without getting any kind of indigestion.  It's top notch quality.ABOUT THE SELLER:I got my product VERY FAST, packaged properly, and there was even a little extra sample product thrown in there for free.  How cool is that?  You don't even see that kind of thing any more these days.  I was delighted.  Thanks for the sample!  You have my ongoing business, and my 5 star rating.  Please don't change anything!

I use this about six times a week, one scoop per day in ~12oz water, along with the typical 5g of Creatine and 5g of fiber. I use an electric milk foamer to integrate the powder (avoids clumps of powder sticking to roof/mouth of shaker cup), then shake it in a shaker cup to fully emulsify. This produces a nice, even consistency a little less thick than a vanilla shake.Flavor-wise - inoffensive. A little protein bitterness but really not much at all, not too sweet, not too creamy. Better than most of the sugary brands out there. No aftertaste. Clean the cup well, though, because this is the kind of powder that will leave an odor if your aren't reasonably thorough.Comfort-wise - no discomfort if you take it after your sets. No gastrointestinal distress of any sort, no bloating. Decently filling on its own, and quite acceptable with the fiber.Effect-wise - well I'm plateaued at 183 and have been for a couple years - this didn't change that at all. But it maintained well and isn't to calorie-heavy, so no complaints I suppose.Cost-wise - worth the price for what you get. Doesn't have the same protein/dollar ratio you can get with some brands, but the flavor's better, which for someone like me, who is content to maintain mass and support the sets, it's fine.Give it a try if you haven't already, but otherwise unremarkable.
It’s not the flavor you expect. I use a variety from this brand and this is my least favorite.

First of all, it tastes great!  Probably the best tasting isolate I've had and seems to work effectively.  However, it should be noted that there is a Bioengineered food ingredient statement that has been omitted from the online ingredient label, so this product does contain GMOs.  Some people don't care, some do... I feel it should be stated for transparency.  Also, I think the product weight and/or the indicated servings per container (about 71, it says) may not be entirely accurate.  I drank one level scoop per day with my workouts, and the container I received was gone in a month.  @71 servings, it should have lasted over 2 months!  Could just be the container I received was shorted somehow, these things happen, but this product is quite expensive... if I'm paying for 71 servings, I better be getting at least close to that amount, not less than half of it.

For starters, I've been buying this product for MANY years now. I was always happy with the product and would have given this product a 5 start rating until my last purchase. After opening the box that the container arrived in, I noticed trace amounts of protein power in the box and on the container near the tear off safety seal. I then removed the tear off safety seal and removed the lid. I was shocked to see that the container didn't have an inner safety seal on the container. Like I said, I've been buying this product for years and the container ALWAYS had an inner safety seal on the rim of the container that had to be peeled off. My first thought was that the product had been tampered with so I contacted Dymatize support and let them know that the container didn't have an internal safety seal. I communicated with 2 people and they both told me the same thing. Once response was, "Yes, we recently transitioned to a foam inner liner that creates a seal with the pressure of closing the lid." The other response was, "We included a foam liner in place of the typical paper liner. The foam seal is not adhered to the container. It creates a seal by the pressure of closing the lid. We are doing so with the same care and commitment to quality that has made us a trusted leader in the sports nutrition industry for over 20 years."Dymatize in my opinion has always been a top-notched protein powder which is reflected in the steep price customers have to pay for their protein. For customers like myself who've been with them for years, I have a VERY hard time understating why they would decide to stop selling their protein with an inner safety seal. They're telling me that the quality hasn't changed, but I beg to differ on that because the fact that I saw trace amounts of protein on the container and in the Amazon box BEFORE opening it pretty much proves the container wasn't air tight.

This is everything you could want in a whey powder. It's certified organic from grass fed cows. Jersey cows no less, which are known for producing outstanding milk. I trust the advertisement that the cows are out on pasture at least 300 days a year. That's important, because 'grass-fed' as a marketing claim is not regulated by the USDA, so you have to dig deeper to find out. This whey is also a concentrate, which some people may not prefer, but it preserves all the natural nutritive compounds (in their natural ratios) which heavier processing to create isolates can destroy. The chocolate is certified fair trade, as well as raw (this is the difference between cocoa and cacao, which has additional health benefits over cocoa). And the product is even humane certified! There are also no added sugars, and the addition of bifido-lactis assists with digestion, which is a very thoughtful addition that makes this whey stand out.I disagree with reviews that identify erythritol with producing excessive gas and bloating. Although it's certainly possible one could be sensitive to erythritol, it's much more likely that gas and bloating came from introducing a new strain of probiotic into the gut. I think this would be especially true for someone who has a poor gut microbiome. Also, whey is known to cause gas and bloating itself, partly since it is so easily assimilated by the body. Hence the bifido-lactis. This product did make me gassy for several days, but then my body adapted and it doesn't cause me any issues.

Started using this and I in the first six months with walking every day I lost 10 pounds drinking out at four in the afternoon kept me from munching on my way home and when I got home to make dinner what is a simple keto dinner. I love the flavor

I would never have bought this if I known how much stevia is in it. As a cancer survivor, I avoid stevia at all costs as studies have shown it to have mutagenic effects, i.e. it is carcinogenic.  (Not to mention, it tastes terrible) This would be a great product except for the stevia problem!
I make it with milk instead of water. More protein!
Love the flavor and texture. Love organic, grass-fed. Price is higher but worth it, to me. :)
My teenage son LOVES this so much! Not gritty, delicious and easily blends into fruit smoothie. Been a customer for 3 years- I even have it sent to his college address!
Love this fir my diet. Use to get it at Vitamin shop but they stopped carrying it.
This protein shake tastes great I usually blend with 1 banana and ice and water.. I also like it’s smooth consistency, other protein shakes have not blended as well.
I do not like that it has Stevia. I would have preferred to have no sugar whatsoever.
I am satisfied with the product
Disgusting flavor
Using this product for weight loss program
Only one my husband will use

I keep coming back for this protein powder. It always tastes consistent and is well blended in about 50 shakes. I love that it’s organic and doesn’t have artificial or stevia sweetener since I’m sensitive to anything but sugar. Added to smoothies or just milk is delicious!
Great product, make smoothies with it every morning

The best protein powder I’ve tried! Finding protein without stevia or monkfruit has been an absolute nightmare, so when I came across this I was thrilled! Just like other Garden of Life products the quality is top notch and you really do get what you pay for.
Excellent product.

I've tried many different types of protein powders and this is the first one that doesn't have that chalky aftertaste. This powder also mixes extremely well, can be drank by itself in milk, or in shakes with mixed fruit, or with juiced fruit/veges/vitamins/minerals.

I absolutely love this protein. I blend it with heavy cream and water, and it tastes like a chocolate milk shake. The consistency is great and it has BCAA's so it's great to drink pre, during or post-workout.
I really enjoy how tasty and clean it tastes
So good, love this!!!
When my mother was in hospice, the wound care nurse suggested it.  Added proteins help skin heal.  I never tried it but my mother loved it and it smelled great.  We put it in her cereal.
Very bad taste and won’t blend in anything I tried (coffee, oatmeal or yogurt). Won’t purchase again
This product was referred by my personal trainer. It is an excellent source of protein.
Excellent product .
I love this powder. The flavor is not overpowering sweet but good taste. It blends very well. If you search this product can be obtained at a reasonable price. Not bad regularly for the quality!
The powder doesn’t dissolve well with water.
Taste was good, blending was too frothy for me though. Digested well but not the best value for your money. Would likely buy again down the road.
