I really love this protein powder. I only buy organic whey and I’ve tried all of their flavors and the strawberry is my favorite. I mix with vanilla almond milk. Doesn’t have a nasty, chalky taste when I drink it. Low calories, low carbs, low sugar, high protein, and a good amount of BCAAs.
Taste is good in a smoothie.  My only small complaint is that is does not alway mix well.  It sometimes leaves deposits on the side of the blender.  The compatible flavor outweighs that small issue.
It is a wee bit chalky like all of these powders, but the flavor was good and it fluffs nicely in blender.  I added a banana and it was really good. No bad after-taste.
Taste great. Love it by itself or in my smoothie. Cannot go wrong with this product.
This powder really is packed with everything I like with a great texture and taste.  Unfortunately I think I am allergic to whey as it really bloated me so I had to return unopened containers.
This is the best protein powder.  It doesn’t contain Stevia and is very lightly sweetened without the sickly, overly sweet chemical taste of the others I’ve tried.
My husband and I do not like protein powder that has "that" taste.  This does not have "that" taste.  I mixes well.  Love the Strawberry flavor.
This is a good protein shake though a bit thin. It is filling by itself but I like to add frozen fruit and yogurt to it for a different flavor and thicker texture.
I use this daily.  It doesn’t totally dissolve in room temperature water but I don’t mind that.  Tastes good.  Have used it for about five months now and my body tolerates it well.
Good product. Smooth chocolate taste. Mixes into Almond milk easily in the blender.Personally prefer stronger chocolate taste and so add extra cocoa powder.

50 servings for less than a dollar per serving is crazy. The vanilla flavor test pretty good with milk, ok with water. Both are only a little bit chalky. Totally tolerable, overall on the enjoyable side. Get it if you’re looking for discount gains
I love this powder! The flavor is good, it blends well, and I notice more muscle gain. A +

The powder is extremely dry and finely grain.  Every time I open or close the bag, a plume of dust puffs out.I use a blender to mix and it comes out very thick.  The flavor is not bad, but is worse than any other protein I have.I won't ever order this again.

I love this brand. The best value for the money bar none in my opinion. I can get huge quantities, with quality protein, decent flavors and good prices.I use the regular MuscleTech during the day and at night, right before bed, I mix up one of these bad boys. Let me tell you, I was VERY skeptical since I'm a die-hard chocoholic and generally hate vanilla but this vanilla was the best value and I decided to give it a chance.I've been on a cut and pounding the weights hard to maintain muscle mass and strength during the cut. I wanted to maximize protein/amino acid volume in my blood and protein muscle synthesis. So I figure getting a long-acting protein like Casein during the sleep "fast" would be a great way to do this.The good news is the protein tastes great by itself and occasionally I mix it up by tossing in cinnamon or cocoa powder or powdered peanut butter and I'm on my way to flavor town. I get an upset stomach, bloating, and gas from some powders, but not Casein. It was gentle on my gut and during this diet cycle I not only lost weight and fat, I seem to have gained a little muscle and everyone is commenting that my back and shoulders and arm actually look bigger, not just due to fat loss, but greater peak and volume and lat spread. ON A CUT! I'm no mass monster by a long shot but it's a great feeling.Just for reference I am 186cm and cut 5kg from 100kg to 95kg and was hitting the gym 4 to 5 times a day, walking cardio 6x a week and a short jog 3x times a week and roughly 1.1g of protein per lb of body weight (or 2.42g per kg if my math is right).Highly Recommended to tweak your MPS (muscle protein synthesis) to a higher level during your training cycle by taking advantage of the benefits of slow digesting protein during your 8 hours of sleep (the 8 hours or more is  KEY for growth and recovery).Good luck!

Chocolate flavor tastes good to me, but I'm pretty flexible on tastes.  I usually do a half scoop along with some other brands mixed in for a post lifting shake.  Definitely like to grab it when it's on sale.
I like the flavor it is not as chalky as other ones and easy to drink after a workout.

MuscleTech products have always been high quality and this one is no different -Tastes great, mixes super easily in water (powder is super fine, which can get messy though if you're scooping with abandon) and is sold at a good price point.After several months it seems to work just as well as any other powder I've used, and the casein does help you feel full for a while afterward.
Love the flavor and is filling for meal/snack supplement.

Of all the protein powders I have tried, 8 Hour Protein ( formerly called Phase 8)  is definitely at the top for quality, value and price.  Pretty good vanilla flavor (recently name changed to Vanilla Cake) and relatively straight forward ingredients. Definitely have seen results when taking it after workouts and at times before bed. A good in between meal snack as well. Mixes well with water or milk.However, It used to come in a large jug. Was easy to handle, scoop out and seal with the lid. The company recently changed the packaging to a large sack that is supposedly resealable. It is awful. You require scissors to open the package as there is no starter notch or perforation. The resealable zip lock does not work. It is cheap thin garbage. Try pressing it shut and it does not close and the fine powder goes airborne and everywhere. Messy. The jugs were better but they must be cutting costs. Surprise surprise.
Delicious, i'm a big fan of Muscle tech. My favorite flavor was vanilla but after try this, i think i found the best of chocolate flavor for me
one the best tasting chocolate I've had.

What used to be called MuscleTech Phase8, and is now MuscleTech Platinum 8-Hour Protein, has been my go-to protein supplement for years. Great specs, good flavor, easy to mix.The new name came along with new packaging. Rather than being a large jug, one that I could actually get my hand in and scoop the powder out, it now comes in a flimsy plastic bag. I can understand cost-cutting measures. I could live with that...not happily but, hey, also less volume in the trash can.However, if it was a cost-cutting measure it clearly failed. January 2020 I paid, through Amazon, $32.95 for the 4.6 pound jug. In January 2022 that had risen to $41.60. But now it's $60.46? Seriously? We now have a cheap plastic sack instead of an easy-to-use jug and the price has gone up a whopping 45.3% in just 8 months? I'm paying almost TWICE AS MUCH for it as I was in 2020?Great specs and good flavor, but I have to find a replacement product that doesn't require I take out a second mortgage. At $60.46 per, if you take one serving twice each day that's an annual cost of $883. Not a typo. If you take 4 scoops daily per MuscleTech's recommendation for maximum results, that's now a price tag of $1,766 per year.So I give it 5 stars for the product itself, and take away two stars for the new packaging...and especially the new price.

I usually hate how Casein tastes but this one is actually quite good and perfect for before bedtime protein for those long hours sleeping. The new package in bags is also more convenient that the 5lbs pots they used to ship in a couple years ago.Even though it does taste quite good there is still a small aftertaste and also, it was an ok deal because I bought it on Prime Day but at the regular price and because of that little aftertaste I think it deserves 4 stars. Still good though.
I went with somethjng else for its value as this, the price went up when there are better out there

The Positives:- This is one of the more calorie conscious protein powders I've seen. One serving has 26g of protein for only 150 kcals.- No issues with the ingredients used to create the protein powder!The Negatives:- The powder is TOO FINE. Whenever you open the bag or any sort of storage container, the powder flies out at you in a small dust cloud of whey. This also makes it difficult to fully mix into beverages...still get that nasty, grainy texture.- The bagged design with a ziploc-style seal makes it more difficult to open the package, and increases the likelihood you lose some protein powder over time with consistent use, given how light and powdery the formula is. Every time I open the bag to scoop some out, I lose some powder.- The taste. Look, I know flavor is not most people's #1 consideration when purchasing protein powders, but for me, this chocolate flavor is not good. Have had comparably much better flavoring in other protein powders.

I've had several vanilla flavored proteins and while most of them have been good, this one is by far my favorite. It's great with milk and also blended with fruits, like bananas. The powder is extremely fine, more than any other protein I've tried, to the point that it blows out a bit like dust when I open the package. I think a bottle would have been better for such a fine powder than a bag. But it's no big deal, just gotta handle carefully. The ultra fine consistency probably helps with mixing, though I always use a blender so I don't know how well it would mix without one.

I guess it is just me but I cannot stand the taste of it. I have to literally chug it and then I feel like throwing up because of the flavor. I hope it actually helps grow muscle and that's the reason I am chugging it in. If there was a way I could return it after trying it one time, I would do it. I have tried a lot of protein powders as I am a student athlete and I have been playing tennis and hitting the gym for past 11 years and the taste of this protein powder is one of the worst ones I have ever tried. I seriously hope it helps my body otherwise all this sacrifice of my taste buds will go in vein.
This has a great chocolate milk flavor and the blend is VERY filling  and SATISFYING! I have noticed an increase in my quality of sleep and actually an increase in gains!

Who decided to put it in a bag? I've been putting Whey and Casein in my shake for a while now. Whey for the immediate and Casein for the longer term. But I've stopped buying the expensive stuff as I have seen no difference. I saw this on Prime Day and thought I'd try it. And it IS good. Great flavor, etc. But a bag? I just opened the bag and could have been arrested. The contents flew EVERYWHERE. And the "zip lock" is basically useless. So I closed the bag, pressed out the air and put it in my cabinet. And when I pulled it out of the cabinet the next day? Boom! It was everywhere. I had to vacuum my kitchen floor. Again, great powder. But who decided to put it in a bag instead of an inexpensive tub?

Great protein powder if you don’t mind the chalkiness. Not my favorite to blend up because it’s a bit gritty but it gets the job done. Now forThe packaging-horrible! If you have an old 5lb plastic container, KEEP IT to put this protein powder into. I messed up and tossed my last container. There is an atomic bomb of powder when opening this bag. Beware
I wasn’t a huge fan of the flavor but it’s protein that doesn’t clump up
Taste ok good product great price on sale.

The chocolate flavor of this powder is simply awful. I tried this brand because my normal one has gotten so expensive, but after one try I just can't do it. There is this almost bitter taste to it that just gets worse after you swallow. I'm not kidding when I say I was almost gagging. It's a good price, but that's all the good I can say
Like the taste, great product. Glad I took a chance and tried it. The only thing is it came in a bag not a container.
I bought the milk chocolate flavor and honestly, it wasn’t too bad. I’ve definitely had worse tasting protein powder
Good price but there are better proteins on the market

This protein powder mixes up with lumps of undissolved powder no matter how hard or long I shake the bottle.  It also has an off-taste which is difficult to identify.  I thought it tasted like cut grass but others thought it tasted nastier.  Maybe it was just my batch but am not going to roll the dice on this brand again.

I'm not sure if it's a good thing or a bad thing how incredibly thin this powder is. It makes a cloud when I open the container and covers everything in a three foot radius with a thin dusting of protein. Usually the thinner the protein powder is to digest and absorb. However, I've never had a protein powder so thin I'm afraid to breath on it and accidentally blow up a huge protein cloud. Scooping too vigorously stirs up the powder so much I usually have to go back with a sponge and clean up the countertop.It turns to sludge if it's not shaken or stirred immediately after touching water. I would suggest not even trying a fork or stirring. If you use a shaker cup the clumps are soft and easily obliterated with shaking. It mixes better than any other protein in a shaker cup or blender, very smooth. However, its impossible to stir it into liquid.I feel like the claim it's slow digesting is truthful, usually if I mix it with some maltodextrin and fiber I feel satiated for a few hours and don't have hunger pains like I do shortly after ingesting other protein like ON Gold Standard.The vanilla flavor is amazing, I mix it with walnut butter, almond milk, oat and wheat bran, psyllium and maltodextrin to make a meal replacement gainer drink. Blended this is the absolute best tasting mix I've come up with, this is the only vanilla that doesn't leave a artificial sweet taste in my mouth.3-stars for the mess5-stars for everything else, my favorite when compared to: Muscle Pharm Combat, ON Gold Standard, and Syntha-6

I’m not picky by any means, but the vanilla flavor has a very strong chemical like taste to it. I’ve been very happy with other Muscletech products in the past. Their grass fed whey protein is one of the best I have ever had. This one is just overpowering to the point that it can’t be covered up by any other ingredients in a smoothie etc.

I've been using protein powder for a long time and have tried many different brands and flavors.  I love this one! Its tastes so good and when I blend it for my smoothie it's thick like a shake should be.  Others are not.  I'll definately purchase this one again and again.

This protein tastes fine, get a lot for the money, only gripe is the powder is too fine. When you open the bag or poor into a container its so fine you can inhale the dust from the powder. This is not ideal for me.

UPDATED REVIEWI have stopped using this product. The price has gone up some and the quality has gone down or become inconsistent. It's not terrible, but there are better products out there with similar formulas. I have dropped my rating from 5 to 3 stars, but 2.5 stars is probably more accurate.My main issues are that the powder is so fine that it goes all over the place when getting it out of the container. And it is not that easy to dissolve. The taste for the vanilla version I used is maybe OK to chalky - varies from container to container. They have also increased pricing somewhat - though to be fair, prices vary depending on where and when you look.I now use Syntha 6 in regular or Edge version. I think they cost a little more usually, but don't  have the problems of the muscletech product reviewed here.ORIGINAL REVIEWI have tired both vanilla and chocolate. They both tasted pretty good - the vanilla tastes like a very good malt, and I liked it a bit better than the chocolate.I use half milk and half water as the base and add the powder while stirring with a spoon. Easy to blend. The vanilla looks more agreeable when blended. The chocolate not so nice looking then.I like that it is sort of a time release protein. It keeps the blood level steadier than plain whey protein. I drink one serving first thing in the morning and another before bed. I do use a regular whey product during the day. Trying to get 150 - 180 g of protein a day and would not be able to without protein powders.One downside of the Phase 8 product in vanilla is that it can be quite difficult to find - here or at a local store. Not sure why that is. The company should up production.

I was getting Phase8 and I LOVED it. The taste was great and it did not upset my stomach. I was real disappointed to see that Phase8 is no longer available and now it is this thing.This new one says it is the same but a different look, which by the way is much much worse than what Phase8 was. Also, the taste is NOT the same at all. I get the chocolate and Phase8 was great, this is not as strong. When I mix it, the powder remains not completely mixed almost like it's a little grainy. I did not get that with Phase8 either.BRING BACK THE ORIGINAL PHASE8!!!!!!!!!!!!
Can’t complain about the product but I would like it to show more information on the BCAA’s comprised in the 5.6grams.

I just don't like vanilla powders. I've tried so many of them and they all taste bad to me. This one is at least tolerable but I am just going to stick to chocolate powder. Not refundable so I'm stuck with it.

We've been buying this protein for years and have had it as a subscribe and save for a while. I didn't realize that they had changed packaging from their usual container with lid to a bag.  The bag is definitely not as easy to store and use and causes more of a mess. We'll be trying different proteins to switch to.

This looks like a powder but once you actually put it in a shake (and then in your mouth) you realize that there are small little chunks that are pretty hard that stay in your mouth. It really grosses me out, actually, and I’ve never had a protein powder like this. It’s my first time buying this brand so I’m not sure if it’s normally like this or if they had a quality control issue with my specific batch. Either way, I’m turned off enough that I wouldn’t even consider purchasing this brand in the future. Disappointment. If you can get past the small chunks I appreciate the milk chocolate flavor but do feel like it’s sweeter than it needs to be.

I've been using muscletech brand sups for years now. They always seem to have the better textures, better flavors, minimal aftertaste, lower prices, better quality, more effective supplements. I mean I've tried so many other brands. I used to mostly buy musclepharm, but honestly I feel like these products are much better. The whey protein (milk choc) has an amazing flavor and is actually enjoyable to drink. I'm a bodybuilder, and I've been able to get pretty big and pack on loads of muscle. Pretty sure this protein does nothing but help. People tend to leave reviews about sups saying things like "who cares about the flavor, just choke it down and enjoy gains". Honestly, after so many years of supplements, the ultimate deciding factors for me are performance, taste, and aftertaste. If you're going to ingest something daily and virtually religiously for years on end, for god sake, make sure you're able to damn stomach the stuff. Like i said, muscletech, and particularly this whey shake, is amazing. Scrumptious flavor, little to no aftertaste, easy mixing, and high quality muscle building protein.However, I will mention that every other tub of whey I encounter tends to have some strange "hard bits" in the powder. I have no idea what they are. Can anyone inform? @seller ?? They don't dissolve in liquid, regardless of how vigorously you shake or blend. It's kinda gross, but it's so rare that I see no reason to start the search again for another post workout recovery.

After I started consuming this protein powder I experienced these issues:1. Nausea and lightheadedness: I am sure that my condition is not due to anything else but this powder; I had never experienced such conditions before and these started happening to me right after I started consuming this powder;2. Stomach and intestines discomfort: your stomach/intestines will produce a lot of gas throughout the day; this powder is super-bulky and therefore you must mix one scoop of it in a lot of water otherwise you will be drinking a semi-solid past;Moreover, you would not like the taste and texture of this in your mouth.

Dealing with the bag that it comes in is not very fun, it’s like handling a bag full of concrete, every time you open it dust goes everywhere when you close it dust goes everywhere when you scoop it out dust goes everywhere, protein powder dust. And after mixing it in a ninja blender there were some small particles that were still a bit chunky and chewy

This is not the first time I’ve used this exact product.  After my last container of this protein drink was empty (which was purchased in a brick and mortar) I wanted to get another.  I was very happy with it the first time.  However the container I received from my Amazon order wasn’t overall as good.  First, there was no scoop in the container.  The directions say to use a scoop so you would THINK it would be included.  Thankfully I still had the provided scoop from my first one.  Second,  it didn’t mix very well.  Not sure why but I couldn’t get this powder to mix nearly as well as my first one.  I was always left with lots of chocolate chunks that would mix completely.

The vanilla flavor is great and blends incredible well with just a shaker bottle! Additionally, the slow release casein protein definitely helps me feel full longer compared to a previous protein powder I was using. The cost is incredibly low for a mix of this quality and quantity! I definitely feel like my workout recovery time has been improved by using this product. I was spending a lot of my time sore and struggling to get a full recovery between workouts (which was lowering my work out performance as I fought through soreness and fatigue), but after getting this protein blend with some immediate recovery benefits (from the whey isolates) as well as sustained recovery benefits (from the casein blend), my workouts have been progressing as I had hoped! Can't say enough good things about this protein performance wise and flavor wise. Be warned though, since the powder is so fine (for ideal blending ability) it is like a fine dust and if you are not very careful, you will get the fine dust all over your counters/kitchen scooping in a hurry. So just take your time and you will love this protein!
Great product except for the Sucralose. Sucralose is supposed to be very bad for the microbiome and I believe they say it causes cancer also. wtf

It is a good protein power with okay taste profile. I usually get MusclePharm blended protein and in the past I have used mainly OK whey protein. I wanted to try MuscleTech Phase8 to rotate the protein powders.MuscleTech Phase8 has protein, glutamine and BCAAs. Compared to MP and OK, MuscleTech Phase8 protein powder flavor is not very appealing. The flavor, while not repulsive, felt a bit more synthetic, with water and milk, both.I may order other flavors in the future, eventhough, I prefer blended proteins over single source proteins.

Short of putting this in a blender, it's nearly impossible to shake this well enough to get rid of all the chunks.This is true even when the concentration is low and it is mixed with warm water.Otherwise, it has solid taste, nutrients, and price.
This is the only protein powder that I've actually lost some weight on. Need to take it an hour or so before bedtime. Goes great in coffee also!

I got this for a great price, and it has BCAAs, and some other stuff, Glutamine and whatever.  It’s good for recovery.  This has the same stuff in it that some post workouts have in it so it saves me from having to buy post workouts.  This really goes super tasty 😋 with whole milk 🥛 at night.  I hope they keep the price down.  I got mine for like $20 and change with the coupon and a subscription.The vanilla with whole milk 🥛 tastes like a vanilla milk 🥛 shake 🥤.  I do 1/2 scoop with 12oz of whole milk at night.  I’m not doing script strength training or I would use a whole scoop.  I usually take a whole scoop with 12oz of water after an hour jog or an hour of cardio/body weight/strength/stamina military style exercises.
It might be the same underlying product, but the packaging is definitely cheaper and that should be clear in the description

This is amazing. The flavor is spot on wonderful and very filling. I use a blender to blend it up.  I ordered vanilla and it taste like cake batter. There is absolutely no gross fake sugar taste or fake chemical taste. I’m so impressed a let my neighbor have some and now she’s going to buy it.I do recommend using a blender to mix it I tried to shake it and it was not the same. It keeps you for for a very long time. I have a fast paced intense workout job and this solved all the problems. A friend of mine had recommended it and had used it for years.
My new favorite!

Tried the triple chocolate flavor of this product, it actually mixes a lot better than I thought it would. I put two scoops in 1 cup of milk it mixes very well.  The triple chocolate is not bad in my opinion and it does not have a bad aftertaste. MuscleTech is known for making well made products and the Phase 8 protein is no exception. I'll say that this is one of the better proteins that I have tasted from MuscleTech and I think that this product is worth the money.  The results you get from Phase 8 protein is equivalent to that of similar products from other brands, only this one is more affordable. This is a great protein for after workouts, especially with the hydrolyzed whey protein isolate and the casein protein for the slow digesting at night. It doesn't hurt your stomach like the other protein product can. I would recommended this product to my friends and colleagues.

I've tried a lot of different protein powders over the years, I am certainly no body builder so I can't attain to the effectiveness of the product long term, but I will say that the vanilla version of this one doesn't taste good. Even compared to others this one has an odd taste and grainy texture. I've tried water, skim milk, whole milk, adding cocoa powder, matcha powder, even tried cooking with it and you just can't get rid of the strange taste it has. I was getting the "nitro tech" powder from them before and it wasn't bad, I thought the vanilla might be good to mix with other things and it seemed like this blend might have been better possibly, but I think I'll probably just go back to the nitro tech instead next time.

I am a fitness instructor. Have been working out consistently for years. Have had different types of protein powder, switching it up almost every time. What I like best about this product is the price point. Can't beat that. I also like the texture/thickness of the shake. Definitely feels more fulfilling than others, especially if you use water to mix with your shakes. The only reason why I give this 4 stars is because it does feel chalky no matter how much i mix or shake it. I feel like I need to cough or clear my throat after drinking. The flavor is just okay but I dont drink protein shakes because I like the taste. Overall would recommend at least once but I dont think I'll buy again.

Using this product for over a year with in combination with keto diet, and I've went from 180lbs to 135 lbs! I am a 5'3" woman in my 30s. After having had 3 kids, I had such a hard time loosing weight, but this shake keeps me full and gives me just a bit of something sweet. The way I use it is by mixing in water and adding instant coffee and some ground flax seed to it. Gotta stay regular somehow when on keto. I honestly don't think I will ever go back to not using this product.

I remember I used to buy the previous version of this muscletech phase 8, that protein powder used to be thicker and felt more filling, this one it feels like its more whey protein rather than longer lasting casein protein, doesnt feel it adds up to my nutrition especially me that im a hard gainer and that was the reason for this 8 hour protein.

I always read reviews on protein powders that complain about the flavor. It's a nutritional supplement, not a milkshake. It is meant to serve a purpose, not entertain your taste buds. With that said, the ones who say the chocolate flavor tastes horrible are crazy. I've tried MANY protein powders over the last decade and chocolate is always my default flavor, and this is probably the best tasting one so far. And even though it is mostly whey protein with a little casein thrown in, it does seem to keep me satiated for a long time. It also mixes way easier than pure casein, which is nice. Aside from the useless claims of "making your muscles bigger and stronger" and all the BCAA garbage that you get from regular food anyways, this is a solid product.

Kinda crazy experience. I ended up playing basketball for 2 hours and strength training a bunch after couldn’t stop moving till the very end of the day and that’s when it hit me it was the first day I had this powder. I burned 2000+ calories according to my Apple Watch and still had energy left the last half hour before bed I was walking on my tread mill. I don’t know what is in this but it had my energy level way amped up and I forgot I had even drank it so no it’s not just my mind lol.
The main issue I have with this protien powder is when you mix it... it gets foamy... I hate having to gulp down foamy protien powder.Other than that.. taste is OK.. value is decent.

Guys I had to give this stuff away. The flavor is exactly as stated. Although it doesn’t taste better as other products like ON NUTRITIONPros:  works, leaves you feeling full, best to take directly after a workout.  Didn’t have fatigue or muscle sorenessI was taking this right after my workout BEFORE bedCons: my kidneys was always hurting, had to stop taking it after a week and a half. waking up in pain in the middle of night.Regularly using the bathroom and drinking lots and lots of water after I drank the shake.I tried mixing with water , I tried milk, I mixed this with ice cream, I’ve tried different ways to offset that “fake taste” and prevent my kidneys from hurting.

This is the best tasting protein powder I’ve tried yet, and I’ve tried probably 20 kinds. It’s a very fine powder so it mixes really well. I shake it up with some milk and it all dissolves and leaves no clumps. Sometimes I blend it with ice and peanut butter in a blender, and it tastes like a real shake. I can’t wait to try the other flavors.. plus 32 bucks for 4.6 pounds is a steal! 10/10.. will only buy this from now on
I’m pretty picky with protein, but this is perfect blend of cheap but effective protein. Have been using it for years. Highly recommend.

I hate using water with my protein powder. After the gym everyday for the last two months I would make a milk based protein smoothie and this powder was terrible for it. It was too foamy. Last week I ran out of milk and made the smoothie with just water. This powder is great!  If you use water than the powder mixes really well and it is smooth. I won't buy this line again but if you don't mind using water in your smoothie this is a great product.

I tried the Premium Gold 100% WHEY PROTEIN (Vanilla Ice Cream) from Muscletech before this and it was a much different consistency and flavor. The Vanilla flavor of PHASE8 tastes more like chemicals than anything, and the consistency is like trying to mix sand with water (very grainy). The previous product was much more chalky and mixed way better. I bought this for the price, which was about $10 cheaper than most other brands, so I can't complain too much if it still does the job. I'm not the type of person to waste things, so I will finish the tub, but I won't be buying PHASE8 again. That extra $10 seems worth it now. Lol. I also might try to avoid Vanilla flavoring in the future since most companies just can't seem to get it right.
It makes you real bulky. So, use it only u want to gain real mass. To get lean , not a good choice

The container is huge, it lasted me about 7-8 weeks. Yes, vanilla flavor is very chalky tasting, but as for someone who stays away from sweets, it tastes pretty decent with milk. You get used to the taste eventually and it doesn't taste that weird after some time. I'm not sure about the benefits it advertises, I did not notice anything different when using it. Was on sale, so was even cheaper than the other regular protein powders.
Mixed fine, but kinda gritty flavor/feel.

This is my go to protein after every work for laat couple of months. I'm happy that it comes creatine and BCAA for the price I paid. The texture and taste are really good. I'm not completely satisfied with the way it mixes in protein shaker bottle with just water. I tried in the Vitamix and it's fine. Other than that it a great product.
I've had this brand before.  This isn't that great
Me encantó el sabor y la calidad. Lo uso para aumentar mi masa muscular.

The reason for me buying this is that it has 26 grams of protein per scoop with only 150 calories each. Compared to what I was taking before, the Syntha 6 powder with 23 grams of protein at 200 calories, I figured the trade off is worth it. The price is what it is, but at the end of the day these giant jugs of even just decent protein powder isn't going to necessarily be dirt cheap.So that's the good part, the bad part is the taste, or more specifically the after taste. It's good first going in but when the after taste is just bitter and medicine like with a bit of Vanilla flavoring. You can KILL the after taste with a spoon full of peanut butter which makes it taste WAY WAY better than it would without it, plus peanut butter adds more protein, so as far as I'm concerned it's win win.I realize a bad after taste maybe a non starter for a lot of people, but like I said, the protein and calorie content per scoop is what I'm basing my value proposition on, so take that how you will.
Have tried many chocolate protein powders this one has no dry taste and has the best chocolate flavor and gives a thicker chocolate drink

Taste wise, this is my favorite protein powder by far. The ingredients leave a bit to be desired as we're trying to find that perfect balance of a good protein powder, taste and optimal ingredients. The final downfall is we're watching our carb intake and 8g of carb per serving is way too high for day to day.If you're objective is fantastic taste and quality whey protein, this is a stellar protein powder.On the other hand, if you're fine tuning your carb intake and seek a higher quality protein powder with minimal additives, this is not for you.3/5
Way too sweet with a gross chocolate flavor aftertaste. I gave it away.

I'm not sure if the first tub or the second tub has the issues. The first tub was delicious and did not overly foam my smoothies. The second tub foams everything, hot& cold beverages to the point where I can't use it in cold beverages and it's barely acceptable for my hot. Disappointed & not sure I want to try a third tub.

Kept me full as claimed. I didn't like the Sucralose sweetener that this has, but didn't find out till I had it in hand.  I would prefer no sweetener than what this has.I would not order again.Some simple research revealed Sucralose is not good for you, its manufactured by combined  sucrose (cane sugar) and chlorine, yeah that's right,, drain cleaner and laundry whitener, and its these chlorine atoms in the chemical makeup of sucralose that is killing your good gut bacteria  Sucralose alters the amount and quality of those beneficial microbes that hang out in your belly (the same ones found in yogurt) by 50% or more. “Alteration in bacterial counts is associated with weight gain and obesity,” and limits you body's ability to process certain therapeutic medications. Sucralose can be up to 1000 times more sweeter than cane sugar and its more stable for enabling a prolonged shelf life. Its this reason manufacturers like to use it, Their cheap and a little goes a long way so they choose the coin over their customers health.  Why not make it without the sweetener as an option.

This is not the 8 hr protein. It is thin and more like milk and water consistency.  In the past it was fine.  This is different. Some companies change their product to a cheaper quality when it sells well. The consumer is not stupid.This is my last purchase of this product.

Really easy to mix.  No chunks, or nonsense left over after shaking it up.  It tastes really nice.  I like adding a half scoop to my overnight oats.  Perfect sweetness without tasting artificially or sickly sweet.This has given me a little gas, unlike Syntha 6, but it's not a prolonged thing or a big deal.  Sweeteners do that and you'll react to some and not others.  Find the right one for you.  Overall, this makes a really nice, filling shake.  I'm using it as a meal replacement for lunch, or a filler between lunch and dinner if it's going to be a long day.

After blending, this powder left behind little white chunks that I end up having to spit out for the next twenty minutes after drinking.  Like little plastic grains that get stuck in your throat…nasty!

Tried this as a cheaper alternative to Gold Standard. I guess it all depends on what protein you're coming from. Having tried a few different kinds, from the GNC generic brand to the cheap stuff from Wally World, Gold Standard seems to be fairly top tier in regards to taste and quality. I could taste the artificial sweetener immediately in Phase8 where as I couldn't with GS. I 'think' GS uses a form a stevia as to sweeten their whey so that's probably the big difference. That said I did get used to the taste, I was just concerned I wasn't going to be able to finish the tub at first.Also, Phase8 is a PITA to mix. With GS, I can use a spoon to stir it up with water and milk and it come out with very little to no clumping at all. I had to use a shaker at all times with Phase8, otherwise I'd be choking on huge clumps of powder. Also, it's crazy how "powdery" this stuff is. Dumping a serving into my shaker created a cloud of dust every time. I know that's a pretty nit picky but it's nice not to have to wipe down the table after every protein shake.You could probably do worse at this price point. So it gets two stars as it is tolerable if this is what you can afford. On a side note, as I was going to order more GS, I discovered Amazon has finally, thankfully, added it back to their Subscribe and Save program. That just made it tons more affordable and that's what I'll be sticking with for the time being.

I am moving into the bodybuilding world and supplements are something I have more knowledge about that most. And this supplement has a lot of Carbs per scoop but still a great supplement to have in your armada! Would I purchase again? Yes, but I am gonna try more before. Because again. The only concern is carb amount!

I'm an evening lifter, and even though I do use a protein supplement after the workout, I've noticed that this does seem to help with fatigue and recovery when I take even a smaller extra shake of this before heading off to sleep. I have to say, I don't love the flavor, but it is bearable.
Chocolate “flavoring” yes - but it is really bad - oh my - I know it’s Healthy - but really doesn’t taste good - wish I could return it

Since I generally only eat once a day at dinner, I wanted something more substantial in the morning than just my coffee, and this is my go-to daytime protein boost. In hot coffee, it's a little clumpy if it's not thoroughly mixed. I've found that it's best if I put the powder in the cup first, add a few ounces of hot coffee and stir it up to almost a thick uniform paste-like consistency, then continue adding the rest of the coffee while stirring. I generally use a large 20oz mug for my morning coffee.UPDATE - I just ordered one in the vanilla flavor and it has a bitter, chemical-tasting aftertaste - definitely not happy with the vanilla and would not recommend.

1. Pour milk/water in your shaker cup. It helps stop the powder from sticking to the bottom of the cup.2. Put a scoop of protein powder in the shaker with a blender ball. You have NO hope of making this shake without a blender ball.3. Get a spoon and spend the next 10 minutes scraping powder off the sides of the cup.4. Scrape the powder off the spoon. This stuff just cakes on there like dried oatmeal.5. Wait for your clumpy concoction to get to room temperature. This stuff does not like to mix in cold milk.6. Shake vigorously for 35 minutes, then open the lid of the shaker cup and scrape all the dried powder off the lid.7. At this point, the shake will have the consistency of pancake batter. If you add about 8 gallons of water, you'll have something that's more like chocolate pudding.8. Choke it all down. It can take a while, but I always power through.9. Be disappointed at how much protein powder got stuck to the bottom of the cup.10. Repeat after every workout.Yeah, the taste is OK, but it's totally worth spending another $15 on a better protein. I've been a protein shake drinking gymrat for years, and I'm not even going to finish this container; I've already ordered a better product.And yes, I followed the mixing directions on the container. It's awful.

Muscle Tech has created an amazing protein with the Phase 8 blended formula. For those who regularly workout and for those who don't, this is a must go to protein that consists of seven sources. It is low in calories and carbs compared to other proteins which make it ideal for a meal replacement shake. The blended protein definantly helps with muscle recovery.  The taste is fabulous too (well as good as a protein supplement can taste) and it mixes very well. I personally get the Vanilla flavor and mix it with vanilla almond milk - unsweetened and vanilla almond chocolate milk to change it up. I highly recommend this product to individuals looking for both a meal replacement and muscle recovery protein. Plus, Amazon has a great price on it!
Excellent flavor! Tastes like cake batter :-)
This protein powder has everything I wanted with multiple types of protein, however I can not get past the terrible taste of the vanilla.
Not sure of the seal got broken in the handling,but powder Was all over the package , a líttle mess

I love this protein. It is lower carb than most others and tastes great in water. Usually I have to add milk to get a good flavor out of protein, however this stuff somehow tastes great in milk. I also like the fact that it is sweetened with Splenda, my non-nutritive sweetener of choice, as I am a diabetic.I also like the fact that it doesn't have soy protein. Soy protein increases estrogen levels in men. Estrogen is not what I am looking to get out of a protein shake. All in all, excellent product, I'll be back for more so long as the price is right.

I'm really fond of MuscleTech's "Whey Gold" line, and the vanilla flavor there. It's some of the best vanilla whey I've tasted. I was hoping for more or less the same here, anticipating some slight deviation given the added ingredient and benefit list here.Unfortunately, I'm guessing due to whatever additive pack or filler they're using to hit the advertised supplement list, the flavor is pretty awful. It leaves a kind of off-coffee aftertaste. That said, I've tried a different brand's whey+creatine mix product, and this one does a better job of masking the aftertaste. Still thoroughly unpleasant though, whereas Whey Gold is an absolute treat to drink.

this is not my favorite powder... i have to say that much. it breaks down ok, if the container you start it in is slightly wet at all the spots it sticks to when pouring in are very hard to get to mix. drinking this is like.... drinking sand paper? its very gritty. compared to other proteins i'm not considering this to be extremely worth its while. another annoying part is scooping and pouring this powder... I haven't had a powder that responds like this one before. If it pours out or clumps out that is, all at once, it poofs up a death cloud which then some how instantly settles onto whatever you're wearing or wherever you're mixing it. normal protein you can get a hand in the powder on accident, no big deal. this protein will stick to your hand like you dunked it in water prior to reaching in the container... overall i'm displeased. but it's protein and it works so i'm fighting through the annoyances because why would I throw it all away.

The first two times I made a shake, I thought that I did a poor job washing my dishes as it has a very soap-like after taste (vanilla). Luckily I’m able to chug the entire thing in one sitting so it doesn’t bother me too much. It’s bearable, but I’ve absolutely had much better tasting proteins!

Been using this protein for about a month, not a bad product no stomach issues at all no bloating. One little thing that bothered me is the residue that it leaves at the bottom of the shaker which is a pain to wash out after, no matter how much time I shake it, I mix one full scoop with a full bottle of water (16oz) which is double the amount indicated on the label but still have that issue.

Phase 8 has a good list of ingredients but I wouldn't say that it it mixes well with anything. You can get it to mix with milk (good) water (mehj) with a LOT of vigorous shaking in a blender cup. The label says you can use 2 scoops in 14fl oz of water which sounds like it would require a lot of wrist action if that's your thing.The flavor is fine - not as good as others like Designer Protein but this is a protein shake not a delicacy. On the plus side it has a decent amount of protein and a good combo of other ingredients.

I've used 2 or 3 other types of protein power.  This brand actually tastes GOOD, and the ingredients are equal or better than others i've tried, in terms of overall amino acid mix and quality, as well as being super low in sugar/carbs and fat.  The price is comparable as well.  If you use protein powder with regularity, i'd suggest buying the big drum because it's the best per-unit price.

This is a great overall go-to protein with a great profile for the price point.  Yes this is not a super clean isolate protein and that is fine for most people's goals.  I have been using this product to hit my daily protein requirements.  Mixability is great and so is the flavor.  Muscletech really knows how to hit the flavoring on the head.  The PHASE8 protein has been particularly helpful in shifting my caloric intake towards proteins and curbing my appetite in between meals.  I would recommend that anyone give this a try for the price point of entry here.  Great product!

I purchased one with chocolate flavor. It tastes good. But one thing I need to point out, I take protein powder before go to sleep everyday and this one always puts me UNABLE to sleep, you just feel so pumped and can't fall into sleep...I've been skeptical they mixed some other things with it...So if you take one before sleep, I suggest going with another brand, otherwise it is fine.

i mean its protein powder. and its relatively cheap. so i cant knock it too hard.  but the flavor is just weird. it doesnt even really taste like vanilla. and it leaves a strange chemical after taste that i really didnt like. had to force myself to finish it. often i had to add stuff to hide the flavor.  if you can get over the taste then this will be perfect for you because again, its cheap protein. mixing it with banana and peanut butter usually did the trick and made it more bearable.
Good Product but too thick shake for me. I was expecting this very light shake as other brand but it is not so I am not fan of this.
It doesn’t mix well and it tastes like horrible chemicals.It makes my left kidney hurt so bad.Take my advice and stay away. It will make you sick!

I hate the taste of whey and most whey-based products, literally, make me ill (seriously.. as in I need to puke kind of ill).This is the first whey-based product I've bought that doesn't make me sick.I added some ice cubes and half a banana, and it was actually pretty good!Contents of my protein shake:8 ounces of Fairlife fat-free Ultra-Filtered Milk (13 gram of protein)1 scoop Syntha 6 Vanilla Ice Cream Protein Powder (22 grams of protein)Half a banana (mostly for taste but it has some potassium in it · 145 mg).That's 35 grams of protein and 305 calories.Yeah, I know. It's got some extra calories and carbs BUT it tastes a LOT better than the others I've tried, and at least I can drink this one.It's not the same as a milkshake but it's pretty good. Compared to the competition it's EXCELLENT.My two cents worth. :D

I struggled to find a good protein powder as I am not a huge fan of chocolate. This stuff tastes so good and it comes with a scoop inside (usually buried when you first open the bag). This bag is huge so make sure you have a place to put it before you order it
Everyone hates a lawn out of fashion. I went to plant winter grass seed this season and covered the entire lawn afterwards with Syntha-6. Who says the grass is greener on the other side ?

This is great if you're bulking, amazing taste so easy to down. I would recommend also getting their mass gainer and mixing with milk, literally turns into a vanilla shake.Product on its own is a tier above in terms of flavor vs all other brands though.
We have used this for years, I finally broke down and bought the large 90 serving bag. So glad I did. Great value. Love this stuff!! Our entire family uses it daily!

This is probably the best-tasting protein powder I've had. I've tried chocolate and vanilla. Protein powders have definitely evolved a lot since the 90s and early 2000s. Syntha-6 is part of the new generation of protein products that taste great and offer good nutrition. I highly recommend this powder.
The taste is amazing it doesn’t taste like protein powder at all super good

I just finished whole bucket recently. I need to say this is almost the best tasting protein powder I've tried. Also it mixes pretty good with water or mike. Price is also fine. I love and recommend it!
love  chocolate and vanilla.

BSA is generally a higher than average brand marketing to serious to semi-serious athletes - so keep that in mind when you order. It's not top of the line, but you're not getting garbage either.On to the Syntha-6 specifically: taste is top notch and hard to beat. Ace-K as a sweetener, along with the other fillers, aren't great for you, but they're in almost all other major brands so it's hard to avoid. The additional 10g BCAAs are a nice touch, however, you don't know which amino acids they're packaging and at what doses - is it effective???Unless you go to higher end brands, you're going to get proprietary blends and you won't know the dose of each ingredient. That's just something you have to be willing to accept in this tier of supplements.Having a protein blend is great as research suggests that when you add medium-digesting (egg) and slow-digesting (casein) proteins to fast-digesting whey, muscle protein synthesis remains elevated for longer and muscle protein retention is higher. Not many recovery shakes have a protein blend, especially at this price point. Downside to Syntha-6, we don't know how much of each protein source there is.The sodium and carbs are a little high. This makes the nutrition profile more like a meal replacement than a lean protein source.Biggest question is does it work? I would say yes, it outperforms many of the protein shakes at this price point.Overall, the pros definitely outweigh the cons. This is a solid protein shake that tastes great.
Keep buying great taste

Mixes well with milk, Texture is a bit different since its a whey/casein mixture then pure whey, But its very drinkable, I mixed it with a scoop of Boost Vanilla to get my needed vitamins in as well as protein for breakfast, Im just a normal non body builder type looking to replace breakfast meals with a shake. This fits my needs.Taste is a generic vanilla, I can't tell the difference between it and boost vanilla powder, The after taste has a slight very slight cardboard flavor that dissipates pretty quickly.Overall its a 4/5 its my 2nd protein powder I've ever tried, with Ghost Whey being the first and preferred. But this is good too.Will have to try the cookies and cream flavor to get a lil chocolate in there.UPDATE: Picked up the 5lb jug of the vanilla, I've learned to love the taste, and the digestive enzymes they add REALLY HELP With the Gas/bloating issues other products may provide, this one does not give me gas or bloating!! LOVE THIS PRODUCT!

I think the company makes good protein but the chocolate peanut butter missed the mark. The taste is drinkable, not bad, not great. What I don't like are the black specs throughout the protein. I have no idea what they are and I was worried I received fake product. After researching other who bought the same flavor I did find reviews with the same black pieces in theirs. They do not blend and are hard. Wish the company would would clarify it had chunks of something in it and exactly what it was.

This is by far the best protein shake mix out there! I was skeptical because I'd tried many over the years. I was introduced to this and havent (AND WON'T) looked back! I put a banana and a tablespoon of peanut butter with about 1/4 cup of water and ice and its almost heaven. I look forward to getting home after work and making a shake. Its calming and just overall a great way to end a hard day! Its VERY fulfilling. I have added about 3 tablespoons of oatmeal to it on days when I hadn't eaten. There is no need for sugar and/or sweetener. I liked it so much that I purchased the strawberry flavor also. So far I dont like it as much as the vanilla ice cream flavor. I think I need to continue to try adding things to the strawberry flavor to see if I could be a fan of it. But for now I'm 1,000% sure ANYONE would love the vanilla! I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS!!! THANK YOU SYNTHA-6!!!!!!!!

Best protien shake I've had yet.I burst with energy after having it-my body really likes it, but my taste buds like it the most!I got the vanilla ice cream flavor and it's delicious even with just cold water. I add 2 scoops of raisins too it and eat with a spoon, and wow is it ever good like this!No other protien shake makes me feel as good. Maybe placebo? Dunno, I just know I'll pay the price difference to get this over body fortress in the future.
This is a great tasting protein mix and mixes easily by itself or with other items. I mix it with a banana and almond milk. A great shake after workouts .

Well, I've been trying out various protein powders this year, for trying to lose weight, not for working out.As I type this, I have six different brands in house in various flavors.  Syntha-6 beats them all on the flavor.I try the mixes with milk, but judge them on how I normally drink them, which is with cold water.(Milk and I don't agree very much, so I have to limit my milk intake drastically.)So far, I've only tried the Syntha-6 in the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor. I read through almost all the reviews before purchasing,and looked up more on the actual contents of the product on another site. (This is a downfall of Amazon's - they don't provide enough information on the ingredients for food products! To list foods, I wish they'd require at minimum that the Nutrition Facts label contents be posted!Anyway, I must say that this powder has fantastic flavor, both with water and with milk. It is higher in calories than some of the other brands out there, but has more protein. One of the reasons I tried it (and the reason I rule out many other brands/flavors) is that this has NO ASPARTAME. I am allergic to it, and must watch all foods and supplements carefully for it being snuck in to the mixes. This does have some corn syrup in it, which is probably why it tastes so good! But, if you are someone who is avoiding corn sweeteners, then note that this item has it.It tastes a lot like a bowl of good vanilla ice cream that melted would taste. Yes, it is that creamy and tasty.My only real complaint about this item is that it makes a very thin-bodied shake. It is like a glass of vanilla milkin texture. If you mix it with water, it looks like really cheap skim milk. That's a bit of a put-off. I ended up mixing it half and half with a flavor of Spiru-Tein and got a decent, tasty thick shake. (Note that I really don't like Spiru-tein's vanillas - there's not much hope for them. But other flavors mix nicely with this brand's vanilla.)Now, note that I have limitations in my mixing that many others won't have. I am partially disabled, so can't always get ice when I want it, or just throw some frozen fruit into the mix. Many times, I am home alone and the kitchen is downstairs, out of my reach. I did try this with ice, and that helped A LOT. Definitely better and a tad thicker when ice cubes were added to the mix. But, I don't see why Syntha-6 doesn't add a little more of some type of thickener to the mix. It would make a world of difference in the general texture of the drink. I haven't tried adding a little guar gum myself yet, so don't know if that would help.Here is the ingredient list:A Sustained Release Ultra-Premium Protein Matrix Comprised of (Ultrafiltered Whey Protein Concentrate [Milk] Rich in Alpha-Lactalbumin, Microfiltered Whey Protein Isolate [Milk] Rich in Whey Isolate Peptide Fractions, Calcium Caseinate, Micellar Alpha and Beta Caseins and Caseinates [Milk], Milk Protein Isolate [Milk], and Egg Albumen [Egg], Glutamine Peptides), Richmix Sunflower Powder Consisting of (Sunflower Oil, Corn Syrup Solids, Sodium Caseinate [Milk], Mono- and Di-Glycerides, and Dipotassium Phosphate), Litesse II Polydextrose, Natural and Artificial Flavors, Nutrisperse MCT Powder Consisting of (Medium Chain Triglycerides, Non-Fat Dry Milk, Disodium Phosphate, and Silicon Dioxide), Ticalose Cellulose Gum, Sucralose, Acesulfame Potassium, Lecithin [Soy], Aminogen, and Papain.Overall, I really like this product. Since I started using it, my nails have been growing like crazy!  Not sure if it is related to this product, but it was certainly a change I experienced. I don't feel hungry afterwards, and it doesn't leave me with "hairy tongue" like some powders do. I definitely will be trying some other flavors as the finances allow.
Whole family uses it . Great stuff
The vanilla flavor is similar to other vanilla protein powders. The flavor isn’t too overbearing. Great Value for money.
Ive been using this for years and there is nothing better, period.
Absolutely delicious! Tastes like desert!
It works great for muscle building
I like it and it blends very well with all types of fruits

I have tried many a protein powders in my many many years working out, but this one is by far the best.  I recently got the chocolate mint flavor for myself and the vanilla ice cream flavor for my husband (since he doesn't like chocolate mint or mint anything), and have used it for about a week now.Until a week ago, I was using the Elite XT powder from Vitamin Shoppe, but I will never go back to it- Syntha-6 is really that awesome!  It's got a great taste- even the vanilla flavor, and I usually don't like ANY vanilla protein powders because they give me heartburn for some reason.  Not this one!  The quality of this stuff is amazing, and it's really filling.  I haven't tried it with water yet (I'm traumatized my using Muscle Milk with water... aka dissolved chalk in a cup, eew), so I use the unsweetened plain 40 calorie almond milk with it (Almond Breeze, I think).  The flavor is really smooth, and has that ever-so-slight dairy, milkshake kind of aftertaste without actually having to use ANY milk products (except the protein, of course).  I don't like milk at all, and was allergic when I was younger but I'm not anymore.  I've always drank Soy and used tofu, and then in recent years since it's become more widely produced, almond and coconut milks; I can't stand the taste of cow milk- yogurt, some ice cream, and cheese is as far as my dairy consumption goes.  Even still, if I have too much lactose my nose gets stuffy and all that fun stuff.  My husband has become more sensitive to lactose in the last 2 or so years, too, so this protein powder is really nice for that, even though it is whey; there's no bloating, no upset stomach, and is really tolerable if you're sensitive to lactose (I actually didn't even know it was until I read the whole label yesterday, it's that good).That being said, after using it for about a week, I love it!  It really does keep you absolutely stuffed until your next meal 3 hrs later.  My husband agrees; with the Elite XT he would have to add extra fruit or almond/peanut butter to his protein shakes to stay fuller longer, but hasn't added anything to any of his shakes made with the Syntha-6 powder, which is amazing.  It has an awesome flavor with no nasty chalk or salty aftertaste, and is really nice after a hard workout- it really does reduce your soreness and decreases recovery time.  I can't say too much about fat loss benefits yet, but I imagine with how filling it is, and how well the body responds to it after a workout it would be pretty effective in helping.  Only time will tell, but so far, so good!  I don't think I'll ever buy another brand of protein powder, I'm an addict already.(The only reason I give it 4 stars is just because I haven't had it long enough to evaluate its benefit toward fat loss, but I'm sure it will be changing to 5 stars...)

I've been loving the syntha-6 proteins, haven't found a bad flavor yet. I decided to try peanut butter cups.When opened, the smell knocked me back a bit. It's awful. Even checked the expiration date thinking it was bad, but nope, all good there. I've been drinking protein powders for years and never experienced this.The taste is fine though. Does taste like peanut butter cups. It's weird. I like the taste but the smell almost ruins it. I'm also not a huge fan of the crunchy balls in it. Mint chocolate has them too but I enjoyed the texture element in the mint flavor. For some reason I just don't like it in this one.All in all I can't really give this a bad review. It does taste pretty good. Maybe subjectively it's just not my thing.
I love the taste and texture of the protein shake. It is very hard to clean from my blender and get the smell out. When served frozen it's great.
Perfect blend of chocolate and peanut butter. This doesn’t have that weird isolate aftertaste. It is my favorite of any protein powder I have ever tried!

I’ve been very picky about anything protein related. I’ve tried so many different brands with very little success because the taste of the protein is always too strong and leaves a bad after taste in my mouth. I’ve luckily found a protein bar I really like and now I can add this protein powder to that list. This protein powder was delicious. I was pleasantly surprised by how good it was. I was kind of dreading it ever since I purchased it because I was afraid I wasn’t going to like it and waste my money. But it was sooooo good. The vanilla flavor was strong and the protein taste was barely there. I use oat milk which gives it a thicker texture which I like because it was like drinking melted ice cream. I will definitely be purchasing this again as I work on my muscle building.

Got the vanilla before but this time Chocolate peanut butter.. wow. This is their best flavor in my opinion. I chose BSN because I’m trying to bulk up and when it is the best tasting on the market it is easier to drink shakes more. I also put a scoop in my overnight oats. Taste is 10/10 with milk

When I get home after a workout I usually blend up Milk, Ice, and this BSN Vanilla Ice Cream protein powder.  I am one to say that I really like the taste of this protein powder as I did not have any previous successes with other protein powder brands.
Such a good protein for the price. The flavor is phenomenal when mixed with milk! Don’t buy if you are lactose intolerant, I made that mistake

This protein powder changed my life, it is not chalking tasting at all, it tastes like a true smoothie! The vanilla ice cream flavor is the best and I add whatever flavor or frozen fruit I want, so many flavor combinations you can do and it does it's job great! I never have muscle fatigue! You will not be disappointed in this protein powder!
Tastes so good and blends wonderfully
I like to make coffee smoothies and this mixes great. It is also very good with fruit syrup or by itself.

I have tried some protein shakes (I won’t say that a lot of them, but still some), and I think this might be the best I have tried.I LOVE it’s flavor, many other protein shakes taste weird or have a very disgusting blending texture, but this one dissolves into the milk quickly and smoothly, and the taste is amazing, it’s like drinking a Vanilla Ice Cream milkshake, I just love it.As for the quality, it seems to be a very good quality product, it does have some calories but they’re not much, is almost like taking a granola bar, and I mean, you really NEED some calories, and even more if you are going to the gym, and most of them are quite useful rather than “harmful” calories because most of them come from the protein itself, it has a little bit of carbohydrates but not much. I wish it had lower levels of cholesterol (they’re not very high but still would want it to be a little lower), but I also know that some cholesterol is actually necessary for your body, as all of the membranes of the cells have cholesterol in them. The protein itself seems to be from very high quality amino-acids, which are very important for real muscle growth.It’s very good because it also makes decrease my food craving and my appetite (which may be because of the high protein levels itself). And it does not give me any side or negative effects.The product content is quite good, and it will last very long, so for the price I think it’s very good.So far, so good, it really has helped me to gain some muscle at the gym, without gaining fat related weight, it has done it’s job, I love it. Would definitely recommend to buy.
I have tasted many protein shakes but find this one in particular to be the best flavor. I blend mine with one banana, peanut butter and oat milk. Taste amazing and keeps me going for several hours.

I've been taking some form of protein powder for over a 20 year period.  Recently, I've looked for an all in one powder that I can readily make and shake after workouts as well as before bed or during the day if I need a quick meal replacement. This would replace whey after a workout, and casein before bed I am just tired of buying multiple bottles of protein powder. I also just started using a new pre workout instead of C4 
it's called METAHUMAN by Prime SUPPS
.  I found it cheap and works well. This stuff with protein on an otherwise empty stomach in the AM before cardio is really shredding the fat away and gives me great energy throughout the day!Anyway this protein product fit the bill nicely. I look for 4 things when picking out a protein powder (not in any particular order) :1) Nutrient profile: This has 22 grams of protein, and includes a mix of whey and casein, which is what I was taking before in two separate products. It also has 15 grams of carbs, which is pretty low (I'll buy anything below 20g of carbs, but the lower the better).2) Flavor: Taste is pretty good. I usually get protein in either chocolate or vanilla, and I got the Vanilla Syntha-6. It doesn't have any sweetener aftertaste or gritty flavor, which is a problem. I usually mix it with water, it tastes as good in water as it can taste. I'll occasionally mix it with milk, which makes it almost creamy tasting but beware Dairy can make you hold water so I only do that when I am bulking or not worried about overall calorie intake.3) Mixability: Syntha-6 mixes extremely well in water or milk in my shaker bottle, with no clumps. A little bit sticks to the side, which I will chalk up to normal it’s sort of unavoidable.4) Price: Price was descent and better than I can find in a GNC or similar store.  Under $25 for over 28 servings of quality protein is a good deal. It's not the cheapest protein powder, but you get what you pay for.IDK everyone has their own favorite protein but this one seems to cover a lot of bases especially if your not prepping for a show.  Good luck in finding what works for you!

Since I've joined a gym and begun to focus on what goes in my body, I'm working towards a moderate-protein, 1200ish calorie-a-day diet.  I used to be an athlete in college, and I know how gross some protein shakes can be; many are just downright unpalatable.  I did some research about protein powders with a decent amount of protein that both mix well and taste great, and I ordered Syntha-6 Chocolate Milkshake.  For nearly a month, I consumed this flavor 1-3 days depending on my nutritional needs, workouts, etc.  In order to attain some variety, I also ordered Orange Smoothie, Mochaccino, and Chocolate Mint.  I also have subscribed to the Vanilla Ice Cream flavor, but it has yet to come.  I mix all flavors with water and ice.Chocolate Milkshake: Taste - 8/10.  Very creamy, tastes a lot like a variation of chocolate milk just with water.  This flavor is also excellent blended with a teaspoon of peanut butter or 2/3 cup of frozen strawberries.Orange Smoothie : Taste - 5/10.  It's ok.  It's going to be my bottom-of-the-barrell, use-it-only-when-it's-my-only-option flavor.  It tastes too off, almost like orange fluoride from the dentist.  Still very creamy.  I blended it with ice and blue berries and it was WAY better-tasting than just with the powder alone.Mochaccino: Taste- 7/10.  It's good and gets me through coffee cravings.  Sometimes I'll just say "screw it" and make a blended drink much like large coffee chains do, but I'll use the power, ice, and and a to-go packet of instant coffee in the blender.  It does kind of have a funky aftertaste.Chocolate Mint: Taste - 10/10.  My favorite flavor so far by a long shot.  Since I don't eat sweets, the Chocolate Mint flavor satisfies my cravings for Girl Scout Thin Mints, Andes Mints, and mint chocolate chip ice cream all in one.  I cannot emphasize how great it tastes.  The minty flavor stays with me like mint normally does, like fresh feeling in the mouth and back of throat.
Powder blends well, flavor is good not chalky and there is no weird aftertaste, and helps me in between meals.

I love this stuff. If I could give it 6 stars I would. It has the best flavor and texture in my opinion. I haven't tried the other flavors because the Vanilla Ice Cream has never gotten old so there has been no need to explore other options. I am not going to get into the "ingredient breakdown" wars that a lot of people like to do in reviews since I am no expert on these things. It does have a little more calories (not a concern for a lot of people, myself included), sodium and sugar than other products but not much. With that being said, as far as performance and recovery goes, I swear by this stuff. It has everything I need to feel great after the hardest workout. On heavy days I take 1.5 - 2 scoops if I need it. Syntha-6 seems to recharge me and give me the fuel I need to run the rest of the day. This may not be THE best protein on the market for building a lot of muscle, but if you want to get leaner, keep the muscle you have and still make noticeable gains, go with BSN Syntha-6. With a lot of hard work and many hours in the gym, I have lost about 15 lbs in 2 months and made noticeable gains in muscle mass. I honestly believe that this protein has helped with my progress so much. Maybe it just helps me recover quicker but I can tell the difference between the days I don't use this and when I do. I also like it because I am lactose sensitive and it does not hurt my stomach at all. I have tried the ON proteins and they seem to tie my stomach in knots, even though their products look a little better if you compare the labels. The taste and texture do not compare. I am by no means a fanboy of BSN because I really do not care for their pre-workouts and I typically go with ON Amino Energy or USP labs.

The flavor is outstanding, the best tasting protein shake with all the needed ingredients. It's like a treat in a bottle. I shared with others in the workplace and now everyone is ordering this product.Great Job on this one SYNTHA-6.

I chose this product based on several things.  The first factor was taste.  I had sampled a casein from Optimum Nutrition that was flavored as "Blueberries and Cream" that tasted, well, god awful.  I think that was likely a reflection on the particular flavor and not ON in general, I have taken their Amino Energy which tastes great but is pretty dubious as to its effectiveness.  In light of those experiences, I had heard nothing but good things about the taste of Syntha-6 and I can confirm that this stuff does indeed taste damn good.  Given the amount of carbs, fat, and "corn syrup solids" in it, I suspected it probably would taste good.  Cold Swiss Miss hot chocolate is a good reference for how you can expect this to taste.  I've also tried the vanilla flavor and while I prefer the cake batter, vanilla was fairly tasty, didn't have as much of a chemical taste as some vanillas do.  Additionally, I have no issues with dairy/lactose/gluten all that stuff so I can't give any reflection on what effects it has on someone with a sensitivity to any of that.The second factor was price; I have never had too much of a budget for these sorts of things.  It's cheaper than a lot of proteins that I have seen.  Most any protein powder with a reasonable price and good taste is going to contain artificial sweeteners and those things, and this is no exception.Overall, the comparatively high levels of fat and carbs in this mean it is probably best for those looking to gain weight as they train and also for people looking to use these things as meal replacements.  Price is decent, making this a good value in my estimation.  There are better options out there, but there are also a ton of lesser options as well.

I can literally eat it by the spoonful. I mix tiny bits of water in till it’s a paste and eat that. Sometimes I’ll just do 3 scoops in a shaker and have a thicc shake. I wanna start trying recipes with it too. New favorite brand

I'm not a body builder or a hard core gym freak, but I do what I need to do to stay healthy. I take a pre-workout and protien shake twice a day, once in the morning and once immediatly after my workout and that's all the workout supplements I take.I've used ON Gold Standard, Dymatize Elite, and Scivation Whey. I think they are all great and have a good taste and are also easy to mix, but I'm leaning more towards the Syntha-6. First let me say that the cake batter is the best tasting protien I've ever had, even my wife liked it (and she's very picky). Secondly, the mixability is good but I use the blender ball and that always gets it done. I did try to mix it one day without the blender ball and had some clumps, but nothing too bad. I felt like I had a noticable difference in the performance as well.I started taking syntha 6 after I took about 7-8 months off from the gym and I wasn't taking anything that entire time. I was literally starting out fresh. I've done this before and I knew the first 2-3 weeks would be the worst. Muscles swelling, cramps, aching and so forth, HOWEVER I had none of that. This was the first time I didn't have cramps or severe swelling. I didn't hold back either, I pushed and did the force rep method and even some drop sets. The Syntha-6 gave me quick recovery times and excellent support for muscle growth. It was immediate. I had people asking me if I had been working out by week 2. They could see it that fast. 2 scoops in the morning every day (on days and off days) and then 2 scoops immediatly after your work out will get it done.This is an excellent protien for the money and worth the try. I'm going to stick with this product for the long haul.

I have bought Protein powder from BSN many times from different resource.This time it is no plastic sealed or white paper sealed. I am not sure whether they change the product line or I receive a defective product. Request for a replacement. Will update the review if it is still sealed otherwise I think we can move forward with other brand.———————————————————————Updated on June 16th. It is sealed this time and it worth 5 star

My husband loves this protein shake. He loves vanilla ice cream taste and it’s pretty good he said. Also the benefits of the protein, very little sugar is definitely a good buy. I think BSN is a great brand, I like their protein bars, they are so good.

This product review pertains to the purchase of a 5.04 lb container of Vanilla Ice Cream flavored BSN Syntha-6 Protein Powder. Previously, some protein powders would leave me with the full stomach and bloated feeling after a workout. On the advice from a roommate, I was directed towards this product that has easy digestion and has a satisfying post-workout absorption.There are 25 grams of protein in each scoop and this is more than adequate for results. Only having to take one scoop is great for digestion and also limits the feeling of post workout bloating. The flavor “Vanilla Ice Cream” has tremendous taste and does not leave a chalky or powdery protein flavor like many other protein powders. Apposed to mixing with milk, I mix this product with water and throw in a few ice cubes to make sure the shake is chilled. This makes the already great flavor even more desiring.I have used this product for four weeks now and there are obvious gains that I have not seen in previous protein powders. I previously used Muscle Milk and was putting on undesirable fat weight in my abdominal area. This product has helped me to lose 25 pounds of fat and build lean muscle mass. What gives this product an advantage is the addition of the amino acids along with the whey protein. These two components work in tandem to give a serious athlete or weight lifter the most beneficial results for post-workout.This product is a wonderful source of protein, amino acids and flavor. BSN is a well-known supplement company that always puts out great products. Synthna-6 is not the cheapest protein on the market, but you get what you pay for.  In this case, the slightly higher price gives the consumer desirable quality and performance. I would recommend this product to any serious athlete or weight lifter.

I use a fast-absorbing whey protein powder before and after a workout but was looking for a longer-acting protein source that I could supplement during other parts of the day to get the total amount of daily protein I was looking for.  Syntha-6 contains whey protein but also has slower absorbing milk and egg proteins that my body can use on a more sustained basis when I'm not working out.  I take the Syntha-6 before I go to bed so my body has a lasting source of protein for recovery while I sleep and again in the morning to replenish my protein levels until I get to work out later in the day.  So Syntha-6 is great for fueling my body with protein when I'm not working out, and the vanilla ice cream flavor tastes fantastic.
