It tastes great even with just water, but sometimes in the morning I'll mix it with 8 ounces of 2% milk and pour it over cereal for a great tasting source of protein and carbohydrates to get the day started -- and it's absolutely delicious!If I had to point to any negatives it would be that the cholesterol level is higher than I'd like probably due to the egg protein, but I'm okay with it because a Syntha-6 drink often substitutes for another less healthy snack I may have eaten instead.  So for my purposes Syntha-6 has been a great supplement and a relatively good value on a per-serving basis.

I have tried several protein powders over the course of 5 years..... THANK GOD I found this one. It is by far the best tasting WHEY protein powder I have found. I found it at GNC for the same price as here on Amazon but it was for a lot less quantity.... I will be ordering it on here from now on. I am not a chocolate person and tried several chocolate shakes through the course of finding a delious Whey protein. I had stuck with one for awhile but was never thrilled with it. This Vanilla protein powder I found that I can add several things. Fruit or PB Powder (peanut butter powder) all mix well but the best so far is unsweetned cocoa powder.I use 8 oz of FAIRLIFE fat free (more protein) milk, one scoop (or 4 tablespoons) Syntha-6 powder. I had ice and shake with make shaker cup (you could use a blender then add the ice) then I use a little hot water to mix in 2 tablespoons of unsweetened cocoa powder (I use Hershey's) and add 3 packets of Sweet & Low. Then after it dissolves I add it to my protein mixture and shake some more and add more ice since it melts it. I is the best chocolate protein shake ever and it actually tastes better than a REAL CHOCOLATE shake from Dairy Queen.All the other whey shakes have a funny after taste to me or they tasted sour this one does not have that problem. If you add the protein powder to milk with nothing else it tastes just like a vanilla shake. And Whey is the best absorbed into your system. I was trying all kinds and before this one I landed on a Soy Protein which was not horrible but this one kicks it's butt.
TASTE REALLY GOOD

Best tasting hands down. I've tried so many protein powders as a part of my very active lifestyle - including Dymatize, Optimum, Body Fortress, you name it. I won't go out on a limb and say that this protein has the best ingredient profile, because I'm not so sure. It is 400 calories for 2 scoops - in comparison, other isolate powders (this is not an isolate, just to be clear) have in the range of 110-130 calories per scoop for a total of 220-260 for 2 scoops for the same amount of protein. To be fair, not everyone that supplements with protein has the goal of losing weight like I do. When you supplement with a goal of cutting calories/weight, you would probably not opt for something as calorie dense as this stuff - but let me just say that this stuff tastes AMAZING. As a side effect of it being so delicious, I am far more likely to remember to take it than forcing down some stuff that tastes like cardboard - again, to be clear, I'm not saying that the previously mentioned brands tastes like cardboard - they taste great while providing a lower calorie solution to those with specific goals. This in comparison probably has a lot more fillers and questionable additives to achieve a superior taste profile, and most folks have no clue what they are consuming - but it comes at the cost of additional carbs and calories which may not work for everyone. In my case, I use this as a meal replacement for breakfast because I'm busy and I hate eating eggs and yogurt all the time. This is a lazy man's solution for reaching your fitness goals that tastes like God himself put it together. Strawberry is the bomb.
chocolate with a hint of peanutbutter but still better than all the other chocolate ones

The powder paired with milk tastes like the warm breeze on a Sunday afternoon. Both your worries and all your problems disappear like Jesus himself has graced you. Only buy if you want to feel your muscles to cry for more of this formula. 😎
El sabor me gusto, no es igual que la típica proteína
It’s a little expensive but so worth the price the flavor is so good and that’s hard to find in products like these 100% recommend the vanilla over the chocolate though
I do not workout. I am using this to gain weight and recover from a major surgery. This product is helping me with both goals.

SYNTHA-6 is an ultra-premium lean muscle protein powder, and the best-tasting protein supplement on the market. Its formula features multiple quality proteins resulting in a nutritious and multi-functional protein supplement that ensures an athlete's muscles a quality supply of protein building blocks. As any athlete knows, high-quality protein is essential for building and maintaining lean muscle mass. SYNTHA-6 is the ideal solution to any active individual's protein needs, designed to perfectly suit a variety of diets and lifestyles. And with SYNTHA-6, that high standard of quality comes with taste to match, thanks to BSN's exclusive flavor technology.BSN is a solid and trusted brand with many great products, and Syntha-6 is no different. At a cost-per-serving of about $1 compared to other popular proteins at around $1.30, it is definitely a great price for a great product.The flavor I have been drinking is Vanilla Ice Cream and let me tell you... it is amazing. It mixes well, isn't thick, isn't gritty, and taste great. I would call it the best Vanilla protein I have tried so far. I workout pretty damn hard(and often) and when supplementing with Syntha-6, instead of being sore the next morning I am just a little tender and full mobility.Ok, so I broke down everything good about the product, how about some bad.The calories, fat, carbohydrates, and sugars are higher in Syntha-6 than other popular proteins. If you are looking for a protein with low levels of those things, well, this might not be for you.I love this stuff and I am glad I don't watch my calories,far, carbs, and sugar because drinking protein after a workout is tough, but Syntha-6 taste so good that I have no trouble downing it after a tough workout.
Mixes well, great taste.
My favorite protein powder. Tastes good and mixes very well.

I cant believe all the whiners on here complaining about the taste  , it tastes good i use the van ice cream , but whats really important is how it works im finding it working very well i can see and feel the difference if something actually works i dont care what it taste like my muscles feel fuller and  getting more stares at the gym its made a difference
Great stuff
This is a good product. It tastes good in smoothies.

Coming from the cookies and creme version of this product (same size), the chocolate peanut butter has a great flavor and doesn't taste overly sugary. I mix this with a milk alternative called Silk (using milk adds lactic acid to your muscles, which causes that burning feeling after many reps) and when shaken for about a minute using 2 scoops, the product has no clumps. It's comparable to other mid level products and it's not exactly a meal replacement however, for best results always use protein supplements within 30 minutes of rigorous exercises for bigger gains. For people using this as a meal replacement, rethink your stance as diet is easily the sole factor for gains no matter how hard you work out, your body needs fuel. That being said, combine this with a sport multi vitamin and L-arginine and you've got a great combination for muscle recovery and energy support.
Good tasting protein but has way too many calories and fats
Lots of protein. Tastes good. Better than the vanilla ice cream imo
this is my second time buying this and I just love it. It does not have that protein powder type taste. I really love it in my shakes.

I drink a lot of protein, and as a result, have tried a lot of protein brands in the past, and this is by far my favorite brand of protein.I personally have never noticed better gains or anything like that when switching from brand to brand.  They all serve their purpose.  The primary differences, in my opinion, between brands are in their nutritional facts (caloric content, cholesterol, sugars, etc) and taste.  Syntha-6 is fairly run of the mill when it comes to protein nutrition in that it has an average amount of calories, some cholesterol, etc, so if you're looking for a protein that is really low calories, this may not be for you.  However, if you are looking for a protein that actually tastes good and doesn't make you sick to your stomach after drinking it, this is the best.  I always drink protein with water, and this stuff tastes good even in water.  A lot of people in the lifting community look down those who judge protein based on its taste, but if I'm drinking something in the morning, before a workout, and after a workout, it needs to be somewhat bearable.  This stuff definitely fits the bill for me.I've tried both the Vanilla and Chocolate Peanut Butter.  Vanilla tasted good, but was a little too sweet for me (it basically tastes like vanilla cake).  Chocolate Peanut Butter is the best tasting protein I've ever had.  Its taste reminds me of Reece's Puffs cereal, and again, this is when mixed with water.This stuff is awesome, and it makes me realize how spoiled I am when I have to drink ON casein protein at night (which tastes awful).

Product is excellent. No complaints there. Some people complain about the carbs and fat. But, it is marketed and says on the jar itself as a meal replacement. When you compare this with the packaged MRP's, this is an excellent value especially with the Amazon discount. That being said, I am a bit disappointed with the Subscribe and save program on this product. It has been going up about a dollar or two each month. At first, I was paying $17 a jar. Now, it has that my next shipment will cost $22. If it goes up anymore, I may have to move on. There are a few other quality proteins on here that are cheaper and the prices do not seem to have gone up at all.Admittedly, there still doesn't seem to be anything better than this as far as taste and ingredients. This has 5 grams of fiber per serving. And the fat is mostly from essential fatty acids. Anyone that knows nutrition knows that these things are helpful in lowering your bodyfat. In the six months or so that I have used this, I have lost at least 15 lbs and have gotten significantly stronger. I wasn't really overweight to start with. I'm 6 feet tall. I'm now hovering around 180. Yes, the overall diet makes a difference. I'm not attributing everything to this. But, I've been taking 1-2 servings daily and I'm sure it has only been an aid to gaining muscle and losing bodyfat. It is also very versatile. Yes, you can use this after a workout. It does have whey in it. But works great as a meal replacement and the casein makes it great to have before bed.FYI, tastes great in water... No need to add more calories there.

The taste is excellent! I got the vanilla ice cream flavor, but I think it's the same as the vanilla (on the BSN website, only vanilla is listed; I suspect they shortened the name of the vanilla ice cream flavor to vanilla; I also compared the list of ingredients, which is identical).Pros:Delicious flavor, even when mixed with water.It mixes quickly and completely in a shaker bottle.Contains a nice dose of fiber (5g per serving).Nice and creamy consistency, similar to thick milk (but much better tasting).Cons:It's a bit pricey. A very similar tasting product, with nearly the same ingredients, but at a cheaper price, is Dymatize Elite Fusion 7 (creamy vanilla flavor). Actually, DEF 7 has a few carbs less (protein, fat, fiber is the same). To me, the flavor is nearly the same, which is not surprising, as the main ingredients, including the artificial sweeteners, are very similar.Neither a pro nor a con (depending on your goals with this product):Less than half the calories are from protein, so it's actually more like a meal replacement (MRP) than a pure protein powder. One serving has 200 cals, but only 88 of those are from protein (22g protein x 4 = 88). Nothing wrong with that if you want a nutritionally balanced shake. However, if you rather desire a more concentrated dose of protein in your shake (with less fat, carbs, and fiber), you may want to try Syntha 6 Isolate, or Optimum Nutrition's 100% Whey Protein Gold Standard. Those who try to stay away from artificial sweeteners should consider Dymatize All Natural Elite Whey (vanilla flavor is great!), which is sweetened with stevia.

I only workout so I can come home and take this protein. Best tasting protein I have found. I mix with a few ounces of milk, almond milk or oat milk and a banana, frozen black cherries, or frozen cherries and it’s like drinking a milkshake. Not the healthiest protein on the market in terms of fat and sugar but by far the best tasting I’ve found.

Whenever I need to shed a few pounds, I use this powder for meal replacement. It keeps the morning hunger at bay until I can have lunch. It is delicious! I do not work out, so I can not speak to those benefits, but it works great for meal relacement.

I bought this protein powder as a breakfast alternative - an ingredient for healthy smoothie to start the day and provide a good base of nutrition.  It tastes good, mixes well and overall I'm satisfied.  The reason for the review is the wonderful unintended consequence of using this product which is a significant reduction in the severity of my essential tremor. My left hand shakes and it has done so for quite a few years.  The Doctor didn't have any solution for it, other than maybe beta blockers.  It was getting progressively worse and was more annoying than anything.  Can't use a screwdriver with my left hand because it's nigh impossible to get it on or keep it on the screw head.  Not life threatening, just annoying.One serving of Syntha-6 reduced the tremor noticeably.  And after a week or so of 1 serving in the morning, the tremor is still reduced.  It's as if Syntha-6 is feeding my body and muscles something that was lacking.  Without changing anything else in terms of exercise, caffeine intake, diet, the tremor reduced to the point that it feels as if I'd gone back in time 10 years or so.  My hand and arm feel stronger, typing is easier and more solid.  It's a nice feeling.I'm 53, healthy and relatively fit.  Based on this initial experience with the product, I feel that Syntha-6 will help me stay that way and help me maintain and build muscle when I exercise.  This is not a scientific experiment - it may be that other protein powders could do this - but I am pleased with the result and the feeling of strength in my hands and credit it to this product.

This taste so good, wow, just like vanilla ice cream.  Unfortunately, my hubby had a malignant cancer removed from his face and now in radiation.  The doctor said that especially, where the radiation hits, he will suffer in his mouth and throat and won't want to eat.  Therefore, we need to have him drink protein shakes.  My son recommended this, he is a workout, health freak so I listened and I am so glad I did.  I add almond milk, crushed ice, a little water, frozen strawberries or 2 oranges and blend.  You will have a true strawberry shake or orange dream smoothy.  Yummy.  I just purchased the "edge" for myself now.  He gets the full fat to keep his weight up and I get the lesser.

This is a pretty good protein for the price. For awhile I was using Rule 1 protein before switching over to this recommended to me by a friend. I seen pretty good results from it. But just be aware that the last bottle I received tasted off. Like it was contaminated or out of date. I mix my shakes with essentia water and never had a problem before. But this last jar I got tasted off. The last shake I had from it before I stopped using that jar literally tasted like sour milk and I almost vomited. It’s probably too late for a return now but if you decide to get this make sure you let them know right away if you have this problem. Aside from that the first jar I had was great and like I said I seen really good results from it so don’t let my one bad experience discourage you from giving this product a try.
Go to protein powder for taste/texture combo. I’ve had better unique flavors but this is the best simple vanilla out there
I tried a couple of protein powders but the chocolate cake batter is by far the best tasting and easy to mix. Highly recommend!!

I admit, I am the pickiest eater on the planet. There are very few things that I will try right offhand, and protein shakes rank right up with what I deem "funny food", which are foods that I already know I don't like, so I refuse to try other types of that item. That was, until I got approved for weight loss surgery. I had to find a meal replacement shake with protein and made from whey isolate. For this notoriously picky eater, the decision was brutal. I'd heard a lot of people say that this was the best though, so I hesitantly ordered a 5lb jar. I hate wasting money, so I knew even if I didn't like it, I'd choke it down as best as I could to get my money out of it.Turns out? No force feeding necessary. When made with almond milk and ice, the resulting blended mix is pretty much a milkshake. Something about the almond milk enhances the Choc-PB mix far more than the 2% milk did. It turned into something I didn't mind using, as the taste made t seem like a treat instead of the punishment I thought it'd be.I've finished the first jar and I'm looking at another surgery to finish the bypass, and I'm going to be ordering another to help me through this leg of the trip as well. I haven't tried any other flavors, but Choc-PB gets a win from me.
Best tasting protein around.  I mix it in my coffee instead of using creamer

We've been using Syntha 6 for a few months along with doing P90X and it's definitely making a difference. It does have a higher fat and carb content than many protein powders, so make sure you can fit those in your macro allowance for the day. My husband struggles to get enough calories is its not an issue for him; I use Syntha 6 as a meal replacement and occasionally as a before bed drink when I've worked extra hard that day. As far as flavor, nothing beats this. I also use ON Gold Standard Whey for after workouts and have used several others and this is 10x better than any other brand for flavor hands down.We've tried: Vanilla Ice Cream (10/10, we always have a tub of this around), Chocolate Milk Shake (8/10, good for chocolate but neither of us are big chocolate lovers so we get sick of it), Peanut Butter Cookie (9/10, super yummy as long as you really like peanut butter), Cookies and Cream (7.5/10, good but we got sick of it quickly) & Mochaccino (6.5/10, I love coffee but a bit too chocolate flavored for me). I'm sure we'll eventually try them all.This is a bit pricey as far as cost for the percentage of protein which is why I give it 4 stars, but if taste in important to you, this is a great product and we can definitely tell it's doing the job.
Have been using this protein since 2012, good price and good taste.
I use this as my daily breakfast, it really helps me to keep my weight down and I really like the flavor as well.

I've been using Orgain Vanilla which isn't bad at all, but, this blows that out of the water on taste. I know I'll need to alternate between plant based and whey to keep my tummy happy, so, I guess it will be these two.I even mixed them together with half a banana and almond milk and was pleasantly surprised with the results. I'm curious to try chocolate and other flavors now. I don't think any other brand will taste better than this...This makes me geek extremely full all day. Like, I literally have to force myself to eat after it throughout the day. But, that makes it easier to eat healthy and healthy portions. I just have to be careful not to overdo it so I don't get heartburn.
Love the taste.Excellent benefits. Will be my #1 choice from now on.

I'm a young petite woman that has been working on fitness and losing weight for several months now, so my review is based on what this product has done for me and how it has fit into my lifestyle.I've tried many protein powders from GNC, Vitamin Shoppe, Muscle Milk, etc. I used to be a big fan of the Pure Protein in Chocolate Frosty, but found that I was experiencing a lot of bloating a half hour to hour after using it. After reading a lot of reviews on here, I decided to make the switch to Syntha-6 Protein Powder. I'm very impressed! No bloating, and it keeps me full for several hours after working out.I typically use Syntha-6 as a meal replacement (200 calories per scoop, so that's enough for me!). I was torn between purchasing this powder and the Syntha-6 Lean Dessert Powder (seems more targeted for women), but decided on this one. Google the differences in the product and decide what's best for you. There are a lot of fitness forums that will weigh the pro's and con's of using each product.I love mixing the vanilla ice cream flavor with water and raspberries. The raspberries break apart and it's like drinking a raspberry milkshake. This is hands down the best tasting powder I've used. There is no bad aftertaste, and it doesn't have the artificial taste that a lot of powders (particularly Muscle Milk) have. I plan on trying a lot of different flavors after my vanilla ice cream is gone. Mmm! Great product!
This is a really good sup. The taste is awesome & it really digests easily with no gas or bloating often associated with casein products.

Syntha-6 has definitely helped me to recover and build muscle. Been using it for 5 months now, taking a scoop in the morning after I wake up and a scoop post-gym. Very good for people that are trying to bulk and add a little weight since the calories and carbs are higher than some more pure whey proteins. I've gained about 5 pounds of muscle since I started using it and working out. It also contains casein protein so it could be used as a shake before sleeping, however I prefer whole foods before bed.My personal ratings:Effectiveness: 9/10Taste:10/10Mixability: 9/10Digestion: 7/10Price: 8/10Great product, especially for the price. You can pay much more for whey that contains less fillers and no fake sugar (sucralose), but unless you are a serious bodybuilder, I don't see the point in spending more money. My only complaint is that the cookies and cream flavor made me a little gassy, but I haven't noticed this issue with chocolate peanut butter for some reason. I don't know why this would happen with a certain flavor, or if the flavor is even the cause of this. The only thing I could think is maybe the batch of cookies and cream I got wasn't good? Or maybe my body is developing a reaction? Not sure, but not a big enough problem to get me off the product. Will stick to chocolate peanut butter and enjoy the results.
This is an excelent protein powder. It mixes easy, taste great, and can be taken any time of day.

After weight loss surgery (with complications), anytime I use protein drinks, it makes me sick - reminding me of the time I spent in the hospital.  I'm happy to report that while I can still taste the protein, it tastes better than ANY other protein powder I've had.  It still doesn't compare to pre-mixed protein drinks, like Premier Protein, but with milk it's good.  I have only tried Vanilla Ice Cream, but will be buying other flavors.  I do use this for meal replacement and I'm on a heavy protein diet (180g a day) for healing, so it can be difficult to hit that allotment and not blow my calories per day.The carbs are a bit higher than other powders, so folks that are limiting their carb and sugar intake should take note.  It also is 22g a serving, which is lower than some of the ones I've used.  But I'd much prefer to use this to minimize (not eliminate) my retching from the protein taste.One irritation is that the scoop was at the very bottom of the canister, so I had to dig it out.  Settling may occur I suppose.  I do recommend this powder, with the caveat on the higher carbs.

Very few brands offer protein powders that are not chalky in flavor as well as having high quality ingredients. BSN syntha-6 is definitely one my top 3 options because of that. As someone who struggles with protein intake, this is a lifesaver. I always get vanilla, so that I can add fresh strawberries, bananas, and/or blueberries, or peanut butter, and it’s super yum.
Love the choco peanut butter. Always mixes nice and has a great taste. Protein wise seems of a good quality and doesn’t hurt my stomach

After trying many protein powders that just piss off my gut, this Syntha 6 has been just great. The chocolate- peanut butter flavor is really good in either water or especially with milk. I tried it with berries added, extra peanut butter and ice cream. Everything tasted good.

This is the first protein powder I've purchased on Amazon. I have purchased protein powders in the past from another site and they were pretty good, but I figured a change of pace is always a good thing so I went for the Syntha-6 five-pound container of Vanilla Ice Cream flavored protein powder.I've been using it regularly for a month and I am extremely happy with my purchase. I have noticed an increase in energy when I use it to mix up a recovery drink for during and after my cardio workouts. I do P90X workouts and this stuff is perfect for mixing up with a smoothie after I do one of the weight routines.This stuff is so delicious it's hard to believe it's healthy. I look forward to my workouts partly due to the fact that I get to consume this stuff. I have mixed it with water in a plastic water bottle and have had no trouble with clumping (separation of the powder and the water). I have also used the powder in fruit smoothies and it makes them even more smooth and delicious. It also has a really great aroma and tastes and smells very much like vanilla ice cream.The five-pound container is HUGE. I use roughly a scoop a day and I'm sure it will last me for several months. The only downside I can see for buying such a big container of the stuff is that I might get tired of the flavor after a couple months, but I don't foresee that being a problem with this stuff because it is THAT tasty.

It tastes delicious, however it doesn’t blend very well, it always balls up and creates little grainy chunks, which honestly I enjoy, more texture. It’s not so great for you relatively, higher fat, cholesterol, and sugar compared to other proteins but this is decent compared to others in Themis price range. You pay for what you get! I’m just here for the gains!

I had this on a monthly delivery for the last 4 years.  During that time 2 of the containers were difficult to dissolve in water, but I pushed through.  In December 2022 and February 2023 they were VERY bad (thats 10 pounds out of 15) and I had to choke them down.  Quality is a becoming a problem.  That and the jump in price from $40 to $62 with poorer quality forces me to cancel this monthly subscription.  Since Amazon won't accept this for return or refund (after 4 years) I'll shop at a local vitamin store, sampling a couple and decide on a replacement.
Great product and it mixes well with my almond milk. Will purchase again!

This is one of the first protein powders I've ever gotten years ago and I keep trying new ones but always ending up going to back to this. The taste is just too good and it fits with many different flavors and shakes. It's not gritty like most other powders and did I say that it tastes good? Because it does. It feels and tastes clean and not super processed, so I would say the ingredients are high quality.

My wife and I like to have a protein shake every day for lunch, and this is the protein that goes in it. We are not meticulously helthy people who claim to know the science behind every method of weightloss or diet, so I can't comment on things that are truly in-depth, but the flavor is excellent and the protein is filling.We use it for shakes, as well as in cooking/baking, and perhaps it's best claim to fame is the fact that when we give some to our friends, they can't tell anything is "different" about it. I'm the kind of person who is sensitive to the "sugar free" taste of soda or other alternatives, and I can't tell a difference.All in all, we would buy this again if the price stays consistant.

My go-to post-workout protein powder.  The taste in vanilla is excellent.  Typically, I make a smoothie with frozen berries, a banana, creatine, and leucine, and this product, and the taste of this powder blends in seamlessly.  Occasionally I'll just mix it straight-up with milk in a shaker.  While you might get some clumps going this route, they aren't unpleasant, like in some products.The powder is sweet, and doesn't have the chalky aftertaste of other powders.  Only one scoop is required for 25 g of protein, so the texture won't weigh down whatever concoction you put together, like some other powders I've tried in the past.I used GNC's Gold Standard for a really long time.  This has a richer taste, and provides a more calorie dense option.  That clearly isn't for everybody.  If you want to put on muscle while packing on as little fat as possible, Gold Standard might be the way to go for you.  Both products are similarly priced and similar in quality (though I find Syntha-6 slightly better tasting).  If, however, you want to bulk up and could afford to put on a few extra pounds in the process, go with Syntha-6.-Joe

I have tried some nasty tasting protein powders in my day and this is by far the best tasting. When mixed with a little water it tastes just like a vanilla milkshake. I know this has more calories and slightly less protein than other brands but this isn't 100% whey so it will have more calories. If calories is your concern than just make sure you account for it in your daily amount. You will still get more grams of protein per calorie than any other food source (for example I ate a salad with chicken, avocado, pumpkin seeds, and bell peppers for lunch and got 45 grams of protein but still cost me 455 calories). for 400 calories you can get 44g of protien. plus two scoops of this is cheaper than my salad! Anyway, my point is this stuff tastes amazing and does just the job I need it to. I rather spend a bit more money on something that tastes good, since I am not the type of person who will shove stuff down my throat just because it's fuel. I may be able to do so once or twice but I wouldn't wast my money on poor tasting protein powders with this on the market. I can't wait until I finish my workouts to drink this stuff!

Mixes well, tastes great, doesn't make me feel bloated or fill me up. However, this protein isn't the best in a lot of categories. It's price per serving isn't the best, it's protein per scoop isn't the highest, nor is it's BCAA's per scoop (Or as BSN calls it, EAA's). With some light research, you can easily find cheaper or equally priced protein that beats Syntha-6 in nearly every category, but that in no way makes this a bad purchase or waste of time. It isn't a protein isolate, but it's probably one of the best regular whey proteins out there. I'd recommend this to some just getting into working out or someone getting their feet wet while searching for a beginner protein, but for someone experienced or looking for a change of brands, this might not be for you. It's not going to make you gain massive amounts of muscle/weight or help you smash your bench press through the roof.-ProsTastes GreatNo bloating or fullnessMixes fairly well-ConsTends to get small clumps that basically refuse to separate in a Blender BottleIsn't the king of protein, price, or serving per scoop
I got the strawberry & crème. I recommend a very low-key taste; it tastes like rose milk but is very subtle. Got the 5 pounds.
I love it 🥰it has a great taste and when blending it with the right fruit give it a rich blend i highly recommend !!

Honestly this is one of the few Whey proteins powders that don't make me break out. I drink two shakes a day on top of a healthy and lean food plan. The packaging could use some improvement as Amazon drivers don't care if the product gets damaged in transportation. That said I took off one star, but I love the strawberry flavor, and it mixes not too bad. Overall this is perfect for me. Inexpensive compared to other brands and doesn't cause any unnecessary ache.

This protein powder is really worth it because of its price and amount of servings also not to mention all of the ingredients. The flavor is a good 8/10 and it blends really well in the shaker bottle I have. So I really recommend you get this protein powder.

This is my third flavor attempted (previously tried Double Rich Chocolate and Chocolate Extreme) and am a bit disappointed by the lack of flavor in it. I can barely taste the flavoring. If this makes the product healthier by limiting added sugars and artificial flavors, I don’t mind at all. I 100% prefer the healthier option. However, if you are looking for something more sweet and flavorful, this may not be the mix for you. I prefer the chocolate options over this one as of now.

Y'all, don't make the same mistake that I made. I decided to buy the strawberries & cream flavor wanting to try something new. I've tried a lot of whey protein powders before and honestly, even though some flavors are really good, most of whey protein powders end up tasting the same, like whey, and despite of the fact that I have a sweet tooth, the whey protein taste can really be tiring sometimes. I had never tried a strawberry flavor so I decided to give it a try, a mistake. At first it was not bad, I couldn't even feel the whey,  honestly, I even mixed it with water and still it wasn't awful. However, a week later I was already sick of the flavor, even though I even tried to mix it with milk but it didn't really work so I had to start mixing it with peanut butter and adding extra calories while on a deficit just to be able to swallow it and not waste my money. Again the taste is not really bad, is just that you might get worn out of it sooner than you expect, if you want to try it I can give you basic advice, buy just a few pounds and try it, then you find out if you're really into this flavor, unlike me who decided to buy 5 pounds all at once :(. It always ends up a little chunky when I blend it, I don't know if thats good or bad, but it doesn't really score points to my already existing dilema with the flavor. Now, on my results, it does it's job. It really helped me putting on some muscle when I was still on a calorie deficit. I'll definitely try some other flavor in the future.
Great price and fast shipping
Obviously I have no way of proving it's quality, but it's tastey
always great
Best flavor on the market in my opinion and the stuff works.
I like to snort it
Bought the Strawberry & Cream flavour Whey protein powder.  The taste is very yummy and powder dissolved very smoothly with oat milk/soy milk.  Good product!
Yummy healthy snack to replenish the muscles..

Since I started using Whey Protein, I felt in love with it. I've been using it for almost two years now, and I dont see me stopping soon. Really good flavour, you can taste and see the effects of the product. Give yourself time to read the labels of the package. There's a lot of very valuable information there. I say this because I personally know a ton of people who do not read labels of products, and end up misusing them. Totally reccomend the product.
No issues with product but while product was on shipping process, huge problem occurred in my life and I wanted to return it without even openning the outside box but they didn’t let me
Bought 2 lb first. Loved everytbeing about the product. Next purchase was 5 lb. Strawberry cream blended with half a banana every morning/evening. Yum!!
I've been using this after every workout. It tastes delicious and is very easy to mix with water or milk. I don't think I will ever use a different brand.
Love to be able to get this to my home. Double chocolate is the way to go.

I've recently been trying all the different flavors of protein powder offered by O.N. and came across strawberries and cream.  When I tried their original strawberry flavor, I loved it and so I was excited to try out this new strawberries and cream flavor.  Unfortunately it was not what I expected.  The flavor was very unpleasant and left an aftertaste that made me a little nauseous.  Even the strawberry part of the flavor tasted nothing like the original strawberry.  I honestly don't think I will be able to finish the container which is a little disappointing as I got the 5 pound container.  The powder did blend well, so it has that going for it but the flavor was just too overwhelming.  The O.N. brand of protein is still easily my favorite as I've tried at least 6 other flavors that have been amazing, but this one is going down as my one unpleasant experience with them.  I'm a little sad that I didn't just stick with original strawberry flavor instead.

I bought this for my son after researching the products with the most protein and low sugar content and also lower calories. He loves the taste and drinks a shake everyday for breakfast along with 3 eggs. He is in to working out and consuming a lot of protein.
I never had the strawberry and cream before.. It's really good, and mixes well with other fruits. I will be buying again!
The flavor is pretty good on this one, it still has a weird after taste but not as bad as the coffee and mocha flavors
I use this as my morning meal and for protein intake. I'm not a big believer in protein gains because I dont notice a difference but as a meal replacement it works great.

By far the best strawberry protein I’ve tried. Mixes well like any other optimum nutrition product. This is a great change of pace for people (like myself) who normally just go for plains old vanilla.
Third party sites consistently rank Gold Standard as... well... just that. My experience with their products emulates those reviews. You get what you pay for with protein supplements.
This one is not for me, but my son was pleased.
I have been using this everyday for 3 weeks and even my finger nails have improved.
The creme part of the flavor ruins it. It’s not bad but it’s not great-definitely won’t buy again. Mixes extremely well
I’ve been drinking this for 2 years. It is really delicious especially strawberry one ,and I buy it every 2 months.
Quick delivery and the PERFECT product I was looking for. Thank you!!!MUSCLE POWER!!!
Llegó rápido y producto en excelente estadio
Idk much bout protein but the taste is definitely not the main reason to buy this.
