I don’t think is the original one!
Es súper deliciosa
Ordered this item for a Christmas gift and Received it with broken lid even when the box was perfectly fine! How does this happen?? Now I have to give a late Christmas gift thanks!
Changed formula from previous orders.  Doesn’t taste or mix as well.
The Whey Wasn't Sealed No Cover No Nothing. Someone Could Of Put Something In It
It was refilled
Okay if blended into smoothie but tastes like Freddy Kruegers’ zit crème infused with Aunt Makeesha’s leftover lasagna with a slight hint of children's tears from a messy divorce.

This product would be great if it had Stevia instead of Sucralose. I have and I'm sure others do too, have a hard time digesting sucralose so I can't drink this. Please please consider taking the sucralose out.

I really enjoyed the original strawberry flavor purchased earlier this year.  This Strawberry & Cream flavor is not pleasant. It has  a strong stale taste with a  weak strawberry flavor.  I certainly will not buy it again.

I've always purchased the chocolate malt or extra chocolate flavor of this. The strawberries and cream flavor is absolutely disgusting. Very artficial tasting and EXTREMELY sweet. I'm gonna have to muscle through this container, hopefully i can hide the flavor with other ingredients.
Una excelente opción como suplemento, sobre todo para cambiar por el clásico sabor chocolate.
Husband loves this!

I’ve used Isopure’s protein infusions before and really liked them. It’s nice to have a protein powder with options that are free of artificial sweeteners. I typically just use powders on days I need to get that last but of protein in but I’ve already met my carb and fat goals for the day and this brand has been great for that.I was specifically looking for a protein powder I could either bake with or add to my coffee in the mornings, so I wanted something that was both unflavored and free of fake sweeteners. I haven’t tried cooking with it yet (I’m thinking I can add to some oatmeal or breakfast muffins), but I have been putting it in my coffee with success.I took one star away because it DOES NOT go into super hot liquids like coffee straight from the pot or Keurig. However, if I add it after adding a bit of milk to cool the coffee down, it has no problem dissolving and even gives the coffee a bit of froth, which I enjoy. I was hoping to use it more like a creamer so I could skip the milk, but that’s just not going to be the case.It also goes into cold liquids and smoothies very easily without leaving a gritty texture like you get with plant based proteins (usually the only ones that will use stevia to sweeten). If you have any suggestions of flavored whey protein powders that use stevia please let me know!

I mean it says add to favorite beverage cold or hot... Well.. When you mix it with hot liquid such as coffee the powder congeals into this solid rubbery texture.  And if you are drinking out of a travel cup, you might not notice until this gross textured chunk winds up in your mouth.  And if you are driving, it might be so terrible that you need to pull over to spit it out.  Googled it and apparently this is something that people just know, but I missed the memo.  So many people with advice on their favorite method of adding protein powder to hot liquids.I had mixed it in my milk then added it to my coffee the day prior but it made my milk very frothy so I tried it directly in the coffee the next day.  After that first horrible experience I now have perfected a system where I mix my milk the night before and leave it in the fridge to settle then in the morning add it to my coffee and boom perfect.Good luck.  Definitely recommend in cold creamy drinks or foods.

If you are like me and hate the taste of pretty much all things labeled “protein” (bars, powders, shakes, etc.), this may be for you!!! No added sugars. No carbs. 100 calories per scoop.I mix one scoop with 1 cup fairlife milk and 1 tablespoon of chocolate syrup (no judgment. I like my chocolate milk folks).It tastes like a thicker version of chocolate milk but very little flavor change.I did notice if I tried it with white milk, it does alter the taste of the milk a bit but not awful…just not for me.HELPFUL HINTS:It tastes disgusting with coffee IMO. (Unflavored doesn’t mean NO taste. It’s sorta an earthy taste, but unnoticed in the milk).Do NOT use a shaker to shake it. It makes the fairlife foamy.I normally microwave the milk for about 20-30 seconds to bring temp to room temp to mix. It does not mix great with hot or cold drinks. “Room temp” or slightly warm seems to mix the easiest. Then I let it sit for a few minutes bc some of the clumps will pop open to mix. I add the chocolate and then add the drink to freezer for 15 minutes to make it cold.Yes, this is a bit of work, but hey. Gotta do what you can to get that protein in. I’ll be a lifelong fan!!! It has gotten my protein levels where I need them to be!!Giving it 4 stars only bc I wish it was a little easier to mix. Not a game changer for me though!!!! I’ll take it!

This protein powder was my first one that isn't whey protein and my first one since becoming vegetarian. I prefer unflavored protein as it gives me more control over what goes into my body (natural flavors...spices... Etc). This protein powder was everything I was looking for and was good for what it was. Here's how I felt.Flavor: it's flavorless, so it's going to have that "flavorless flavor" (sounds stupid, but you know exactly what I'm talking about). It's bland, earthy, and griany in taste. If you're a texture person be weary as it has a finly ground sandy like texture when mixed properly. I mixed mine with three different milks, oat milk by oatly (made me feel like I was licking dirt and depression off the floor), 2% lactose free Kroger brand milk (made this powder taste overly sweet somehow, but not in a good way, like the aftertaste when you take Pepto bismol) and Fair Life 2% milk (the least flavor altering). My favorite "base", was hands down the Fair Life milk.Mixing: this powder barely mixed with the oat milk and I quickly changed to cow milk. The two cow milks I tried mixed about the same, but be warned, when you mix it, add the milk into a blender cup first with the spring already in place, then add the power and mix immediately. No, don't even stop to put the lid back on your protein powder container. Immediately put the blender cap on and start shaking or you will get clumpy chunkies that make you want to vomit popping up throughout consumption. I shake mine for about 5ish minutes and if I'm busy I hand it to my spouse to shake for me while I replace the protein powder cap.For some reason shaking this protein powder with milk, makes the milk frothy. Not a deal breaker, but something to note if you're a texture person like me. You will still feel a fine grainy texture when mixed fully. It gets on your lips and no matter how much you try to lick it off, it still feels like it it's there.Would I buy this again? Yes.Would I recommend to a friend? Yes.Will this be my first choice of protein powder? Not likely as I've found a brand that works better for me.Hope this helped!

I tried it because I’m on a strict weight loss plan with a keto diet and I’ve read bad things about sucralose and artificial sugars in other protein powdered. I was nervous about the unflavored taste because I don’t want to mix it with anything besides water. The first thing I noticed is when I mix it, it does get a lot more foamy and bubbly than other powders I’ve used. But that’s not a big deterrent. I was surprised that I really like the taste. It’s very mild and watery but still pleasant enough. I will be sticking with this instead of ON Gold Standard for whey protein.
Nothing but unflavored protein for my fruit smoothies. Mixes well and good amount of protein for each serving. Probably $2 overpriced but seems like everything on Amazon is

I used it in a protein shake. I just mixed it with milk and frozen strawberries and blended it all together. There was a very slight dry milk flavor but overall it was soooo much better than other protein powders. Tasted like a strawberry milkshake. I have tried a few other protein powders. The Vega brand was my favorite but still too sweet for me. This was great. I can add my own flavor and there aren't any overwhelming added flavors. Definitely my new favorite.

I was tipped off to this by an influencer I enjoy watching on YouTube. As a woman approaching 50, I was seeking an easy & sustainable way to add some additional protein to my diet. I use this unflavored protein powder in my morning green smoothie - only 1T vs. a scoop, because my smoothie already contains quite a bit of protein, but this extra “boost” rounds it out nicely! It blends smoothly, zero taste! Truly unflavored! I’m so happy I found this & will continue to repurchase.

This is my first protein powder and I like it. I primarily use it in smoothies. It says flavor less, but it still does add a bit of flavor. I can't put my finger on the exact taste, but may be thats what protein powder is supposed to taste like.Overall happy with it, will try different ones next.
As described It has very little to no flavor. Pricey but worth it if you can’t seem to chop down other proteins supplements. I’m on my fifth or sixth bag and I will continue to use

I'm weird with flavors and textures.  I needed to find a way to add a large amount of protein to my diet.  I got this to add to my fruit smoothies I make for work.  it's perfect! no flavor,  blends smoothly,  adds a nice thickness to the smoothie & it's affordable.  great vegetarian option.

Was looking for a protein powder that wasn’t overly sweet and didn’t have extra calories. Landed on this and very happy with the purchase. Easily mixes in milk. Has a very subtle taste and just has protein.
My fave protein powder. It’s no carb and flavorless so I don’t have to think too hard about my macros.
It works well with making pancakes but it taste like eating protein

I use this everyday. I have for over 20 years. I use it with almond milk chocolate. I thought I was taking this and somehow got switched to a different kind . Finally I'm back to this all natural and I love it! Give it a try you will to.

I'm lactose intolerant so finding a protein powder has been a challenge.  Tried this one and have not found a way to eat it without the taste overpowering what I mix it with. Eggs was the best thing but made them supper rubbery.  Lesson learned is unflavored does not mean no flavor.  If you like milk it's probably good, if you associate milk with a bad day or two this will not likely be for you.
I love that there are no added chemicals and artificial sweeteners, but, why is it more expensive to just get the pure stuff without the added crap?
helped with building my strength and energy
It's hard for me to get my daily required protein in, so I mix this into soups, drinks, vegetables, and other foods.  I can't tell it's there.  It mixes well, and I can't taste it.
great product-truly tasteless but cannot mix in hot liquid- mix first then add to hot beverage
I gave it I gave it to a friend of mine that I work out with and he likes it.
Never mixed so well

Isopure Unflavored Whey Isolate Protein Powder is the first protein powder I have tried. I chose unflavored because I wanted to be able to mix it in a variety of foods and beverages. Also, because there are no additional calories as found in flavored protein powders.  While it is unflavored, it is not tasteless. Whey is a dairy product and I would say the taste is “milky”. It works best for me when mixed with oatmeal, coffee or my chocolate protein shake. To keep the taste from being overwhelming, I divide my daily scoop into two servings.  The powder didn’t seem to mix in very well, so before I add it I stir in very small amounts of liquid(depending on what I’m going to put it in) and make a smooth “paste”’. This allows me to get all the powder dissolved and smash out all the lumps. Then I continue to add small amounts of liquid till it is thin and runny.  This makes it blend in very well. Will continue to buy this product to increase my protein intake without excessive calories.
It blends well and even shakes well if you let it sit for a while. There’s almost no taste but the price increase seems unreasonable.
No flavor to it, I add it to my morning shake, feel less hungry during the day
Great purchase - I have scoop every day blended with soy milk and a banana. Flavor is neutral. Package is fresh (long time to expiration) and sealed - will continue to order.

I've had a difficult time in the beginning getting the powder to mix in with some things, I've discovered so far, soups broth or warm drinks will not mix well with protein powder.It does great with water or water flavored cold items, I make an amazing protein root beer float with it!1 scoop flavorless  protein powder1 pack if sugar free a&w drink mix powder1 cup ice1 cup water1 oz heavy whipping creamBlend well, enjoy!
Love unflavored protein powder this one is my favorite. It blends nice and the calorie to protein ratio is awesome.
the best
A gift for my son-in-law. He requested it because he likes it.

This is unflavored and is perfect to add it to anything you want because of that! It mixes really easy, I use a hand whisk, shaker bottle, or blender. This is very high quality protein so for the price it is great. I still try to wait until it’s has a bit of a discount. I probably went through 15 large containers so far and keep them coming.
Love everything about it. Use for Bariatric care.
Perfect because it has no flavor, so it’s great for smoothies pancakes etc!

I prefer the protein powder over every other protein drink I’ve tried. This is flavorless so you can’t taste it, mixes well in my blender. You cans add to smoothie or other drinks or foods and get creative

I had gastric bypass almost two years ago. Protein intake is a MUST for all Bariatric patients. I used other protein powders before but I wasnt happy with them. I’ve been using the Isopure Unflavored protein for over a year and I am very pleased with it! I use it two to three times per day in my coffee. It doesn’t mix well if you put it really hot beverages and it will be clumpy. So I usually put a bit of creamer in my coffee and let it cool off for about 5 minutes before adding a scoop of the Isopure powder in. I find it mixes better if you let hot beverages cool off a bit and adding the protein powder in slowly, a little at a time. If you mix it this way it will mix smoothly and well.  I actually like how it makes my coffee texture seem creamier! Also, more importantly, my lab work results are always good so I know this protein powder is doing its job. Also note…I usually pour my powder in an older container so it’s easier to store and stays fresher longer as you can see in the included pictures.  I buy Isopure every week and plan on doing so for the unseen future! I highly recommend.

Ditch your other proteins supplements  and get some isopure protein . This unflavored protein powder is my favorite . It mixes well in soups, beans, coffee, tea, shakes, gravies, just about everything that has liquid.  I have even used it to batter my air fry chicken nuggets .  There is zero flavor however it’s not completely tasteless. .
I try to put this in everything but I can’t get over the taste of it. It’s unflavored but it still has a distinct taste
Clean product, No carbs, 25g of protein
I have an eating disorder so it’s hard for me to eat but this helps . It’s a bit grainy so I had to chug it
Bought this for extra protein in smoothies. The unflavored aspect is perfect as it doesn’t overpower what I want to taste.

Love this protein powder!!I have a hard time finding protein powder that doesn't make me sick or give me a migraine. I have a sensitive stomach and artifical sweeteners give me migraines. I have had a shake with this almost every morning the last 2 years. 1 scoop of this. 1/2 a scoop of pb powder and about 6 onces of silk dark chocolate almond milk. Shakes up great in a small shaker bottle. Can freeze it a little while and it's like a dessert! Just remember to take the shaker ball out first.My picky kids even like it!! They drink my shake. Also I've made smoothies in the mixer- this with milk/ banana/ some chocolate syrup for the kids as well. Toss some other frozen fruit in from time to time. It blends out with no taste and no chunks. I've mixed it in with oatmeal (premix packets and quick oats) and its good. For overnight oats I prefer to add this in the morning and shake well before eating vs putting the powder in at night.I can't mix with water- it does have an off taste alone. It also has a bit of odor when you open it. I've baked with it a few times. It was alright but it's just not something I've perfected yet.Overall- I would be in trouble if they stopped making this! My stomach (ulcers among other issues) behaves so much better when this is my breakfast. I'm able to get protein without hurting my stomach in the morning. I can even have multiple shakes in a day with no issues.
I like that it has no flavor or after taste HOWEVER this protein powder will not completely dissolve no matter what I do!

I do but don’t like this protein powder. It thickens foods if you’re mixing to just try and get more protein in and it leaves a film in your mouth. It is unflavored but depending what I mix it with I can still taste it sometimes. I would purchase again, but it could be better.
Easy to blend, and no sugar is a huge plus.
Dissolves very easily.  Very little taste which I enjoy so I can blend in water or enjoy the taste of the fruit in a shake.
I have to use a sifter to get this to blend into liquids which is sad and it definitely has a distinct TASTE even if it's not a "flavor" that you can identify. Trying Genepro next!

What I love the most aside, there is genuinely no flavor when using the product realistically; the powder is not gritty. It mices well with any liquid as well as puréed foods. I was utterly surprised. Now I must admit that if you’re using it in puréed foods, you need to make sure that you’re considering how much of the powder you’re putting into that particular food.I have purchased countless protein powders, and one of my most significant issues is that it feels gritty when you drink or mix it with foods. I also want to reiterate that you really cannot taste it.This will be my go-to from here on out!

While the product does state that it is unflavored, there is a slightly noticeable milk like flavor, which should be expected as the protein is derived from milk. I have only used this mixed into fruit, smoothies, vegetable smoothies, and black coffee. When mixed into either type of smoothie I make the flavor is not noticeable. when I have mixed it into black coffee, again, the flavor is not necessarily present, but it’s almost like a very light plain creamer taste. For me, it’s not a problem and does not cause me to not enjoy anything that I have mixed it with so far.

This is a great unflavored protein powder. I am very happy with it. Easily blends, no taste. I am sensitive to stevia and other artificial sweeteners, and this of course is just pure protein isolate. Giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it uses soy lecithin.

Unfortunately I struggle with an eating disorder. I have a very strict meal plan but a lot of the foods I want don’t have enough protein! This is a nice little hack! I put usually half a scoop because using the whole scoop makes it taste funny. I put it in my oatmeal, yogurt, soup. Definitly doesn’t go well in Mac and cheese n saucy things though 😹 I learned that the hard way
I add this in my morning smoothie! Love it!!

i know, 'bowels' is just the word you wanna hear in a food review. but this is exactly why i wanted to try a whey isolate like isopure.i write this review out of sheer empathy for anyone else who experiences the below when trying to get extra protein in their diet through convenient protein powder, whether you're into bodybuilding or general fitness or whatever.Previously through the past 20 yrs i've tried many brands of whey protein, usually the budget friendlier stuff rather than true isolate which tends to be a little pricier. In the last couple years though I was having some gut issues with even popular brands like ON Whey, gas, diarrhea (again, gross right?). So i dont know if i just became allergic or sensitive to the stuff or if my body doesnt like all the extras (fillers etc).after some research of reviews of isolates i saw helpful reviews saying that going with a true Isolate could help so i gave it a try. i've tried isopure for a month or so at the time of this writing and have zero issues with it so am happy with it. it is a little more expensive than cheap whey protein, but to avoid the above mentioned issues, its worth it!!review of unflavored isopure zero carb:no extra flavoring is kinda nice as you can do what you want with it. just added it to some oatmeal and hey, it can taste like oatmeal vs chocolate oatmeal if i had added a choco flavored protein. (nothing wrong with that, just saying you have more flavor flexibility going with unflavored, but by all means do as you will)Mixes pretty well (most isolates should), is not 'grainy' like some cheaper wheys can be. in the oatmeal example, i have no clue that its in there other than i can tell a slight 'milkiness' quality both in texture and taste. the 'flavor' of unflavored isopure is best akin to a 'milk' aftertaste (doesnt sound appealing i know, but again, you're not buying this for the TASTE of it by itself but that you can add it with whatever flavorings you desire: juice, milk, chocolate, smoothies, cooking, etc)  - and when doing so its own slight flavor of milkiness is easily overpowered by whatever you would add.anyway, if you've had gas bloating or worse with other protein powders, particularly anything less quality than an Isolate, give something like Isopure 100% whey protein ISOLATE a shot. just buy a small bag so you can try it before buying bulk to save $.simultaneously i'm also trying dymatize protein isolate, so far only had a serving of it so can give a good review yet, but off the one serving didnt have any negative impact so i'm optimistic it will also be a good way to go.thanks

I bought this because I'm really not a huge fan of most protein sources and am always looking for creative ways to get my protein in. I wanted something I could just hide in my meals and not even really know it's there, but get an extra little boost of protein!Some things I typically add it to (I usually add it after my stuff is fully prepared or cooked... I haven't tried anything fancy like baking with it yet... I don't enjoy cooking much) are my cereal, my spaghetti after it's all prepared and cooked, my coffee (mix with a frother), my barbeque sauce when I'm dipping stuff in it, and I'm sure there are some other random things I have tried as well. I have used it in ramen noodles once successfully, and once unsuccessfully (it clumped up the second time. I think that was because my ramen noodles were hot, and I was storing my protein powder in the fridge at the time so it was cold.... I think that's what happened.) I rarely ever use a full scoop, I just add in little by little and taste as I go to make sure it's still yummy and the texture is still good - but for me, any protein I can sneak in is a win. I have also used it in smoothies because I'm not a huge fan of flavored protein powders in my smoothies - they typically take over with their taste, whereas this doesn't really taste like anything at all.The smell of the powder when I open it is NOT GREAT lol. I just try to hold my breath when opening the bag, then once it is in the food I cannot taste or smell it anymore. Win!

UPDATE- so I have went through an entire bag of this already. I do put it in most everything however, I wanted to update my previous comment. I have detected a slight smell & flavor to this flavorless protein. When I first noticed I wanted to throw the whole bag out & gag BUT I talked myself off the ledge & convinced myself that I eat & taste protein in ALLLLLL my protein products. Shakes, bars, snacks. It’s there & I handle it just fine. I have removed it from certain food items like my morning coffee. Apparently my taste buds are extra sensitive in the morning and where I wish I could get that nice dose of protein in right away I’ve opted to enjoy my coffee without a trace of smell or flavor. It goes in my shake immediately following coffee. I just ordered my 2nd bag. I’m 6 weeks post -op & feeling great and I contributed it to my diligent protein intake!!I recently had bariatric surgery and knew I was going to need a good flavorless protein to add to my food. I hate the taste of Whey protein. After reading many reviews I finally decided to just try this product.  I am floored.  Zero taste. Zero bad smell.  I am adding it to everything and accomplishing my Protein requirements daily. If you are adding this to something hot I recommend putting it in a bowl with a little hot water and making a watery paste and then adding it to your hot liquids.  If you’re putting it into hummus or something cold blends right in with no chunks.  Read some reviews were people are complaining about it not mixing in, well you just have to use common sense and prepare it the proper way depending on use.  This will be my forever protein!!! So glad I found it
Still my favorite no flavor protein powder choice after 3 month. It dissolves great in liquids
This power has no flavor. It also blends well across the board.

I have gone through 2 lbs of this product, and have now received a 3 lb tub because I have decided this is the powder to go with.  It's great for an unflavored powder because it actually is flavorless!  I've had other unflavored powders, but those have been disgusting alone; terribly sour and acrid.  This stuff mixes up will with just a spoon and I can down it alone with water just fine.  There's a bit of that whey smell, but as long as you don't mind the thickness it's a tremendous protein supplement.  It's also cheap at $0.94/oz at the time of writing.  I've looked for cheaper stuff, but only crap with a bunch of sugar and creatine and whatever shows up, or the unflavored stuff is acrid, like I said.  In terms of flavor, value, and macronutrients, I don't think you can beat this stuff.That being said, I think Isopure is missing the opportunity to add their vitamin and mineral mix to this unflavored product.  If you look at their flavored stuff, they all contain a ton of additional micro-nutrients that I personally would find useful, but I do see some reasons not to include those.  Some people with kidney disease may not be able to handle taking in lots of minerals, like potassium I know is a big one.  And maintaining the pure "unflavor" may be difficult with the vitamin blend, though I don't know for sure.  Anyway, that is my only complaint.  If all you need is protein, look no further.One thing I really like to do is mix 2 scoops with 1 Tbsp of cocoa powder and optionally add 2 Tbsp of natural peanut butter.  It makes an awesome drink for a quick 50g of protein with no sugar added.

This is a good protein powder, but I do have a couple of issue with it.  The main one is that it does not load easily into the included scoop.  It also doesn't smell very good (admittedly I have had it for a while, but it is not expired).  It has a good amount of protein to add it to smoothies and other places where you need a protein boost.  It is also an excellent product for keto baking.
It's important to note that this is unflavored.
This mix as well with my coffee creamer so that I can get my protein in with breakfast. Just copy.

I was looking for an alternative for the iconic protein powder and this brand fits perfectly. I always order the plain flavored coz it comes with simple ingredients and with no extra fillers. The protein powder blends nicely with water. So far after taking it for a month, I have no complaints and no upset stomach or side effects. I will definitely purchase this item again.
I do not like the taste by itself, it is definitely like eating a vitamin by itself. I do however like to mix 1/2 scoop in with my Greek yogurt in the morning.

I have tried many protein powders! I am not a meat lover. This product finally is what I have been looking for! There is no flavor and it blends completely! I start my day with an iced coffee with added banana and this protein powder. An awesome way to start your day! So happy that I finally found it! Now, I buy it by the largest size I can get! I was so surprised that you can purchase it with an EBT card! Not everyone gets their protein from meat!!
Bought as a diet supplement. No flavor is a great thing. Blends smoothly and goes down easily (drinkable - no gag).
Its great for smoothies and protein shakes. It also seems to do well in refried beans and hummus but for any broths and other clear liquids it has a slight aftertaste that cant seem to be masked.
Yikes! Was $58.99… now $74.99? Great stuff, but way too pricey. Unfortunately I may have to get my protein elsewhere.

I drink coffee and water. New meds are having me not eat, so figured unflavored protein would be good. It's disgusting! You have to blend with something to bypass the flavor. Water only is not the way to go. It blend beautifully and I prefer this brand because the tub is actually full. Not halfway like some of the others

This stuff tastes god awful.... i even tried mixing it with root beer, and it still tastes disgusting. it clumps and doesn't mix well.the only positive thing i can say is it sits well on my stomach and digests welli would buy cheap protein powder from the grocery store before i bought this again. especially at this price point(we buy expensive protein powder so it DOESN'T taste bad and clump when it mixes)

This is hands down the BEST protein powder I've ever tried, and I've tried a LOT. I love that it's unflavored, and yes, it's TRULY unflavored, because I can mix it with literally anything, which means *I* control the flavor. I got sick of spending money on different flavored protein powders then hating them and therefore wasting money. If I could only recommend one protein supplement, this would be it. And no, I am not being compensated in any way for my review, I'm just that happy that I finally found a protein powder that works for me.
Love the product…nothing chalky about it. Only thing is that it leaves an aftertaste. Which is okay. If not I would have given it a 5 star as an overall product.

Slightly worried about the people in the reviews saying there’s no flavor. May need to get your tastebuds checked out 🥴. It taste like vanilla protein powder but not as strong. I have Creatine that is actually unflavored so I was expecting that. Super disappointed when I put a scoop in my strawberry lemonade and the taste over powered it.
U can add it to everything u won't taste a thing. I add it to my dinner, salad fruits drink everything

after trying a few protein powders, my friend suggested I try this. It's FABULOUS. I love that it has only two ingredients, I can use a sweetener of my choice if I want to sweeten it. I typically make a cold coffee shake with it in my blender and I can barely taste the protein powder. I am a fan.
There’s no flavor in the unflavored mix so it can be added to anything so it can be used in many different waysThe powder clumps easily

A lot of people are accustomed to protein powders being sweet, and consuming them as shakes or baked goods. After years of this I was sick of drinking my protein or eating baked protein powder foods that rarely actually taste good. I have been on the hunt for unflavored protein to use in savory/salty sauces and dips and this is a winner!I mix it with some Greek yogurt, a little water, and nacho cheese seasoning from FlavorGod and my goodness is it delicious and packed full of protein! I’ve also done the same mix but with curry powder and made a protein curry sauce to have over chicken. I’ve used it to make spicy mayo, garlic “Alfredo” sauce, and guacamole!The base taste of the protein powder is very subtle and honestly disappears into every mixture I’ve made with it.

* edit- it worked better if i poured small amount of coffee into powder to dissplve first then fill the cup.  Not sure why!  Changed my rating.I was unable to get this to dissolve in my coffee which was the reason I bought it.  It has very little taste but doesn't taste very good when big lumps are in coffee.  I tried blender bottle and a frother with no success.

I've been super happy with this Isopure unflavored whey isolate. I've been using it for several weeks now. It blends really well in my little personal blender...a KOIOS 850W I got here on Amazon. I blend it with a low calorie vanilla almond milk with a couple ice cubes and a teaspoon of instant decaf coffee crystals. It tastes like a smooth iced coffee. I've bought this a few times now and will continue to do so.
It does not dissolve.  Only way is to use blender, but that is not possible for savory application
great  product

As a VSG bariatric patient, this unflavored protein powder is my favorite.  It mixes well in soups, beans, coffee, tea, shakes, gravies, just about everything that has liquid.  There is zero flavor.  It mixes well with everything I put it in.  Great protein powder for bariatric patients to reach their daily protein goals.

Ok, I get that unflavored simply means no flavor added, so I'm not docking any stars. But make sure you understand that because my dumb behind thought it meant NO FLAVOR. It does not mean no flavor. THERE IS A FLAVOR. And what a flavor it is!!! This stuff taste like cow tittle sweat. It tastes like you had a nice tall glass of ice cold milk on a summer day that you couldn't quite finish, and forgot outside for a few days. During those days the water evaporated out and it left one of those little dried milk rings in the bottom of the glass. Then someone picked up the glass and went to wash it, but couldn't get the milk out, so they pulled a Jim and filled it with water to "let it soak". After 3 days the water has partially rehydrated the milk. That water is what this tastes like. Like toasted watered down milk from a cow with a yeast infection. Still a terrific product though. Will buy again, strongly recommend!
I am very pleased!  This powder blends in very well and does not leave a grainy texture.  Packaged very well and a good value.

My wife was very critical of the artificial flavors of my favorite whey powders (ON varieties..  I admit that many of their flavors are artificial in a 'kids breakfast cereal' kind of way, except for Mocha Cappuccino which is awesome.)  She wanted to try blending unflavored whey into her favorite Chia Tea mix.  This sounded like a good idea; however, while mixing something 'unflavored' may not add new flavors, it does still affect the overall taste of the mixture.  She tried this twice, said 'Nope', and was done trying.I experienced the same thing when I first mixed creatine powder into my protein shakes; it delivers an element of absolute gritty 'blah' flavor across your tongue that you won't soon forget.  (Sand doesn't have a flavor either, but I don't want to eat it.)  So now I'm stuck with a nearly full bag of fairly expensive, high-end, unflavored whey.  I'll probably try to give it away to someone else.

I'll probably never go back to a different protein powder. Truly favorless. My only complaint is no fault of the products, only that it's whey so it curdles in hot liquids. Otherwise, it's great and so happy that there's no added sugar!

This is the only protein powder I buy. It seems like the only protein flavors are chocolate and vanilla and you can’t just put those flavors with anything. I get the unflavored and put it in my pancakes, waffles, tea, and coffee. It does have a milk/dairy flavor to it. I put it in my black tea and it’s like milk tea. Put it in my coffee and it’s like coffee with milk. You do have to stir vigorously for it to blend well. If you put it in pancake/waffle batter, it does dry it out so make sure to ratio it right to where the final product is still fluffy. It’s a struggle getting 130g of protein in a day but the unflavored powder makes it more achievable.

So it definitely gives a weird background flavor to whatever you add it to. Also I’ve had a hard time getting it to fully dissolve in liquid, but it mixed quite well with yogurt. I do love how it’s just simply protein and not full of all the other junk that other companies add in!
Good but super nasty

I do like that it is tasteless, so I can mix it with my food and drinks. I didn’t like how much the scoop is just to get your 1 serving in. I feel that you could probably get more bang for your buck elsewhere. The package is only 1lb, which gives you 16 servings.

I don't know why they haven't solved that problem with the scoop. It goes all the way to the bottom of the container while they transport it. Also, I don't know why that problem, that happend with several brands, bothers me.

I mixed it with silk's unsweet oat milk and you can def taste the flavour of protein powder even when it's unflavored. It just had a very strong taste and smell. When I opened the bag, it smelled like a butcher's shop.However, it's still heaps better than the other protein powders out there with tons of other shit especially sugar added to it to make it taste even worse.

The product is as advertised and I enjoyed it for the past year. Mixes well with water and can drink with no fillers. The problem is the price has increased 25% in 2 months. It was already on the high end of cost for protein powder but now it’s become a luxury product. Similar alternatives at lower prices exist.
Simple ingredients, easy to use, high protein, works well in shaker bottle or blender, no grittiness. Great product
Absolutely no flavor and exactly what I was looking for!

I am new to the world of protein powders but have been trying to incorporate more protein into my diet. I prefer, at least for now, to add my protein to fruit smoothies, so I was looking for something that blended well but also could be added to my smoothies without affecting the flavor or having to build the smoothie around its flavor. This did just the trick! It doesn't taste like much of anything and even though it slightly changes the texture of my smoothies, I don't mind it.I haven't added it to anything else except oatmeal (didn't love that) but am looking forward to trying to bake with it or just do more basic protein shakes.
It’s gross and smells terrible. I’ve mixed with numerous things and doesn’t blend well and there’s no way to mask the flavor even though it’s “unflavored “
La mezcla está vien, solo un poco el sabor no es mucho de mi agrado pero acompañado con algunas frutas queda bien.
This went from $56 last month to $74 this month?  Big ripoff.  Have to find another brand to buy.  Sad because I liked this brand of protein powder but this is a ridiculous price now.

No taste as promised. Haven’t had any digestive issues yet thankfully.  I learned through trial and error that the powder curdles in really hot liquid (eg. freshly brewed coffee).  Once it has cooled down a bit the powder dissolves nicely.  I add milk to my coffee first now to cool it down and then add two teaspoons of powder.  Seems like a good product overall.

This stuff is awesome! I’ve been on a quest for a flavorless protein and after trying a few others I finally found the one. I love to mix it into smoothies, oatmeal, protein balls, peanut butter, yogurt, you name it. I read some reviews that said “this tastes awful” …but any powdered substance would taste awful if the ratio wasn’t right. Its not like collagen powder where it disappears into whatever you mix it in, but if you don’t want the added taste of the usual protein powders (chocolate, vanilla, etc) or the added sugars then this is your jam. I immediately noticed the texture is softer and more powdery than other proteins I’ve tried (almost like the texture of powdered sugar) and appreciate the short list of ingredients (why protein isolate). I would highly recommend this product if you want to taste your smoothie ingredients and only your smoothie ingredients.
I love this stuff, I make tea and I pour it in and you can’t taste it at all. I also put it in my kids hot chocolate and they don’t notice it.

Decent whey powder but sucralose doesn’t agree with me so I had to find a protein with a different sweetener.  But as a point of reference most whey proteins use the same sweetener and my issue isn’t unique to this brand.

I used to always buy optimum nutrition whey protein when the 5lb use to be under $50 ,now a 5 pound optimum nutrition protein cost $70 ,so I decided to try something new I picked this 5lb muscle tech whey for $40. it’s a good bang for buck calories and nutrition values look similar to optimum nutrition.

I'll concur with other reviews regarding the flavor of this product. It is vanilla, but it tastes different from the vanilla in the other products I've used. It isn't bad, but it is different.My main peeve is that the product is not a true powder, it is very fine granules. The product does not mix very well and so far everyday has clumped up and stuck to the side of the blender jar.  Not a catastrophe for sure, but a peeve.I use the product five days a week in an after workout fruit smoothie.  I am not equiped to do a chemical analysis on the product . Couldn't say if the product information on the side of the packaging is true or not.
Excellent flavor

 Protein mixes easily with a shaker bottle. Lower calories than other whey proteins. Only drawback is the flavor. It’s just okay. Would buy again
Protein power has so many choices, this was delivered fast and the best on low Carbs/sugar, Only 2 grams per serving. I ordered the vanilla flavor, it tasted good and did not have a chalky taste.

I've had issues on and off over the years with finding a protein powder that I like the taste of, but this one is delicious. I don't feel like I have to gulp it down as quickly as possible. It's full of easy to pronounce ingredients, which is what you want in a protein powder. Overall very happy with this product.
Doesn't taste like cookies and cream and the cookie crumbs are basically non-existent :( It's not bad but I was expecting something tastier.

*Update* After finishing my first tub and immediately reordering I have to admit I am obsessed with the flavor, I guess its an acquired taste and I fell in love with it. I am changing my original 4-star review to 5-stars. My new normal is to add a heaping quarter teaspoon of decaf instant coffee to the milk I mix the powder in with, an absolutely decadent tasting drink.________Original review below________Its mixes pretty well, it doesn't get lumpy, maybe a bit frothy, but that can be resolved quite quickly.The vanilla taste is definitely weird at first. At first taste it bordered on sickeningly sweet and slightly burnt, like twice roasted and them caramelized vanilla. After a week it started tasting more normal and after a month I am totally fine with the taste now.My favorite is to make make it with milk and then add a splash of black coffee, it actually tastes really good with some coffee added to knock back the sweetness and give it a bit more depth.

I’ve tried enough protein products to know when a product mixes well. And this product does not. I’m using a standard shaker cup. When I use Optimum product, it mixes instantly—you’d think it was pure water. I shake this product and I end up eating a third of the shake. Not ideal.

We drink protein powders every day both as meal replacements and also for after-workout recovery drinks. We find the Nitro Tech Whey Gold works well for us as a meal replacement or smoothie creator, because it has a medium level of thickness. We don't use this powder as an after-workout drink, because we prefer our after-workout drinks to be a bit thinner so they can swallow more quickly and easily.Also, while some powders easily shake into a smooth mixture, this one ends up with small lumps, even with fairly thorough shaking. It does do great with a blender though. So another point in the direction of kitchen-meals rather than on-the-go workout drinks.The Nitro Tech Whey Gold has both whey peptides and isolates. That's another reason we prefer this as a meal replacement or smoothie shake. We generally prefer just isolates for after a workout.The flavor, French Vanilla Creme, is fairly light in strength. It also has a bit of a "chemically" flavor. It is tolerable, but not as luscious as some other brands. Still, if we make a smoothie out of this and toss in a few fruits or berries, it forms a perfect base for the overall flavor profile.It's nice that the Nitro Tech Whey Gold has the "authentication" seal on the top of the lid so you know you're getting the real deal. On the down side, some of the other protein drinks we use guarantee that they won't pop positive (by mistake) on the various drug tests that are administered in the sports world. This shake doesn't have that statement. It could be they are quite fine and won't cause a problem, but it would be nice for them to guarantee it on the label.All in all, we like this, and use it fairly regularly as a meal replacement or smoothie option.

I’ve always liked the basic flavors of Nitro Tech (chocolate, vanilla, etc.), and this is right in line with all those that came before it. Still, I was shocked that the Vanilla Swirl tasted so good, yet has only 4g of carbs (2g sugars), AND adds and other ingredients (C. canephora robusta & L-carnitine) that aid in weight loss - all while delivering 30g of protein per scoop.With that in mind, I’ve made my first attempt to do some basic label analysis (see image). There are many important ingredients you could look at, but I tried to focus on some of the basics. I’m certainly no expert, and I’m sure there are some that may find this very basic, but I hope it helps others. I plan to continue to do this on future reviews, and maybe even evolve and expand the analysis.The bottom line: If you’re trying to watch your carb intake or cut fat while also ensuring you still hit your protein intake goals, I highly recommend this.

This is my second protein product from MuscleTech.  The last product I tried was MuscleTech Nitro-Tech in Milk Chocolate.  Comparatively, this product contains less protein per serving (24 vs 30g) and does not contain any creatine.  The absence of creatine is helpful, especially if you already taking creatine separately.  It allows you to optimize the amount of creatine that you are consuming daily.In terms of taste, I find that it does a good job of imitating a cookies and crème flavour.  It does have a similar taste to drinking an Oreo McFlurry that has melted.  It does not have the strong whey taste that some protein powders usually carry. There are some artificial chemical aftertastes element as well.  Of course, you wouldn’t expect it to taste exactly the same as a real ice-cream desert.  I also find that the thickness when mixed with water is different than regular Nitrotech.  If you want a watery protein drink, then this would be suitable for you.  Strangely enough, despite this, I found the mixibility worse compared to the regular Nitro Tech.This drink provides the satiety after consumption, which is nice as a snack, or after a workout giving you a hunger-buffer before you can consume a meal with real food.It seems the volume per scoop is also consistently large with this brand.  In this regard, it will a) fill up youf protein shaker easier (a good or bad thing), and b) contain less servings per x/lb of a tub.  Take that into consideration when calculating what you need monthly.All in all, a solid tasting protein with a more flexible profile in terms of macros.

The protein I received appears near identical to the pictures in the listing except for one major thing. Look at the front of the jug in the listing and then look at mine. I do not have a section that says "whey isolate and peptides - primary source." And then look at my ingredient label and look at the ingredient label on the listing. On their listing, the more pure, more expensive Whey Isolate and Whey Peptides are the first ingredient. On mine, the cheaper, lower quality whey concentrate is the first ingredient. So it's a bait and switch. Their listing tells you that you will get a product that has higher quality whey isolate for the majority, whereas you actually receive whey concentrate as the majority. This is important for me as I have a little bit of lactose intolerance and whey isolate has most of the lactose removed. Nice try, but I wasn't fooled. I guess Ill still try to use it since it's the only protein I currently have, but now everyone can see the BS and be weary at least.

I have been bodybuilding for over 16 years now and i have had thousands of protein shakes!  For me, if a protein shake tastes great with just mixing it with water... you got a winner!!! I have heard plenty of people say it's not about the taste if you are serious enough as a lifter. Well, if you have gag reflexes every time you drink your protein drink, chances are that you will not be drinking that protein for very long regardless of how serious of a lifter you are! You have to have something that tastes relatively good. Nitro Tech Whey Gold Double Rich Chocolate is amazing! Over the years i have been increasingly impressed with how much better the taste of MuscleTech's protein powders have gotten. In the past they were great quality protein, but didn't taste the best. Now Nitro Tech Whey Gold Performance Series tastes incredible! I like to use cool water in a shaker cup and it simply tastes amazing! Reminds me of a chocolate malt! It's like Christmas day for me when i discover a new protein that tastes great because they are hard to come by. If you are a taste bud chaser when it comes to protein... this is wonderful product that you will have you running back to make more protein drinks! Happy lifting!

This is a great protein. It's straight to the point.Flavor: I'm a huge fan of chocolate (who isn't) so I got the Double Rich Chocolate flavor. It's great and it mixes well. I rotate mixing it with chocolate almond milk and peanut butter (in the morning when I wake up), and just with water after I work out. Can't go wrong with either one.Ingredients: Straight forward. It's a whey protein, containing amino acids. Good for muscle building. Low in fat / carbs so for those of you on a low carb diet, you won't be over doing it. Haven't noticed any major changes in my lifting habits as far as strength is concerned. But I'm also nursing a shoulder injury when it comes to certain lifts.I recommend this product. Price is good, taste is good. You won't be disappointed.
